	<subparagraph identifier="/dL/tIV/s422/qB/J" id="H7B7638795B5F49B7876F68181E3BC302" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="728">
		<num value="J">“(J)</num>
		<heading> Special rule for fiscal years 2022 and 2023.—</heading>
		<chapeau>Notwithstanding subparagraph (A) and the absence of scheduled passenger aircraft service at an airport, the Secretary shall apportion in fiscal years 2022 and 2023 to the sponsor of the airport an amount based on the number of passenger boardings at the airport during whichever of the following years that would result in the highest apportioned amount:</chapeau>
		<clause identifier="/dL/tIV/s422/qB/J/i" id="HBD78ADC6F9944779A0E7FDFA4E5761A4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="728">
			<num value="i">“(i)</num>
			<content> Calendar year 2018.</content>
		</clause>
		<clause identifier="/dL/tIV/s422/qB/J/ii" id="H4289952D739C4979AC81042BB2C810BE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="728">
			<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
			<content> Calendar year 2019.</content>
		</clause>
		<clause identifier="/dL/tIV/s422/qB/J/iii" id="H42F5D33DC4F041038B21322B947ABC64" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="728">
			<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
			<content> The prior full calendar year prior to the current fiscal year.”</content>
		</clause>
	</subparagraph>
</__xml__>;

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H7C1346398A92458BADA086B28E96C91E" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dN/tII/stA/ch1/schI/s201/d/qB/4" id="H51C08A4244734EEAA86EFA56F511FD8E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="771">
		<num value="4">“(4)</num>
		<heading> Waiver authority.—</heading>
		<chapeau>In the case of individuals who have received amounts of pandemic unemployment assistance to which they were not entitled, the State shall require such individuals to repay the amounts of such pandemic unemployment assistance to the State agency, except that the State agency may waive such repayment if it determines that—</chapeau>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tII/stA/ch1/schI/s201/d/qB/4/A" id="H237530D5B1C545B9BAB76706690CAE62" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="771">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<content> the payment of such pandemic unemployment assistance was without fault on the part of any such individual; and</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tII/stA/ch1/schI/s201/d/qB/4/B" id="HF78E140C229340C7B22A6E89DD569E96" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="771">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<content> such repayment would be contrary to equity and good conscience.”</content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H634A3888903F46A0ADD074F99D191C0C" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dN/tII/stB/s276/a/1/qB/i" id="HECF080A53E604B308C2FE4513B76D3E8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="798">
		<num value="i">“(i)</num>
		<heading> Tax treatment.—</heading>
		<chapeau>For purposes of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tII/stB/s276/a/1/qB/i/1" id="H36A8E6DBC30E427E8F01B088D5BBC623" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="798">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> no amount shall be included in the gross income of the eligible recipient by reason of forgiveness of indebtedness described in subsection (b), </content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tII/stB/s276/a/1/qB/i/2" id="H101877B686884447BC95DD9C872EEAA7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="798">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> no deduction shall be denied, no tax attribute shall be reduced, and no basis increase shall be denied, by reason of the exclusion from gross income provided by paragraph (1), and</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tII/stB/s276/a/1/qB/i/3" id="HE317A1DCF6FB4C3FA13C4C91F9B444D3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="798">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<chapeau> in the case of an eligible recipient that is a partnership or S corporation—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tII/stB/s276/a/1/qB/i/3/A" id="H2B2AFA4A4F814A928CD8B4C5C7128C13" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="798">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> any amount excluded from income by reason of paragraph (1) shall be treated as tax exempt income for purposes of sections 705 and 1366 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tII/stB/s276/a/1/qB/i/3/B" id="HEB852F0B4A774BF882C1A2A19FEEC589" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="798">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> except as provided by the Secretary of the Treasury (or the Secretary’s delegate), any increase in the adjusted basis of a partner’s interest in a partnership under <ref href="/us/usc/26/705">section 705</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 with respect to any amount described in subparagraph (A) shall equal the partner’s distributive share of deductions resulting from costs giving rise to forgiveness described in subsection (b).”</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H5F5E1551C9344776B47A83F732D640E4" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dN/tII/stB/s283/a/qB/g" id="H273453BF70A049BC96F7D100118EB587" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="803">
		<num value="g">“(g)</num>
		<chapeau> Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, the Commissioner of Social Security shall enter into an agreement with the Secretary of the Treasury under which—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tII/stB/s283/a/qB/g/1" id="H779BCE6945F748D6BEF9F1D7BB5244EA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="803">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> if the Secretary provides the Commissioner with the information described in <ref href="/us/usc/26/6103">section 6103(k)(15)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 with respect to any individual, the Commissioner shall indicate to the Secretary as to whether such individual receives disability insurance benefits under section 223 or supplemental security income benefits under title XVI (including State supplementary payments of the type referred to in section 1616(a) or payments of the type described in section 212(a) of <ref href="/us/pl/93/66">Public Law 93–66</ref>);</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tII/stB/s283/a/qB/g/2" id="HFE879E9E910A4DC995761C9CBA7D1EB9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="803">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> appropriate safeguards are included to assure that the indication described in paragraph (1) will be used solely for the purpose of determining if tax receivables involving such individual are not eligible for collection pursuant to a qualified tax collection contract by reason of <ref href="/us/usc/26/6306">section 6306(d)(3)(E)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986; and</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tII/stB/s283/a/qB/g/3" id="H7CDFD184494249C592B0CDBF2CE0A17D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="803">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<content> the Secretary shall pay the Commissioner of Social Security the full costs (including systems and administrative costs) of providing the indication described in paragraph (1).”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="HD81789AA4E23454AAED6F0AE64544CDE" orig_name="quotedContent"> “(7) Election to end transfer period.— “(A) In general.— In the case of an employer maintaining a plan which has made a qualified future transfer under this subsection, such employer may, not later than December 31, 2021, elect to terminate the transfer period with respect to such transfer effective as of any taxable year specified by the taxpayer that begins after the date of such election. “(B) Amounts transferred to plan on termination.— Any assets transferred to a health benefits account, or an applicable life insurance account, in a qualified future transfer (and any income allocable thereto) which are not used as of the effective date of the election to terminate the transfer period with respect to such transfer under subparagraph (A), shall be transferred out of the account to the transferor plan within a reasonable period of time. The transfer required by this subparagraph shall be treated as an employer reversion for purposes of section 4980 (other than subsection (d) thereof), unless before the end of the 5-year period beginning after the original transfer period an equivalent amount is transferred back to such health benefits account, or applicable life insurance account, as the case may be. Any such transfer back pursuant to the preceding sentence may be made without regard to section 401(h)(1). “(C) Minimum cost requirements continue.— The requirements of subsection (c)(3) and paragraph (2)(D) shall apply with respect to a qualified future transfer without regard to any election under subparagraph (A) with respect to such transfer. “(D) Modified maintenance of funded status during original transfer period.— The requirements of paragraph (2)(B) shall apply without regard to any such election, and clause (i) thereof shall be applied by substituting ‘100 percent’ for ‘120 percent’ during the original transfer period. “(E) Continued maintenance of funding status after original transfer period.— “(i) In general.— In the case of a plan with respect to which there is an excess described in paragraph (2)(B)(ii) as of the valuation date of the plan year in the last year of the original transfer period, paragraph (2)(B) shall apply for 5 years after the original transfer period in the same manner as during a transfer period by substituting the applicable percentage for ‘120 percent’ in clause (i) thereof. “(ii) Applicable percentage.— For purposes of this subparagraph, the applicable percentage shall be determined under the following table:
“For the valuation date of the plan year in the following year after the original transfer period: The applicable percentage is:
1st 104 percent
2nd 108 percent
3rd 112 percent
4th 116 percent
5th 120 percent
“(iii) Early termination of continued maintenance period when 120 percent funding reached.— If, as of the valuation date of any plan year in the first 4 years after the original transfer period with respect to a qualified future transfer, there would be no excess determined under this subparagraph were the applicable percentage 120 percent, then this subparagraph shall cease to apply with respect to the plan. “(F) Original transfer period.— For purposes of this paragraph, the term ‘original transfer period’ means the transfer period under this subsection with respect to a qualified future transfer determined without regard to the election under subparagraph (A). ” #component(paragraph());

		<num value="2">“(2)</num>
		<chapeau> either—</chapeau>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tII/stB/s286/b/2/qB/2/A" id="HF54A80640F8B43EA8E94467814A674B8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="809">

			<chapeau> would be so entitled if—</chapeau>

				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> such Act were applied by substituting ‘<quotedText>March 31, 2021</quotedText>’ for ‘<quotedText>December 31, 2020</quotedText>’ in section 5109 thereof, and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dN/tII/stB/s286/b/2/qB/2/B/ii" id="HA87877E443CF430CA45E68031869499E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="809">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> the individual were an employee of an employer (other than himself or herself).”</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

Section 1109(d)(2)(D) of the CARES Act (15 U.S.C. 9008(d)(2)(D))
Section 7(a)(36) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 636(a)(36))
Section 7A of the Small Business Act, as redesignated and transferred by paragraph (1) of this subsection,

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="HFB69BBDB7C1C4E45AB218D13ACF25D25" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dN/tIII/s305/a/qB/h" id="H009B3E55FABA412582DE5D8E9ABF997F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="815">
		<num value="h">“(h)</num>
		<heading> Hold harmless.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s305/a/qB/h/1" id="H54FF96B074A34C58B2E0CAAA12CCBA1C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="816">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> Definition.—</heading>
			<content>In this subsection, the term ‘<term>initial or second draw PPP loan</term>’ means a covered loan or a loan under paragraph (37) of section 7(a). </content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s305/a/qB/h/2" id="H23D1298C301049CDBEEC0BC73A5A0782" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="816">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Reliance.—</heading>
			<chapeau>A lender may rely on any certification or documentation submitted by an applicant for an initial or second draw PPP loan or an eligible recipient or eligible entity receiving initial or second draw PPP loan that—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s305/a/qB/h/2/A" id="H65E481E15F1144B8B98EDDF2C40B0DD9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="816">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> is submitted pursuant to all applicable statutory requirements, regulations, and guidance related to initial or second draw PPP loan, including under paragraph (36) or (37) of section 7(a) and under this section; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s305/a/qB/h/2/B" id="H3A5C0B34C73145119C3BF9AEFE10C144" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="816">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> attests that the applicant, eligible recipient, or eligible entity, as applicable, has accurately provided the certification or documentation to the lender in accordance with the statutory requirements, regulations, and guidance described in subparagraph (A).</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s305/a/qB/h/3" id="HDFF5F8FC685D48BE9DC7789E2157DA2B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="816">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> No enforcement action.—</heading>
			<chapeau>With respect to a lender that relies on a certification or documentation described in paragraph (2) related to an initial or second draw PPP loan, an enforcement action may not be taken against the lender, and the lender shall not be subject to any penalties relating to loan origination or forgiveness of the initial or second draw PPP loan, if—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s305/a/qB/h/3/A" id="H6ED49848603943BE9A339A820901B6C2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="816">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> the lender acts in good faith relating to loan origination or forgiveness of the initial or second draw PPP loan based on that reliance; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s305/a/qB/h/3/B" id="HCF0649ADF7F44903B68A2113FDDA010C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="816">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> all other relevant Federal, State, local, and other statutory and regulatory requirements applicable to the lender are satisfied with respect to the initial or second draw PPP loan.”</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

	<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s310/a/1/qB/T" id="H9A867513942C49538E990F215301FD2F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="819">
		<num value="T">“(T)</num>
		<heading> Requirement for date in operation.—</heading>
		<content>A business or organization that was not in operation on February 15, 2020 shall not be eligible for a loan under this paragraph.”</content>

cite.cite_text: Paragraph (12) of section 7A(a) of the Small Business Act, as so redesignated and transferred by section 304 of this Act,

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H9A55156B6A944718B6B13437D03DCE2D" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dN/tIII/s320/a/qB/g" id="H5398828689EE44F0827EF1429B30708E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="834">
		<num value="g">“(g)</num>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s320/a/qB/g/1" id="H27A53F6D93B1411DB67BDC4C2321D308" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="834">
			<num value="1">(1)</num>
			<content> The court, after notice and a hearing, may authorize a debtor in possession or a trustee that is authorized to operate the business of the debtor under section 1183, 1184, 1203, 1204, or 1304 of this title to obtain a loan under paragraph (36) or (37) of section 7(a) of the Small Business Act (<ref href="/us/usc/15/636">15 U.S.C. 636(a)</ref>), and such loan shall be treated as a debt to the extent the loan is not forgiven in accordance with section 7A of the Small Business Act or subparagraph (J) of such paragraph (37), as applicable, with priority equal to a claim of the kind specified in subsection (c)(1) of this section.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s320/a/qB/g/2" id="HEF0F23CFBA9A4797AD0B5EDBE25C25D2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="834">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> The trustee may incur debt described in paragraph (1) notwithstanding any provision in a contract, prior order authorizing the trustee to incur debt under this section, prior order authorizing the trustee to use cash collateral under section 363, or applicable law that prohibits the debtor from incurring additional debt.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s320/a/qB/g/3" id="HAC6CA3B1116540899B4ADD9B41DCD916" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="834">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<content> The court shall hold a hearing within 7 days after the filing and service of the motion to obtain a loan described in paragraph (1). Notwithstanding the Federal Rules of Bankruptcy Procedure, at such hearing, the court may grant relief on a final basis.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 364 of title 11, United States Code,

cite.cite_text: Section 503(b) of title 11, United States Code,

insert end <__xml__ id="HE0429DF632144C2F9C783E75BF894D48" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dN/tIII/s320/c/qB/f" id="HD0CB4EF89C2E4469884723AA1492FD1C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="835">
		<num value="f">“(f)</num>
		<heading> Special provision related to COVID–19 pandemic.—</heading>
		<content>Notwithstanding <ref href="/us/usc/26/1129">section 1129(a)(9)(A)</ref> of this title and subsection (e) of this section, a plan that provides for payment of a claim of a kind specified in <ref href="/us/usc/26/503">section 503(b)(10)</ref> of this title may be confirmed under subsection (b) of this section if the plan proposes to make payments on account of such claim when due under the terms of the loan giving rise to such claim.”</content>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

Section 7(a)(2)(A) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 636(a)(2)(A))

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H9C042742C5E641B18434AD1C88ADFDEF" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s326/a/2/qB/A" id="H0A8DE82073854C2AB21BC17E7109EBD4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="855">
		<num value="A">“(A)</num>
		<heading> In general.—</heading>
		<chapeau>Except as provided in subparagraphs (B), (D), (E), and (F), in an agreement to participate in a loan on a deferred basis under this subsection (including a loan made under the Preferred Lenders Program), such participation by the Administration shall be equal to—</chapeau>
		<clause identifier="/dN/tIII/s326/a/2/qB/A/i" id="HCC2A47B1CB7749838F8E097D5CD6CA3C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="855">
			<num value="i">“(i)</num>
			<content> 75 percent of the balance of the financing outstanding at the time of disbursement of the loan, if such balance exceeds $150,000; or</content>
		</clause>
		<clause identifier="/dN/tIII/s326/a/2/qB/A/ii" id="H7CD509030743416B85D7CFB3A27D880F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="855">
			<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
			<content> 85 percent of the balance of the financing outstanding at the time of disbursement of the loan, if such balance is less than or equal to $150,000.”</content>
		</clause>
	</subparagraph>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 502(7) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 (15 U.S.C. 696(7))

execution.ampl:
strike subsection( "(e)"); insert <__xml__ id="HB63DB34FB0C74B17A3F5D7362018AE7B" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dN/tIII/s328/b/1/qB/e" id="HED8AC6357EA740C68A8E07FECB0E0867" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="859">
		<num value="e">“(e)</num>
		<heading> Express loan authority.—</heading>
		<chapeau>A local development company designated as an accredited lender in accordance with subsection (b)—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s328/b/1/qB/e/1" id="H35BFE32DB1C545C6ADE083636B1315A8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="859">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<chapeau> may—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s328/b/1/qB/e/1/A" id="H9B83371349D041089E5595775750DDEA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="859">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> approve, authorize, close, and service covered loans that are funded with proceeds of a debenture issued by the company; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s328/b/1/qB/e/1/B" id="H48588D2546484FA8B833D78D9F264F25" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="859">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> authorize the guarantee of a debenture described in subparagraph (A); and</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s328/b/1/qB/e/2" id="H96DE2919487144BB93B091D4ECD78434" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="859">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> with respect to a covered loan, shall be subject to final approval as to eligibility of any guarantee by the Administration pursuant to section 503(a), but such final approval shall not include review of decisions by the lender involving creditworthiness, loan closing, or compliance with legal requirements imposed by law or regulation. </content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
	<subsection identifier="/dN/tIII/s328/b/1/qB/f" id="H7163BC05804C44639CC2A963793FF076" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="859">
		<num value="f">“(f)</num>
		<heading> Definitions.—</heading>
		<chapeau>In this section—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s328/b/1/qB/f/1" id="H9607F038E2734B71A3DF285884CBD0B7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="859">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> the term ‘<term>accredited lender certified company</term>’ means a certified development company that meets the requirements under subsection (b), including a certified development company that the Administration has designated as an accredited lender under that subsection; </content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s328/b/1/qB/f/2" id="H0A66C9240F0B45748D07117028040C10" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="859">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<chapeau> the term ‘<term>covered loan</term>’—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s328/b/1/qB/f/2/A" id="HEA3EFA1BC88844879E9E8D31C582BAC5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="859">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> means a loan made under section 502 in an amount that is not more than $500,000; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s328/b/1/qB/f/2/B" id="HA9144D0638D14856BB13DB089C63FA3D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="859">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> does not include a loan made to a borrower that is in an industry that has a high rate of default, as annually determined by the Administrator and reported in rules of the Administration; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIII/s328/b/1/qB/f/3" id="HF6262837F7194FFCA04BDCFBBF723A56" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="859">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<content> the term ‘<term>qualified State or local development company</term>’ has the meaning given the term in section 503(e).”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 507 of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 (15 U.S.C. 697d)

execution.ampl:
strike subsection({ "(e)",  "(f)"}); insert <__xml__ id="HDE55D06116A94AE0BC81C9691CE6E87B" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dN/tIII/s328/b/2/qB/e" id="H701C804C9FA348AD95008EF1B0D1B07C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="859">
		<num value="e">“(e)</num>
		<heading> Definition.—</heading>
		<content>In this section, the term ‘<term>qualified State or local development company</term>’ has the meaning given the term in section 503(e).”</content>

H2EBA5FCD1B954D3AA3338CE6BFA5645C.author: jwagner
H2EBA5FCD1B954D3AA3338CE6BFA5645C.privateComment: Ref to "this Act" probably means "this title"

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H9D7924D04B384534A7DC39B621830942" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dN/tIV/stA/s412/a/qB/c" id="H2FB33465F26747798E897917B2E32895" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="879">
		<num value="c">“(c)</num>
		<heading> Continued application.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIV/stA/s412/a/qB/c/1" id="H91907298F23946639B1FC3664E335323" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="879">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>If, after the date of enactment of this subsection, a contractor expends any funds made available pursuant to section 4112 and distributed pursuant to section 4113, the assurances in paragraphs (1) through (3) of subsection (a) shall continue to apply until the dates included in such paragraphs, or the date on which the contractor fully expends such financial assistance, whichever is later.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIV/stA/s412/a/qB/c/2" id="H1EB2A5F488854A0B92EF5A844F5D48BC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="879">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Special rule.—</heading>
			<content>Not later than April 5, 2021, each contractor described in section 4111(3)(A)(i) that has received funds pursuant to such section 4112 shall report to the Secretary on the amount of such funds that the contractor has expended through March 31, 2021. If the contractor has expended an amount that is less than 100 percent of the total amount of funds the contractor received under such section, the Secretary shall initiate an action to recover any funds that remain unexpended as of April 30, 2021. </content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
	<subsection identifier="/dN/tIV/stA/s412/a/qB/d" id="H2E5848AED6FC42D39FDC02DB65256D89" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="879">
		<num value="d">“(d)</num>
		<heading> Recall of employees.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIV/stA/s412/a/qB/d/1" id="HF4509ACAEB254E8D9E4F32F35EC12D95" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="879">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>Subject to paragraph (2), any contractor that has unspent financial assistance provided under this subtitle as of the date of enactment of this subsection and conducted involuntary furloughs or reduced pay rates and benefits, between March 27, 2020, and the date on which the contractor entered into an agreement with the Secretary related to financial assistance under this subtitle, shall recall (as defined in section 4111) employees who were involuntarily furloughed during such period by not later than January 4, 2021.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIV/stA/s412/a/qB/d/2" id="H3A3A3F7E828542F5989ABAACF22EAA75" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="879">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Waiver.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary of the Treasury shall waive the requirement under paragraph (1) for a contractor to recall employees if the contractor certifies that the contractor has or will have insufficient remaining financial assistance provided under this subtitle to keep recalled employees employed for more than two weeks upon returning to work. </content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIV/stA/s412/a/qB/d/3" id="H472F75021A7A46278D3A42065CCF289A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="880">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> Audits.—</heading>
			<content>The Inspector General of the Department of the Treasury shall audit certifications made under paragraph (2).”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>#component(subsection());

cite.cite_text: Section 4114 of the CARES Act (15 U.S.C. 9074)
Section 4111 of the CARES Act (15 U.S.C. 9071)

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H3E0F67387AA3416A92409511A02EA1BA" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dN/tIV/stA/s412/c/qB/11" id="H0E38FE88AA7B4EA1B9D5B14E76965689" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="880">
		<num value="11">“(11)</num>
		<heading> Aerospace-related businesses critical to maintaining national security.—</heading>
		<content>The term ‘<quotedText>businesses critical to maintaining national security</quotedText>’ means those businesses that manufacture or produce aerospace-related products, civil or defense, including those that design, integrate, assemble, supply, maintain, and repair such products, and other businesses involved in aerospace-related manufacturing or production as further defined by the Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Transportation. For purposes of the preceding sentence, aerospace-related products include, but are not limited to, components, parts, or systems of aircraft, aircraft engines, or appliances for inclusion in an aircraft, aircraft engine, or appliance.”</content>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="HAF559DCEB7944C6C8FDC033349D8C2F6" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dQ/tI/s105/b/qB/5" id="H66B4EA7F62A84E379621C20085558BB3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="990">
		<num value="5">“(5)</num>
		<heading> Trailing documents.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dQ/tI/s105/b/qB/5/A" id="H47D945D7C8A3473798ECD1263FFDA963" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="990">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The Secretary may issue a certificate of guarantee under this subsection for a loan involving a security interest in Indian trust land before the Secretary receives the trailing documents required by the Secretary from the Bureau of Indian Affairs, including the final certified title status report showing the recordation by the Bureau of Indian Affairs of the mortgage relating to the loan, if the originating lender agrees to indemnify the Secretary for any losses that may result when—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dQ/tI/s105/b/qB/5/A/i" id="H5EF637CA6C704C0E83070FA0EC99B042" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="990">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> a claim payment is presented to the Secretary due to the default of the borrower on the loan; and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dQ/tI/s105/b/qB/5/A/ii" id="H725FEB9C6A464970B468B151E5F9665B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="990">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> the required trailing documents are outstanding.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dQ/tI/s105/b/qB/5/B" id="H709ECBEEE42F473CA367B06B2EC5B0DA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="990">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Termination of indemnification agreement.—</heading>
			<content>An indemnification agreement between an originating lender and the Secretary described in subparagraph (A) shall only terminate upon receipt by the Secretary of the trailing documents described in that subparagraph in a form and manner that is acceptable to the Secretary.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dQ/tI/s105/b/qB/5/C" id="HEBEEC190B1E64A3A919E61D887E7E5CC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="990">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<heading> Rule of construction.—</heading>
			<content>Nothing in this paragraph shall be construed as authorizing the Bureau of Indian Affairs to delay the issuance of a final certified title status report and recorded mortgage relating to a loan closed on Indian trust land.”</content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="HB2BC1441AABC46C1AD36041121FDE031" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dQ/tII/stB/s223/a/qB/f" id="H5D71A254FF7C4E5E99D2AB8211710757" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1020">
		<num value="f">“(f)</num>
		<content> A third party may submit for consideration for inclusion in the record of an application evidence relevant to a ground for refusal of registration. The third-party submission shall identify the ground for refusal and include a concise description of each piece of evidence submitted in support of each identified ground for refusal. Not later than 2 months after the date on which the submission is filed, the Director shall determine whether the evidence should be included in the record of the application. The Director shall establish by regulation appropriate procedures for the consideration of evidence submitted by a third party under this subsection and may prescribe a fee to accompany the submission. If the Director determines that the third-party evidence should be included in the record of the application, only the evidence and the ground for refusal to which the evidence relates may be so included. Any determination by the Director whether or not to include evidence in the record of an application shall be final and non-reviewable, and a determination to include or to not include evidence in the record shall not prejudice any party’s right to raise any issue and rely on any evidence in any other proceeding.”</content>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 1 of the Trademark Act of 1946 (15 U.S.C. 1051)

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H8DD25454FF194059AEB8D345DB3A199F" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dQ/tII/stB/s224/qB/b" id="H828AF61773164ECBA28CF2D48788876C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1020">
		<num value="b">“(b)</num>
		<paragraph identifier="/dQ/tII/stB/s224/qB/b/1" id="H35960B3CCD2E4DE9A4F473EB6418C91D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1020">
			<num value="1">(1)</num>
			<content> If the applicant is found not entitled to registration, the examiner shall notify the applicant thereof and of the reasons therefor. The applicant may reply or amend the application, which shall then be reexamined. This procedure may be repeated until the examiner finally refuses registration of the mark or the application is abandoned as described in paragraph (2).</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dQ/tII/stB/s224/qB/b/2" id="HC5B17C2D870943468715AF6E1E0F8B22" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1020">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> After notification under paragraph (1), the applicant shall have a period of 6 months in which to reply or amend the application, or such shorter time that is not less than 60 days, as prescribed by the Director by regulation. If the applicant fails to reply or amend or appeal within the relevant time period, including any extension under paragraph (3), the application shall be deemed to have been abandoned, unless it can be shown to the satisfaction of the Director that the delay in responding was unintentional, in which case the application may be revived and such time may be extended. The Director may prescribe a fee to accompany any request to revive.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dQ/tII/stB/s224/qB/b/3" id="H645402FDC92C4DCDAA347BDDF415C7BD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1020">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<content> The Director shall provide, by regulation, for extensions of time to respond to the examiner for any time period under paragraph (2) that is less than 6 months. The Director shall allow the applicant to obtain extensions of time to reply or amend aggregating 6 months from the date of notification under paragraph (1) when the applicant so requests. However, the Director may set by regulation the time for individual periods of extension, and prescribe a fee, by regulation, for any extension request. Any request for extension shall be filed on or before the date on which a reply or amendment is due under paragraph (1).”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<chapeau> $28,700,000 for fiscal year 2023, of which—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/2/C/i" id="H8825CB7A622E458F90FA2FAA5BFCE4B0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> $3,000,000 shall be used to carry out section 12 of the Pipeline Safety Improvement Act of 2002 (<ref href="/us/usc/49/60101">49 U.S.C. 60101</ref> note; <ref href="/us/pl/107/355">Public Law 107–355</ref>); and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/2/C/ii" id="H8DA3555E33B447ABA718B2257F0D5134" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> $13,000,000 shall be used for making grants.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/3" id="H6C8C2010FEC14927BE384C655A3F7B97" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> Underground natural gas storage facility safety account.—</heading>
			<content>From fees collected under section 60302, there is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out section 60141 $8,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2023.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4" id="H7E5230A5811B4211983208C597145E27" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
			<num value="4">“(4)</num>
			<heading> Recruitment and retention.—</heading>
			<chapeau>From amounts made available to the Secretary under paragraphs (1) and (2), the Secretary shall use—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/A" id="HC0C6C3BDF7014F939575A4B8F2FB73EE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<chapeau> $ 1,520,000 to carry out section 102(b)(1) of the <shortTitle>PIPES Act of 2020</shortTitle>, of which—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/A/i" id="HB078C5FC6A734640BBE6BA97264E6544" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> $1,292,000 shall be from amounts made available under paragraph (1)(A); and </content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/A/ii" id="H224E7674BCEE41869A89E46DF1D9618A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> $228,000 shall be from amounts made available under paragraph (2)(A);</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/B" id="HB8DCE78805AC438FA7C5DEE525667A33" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<chapeau> $2,300,000 to carry out section 102(b)(2)(A) of the <shortTitle>PIPES Act of 2020</shortTitle>, of which—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/B/i" id="HACC16EB6CE274F5FB633E361C5F03865" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> $1,955,000 shall be from amounts made available under paragraph (1)(A); and </content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/B/ii" id="HF471488489B04803A94E9ED31DE03021" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> $345,000 shall be from amounts made available under paragraph (2)(A);</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/C" id="HB110565F13E44F2BB4B55ED2F82A1D44" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<chapeau> $1,600,000 to carry out section 102(b)(2)(B) of the <shortTitle>PIPES Act of 2020</shortTitle>, of which—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/C/i" id="H79BFC064FD6344D38878F15F5D7F018A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> $1,360,000 shall be from amounts made available under paragraph (1)(B); and </content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/C/ii" id="H74FED9B7071242ECAB80DFE1494397D0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> $240,000 shall be from amounts made available under paragraph (2)(B);</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/D" id="HAA5A0DF6EB8E452E81533F6935A17B23" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
				<num value="D">“(D)</num>
				<chapeau> $1,800,000 to carry out section 102(b)(2)(C) of the <shortTitle>PIPES Act of 2020</shortTitle>, of which—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/D/i" id="HFE1271DE4BB04247B137A96905CD02B7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> $ 1,530,000 shall be from amounts made available under paragraph (1)(C); and </content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/D/ii" id="H12C341DA7C774B5CA4C1701F17245531" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> $270,000 shall be from amounts made available under paragraph (2)(C);</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/E" id="HE0B68B60FEE34AB9A4269FC022B162DD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
				<num value="E">“(E)</num>
				<chapeau> $2,455,000 to carry out section 102(c) of the <shortTitle>PIPES Act of 2020</shortTitle> in fiscal year 2021, of which—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/E/i" id="H9757EDDF0EE74B63AC8F63906356B651" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> $2,086,750 shall be from amounts made available under paragraph (1)(A); and </content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/E/ii" id="H1FEC59CA5C154BC5858AE2CEFBD53142" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> $368,250 shall be from amounts made available under paragraph (2)(A);</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/F" id="HFA0BFB7862294DA6A3E1F50442FCBDD4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
				<num value="F">“(F)</num>
				<chapeau> $2,455,000 to carry out section 102(c) of the <shortTitle>PIPES Act of 2020</shortTitle> in fiscal year 2022, of which—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/F/i" id="HFA5CB14CDF574A40B34C488A4E307DF8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1031">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> $2,086,750 shall be from amounts made available under paragraph (1)(B); and </content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/F/ii" id="H0B323B06827F448DBCC32DD9BA6C134E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1032">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> $368,250 shall be from amounts made available under paragraph (2)(B); and</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/G" id="HF3D0FD5C6D384165A91F017725BE0B14" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1032">
				<num value="G">“(G)</num>
				<chapeau> $2,455,000 to carry out section 102(c) of the <shortTitle>PIPES Act of 2020</shortTitle> in fiscal year 2023, of which—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/G/i" id="H1849AFC96A14408FACA1A476A68BA3E7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1032">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> $2,086,750 shall be from amounts made available under paragraph (1)(C); and </content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s101/a/qB/a/4/G/ii" id="H6F1699A492B74502B68AD4A1DEE09C1A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1032">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> $368,250 shall be from amounts made available under paragraph (2)(C).”</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H1D7C38E5B3A94F099D021379D39626D1" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q" id="H2498FD9539E94CA99279D2A82C3E6C72" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1047">
		<num value="q">“(q)</num>
		<heading> Gas pipeline leak detection and repair.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/1" id="H34BEF232ADF94589AB60F72CE98BDEB0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1047">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<chapeau>Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall promulgate final regulations that require operators of regulated gathering lines (as defined pursuant to subsection (b) of section 60101 for purposes of subsection (a)(21) of that section) in a Class 2 location, Class 3 location, or Class 4 location, as determined under section 192.5 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, operators of new and existing gas transmission pipeline facilities, and operators of new and existing gas distribution pipeline facilities to conduct leak detection and repair programs—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/1/A" id="HA993F81A18444D7DA8C28F71901C682A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> to meet the need for gas pipeline safety, as determined by the Secretary; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/1/B" id="HFBECACC337C84ABE8BD4E3EBEE41041B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> to protect the environment.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/2" id="H278B3E06F2F44F1589EF38AB4775EF98" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Leak detection and repair programs.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/2/A" id="H5375AB87F81D47E99B04326344626C36" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> Minimum performance standards.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The final regulations promulgated under paragraph (1) shall include, for the leak detection and repair programs described in that paragraph, minimum performance standards that reflect the capabilities of commercially available advanced technologies that, with respect to each pipeline covered by the programs, are appropriate for—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/2/A/i" id="HC9A6448A77FE40E3B2D6212FC60E587D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> the type of pipeline; </content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/2/A/ii" id="H89D7D5FC9EAE4E8C9E1750AB4D3DEE80" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> the location of the pipeline; </content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/2/A/iii" id="H7F6B1FDC467D459EBD9E048D516E4693" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<content> the material of which the pipeline is constructed; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/2/A/iv" id="H65B2BD84B3C44C81AFCE9C07F74DF2AB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
					<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
					<content> the materials transported by the pipeline.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/2/B" id="HB19D6110D2F34F32990C2E63D6C31E19" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Requirement.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The leak detection and repair programs described in paragraph (1) shall be able to identify, locate, and categorize all leaks that—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/2/B/i" id="HF62663D15E2A41649BC1917D077013D9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> are hazardous to human safety or the environment; or</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/2/B/ii" id="H1F9301AA72174E2DAB1108C8369DF99F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> have the potential to become explosive or otherwise hazardous to human safety.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3" id="H4F42413324F04D5196A8C71DD7899F78" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> Advanced leak detection technologies and practices.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3/A" id="H9CD62A4555D04268AFBC3D740CCBF8F9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The final regulations promulgated under paragraph (1) shall—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3/A/i" id="H844F73C6805A411FB0C8E00A2A9AD505" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> require the use of advanced leak detection technologies and practices described in subparagraph (B);</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3/A/ii" id="HF7408EF7569D49BC94690A7091E0D17D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> identify any scenarios where operators may use leak detection practices that depend on human senses; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3/A/iii" id="H0C791248FF5C44259798D7ADA1EE11FC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<content> include a schedule for repairing or replacing each leaking pipe, except a pipe with a leak so small that it poses no potential hazard, with appropriate deadlines.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3/B" id="HAC937A69974542F8A677E718711D0923" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Advanced leak detection technologies and practices described.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The advanced leak detection technologies and practices referred to in subparagraph (A)(i) include—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3/B/i" id="H477190563D5342198730078B39266630" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<chapeau> for new and existing gas distribution pipeline facilities, technologies and practices to detect pipeline leaks—</chapeau>
					<subclause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3/B/i/I" id="H7672C323B2BD4FD2888D7BE05D2FB761" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1048">
						<num value="I">“(I)</num>
						<content> through continuous monitoring on or along the pipeline; or</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3/B/i/II" id="HE475E17613E745879D8BD075B8518F68" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1049">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> through periodic surveys with handheld equipment, equipment mounted on mobile platforms, or other means using commercially available technology;</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3/B/ii" id="HB907F62CAE364BD9893C13A372BE7BD1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1049">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<chapeau> for new and existing gas transmission pipeline facilities, technologies and practices to detect pipeline leaks through—</chapeau>
					<subclause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3/B/ii/I" id="H88012AB12DC649F787B730B6514CE731" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1049">
						<num value="I">“(I)</num>
						<content> equipment that is capable of continuous monitoring; or</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3/B/ii/II" id="H56BD24D5B8C344B5990EA0D112F5127B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1049">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> periodic surveys with handheld equipment, equipment mounted on mobile platforms, or other means using commercially available technology; and</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3/B/iii" id="H121D0146A8A0481BB9AF9EAA64040789" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1049">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<chapeau> for regulated gathering lines in Class 2 locations, Class 3 locations, or Class 4 locations, technologies and practices to detect pipeline leaks through—</chapeau>
					<subclause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3/B/iii/I" id="HB455E7C9849949B1A8C6AC6925780418" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1049">
						<num value="I">“(I)</num>
						<content> equipment that is capable of continuous monitoring; or</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/3/B/iii/II" id="H23E74F5593AC4A5BBCAB73AA052FC65C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1049">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> periodic surveys with handheld equipment, equipment mounted on mobile platforms, or other means using commercially available technology.</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/4" id="H5B9625BAE42544138EE712029BA91505" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1049">
			<num value="4">“(4)</num>
			<heading> Rules of construction.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/4/A" id="HCC48B81B48BD401898EC63F71E537F1F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1049">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> Surveys and Timelines.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In promulgating regulations under this subsection, the Secretary—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/4/A/i" id="H785BDC76072D414DBB97DEEF417BD541" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1049">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> may not reduce the frequency of surveys required under any other provision of this chapter or stipulated by regulation as of the date of enactment of this subsection; and </content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/4/A/ii" id="HDA98AF62F6BB476F827EA054B6BA1D77" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1049">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> may not extend the duration of any timelines for the repair or remediation of leaks that are stipulated by regulation as of the date of enactment of this subsection.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/4/B" id="H6F5B72552B164812892040C74638148E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1049">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Application.—</heading>
				<content>The limitations in this paragraph do not restrict the Secretary’s ability to modify any regulations through proceedings separate from or subsequent to the final regulations required under paragraph (1).</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s113/qB/q/4/C" id="H8F0167A65F68405D936E55F24DEDA393" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1049">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<heading> Existing authority.—</heading>
				<content>Nothing in this subsection may be construed to alter the authority of the Secretary to regulate gathering lines as defined pursuant to section 60101.”</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

execution.ampl:
strike paragraph( "(2)"); insert <__xml__ id="HED22A296AD9846AD9264E67E1CFD689E" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dR/tI/s121/qB/2" id="H5E8DA171720B4EB6B5BB5B529FB77B2A" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
		<num value="2">“(2)</num>
		<heading> Submission of report.—</heading>
		<chapeau>As soon as practicable, but not later than 5 business days, after a representative of a person to whom this section applies first establishes that a condition described in paragraph (1) exists, the operator shall submit the report required under that paragraph to— </chapeau>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s121/qB/2/A" id="HCD57BC155B544ECB949CE767E8541ACD" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<content> the Secretary;</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s121/qB/2/B" id="H9A02E736BD114C92B994B0F34C613459" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<content> the appropriate State authority or, where no appropriate State authority exists, to the Governor of a State where the subject of the Safety Related Condition report occurred; and</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s121/qB/2/C" id="HDA249A88EF14435680814749BFBFBADC" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<content> the appropriate Tribe where the subject of the Safety Related Condition report occurred.</content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
	<paragraph identifier="/dR/tI/s121/qB/3" id="H34D81A82A9984A319AC44D09AB34628D" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
		<num value="3">“(3)</num>
		<heading> Submission of report to other entities.—</heading>
		<chapeau>Upon request, a State authority or a Governor that receives a report submitted under this subsection may submit the report to any relevant emergency response or planning entity, including any—</chapeau>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s121/qB/3/A" id="HE7B2A8142A3B423C9116FC662BBBA161" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<content> State emergency response commission established pursuant to section 301 of the Emergency Planning and Community Right-To-Know Act of 1986 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/11001">42 U.S.C. 11001</ref>);</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s121/qB/3/B" id="H24D3ED8D13A741DB8F69F0DC61A85F31" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<content> Tribal emergency response commission or emergency planning committee (as defined in part 355 of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations (or a successor regulation)); </content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s121/qB/3/C" id="H79CA271AC0314218BDFA69E69E6C7005" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<content> local emergency planning committee established pursuant to section 301 of the Emergency Planning and Community Right-To-Know Act of 1986 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/11001">42 U.S.C. 11001</ref>); or</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s121/qB/3/D" id="H07AB992B6A764B8D9EDB6D953E0929EE" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
			<num value="D">“(D)</num>
			<content> other public agency responsible for emergency response.”</content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 60102(h) of title 49, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 49 of the United States Code

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H78A3EBB8B6004FF29653FC0C04E43206" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dR/tI/s122/qB/12" id="HAB4C6B3996F8424F94266080E661A66D" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
		<num value="12">“(12)</num>
		<heading> Distribution pipelines.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s122/qB/12/A" id="H57CA9D130516434B8F9CDA7BBD049761" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> Study.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The Secretary shall conduct a study of methods that may be used under paragraph (3), other than direct assessment, to assess distribution pipelines to determine whether any such method—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s122/qB/12/A/i" id="HFC811202E76944C596B2E25A90761024" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> would provide a greater level of safety than direct assessment of the pipelines; and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s122/qB/12/A/ii" id="H34BAB68799354E888C16F64BE15D86C1" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> is feasible.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tI/s122/qB/12/B" id="H74A14052AA764E4AA044585FC33D7451" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Report.—</heading>
			<chapeau>Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this paragraph, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committees on Energy and Commerce and Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a report describing—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s122/qB/12/B/i" id="HA3339A61C1224E00B80BB5CA090DC2FF" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> the results of the study under subparagraph (A); and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tI/s122/qB/12/B/ii" id="HFB2006C3E55A4784AF958370102D5921" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1055">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> recommendations based on that study, if any.”</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 60109(c) of title 49, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 49 of the United States Code

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="HBADD407186B1485A84EE5134F69B4C68" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7" id="H4374D9C8523F49C98642676BD5AFEBD1" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1056">
		<num value="7">“(7)</num>
		<heading> Evaluation of risk.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/A" id="H3A1A24704BBF4EC39CB2C959FEE0B363" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1056">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<chapeau>Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this paragraph, the Secretary shall promulgate regulations to ensure that each distribution integrity management plan developed by an operator of a distribution system includes an evaluation of—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/A/i" id="H854174593E8E408A9F700C6F6C071336" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1056">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> the risks resulting from the presence of cast iron pipes and mains in the distribution system; and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/A/ii" id="H59CFCEF6DC8A4C5FB3BF07AAD4B8E272" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1056">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> the risks that could lead to or result from the operation of a low-pressure distribution system at a pressure that makes the operation of any connected and properly adjusted low-pressure gas burning equipment unsafe, as determined by the Secretary.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/B" id="H205225251E434482AFE472E60FB6569C" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1056">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Consideration.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In carrying out subparagraph (A)(ii), the Secretary shall ensure that an operator of a distribution system—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/B/i" id="HE3647EB8FCC54165AFBB8214A17FE88D" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1056">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> considers factors other than past observed abnormal operating conditions (as defined in section 192.803 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations (or a successor regulation)) in ranking risks and identifying measures to mitigate those risks; and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/B/ii" id="H5786B35EF5F8479C833C7A51EB3C74B4" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1056">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> may not determine that there are no potential consequences associated with low probability events unless that determination is otherwise supported by engineering analysis or operational knowledge.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/C" id="H798600FABD964CF6AAB090437ECFDF99" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1056">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<heading> Deadlines.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/C/i" id="HB227A9D8E8E84B36BFAFEEFAE5C41891" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1056">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this paragraph, each operator of a distribution system shall make available to the Secretary or the relevant State authority with a certification in effect under section 60105, as applicable, a copy of—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/C/i/I" id="H3B176532ABD34D09B7E9C0A634140576" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1056">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> the distribution integrity management plan of the operator;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/C/i/II" id="H0E774856226B41EEABF005E95E1B3A12" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1056">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> the emergency response plan under section 60102(d)(5); and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/C/i/III" id="H4650F372EE6B4702B339E0C9737CF444" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1057">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> the procedural manual for operations, maintenance, and emergencies under section 60102(d)(4).</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/C/ii" id="HFFD24F63D5454EFD884C5A07DED28C97" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1057">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Updates.—</heading>
				<content>Each operator of a distribution system shall make available to the Secretary or make available for inspection to the relevant State authority described in clause (i), if applicable, an updated plan or manual described in that clause by not later than 60 days after the date of a significant update, as determined by the Secretary.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/C/iii" id="H390ACD691C7F4857B4DC883577CE7B5A" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1057">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> Applicability of FOIA.—</heading>
				<content>Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to authorize the disclosure of any information that is exempt from disclosure under section 552(b) of title 5.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/D" id="HE386A25FFEE44BCC89F1D4A84FDD9942" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1057">
			<num value="D">“(D)</num>
			<heading> Review of plans and documents.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/D/i" id="H3766940E0D5E42E4BBB25343F107D164" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1057">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> Timing.—</heading>
				<subclause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/D/i/I" id="H4F8FD64DCA1745168CF5FF4D2F139F7B" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1057">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<content>Not later than 2 years after the date of promulgation of the regulations under subparagraph (A), and not less frequently than once every 5 years thereafter, the Secretary or relevant State authority with a certification in effect under section 60105 shall review the distribution integrity management plan, the emergency response plan, and the procedural manual for operations, maintenance, and emergencies of each operator of a distribution system and record the results of that review for use in the next review of the program of that operator.</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/D/i/II" id="HC6BF6D99AA3E425683CE8024FB1E6D3A" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1057">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<heading> Grace period.—</heading>
					<chapeau>For the third, fourth, and fifth years after the date of promulgation of the regulations under subparagraph (A), the Secretary—</chapeau>
					<item identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/D/i/II/aa" id="H173E88F36FED40898065AE43E0469B88" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1057">
						<num value="aa">“(aa)</num>
						<content> shall not use subclause (I) as justification to reduce funding, decertify, or penalize in any way under section 60105, 60106, or 60107 a State authority that has in effect a certification under section 60105 or an agreement under section 60106; and</content>
					</item>
					<item identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/D/i/II/bb" id="HF8552ED61F83493697F63A78827FA0E8" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1057">
						<num value="bb">“(bb)</num>
						<chapeau> shall—</chapeau>
						<subitem identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/D/i/II/bb/AA" id="H57D80A7B2002468898FFAE0C249958E4" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1057">
							<num value="AA">“(AA)</num>
							<content> submit to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committees on Transportation and Infrastructure and Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives a list of States found to be noncompliant with subclause (I) during the annual program evaluation; and</content>
						</subitem>
						<subitem identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/D/i/II/bb/BB" id="HE52C1683A51E4C5A881B0A7CCD3D1DB1" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1057">
							<num value="BB">“(BB)</num>
							<content> provide a written notice to each State authority described in item (aa) that is not in compliance with the requirements of subclause (I).</content>
						</subitem>
					</item>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/D/ii" id="H0FC95AB3F52C4013A01DDF533A176D75" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1057">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Review.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Each plan or procedural manual made available under subparagraph (C)(i) shall be reexamined—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/D/ii/I" id="H669AF974EF544782BB878C2D08FE0223" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1057">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> on significant change to the plans or procedural manual, as applicable;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/D/ii/II" id="H71669413348042E4B58CB67B3A4F1925" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1058">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> on significant change to the gas distribution system of the operator, as applicable; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/D/ii/III" id="HA72055E1020C4E0F9EFE62E12E35AB67" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1058">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> not less frequently than once every 5 years.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/D/iii" id="H022B4C8FEA6F445597ED4596B38E4A77" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1058">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> Context of review.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary may conduct a review under clause (i) or (ii) as an element of the inspection of the operator carried out by the Secretary.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s202/a/qB/7/D/iv" id="H476EC870B92A44FDA78E4582E74A95E3" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1058">
				<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
				<heading> Inadequate programs.—</heading>
				<content>If the Secretary determines that the documents reviewed under clause (i) or (ii) do not comply with the requirements of this chapter (including regulations to implement this chapter), have not been adequately implemented, or are inadequate for the safe operation of a pipeline facility, the Secretary may conduct proceedings under this chapter.”</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 60109(e) of title 49, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 49 of the United States Code

cite.cite_text: Section 60105(b) of title 49, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 49 of the United States Code

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H66866F272DF94331B19480C3A577FE58" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t" id="H1AF8D4CED32347D5B1CAD0183AC2D0B7" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1060">
		<num value="t">“(t)</num>
		<heading> Other pipeline safety practices.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t/1" id="HA0D2D5ECEC2B4E329356E15FD66D8C56" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1061">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> Records.—</heading>
			<chapeau>Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall promulgate regulations to require an operator of a distribution system—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t/1/A" id="HC6D22DC6A8C845DFA108E69937108698" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1061">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> to identify and manage traceable, reliable, and complete records, including maps and other drawings, critical to ensuring proper pressure controls for a gas distribution system, and updating these records as needed, while collecting and identifying other records necessary for risk analysis on an opportunistic basis; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t/1/B" id="H16E792FD1E9940F092A2FBA08FDC91C7" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1061">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<chapeau> to ensure that the records required under subparagraph (A) are—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t/1/B/i" id="H12E6032F8402419E8D92144652F51C49" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1061">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> accessible to all personnel responsible for performing or overseeing relevant construction or engineering work; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t/1/B/ii" id="H1B5F31C773A44D1B84F17A66DEB59D52" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1061">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> submitted to, or made available for inspection by, the Secretary or the relevant State authority with a certification in effect under section 60105.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t/2" id="H5A71D4C6C4974E0E837422A0A2FDF7B4" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1061">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Presence of qualified employees.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t/2/A" id="HD7ED632BBA0A4D7FB3046CA2FAD644D1" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1061">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall promulgate regulations to require that not less than 1 agent of an operator of a distribution system who is qualified to perform relevant covered tasks, as determined by the Secretary, shall monitor gas pressure at the district regulator station or at an alternative site with equipment capable of ensuring proper pressure controls and have the capability to promptly shut down the flow of gas or control over pressurization at a district regulator station during any construction project that has the potential to cause a hazardous overpressurization at that station, including tie-ins and abandonment of distribution lines and mains, based on an evaluation, conducted by the operator, of threats that could result in unsafe operation.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t/2/B" id="H7FEA82D65C1845BA90CFD340D427F3ED" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1061">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Exclusion.—</heading>
				<content>In promulgating regulations under subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall ensure that those regulations do not apply to a district regulating station that has a monitoring system and the capability for remote or automatic shutoff.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t/3" id="H3BB919EDEEFC4951941D1BC5FBF1B9F5" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1061">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> District regulator stations.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t/3/A" id="HB4DFF837D251438A8A66B090D2E5046D" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1061">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall promulgate regulations to require that each operator of a distribution system assesses and upgrades, as appropriate, each district regulator station of the operator to ensure that—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t/3/A/i" id="HDA816F9F4A224AFEB47B3901F9977A52" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1061">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> the risk of the gas pressure in the distribution system exceeding, by a common mode of failure, the maximum allowable operating pressure (as described in section 192.623 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations (or a successor regulation)) allowed under Federal law (including regulations) is minimized;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t/3/A/ii" id="H33252F51109F42D1B60FBA0A3EA224A8" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1061">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> the gas pressure of a low-pressure distribution system is monitored, particularly at or near the location of critical pressure-control equipment;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t/3/A/iii" id="HDEEF4F5E7628438E993C2B675AE42DA5" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1061">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<content> the regulator station has secondary or backup pressure-relieving or overpressure-protection safety technology, such as a relief valve or automatic shutoff valve, or other pressure-limiting devices appropriate for the configuration and siting of the station and, in the case of a regulator station that employs the primary and monitor regulator design, the operator shall eliminate the common mode of failure or provide backup protection capable of either shutting the flow of gas, relieving gas to the atmosphere to fully protect the distribution system from overpressurization events, or there must be technology in place to eliminate a common mode of failure; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dR/tII/s206/qB/t/3/A/iv" id="HDB3240B84E034A47BA28EB5AB72DE0A7" class="bill-dtd-USC" pagenum="1062">
					<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
					<content> if the Secretary determines that it is not operationally possible for an operator to implement the requirements under clause (iii), the Secretary shall require such operator to identify actions in their plan that minimize the risk of an overpressurization event.”</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;
