execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H9A478257ECE049A7999F0BDFDA25563C" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dU/tV/s501/a/qB/e" id="H960FFA61ECCF445AA2BE9BF639063415" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1112">
		<num value="e">“(e)</num>
		<heading> Oversight.gov.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dU/tV/s501/a/qB/e/1" id="H2AC9DAA2B5C346A293325D6F87EA2F71" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1112">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> Definition.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In this subsection, the term ‘<term>Office of Inspector General</term>’ means the Office of—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dU/tV/s501/a/qB/e/1/A" id="HB2BD33C27B544827A406880709EA8BA6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1112">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> an Inspector General described in subparagraph (A), (B), or (I) of subsection (b)(1); </content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dU/tV/s501/a/qB/e/1/B" id="H45A90502FE4342E483027369D2766DA2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1112">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> the Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction established under section 1229 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2008 (<ref href="/us/pl/110/181">Public Law 110–181</ref>; 122 Stat. 379); </content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dU/tV/s501/a/qB/e/1/C" id="H538E8FECC78E48DF8D66E1378DEF957E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1112">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<content> the Special Inspector General for the Troubled Asset Relief Plan established under section 121 of title I of the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 (<ref href="/us/usc/12/5231">12 U.S.C. 5231</ref>); and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dU/tV/s501/a/qB/e/1/D" id="H477A4FF0F2CE4EC382D76D6FDEDF7868" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1112">
				<num value="D">“(D)</num>
				<content> the Special Inspector General for Pandemic Recovery established under section 4018 of the CARES Act (<ref href="/us/usc/15/9053">15 U.S.C. 9053</ref>).</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dU/tV/s501/a/qB/e/2" id="HEFB255501B0C4B2FB15E53F1F100D93F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1112">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Establishment.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The Council shall establish and maintain a website entitled ‘<quotedText>oversight.gov</quotedText>’—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dU/tV/s501/a/qB/e/2/A" id="H50B9F561B7F34D819655834066EEB4A5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1112">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> to consolidate all public reports from each Office of Inspector General to improve the access of the public to any audit report, inspection report, or evaluation report (or portion of any such report) made by an Office of Inspector General; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dU/tV/s501/a/qB/e/2/B" id="H44AFC6C80DE44F4A91F5D8BA91C058DB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1112">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> that shall include any additional resources, information, and enhancements as the Council determines are necessary or desirable.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dU/tV/s501/a/qB/e/3" id="H1225F1E86B454B7E9722FFD92D5AA1D6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1112">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> Participation of offices of inspectors general.—</heading>
			<content>Each Office of Inspector General that publishes an audit report, inspection report, or evaluation report (or portion of any such report) on the website of the Office of Inspector General shall, or in the case of the office of an Inspector General described in subparagraph (I) of subsection (b)(1) may, contemporaneously publish the report or portion thereof on oversight.gov in a manner prescribed by the Council.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 44735(a) of title 49, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 49 of the United States Code

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H2801D38087894029944E92C9D1957698" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dV/tI/s106/qB/4" id="H278C4A359A3D415F9F67B8D89F893743" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1139">
		<num value="4">“(4)</num>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s106/qB/4/A" id="HF4D1D9C5D8E349EE803E22A4F8D5810B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1139">
			<num value="A">(A)</num>
			<content> With respect to a critical system design feature of a transport category airplane, the Administrator may not delegate any finding of compliance with applicable airworthiness standards or review of any system safety assessment required for the issuance of a certificate, including a type certificate, or amended or supplemental type certificate, under section 44704, until the Administrator has reviewed and validated any underlying assumptions related to human factors.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s106/qB/4/B" id="H99781DD51B99425CA40D5D477EA5FE74" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1139">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<content> The requirement under subparagraph (A) shall not apply if the Administrator determines the matter involved is a routine task.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s106/qB/4/C" id="H0D7A7625F2814F3E9F8E46EA92205C9C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1139">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<content> For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term critical system design feature includes any feature (including a novel or unusual design feature) for which the failure of such feature, either independently or in combination with other failures, could result in catastrophic or hazardous failure conditions, as those terms are defined by the Administrator.”</content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 44702(d) of title 49, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 49 of the United States Code

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="HB360D44021664FF7A98461C7FD1EAB17" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/d" id="H655DE21A28084E59BF8D6CC8B54CBA4A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1143">
		<num value="d">“(d)</num>
		<heading> Audits.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/d/1" id="HFE08D1557FF549C7BEE019DF5D421826" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1143">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>The Administrator shall perform a periodic audit of each ODA unit and its procedures.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/d/2" id="H9AB322E948CF4CAF9B05598D6DBAD783" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Duration.—</heading>
			<content>An audit required under paragraph (1) shall be performed with respect to an ODA holder once every 7 years (or more frequently as determined appropriate by the Administrator).</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/d/3" id="H9A27BAD0220B44EAB08DA66752BBB2E5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> Records.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The ODA holder shall maintain, for a period to be determined by the Administrator, a record of—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/d/3/A" id="H9C85C9E4960441CE83C6BCBD6905C45C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> each audit conducted under this subsection; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/d/3/B" id="H2BFADC7AF3714938AF0D73AB3BFCA904" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> any corrective actions resulting from each such audit.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
	<subsection identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/e" id="H5F91957CDAF84FB18CAF2B13E9F5CD63" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
		<num value="e">“(e)</num>
		<heading> Federal aviation safety advisors.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/e/1" id="HE122FEE042A04CA0959BADE8EEA247DE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In the case of an ODA holder, the Administrator shall assign FAA aviation safety personnel with appropriate expertise to be advisors to the ODA unit members that are authorized to make findings of compliance on behalf of the Administrator. The advisors shall—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/e/1/A" id="H2ACE2A2E6991413A9B5671188893206B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> communicate with assigned unit members on an ongoing basis to ensure that the assigned unit members are knowledgeable of relevant FAA policies and acceptable methods of compliance; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/e/1/B" id="H7866C88222F04732A5F0B949C0D5D785" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> monitor the performance of the assigned unit members to ensure consistency with such policies.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/e/2" id="H391B936F96854AC78072C5CF57A48AE3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Applicability.—</heading>
			<chapeau>Paragraph (1) shall only apply to an ODA holder that is—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/e/2/A" id="HD88614D340F04B8498123A2F5F175F11" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<chapeau> a manufacturer that holds both a type and a production certificate for—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/e/2/A/i" id="H241B6C0A2B944D1E85120028DC7C83A3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> transport category airplanes with a maximum takeoff gross weight greater than 150,000 pounds; or</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/e/2/A/ii" id="HD16488FA06D54B58BC12CBA9814DDA11" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> airplanes produced and delivered to operators operating under part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, for air carrier service under such part 121; or</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/e/2/B" id="HC829D4DBF8BB4FDABDFA18492EBC063A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> a manufacturer of engines for an airplane described in subparagraph (A).</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
	<subsection identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/f" id="H230EFC84598E413991AA61C7C67D78AE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
		<num value="f">“(f)</num>
		<heading> Communication with the FAA.—</heading>
		<chapeau>Neither the Administrator nor an ODA holder may prohibit—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/f/1" id="H5AD20BE62C1B4086AC65D654EF0F1111" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> an ODA unit member from communicating with, or seeking the advice of, the Administrator or FAA staff; or</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dV/tI/s107/b/1/qB/f/2" id="HB9C54C482C8F404AB99A2D3EC6F4FE3D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1144">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> the Administrator or FAA staff from communicating with an ODA unit member.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="HF353196033D44627A01AAE721536267F" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dV/tI/s111/b/qB/d" id="HE2867715DF244A46A92C6E29067FD258" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1149">
		<num value="d">“(d)</num>
		<heading> Post-employment restrictions for inspectors and engineers.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dV/tI/s111/b/qB/d/1" id="H198C23FE6E5546E2B5408939D84195BE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1149">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> Prohibition.—</heading>
			<chapeau>A person holding a certificate issued under part 21 or 119 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, may not knowingly employ, or make a contractual arrangement that permits, an individual to act as an agent or representative of such person in any matter before the Administration if the individual, in the preceding 2-year period—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s111/b/qB/d/1/A" id="HB290BC57548A4C4C960D1236397FF9E9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1149">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<chapeau> served as, or was responsible for oversight of—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dV/tI/s111/b/qB/d/1/A/i" id="H3537E7C08DCE4C3BAE1CCBBCBD83DB82" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1149">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> a flight standards inspector of the Administration; or</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dV/tI/s111/b/qB/d/1/A/ii" id="H76BCED6B93E549BC86A4C46EB36C0F51" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1149">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> an employee of the Administration with responsibility for certification functions with respect to a holder of a certificate issued under section 44704(a); and</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s111/b/qB/d/1/B" id="H903DFE65FFC444E1ABE8F2B6750BF97A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1150">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> had responsibility to inspect, or oversee inspection of, the operations of such person.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dV/tI/s111/b/qB/d/2" id="HB6ACC1DDB6BC4DC7939B7BD7F1C9426B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1150">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Written and oral communications.—</heading>
			<content>For purposes of paragraph (1), an individual shall be considered to be acting as an agent or representative of a certificate holder in a matter before the Administration if the individual makes any written or oral communication on behalf of the certificate holder to the Administration (or any of its officers or employees) in connection with a particular matter, whether or not involving a specific party and without regard to whether the individual has participated in, or had responsibility for, the particular matter while serving as an individual covered under paragraph (1).”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="HF47073C6CD194721BBFF72DF503BE1D8" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dV/tI/s120/qB/3" id="HA0806FF8662E4D9090862592944D5D0A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1162">
		<num value="3">“(3)</num>
		<heading> Nonconformity with approved type design.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s120/qB/3/A" id="H593183BE1BA644B7971B3E8B63135FFE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1162">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>Consistent with the requirements of paragraph (1), a holder of a production certificate for an aircraft may not present a nonconforming aircraft, either directly or through the registered owner of such aircraft or a person described in paragraph (2), to the Administrator for issuance of an initial airworthiness certificate.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s120/qB/3/B" id="HAB7804BAA71947BA8CD4F2A1E4B8AA8B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1162">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Civil penalty.—</heading>
			<content>Notwithstanding section 46301, a production certificate holder who knowingly violates subparagraph (A) shall be liable to the Administrator for a civil penalty of not more than $1,000,000 for each nonconforming aircraft.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s120/qB/3/C" id="H1D3403F544614DD7934C99CB5BFC2DBB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1163">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<heading> Penalty considerations.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In determining the amount of a civil penalty under subparagraph (B), the Administrator shall consider—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dV/tI/s120/qB/3/C/i" id="H1635BC36A9DF4E9FB3CA23C661E94685" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1163">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> the nature, circumstances, extent, and gravity of the violation, including the length of time the nonconformity was known by the holder of a production certificate but not disclosed; and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dV/tI/s120/qB/3/C/ii" id="HCB23BFD9130B4F818AF6C9848FA9052B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1163">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> with respect to the violator, the degree of culpability, any history of prior violations, and the size of the business concern.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dV/tI/s120/qB/3/D" id="HC0AC01C92D774C009CDA3670362C50DB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1163">
			<num value="D">“(D)</num>
			<heading> Nonconforming aircraft defined.—</heading>
			<content>In this paragraph, the term ‘<term>nonconforming aircraft</term>’ means an aircraft that does not conform to the approved type design for such aircraft type.”</content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

	<subsection identifier="/dX/s11/qB/d" id="HF730112B4CD6440CA0B2B46489010780" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1236">
		<num value="d">“(d)</num>
		<heading> Application to title IV-E payments.—</heading>
		<content>If the District of Columbia receives the increase described in subsection (a) in the Federal medical assistance percentage for the District of Columbia with respect to a quarter, the Federal medical assistance percentage for the District of Columbia, as so increased, shall apply to payments made to the District of Columbia under part E of title IV of the Social Security Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/670">42 U.S.C. 670</ref> et seq.) for that quarter, and the payments under such part shall be deemed to be made on the basis of the Federal medical assistance percentage applied with respect to such District for purposes of title XIX of such Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/1396">42 U.S.C. 1396</ref> et seq.) and as increased under subsection (a).”</content>

cite.cite_text: Section 453 of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 (42 U.S.C. 17112)

doc_names: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="HC7A25D642CB84996AEFE8F4BD21E67A4" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h" id="H9C905045E60A4F2AAE3ED9D1B2AA8A54" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1247">
		<num value="h">“(h)</num>
		<heading> Federal Implementation Strategy for Energy-Efficient and Energy-Saving Information Technologies.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/1" id="HE0F28EAA99EC4652A2BC7601CE943101" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1247">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> Definitions.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In this subsection:</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/1/A" id="H3993B3654F7F45E2939E95E900197A88" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1247">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> Director.—</heading>
				<content>The term ‘<term>Director</term>’ means the Director of the Office of Management and Budget.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/1/B" id="HB475E0BF4DEA42BB885F78AD2E818BE5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Information technology.—</heading>
				<content>The term ‘<term>information technology</term>’ has the meaning given that term in section 11101 of title 40, United States Code.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/2" id="H3F74BA99BE964F8EBC6F8E88F3572964" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Development of implementation strategy.—</heading>
			<content>Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>, each Federal agency shall coordinate with the Director, the Secretary, and the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to develop an implementation strategy (including best-practices and measurement and verification techniques) for the maintenance, purchase, and use by the Federal agency of energy-efficient and energy-saving information technologies at or for facilities owned and operated by the Federal agency, taking into consideration the performance goals established under paragraph (4).</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/3" id="H238C8F17E07742818C3CD87EF6E8F7BF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> Administration.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In developing an implementation strategy under paragraph (2), each Federal agency shall consider—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/3/A" id="HE0F21B49CB8F4589B3B7F1A64719F4D5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> advanced metering infrastructure;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/3/B" id="HD50249F815F6477886F44082C926B231" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> energy efficient data center strategies and methods of increasing asset and infrastructure utilization;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/3/C" id="H089FF6A5B1A14A30A8A804C59FF02CE1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<content> advanced power management tools;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/3/D" id="HB6D302A1E1C54857A3E6E007A0524153" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
				<num value="D">“(D)</num>
				<content> building information modeling, including building energy management;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/3/E" id="H20DE1AB5553340E38DE1EBBA4DF9372C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
				<num value="E">“(E)</num>
				<content> secure telework and travel substitution tools; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/3/F" id="H2A07E6EB52E646C8BEA6C7F9F0F50A4D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
				<num value="F">“(F)</num>
				<content> mechanisms to ensure that the agency realizes the energy cost savings of increased efficiency and utilization.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/4" id="H61BB99F02AD142E1A0D0C0D9134198C9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
			<num value="4">“(4)</num>
			<heading> Performance goals.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/4/A" id="H3B1845AFCAD641A1ABAADFEA7563EF76" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>, the Director, in consultation with the Secretary, shall establish performance goals for evaluating the efforts of Federal agencies in improving the maintenance, purchase, and use of energy-efficient and energy-saving information technology at or for facilities owned and operated by the Federal agencies.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/4/B" id="HFB20B7F6AFB14931BDC76261F48BB3D4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Best practices.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Chief Information Officers Council established under section 3603 of title 44, United States Code, shall recommend best practices for the attainment of the performance goals established under subparagraph (A), which shall include, to the extent applicable by law, consideration by a Federal agency of the use of—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/4/B/i" id="HFC66B8A97049439CA97B750D0DACE219" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> energy savings performance contracting; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/4/B/ii" id="HDF40BE83044444FDA6583C6BD3D958EC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> utility energy services contracting.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/5" id="H16671DB1E8874CE597EA967B9213604B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
			<num value="5">“(5)</num>
			<heading> Reports.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/5/A" id="H1D19D40090B94274BA66D3C8310FB03D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> Agency reports.—</heading>
				<content>Each Federal agency shall include in the report of the agency under section 527 of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/17143">42 U.S.C. 17143</ref>) a description of the efforts and results of the agency under this subsection.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/5/B" id="HBD91607AFE5C4C2CBD42D9B0CBE1653E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1248">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> OMB Government efficiency reports and scorecards.—</heading>
				<content>Effective beginning not later than October 1, 2022, the Director shall include in the annual report and scorecard of the Director required under section 528 of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/17144">42 U.S.C. 17144</ref>) a description of the efforts and results of Federal agencies under this subsection.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1004/qB/h/5/C" id="H53EF3B6FA2444C86A23DADD6EA37A258" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1249">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<heading> Use of existing reporting structures.—</heading>
				<content>The Director may require Federal agencies to submit any information required to be submitted under this subsection though reporting structures in use as of the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>.”</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 543 of the National Energy Conservation Policy Act (42 U.S.C. 8253)

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H825BDA4CF78B4D4F9359F813D083CB57" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1008/a/qB/C" id="H9EA0D9B81B664E44B036F25C21AF879F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1256">
		<num value="C">“(C)</num>
		<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1008/a/qB/C/i" id="H876C46076BC84FB8AC08DA657BE3A391" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1256">
			<num value="i">(i)</num>
			<chapeau> Large-diameter ceiling fans manufactured on or after January 21, 2020, shall—</chapeau>
			<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1008/a/qB/C/i/I" id="HEA254AE74011408E983A77A88E7C0E53" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1256">
				<num value="I">“(I)</num>
				<content> not be required to meet minimum ceiling fan efficiency in terms of ratio of the total airflow to the total power consumption as described in the final rule titled ‘<quotedText>Energy Conservation Program: Energy Conservation Standards for Ceiling Fans</quotedText>’ (82 Fed. Reg. 6826 (January 19, 2017)); and</content>
			</subclause>
			<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1008/a/qB/C/i/II" id="H95EBBED98F1949D28A2D048F4AA45507" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1256">
				<num value="II">“(II)</num>
				<chapeau> have a CFEI greater than or equal to—</chapeau>
				<item identifier="/dZ/tI/s1008/a/qB/C/i/II/aa" id="H7722CF9BF0D4430EA0104C7FDACA1C37" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1256">
					<num value="aa">“(aa)</num>
					<content> 1.00 at high speed; and</content>
				</item>
				<item identifier="/dZ/tI/s1008/a/qB/C/i/II/bb" id="HD320EDC21C2945908475860A7FCEF44B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1256">
					<num value="bb">“(bb)</num>
					<content> 1.31 at 40 percent speed or the nearest speed that is not less than 40 percent speed.</content>
				</item>
			</subclause>
		</clause>
		<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1008/a/qB/C/ii" id="H6C0922ED734840A3BDCF70FB9F4C9632" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1256">
			<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
			<chapeau> For purposes of this subparagraph, the term ‘<term>CFEI</term>’ means the Fan Energy Index for large-diameter ceiling fans, calculated in accordance with ANSI/AMCA Standard 208–18 titled ‘<quotedText>Calculation of the Fan Energy Index</quotedText>’, with the following modifications:</chapeau>
			<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1008/a/qB/C/ii/I" id="H3603436BE2044508AB05C8B5D7B61EBA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1256">
				<num value="I">“(I)</num>
				<content> Using an Airflow Constant (Q<sub>0</sub>) of 26,500 cubic feet per minute.</content>
			</subclause>
			<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1008/a/qB/C/ii/II" id="H19A261487871483FABB730FB2FFFD161" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1256">
				<num value="II">“(II)</num>
				<content> Using a Pressure Constant (P<sub>0</sub>) of 0.0027 inches water gauge.</content>
			</subclause>
			<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1008/a/qB/C/ii/III" id="HBEBCF0D9422B4348BA2B0A434D26FC3A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1256">
				<num value="III">“(III)</num>
				<content> Using a Fan Efficiency Constant (η<sub>0</sub>) of 42 percent.”</content>
			</subclause>
		</clause>
	</subparagraph>
</__xml__>;

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H42610510DB4B4D129E49E679A17BCF8B" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i" id="H0916930B777445D199D5C8C54982E7EB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1266">
		<num value="i">“(i)</num>
		<heading> Federal energy management program.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/1" id="H54548FC2E68447FA94900340CE69F258" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1266">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The Secretary shall carry out a program, to be known as the ‘<quotedText>Federal Energy Management Program</quotedText>’ (referred to in this subsection as the ‘<quotedText>Program</quotedText>’), to facilitate the implementation by the Federal Government of cost-effective energy and water management and energy-related investment practices—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/1/A" id="H015986096481470C9A7B2E65DC3F8E28" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1266">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> to coordinate and strengthen Federal energy and water resilience; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/1/B" id="H308FDA7CBB934CD6B3D5F0AEC1700F53" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1266">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> to promote environmental stewardship.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/2" id="H974A17ADFDD14A0FA8BCB03F82EE3B8C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1266">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Federal Director.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary shall appoint an individual to serve as the director of the Program (referred to in this subsection as the ‘<quotedText>Federal Director</quotedText>’), which shall be a career position in the Senior Executive service, to administer the Program.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3" id="H907F6A2BA21A4FD3840D71B7CE5541AA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1266">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> Program activities.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/A" id="H8F66A51CDA5C40128CAE1113B37271FD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1266">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> Strategic planning and technical assistance.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In administering the Program, the Federal Director shall—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/A/i" id="H830DB039061144839FD7B51D7E91BC5C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1266">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> provide technical assistance and project implementation support and guidance to agencies to identify, implement, procure, and track energy and water conservation measures required under this Act and under other provisions of law;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/A/ii" id="HDAA67C692EBB46688D6E925249383869" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> in coordination with the Administrator of the General Services Administration, establish appropriate procedures, methods, and best practices for use by agencies to select, monitor, and terminate contracts entered into pursuant to a utility incentive program under section 546(c) with utilities;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/A/iii" id="H69A294B18ABF4CEF8346C571F17F7AF0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<content> carry out the responsibilities of the Secretary under section 801, as determined appropriate by the Secretary;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/A/iv" id="HC767927A32274BEAA9842AD055608816" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
					<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
					<content> establish and maintain internet-based information resources and project tracking systems and tools for energy and water management;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/A/v" id="H4E849FCFFAE4495EA5D45794A00670C3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
					<num value="v">“(v)</num>
					<content> coordinate comprehensive and strategic approaches to energy and water resilience planning for agencies; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/A/vi" id="HAD199FE196AA4CC8A0D17FE254216E1A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
					<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
					<content> establish a recognition program for Federal achievement in energy and water management, energy-related investment practices, environmental stewardship, and other relevant areas, through events such as individual recognition award ceremonies and public announcements.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/B" id="H2E2B547C0085423EA2B54432BDFA8CAB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Energy and water management and reporting.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In administering the Program, the Federal Director shall—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/B/i" id="H92ACEDF79C98463A8BC7AC989AD0398E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> track and report on the progress of agencies in meeting the requirements of the agency under this section;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/B/ii" id="H075F37C20B3243079366B7849EF59D8E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<chapeau> make publicly available agency performance data required under—</chapeau>
					<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/B/ii/I" id="HCF91C7CC615F45398EC518AAB6123AA0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
						<num value="I">“(I)</num>
						<content> this section and sections 544, 546, 547, and 548; and</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/B/ii/II" id="H55B5BD31994442E29C0456F13CAF718C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> section 203 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/15852">42 U.S.C. 15852</ref>);</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/B/iii" id="H28D5C413DC0A4E6FA2036FAD1D05884B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/B/iii/I" id="HC6D10333A2234DDC9346FAF21345F20A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
						<num value="I">(I)</num>
						<content> collect energy and water use and consumption data from each agency; and</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/B/iii/II" id="H3A223138128841988D15E539EE13846A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> based on that data, submit to each agency a report that will facilitate the energy and water management, energy-related investment practices, and environmental stewardship of the agency in support of Federal goals under this Act and under other provisions of law;</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/B/iv" id="H3566A4C398F34FA3AF188D8031CFD505" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
					<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
					<content> carry out the responsibilities of the Secretary under section 305 of the Energy Conservation and Production Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/6834">42 U.S.C. 6834</ref>); </content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/B/v" id="HEA7D7C90C6AC4A419B60728BCFCAA5DA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
					<num value="v">“(v)</num>
					<content> in consultation with the Administrator of the General Services Administration, acting through the head of the Office of High-Performance Green Buildings, establish and implement sustainable design principles for Federal facilities; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/B/vi" id="HAD59FC58ABC545CBADE8B662E58FA10C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
					<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
					<content> designate products that meet the highest energy conservation standards for categories not covered under the Energy Star program established under section 324A of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/6294a">42 U.S.C. 6294a</ref>).</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/C" id="H817856AE5D9B442A8B76737DC19D0813" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1267">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<heading> Federal interagency coordination.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In administering the Program, the Federal Director shall—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/C/i" id="H18F4650C367942A1AFC9FFA456C77811" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<chapeau> develop and implement accredited training consistent with existing Federal programs and activities—</chapeau>
					<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/C/i/I" id="HCC4A611464954C68A616567B4A5B6319" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
						<num value="I">“(I)</num>
						<content> relating to energy and water use, management, and resilience in Federal facilities, energy-related investment practices, and environmental stewardship; and</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/C/i/II" id="HD34D7AAA88CE4CAB8179D3C5E9583D6A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> that includes in-person training, internet-based programs, and national in-person training events;</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/C/ii" id="HD086285AD35740BCAD873991FCEAF8B3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> carry out the functions of the Secretary with respect to the Interagency Energy Management Task Force under section 547; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/C/iii" id="H65A34B853A1F4EDEA6E02D39DEB0C85E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<chapeau> report on the implementation of the priorities of the President, including Executive orders, relating to energy and water use in Federal facilities, in coordination with—</chapeau>
					<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/C/iii/I" id="HFD3458C53A7342789450DFFD1033B9E1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
						<num value="I">“(I)</num>
						<content> the Office of Management and Budget;</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/C/iii/II" id="HA1A6B7CC5A2A4F50AD4E8539D6AA1FF9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> the Council on Environmental Quality; and</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/C/iii/III" id="HD8DF74BB2CBA4BD2B27352B5046ECA92" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
						<num value="III">“(III)</num>
						<content> any other entity, as considered necessary by the Federal Director.</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/D" id="H3A18520F1248403D9D601A6EC758F21B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
				<num value="D">“(D)</num>
				<heading> Facility and fleet optimization.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In administering the Program, the Federal Director shall develop guidance, supply assistance to, and track the progress of agencies—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/D/i" id="H3973BCB69AF448979C5A8DA7339FFC4F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> in conducting portfolio-wide facility energy and water resilience planning and project integration;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/D/ii" id="HFE48153D522948B5A8BC08B4DB06CEA4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> in building new construction and major renovations to meet the sustainable design and energy and water performance standards required under this section;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/D/iii" id="HDA2F9B245D9B4006AFF829C13F5ECD5C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<chapeau> in developing guidelines for—</chapeau>
					<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/D/iii/I" id="HAFB23669F69941D8B324E24754F34C9C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
						<num value="I">“(I)</num>
						<content> facility commissioning; and</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/D/iii/II" id="H903A5DA0E59246E8970338A64A05D0EE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> facility operations and maintenance; and</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/3/D/iv" id="HEF246056327445A6AE83E2B27A563C4E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
					<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
					<content> in coordination with the Administrator of the General Services Administration, in meeting statutory and agency goals for Federal fleet vehicles.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/4" id="HD82DBADE4A2547DBA700C7BD7440F45F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
			<num value="4">“(4)</num>
			<heading> Management council.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The Federal Director shall establish a management council to advise the Federal Director that shall—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/4/A" id="H5932DC3A9B24485EA7C852E23DB097AF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> convene not less frequently than once every quarter; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/4/B" id="HF41B327D8B184C64B4CDEFEC4F9DDC8E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<chapeau> consist of representatives from—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/4/B/i" id="HF91C8EE917554E738598C50AEF014ED8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> the Council on Environmental Quality;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/4/B/ii" id="H028F88C37B29419A86BF63B0123C2978" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> the Office of Management and Budget; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/4/B/iii" id="H1F762DA95FEA42DBA5F2C59FCE91F388" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<content> the Office of Federal High-Performance Green Buildings in the General Services Administration.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1012/qB/i/5" id="H934E72B4DF4041F2BBA6576B7A0A03D9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
			<num value="5">“(5)</num>
			<heading> Authorization of appropriations.—</heading>
			<content>There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out this subsection $36,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2025.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 543 of the National Energy Conservation Policy Act (42 U.S.C. 8253)

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H6E5DF0500F25496CB33B96A534D2995C" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375" id="H5E0F970F6C1E4BE9AAEF2B234325693A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
		<num value="375">“SEC. 375.</num>
		<heading> CHP Technical Assistance Partnership Program.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/a" id="H07CD96E6BC89458CB5D60F79A885DF03" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1268">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> Renaming.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/a/1" id="H15ACE9C7CAA6442BA018F97CE7E3C03F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>The Clean Energy Application Centers of the Department of Energy are redesignated as the CHP Technical Assistance Partnership Program (referred to in this section as the ‘<quotedText>Program</quotedText>’).</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/a/2" id="H61D935AA337B4CB7BD7D0E7476106589" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Program description.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Program shall consist of—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/a/2/A" id="H728EDCF5A0BB4BA5B9AAEAF18A244F7C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> the 10 regional CHP Technical Assistance Partnerships in existence on the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/a/2/B" id="H4C6CB816C15244D3AF8B0B412FF08CB5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> such other regional CHP Technical Assistance Partnerships as the Secretary may establish with consideration given to establishing such partnerships in rural communities; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/a/2/C" id="HED42504FEB4544E4B39018BCE3E96BDB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> any supporting technical activities under the Technical Partnership Program of the Advanced Manufacturing Office.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/a/3" id="HE3C8D728D065463DA4C4A3940E3862DF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> References.—</heading>
				<content>Any reference in any law, rule, regulation, or publication to a Combined Heat and Power Application Center or a Clean Energy Application Center shall be deemed to be a reference to the Program.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b" id="H24D12260139645EBBC435666C1814CCF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> CHP Technical Assistance Partnership Program.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/1" id="H9AC2E441641D487180874ECF2B85CFCA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Program shall—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/1/A" id="H277F959E09E54C23813BDAC5F50E2EA1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<chapeau> operate programs to encourage deployment of combined heat and power, waste heat to power, and efficient district energy (collectively referred to in this subsection as ‘<quotedText>CHP</quotedText>’) technologies by providing education and outreach to—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/1/A/i" id="H84601749A3694C5CBFD87542AC2F07CC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> building, industrial, and electric and natural gas utility professionals;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/1/A/ii" id="HE835E8E9F9B148A8983C0E43A136C4D9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> State and local policymakers; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/1/A/iii" id="HB3D1C0D719044E13A8541326D3A61F11" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> other individuals and organizations with an interest in efficient energy use, local or opportunity fuel use, resiliency, or energy security, microgrids, and district energy; and</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/1/B" id="H879F3F29DF154FC2AC29ED115DB2B7BB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> provide project specific support to building and industrial professionals through economic and engineering assessments and advisory activities.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2" id="H92E6C192FF9A4BCEA3C114764794487D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Funding for certain activities.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2/A" id="H39750835B0FF477EAAAFEA0488D0FF54" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<content>The Program shall make funds available to institutions of higher education, research centers, and other appropriate institutions to ensure the continued operations and effectiveness of the regional CHP Technical Assistance Partnerships.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2/B" id="H3E20444392084927AB042551D5521D53" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Use of funds.—</heading>
					<chapeau>Funds made available under subparagraph (A) may be used—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2/B/i" id="HB63D814B649842FC8A64665A1936CBEF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<chapeau> to collect and distribute informational materials relevant to manufacturers, commercial buildings, institutional facilities, and Federal sites, including continued support of the mission goals of the Department of Defense, on CHP and microgrid technologies, including continuation and updating of—</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2/B/i/I" id="HE4BCE65B631F4D1F9C83BA5BE5EBC4D6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> the CHP installation database;</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2/B/i/II" id="H92ACEF1671574BB9BBE5F65206171CC1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> CHP technology potential analyses;</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2/B/i/III" id="HBE4B49D8486845978DE3B1DB7D2D272B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
							<num value="III">“(III)</num>
							<content> State CHP resource pages; and</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2/B/i/IV" id="HDF25396BDE074B4E9A94D0F1290B4267" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1269">
							<num value="IV">“(IV)</num>
							<content> CHP Technical Assistance Partnerships websites;</content>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2/B/ii" id="H7FF600F49BF440AFA8CA072E79032A2D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1270">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> to produce and conduct workshops, reports, seminars, internet programs, CHP resiliency resources, and other activities to provide education to end users, regulators, and stakeholders in a manner that leads to the deployment of CHP technologies;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2/B/iii" id="H404E5753D878461090118AC92C24EE64" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1270">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> to provide or coordinate onsite assessments for sites and enterprises that may consider deployment of CHP technology, including the potential use of biomass CHP systems;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2/B/iv" id="HF545E57317294C24AA56E66A92938992" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1270">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> to identify candidates for deployment of CHP technologies, hybrid renewable-CHP technologies, biomass CHP, microgrids, and clean energy;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2/B/v" id="H99EE2A75A8C54F358559DA20A92A1FB0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1270">
						<num value="v">“(v)</num>
						<content> to provide nonbiased engineering support to sites considering deployment of CHP technologies;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2/B/vi" id="H059CE1A76DE14ABBB74C78C5EDC0A21D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1270">
						<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
						<content> to assist organizations and communities, including rural communities, developing clean energy technologies and policies in overcoming barriers to deployment; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2/B/vii" id="H383A136278384980BD60411EBF43FFF6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1270">
						<num value="vii">“(vii)</num>
						<content> to assist companies, communities (including rural communities), and organizations with field validation and performance evaluations of CHP and other clean energy technologies implemented.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/b/2/C" id="H4E99B686ECAA40298FD01FC0B114A1E6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1270">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<heading> Duration.—</heading>
					<content>The Program shall make funds available under subparagraph (A) for a period of 5 years.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tI/s1013/a/qB/s375/c" id="H67011C28103A4DCE8E594F06286F2059" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1270">
			<num value="c">“(c)</num>
			<heading> Authorization of appropriations.—</heading>
			<content>There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $12,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2025.”</content>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;
