cite.cite_text: The table of contents of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (Public Law 109–58; 119 Stat. 594)

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H3FB783C892AA419D8EFA841349B6D00E" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2002/qB/1" id="HB52D1DAF8B3240F288ECC8C7CB519ACB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
		<num value="1">“(1)</num>
		<heading> Advanced nuclear reactor.—</heading>
		<chapeau>The term ‘<term>advanced nuclear reactor</term>’ means—</chapeau>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2002/qB/1/A" id="H134FDA10B1F0404D9A475974FB49D335" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<chapeau> a nuclear fission reactor, including a prototype plant (as defined in sections 50.2 and 52.1 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations)), with significant improvements compared to reactors operating on the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>, including improvements such as—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2002/qB/1/A/i" id="HAA6CD0591AB94041B29A433C80A85A55" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> additional inherent safety features;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2002/qB/1/A/ii" id="H6879FAA241274216BEED53F310D104DF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> lower waste yields;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2002/qB/1/A/iii" id="H2C4B3D742F1B474B9461EE07D8FE648B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<content> improved fuel and material performance;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2002/qB/1/A/iv" id="H12E4C28705A34AE9BA7FE1B7B89F656E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
				<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
				<content> increased tolerance to loss of fuel cooling;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2002/qB/1/A/v" id="HCBA7AE7999D647589886C0FE8F08BECC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
				<num value="v">“(v)</num>
				<content> enhanced reliability or improved resilience;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2002/qB/1/A/vi" id="H81B7A56C86FC47669C220B52BF9274B6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
				<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
				<content> increased proliferation resistance;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2002/qB/1/A/vii" id="H9CFAC6E367CE41A1A795FDEF617C25C9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
				<num value="vii">“(vii)</num>
				<content> increased thermal efficiency;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2002/qB/1/A/viii" id="HCD03679CAF7D4DE9879E1F336E7B1DB2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
				<num value="viii">“(viii)</num>
				<content> reduced consumption of cooling water and other environmental impacts;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2002/qB/1/A/ix" id="H896A791DD4654C8E86E106D310DF9B76" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
				<num value="ix">“(ix)</num>
				<content> the ability to integrate into electric applications and nonelectric applications;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2002/qB/1/A/x" id="H8460F0BD8D304B01826A3F94CFCBFB19" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
				<num value="x">“(x)</num>
				<content> modular sizes to allow for deployment that corresponds with the demand for electricity or process heat; and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2002/qB/1/A/xi" id="HB796C5395063491EB8BEDD8B6BEAB3EE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
				<num value="xi">“(xi)</num>
				<content> operational flexibility to respond to changes in demand for electricity or process heat and to complement integration with intermittent renewable energy or energy storage; and</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2002/qB/1/B" id="HFEF6A206A4B24262BFEF67134B48D183" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<content> a fusion reactor.”</content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 951(b)(1) of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16271(b)(1))

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H26B41E42CA954B659556CBA68B96257C" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952" id="H2C79FC6E45344A4BAA19A0B94778148F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
		<num value="952">“SEC. 952.</num>
		<heading> Reactor concepts research, development, demonstration, and commercial application.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a" id="HE5F58AB683494C658ABA08976CB41896" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> Sustainability program for light water reactors.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/1" id="H38250F697B80487B8FB982C9761DC209" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall carry out a program of research, development, demonstration, and commercial application, including through the use of modeling and simulation, to support existing operating nuclear power plants which shall address technologies to modernize and improve, with respect to such plants—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/1/A" id="H2926327F535A4533B814D5AA3440459E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> reliability;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/1/B" id="HDBBA84C93128418AA777D598B1E630F0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> capacity;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/1/C" id="H527206D2AA2649A9B8084EA1164E1D58" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> component aging;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/1/D" id="HFDD8EC9F119047FCA5A0A15A38F38D8D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> safety;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/1/E" id="H342E0101A29D4CA98EDF71549B77E2FF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<content> physical security and security costs;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/1/F" id="H7915D8879F8E477493CA8F583DF55505" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
					<num value="F">“(F)</num>
					<content> plant lifetime;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/1/G" id="H5A629150EBF749ECABC05D6F7EE48952" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
					<num value="G">“(G)</num>
					<content> operations and maintenance costs, including by utilizing risk-informed systems analysis;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/1/H" id="HE4498FC1CAB140379E4E6B1ED6EDC23B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1278">
					<num value="H">“(H)</num>
					<content> the ability for plants to operate flexibly;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/1/I" id="H4BF4C80D497843619BC7D5EE7CF72F17" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> nuclear integrated energy system applications described in subsection (c);</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/1/J" id="H941F87495EFE46EA9550697E944374AE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
					<num value="J">“(J)</num>
					<content> efficiency;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/1/K" id="H01C350FD4A4240BFAA61C59D69E469FA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
					<num value="K">“(K)</num>
					<content> environmental impacts; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/1/L" id="HBD2EAFFB9DE640AF88C7292658A033E0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
					<num value="L">“(L)</num>
					<content> resilience.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/2" id="H59CF802CAB504909B3F0F6251125A468" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Authorization of appropriations.—</heading>
				<content>There are authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out the program under this subsection $55,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2025.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/a/3" id="H02DDE8EE28614D7589A7AB8F235C45F6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Report.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall submit annually a public report to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate documenting funds spent under the program that describes program activities, objectives, and outcomes, including those that could benefit the entirety of the existing reactor fleet, such as with respect to aging management and related sustainability concerns, and identifying funds awarded to private entities.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b" id="HCAD5DB05E82C42E2BEEA49DB3375DE02" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Advanced reactor technologies.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/1" id="H763F517505E8413AA273560871797228" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall carry out a program of research, development, demonstration, and commercial application to support advanced reactor technologies.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2" id="HEA86683E076C4C38BE57C20E756AB8DE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Requirements.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In carrying out the program under this subsection, the Secretary shall—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/A" id="H2C9A1AA04CDE459CA4F9B6EC53C38C75" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<chapeau> prioritize designs for advanced nuclear reactors that are proliferation resistant and passively safe, including designs that, compared to reactors operating on the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/A/i" id="HDA42EDC7A1E443E1B827BB79E280DC86" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> are economically competitive with other electric power generation plants;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/A/ii" id="H9225C4ADBCB44440B909E2311CA45A53" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> have higher efficiency, lower cost, less environmental impacts, increased resilience, and improved safety;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/A/iii" id="HDA7FA2249EEC4DA8B0D5A91FD41D10AD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> use fuels that are proliferation resistant and have reduced production of high-level waste per unit of output; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/A/iv" id="H98F52131532B47EBB269B80B61EA10C3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> use advanced instrumentation and monitoring systems;</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/B" id="H98E3DCCCE75741B4BA8A9E3D3EBE2DBB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> consult with the Nuclear Regulatory Commission on appropriate metrics to consider for the criteria specified in subparagraph (A);</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/C" id="H192794B306774AF9B090C4D03203CE07" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<chapeau> support research and development to resolve materials challenges relating to extreme environments, including environments that contain high levels of—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/C/i" id="H722F364BB7E34B6580214F3714367C45" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> radiation fluence;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/C/ii" id="H878A3C7FC96A4A73B319EBF8F3A4F34E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> temperature;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/C/iii" id="H6415C0AAF5454C4C90ECFD86FC3CD538" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> pressure; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/C/iv" id="H1F3677E799534246A34C225DDED540EA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> corrosion;</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/D" id="H29E0738BD7CE4853B84AD6DF2C585D10" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> support research and development to aid in the qualification of advanced fuels, including fabrication techniques;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/E" id="H484C6B94A1FD489FA34AA38283D52980" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1279">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<content> support activities that address near-term challenges in modeling and simulation to enable accelerated design of and licensing of advanced nuclear reactors, including the identification of tools and methodologies for validating such modeling and simulation efforts;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/F" id="HE8E9F8F2FC624CEFBAEDDE3FF3C1C40F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
					<num value="F">“(F)</num>
					<content> develop technologies, including technologies to manage, reduce, or reuse nuclear waste;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/G" id="H6FA559ABC6104ADEBB6E299616120A85" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
					<num value="G">“(G)</num>
					<chapeau> ensure that nuclear research infrastructure is maintained or constructed, including—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/G/i" id="HCB180366B3D44DBF881CDD40AB6A72A4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> currently operational research reactors at the National Laboratories and institutions of higher education;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/G/ii" id="H945551A8F33C4A49B32766AA39BAC722" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> hot cell research facilities;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/G/iii" id="H938AD29FC8E248A1A27270FF5C0EB5EC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> a versatile fast neutron source; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/G/iv" id="HB8726AE3E4A74FF79AF4D86839C56F3A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> advanced coolant testing facilities, including coolants such as lead, sodium, gas, and molten salt;</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/H" id="HBC382D51BF7F46EAA88853D1F807182A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
					<num value="H">“(H)</num>
					<content> improve scientific understanding of nonlight water coolant physics and chemistry;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/I" id="H0D5B41AC26B245AD92EE5B7AAF0FBD60" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> develop advanced sensors and control systems, including the identification of tools and methodologies for validating such sensors and systems;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/J" id="H214737D00E6B45629BA00E9018436334" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
					<num value="J">“(J)</num>
					<content> investigate advanced manufacturing and advanced construction techniques and materials to reduce the cost of advanced nuclear reactors, including the use of digital twins and of strategies to implement project and construction management best practices, and study the effects of radiation and corrosion on materials created with these techniques;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/K" id="H378436066625429A9F0D930BBA5741BE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
					<num value="K">“(K)</num>
					<content> consult with the Administrator of the National Nuclear Security Administration to integrate reactor safeguards and security into design;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/L" id="HE17E0499C5554F0EBA716D587A99B630" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
					<num value="L">“(L)</num>
					<content> support efforts to reduce any technical barriers that would prevent commercial application of advanced nuclear energy systems; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/2/M" id="H812BD16C843A46BD934DBCE738E153FB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
					<num value="M">“(M)</num>
					<content> develop various safety analyses and emergency preparedness and response methodologies.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/3" id="H84749BBB31584FED844974465B38953F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Coordination.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall coordinate with individuals engaged in the private sector and individuals who are experts in nuclear nonproliferation, environmental and public health and safety, and economics to advance the development of various designs of advanced nuclear reactors. In carrying out this paragraph, the Secretary shall convene an advisory committee of such individuals and such committee shall submit annually a report to the relevant committees of Congress with respect to the progress of the program.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/b/4" id="H419D3808D8D74CBCACC31AA2DC003F26" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> Authorization of appropriations.—</heading>
				<content>There are authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out the program under this subsection $55,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2025.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c" id="HEAFDA345A40C457D87B73F502D52582D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
			<num value="c">“(c)</num>
			<heading> Nuclear integrated energy systems research, development, demonstration, and commercial application program.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/1" id="HB8C6C06AD69348AFAC9351A0614D1C88" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall carry out a program of research, development, demonstration, and commercial application to develop nuclear integrated energy systems, composed of 2 or more co-located or jointly operated subsystems of energy generation, energy storage, or other technologies and in which not less than 1 such subsystem is a nuclear energy system, to—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/1/A" id="H21EEFDE765594B0F8243A16319B484C3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> reduce greenhouse gas emissions in both the power and nonpower sectors; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/1/B" id="H16E26FB8F0E04904BFBC8AB802AFDA26" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1280">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> maximize energy production and efficiency.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/2" id="HCAC806914C714ADE802698C2BD752B77" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Coordination.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In carrying out the program under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall coordinate with—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/2/A" id="HBF8DD3DC581046AEB3B28060A9614EFE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> relevant program offices within the Department of Energy;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/2/B" id="H8F6787B7A815497FA9FCACAF26F6D42A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> National Laboratories;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/2/C" id="HBF0800F1C68F41E2A7A00C130B18548B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> institutions of higher education; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/2/D" id="HEE689C22784449EE849DF38B4B1651B0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> the private sector.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/3" id="H343234495E084C068B55FACDD3021194" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Focus areas.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The program under paragraph (1) may include research, development, demonstration, or commercial application of nuclear integrated energy systems with respect to—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/3/A" id="H38D8ED9D609840188C2D75AAE6046140" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> desalination technologies and processes;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/3/B" id="HC0567283D5EF4103A4B38A0A915CDC1A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> hydrogen or other liquid and gaseous fuel or chemical production;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/3/C" id="H454CDE944CB74EE3831E2C340BA35C90" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> heat for industrial processes;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/3/D" id="H414F8AB95E344B90B8CF0AF272D3D98C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> district heating;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/3/E" id="H760ACA2E9050400AB29F6FAC9C0EE2C0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<content> heat or electricity generation and storage;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/3/F" id="HA59EA3751604439AAB00EBFD4AA408D4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="F">“(F)</num>
					<content> carbon capture, use, utilization, and storage;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/3/G" id="H078ADEF789E04B5D88A9E4B4BB459A91" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="G">“(G)</num>
					<content> microgrid or island applications;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/3/H" id="HB7CC668B59A648C29B2706B95B5CE6E4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="H">“(H)</num>
					<content> integrated systems modeling, analysis, and optimization, inclusive of different configurations of integrated energy systems; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/3/I" id="H1BACCC0003DF42BAAA5B8F3325F78D75" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> integrated design, planning, building, and operation of systems with existing infrastructure, including interconnection requirements with the electric grid, as appropriate.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/4" id="H5DF43625157546079F765A523E75F5DC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> Authorization of appropriations.—</heading>
				<chapeau>There are authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out the program under this subsection—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/4/A" id="H4DEB5C74F1DF467C832926BB9093291F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> $20,000,000 for fiscal year 2021;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/4/B" id="H76E8F0755F6B43D5BA0D42B70BB26CD4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> $30,000,000 for fiscal year 2022;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/4/C" id="H0D9A26B8AAF64FFE9C4D9BE39022CB65" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> $30,000,000 for fiscal year 2023;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/4/D" id="HC26F46D02C9F4986AB627D1F59F1955E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> $40,000,000 for fiscal year 2024; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/a/qB/s952/c/4/E" id="HE169A1EEF30C4AA18E0DD1F0CFE23050" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<content> $40,000,000 for fiscal year 2025.”</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 952 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16272)

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H3AEB29A8894C48F0B74407D097A5B360" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953" id="HA5E9F0976A494CFABDE9087745CDC49E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
		<num value="953">“SEC. 953.</num>
		<heading> Fuel cycle research, development, demonstration, and commercial application.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a" id="H1F6EAA9AA2FC4EF18AEB8703CDE5FB75" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> Used nuclear fuel research, development, demonstration, and commercial application.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/1" id="H5D3B7BAC8A1D461D945A8EB2A6753FC6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall conduct an advanced fuel cycle research, development, demonstration, and commercial application program to improve fuel cycle performance, minimize environmental and public health and safety impacts, and support a variety of options for used nuclear fuel storage, use, and disposal, including advanced nuclear reactor and non-reactor concepts (such as radioisotope power systems), which may include—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/1/A" id="HA9C4ECA08AFF4B28841F4BF091E611AB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> dry cask storage;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/1/B" id="H05DE2460F7F34439ACC4EE7B77BF8497" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> consolidated interim storage;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/1/C" id="HEDBE778ADFF345D48E59C1B9D9AF432D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> deep geological storage and disposal, including mined repository, and other technologies;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/1/D" id="H1B9686478F354CBD95BFA5D570D3CA8E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> used nuclear fuel transportation;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/1/E" id="H635D5DA6415B4E3D8C36E01EF655937B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<content> integrated waste management systems;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/1/F" id="HDD3A26215DDC4821BEABA93E2BBC5D44" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1281">
					<num value="F">“(F)</num>
					<content> vitrification;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/1/G" id="H9B0B888C7F174D8483BB413519D9B557" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
					<num value="G">“(G)</num>
					<content> fuel recycling and transmutation technologies, including advanced reprocessing technologies such as electrochemical and molten salt technologies, and advanced redox extraction technologies;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/1/H" id="H39986A0942494777985BAD18DEF5292C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
					<num value="H">“(H)</num>
					<content> advanced materials to be used in subparagraphs (A) through (G); and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/1/I" id="HCA6495D057124BB0B9CC5FF9D2BA3727" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> other areas as determined by the Secretary.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/2" id="H1EF14C81DC204F2BA803043472DB86E8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Requirements.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In carrying out the program under this subsection, the Secretary shall—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/2/A" id="HE312EFD11AC54E72AAAB5958EAAE64C4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> ensure all activities and designs incorporate state of the art safeguards technologies and techniques to reduce risk of proliferation;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/2/B" id="HFDB4D9794F824743AC75412731EF809A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> consult with the Administrator of the National Nuclear Security Administration to integrate safeguards and security by design;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/2/C" id="HE56FDAC67D8448F585A36D514F6D3839" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> consider the potential benefits and other impacts of those activities for civilian nuclear applications, environmental health and safety, and national security, including consideration of public consent; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/2/D" id="HAD104F3646A4465E9608C0D8EC42CE83" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> consider the economic viability of all activities and designs.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/a/3" id="H3B64A0C88D0045728E33CFABC01726EA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Authorization of appropriations.—</heading>
				<content>There are authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out the program under this subsection $60,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2025.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/b" id="H20209DAE2CC3402DBB6785DCF7D74991" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Advanced fuels.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/b/1" id="H7DE6511B6BE14817BADB715FD039F6F0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall conduct an advanced fuels research, development, demonstration, and commercial application program on next-generation light water reactor and advanced reactor fuels that demonstrate the potential for improved—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/b/1/A" id="H0795B066B4184B53AE445F2E0CCC1267" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> performance;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/b/1/B" id="HF6B15D2F99A24CCC926594903997B913" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> accident tolerance;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/b/1/C" id="HCFA5875A46194DE297250EBB00E76F82" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> proliferation resistance;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/b/1/D" id="H6F3C714AA0BD4896B272FC89651E0259" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> use of resources;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/b/1/E" id="H07AACB59678D4061BD2B11104FDA4ED2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<content> environmental impact; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/b/1/F" id="HA2C4CCF1B94B47B09B9338F659D04968" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
					<num value="F">“(F)</num>
					<content> economics.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/b/2" id="HB7FB34260A8D4D83A4CAC1DBAB05D6E2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Requirements.—</heading>
				<content>In carrying out the program under this subsection, the Secretary shall focus on the development of advanced technology fuels, including fabrication techniques, that offer improved accident-tolerance and economic performance with the goal of initial commercial application by December 31, 2025.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/b/3" id="HD638D65716A143ECB0A9D328E9C43F9E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Report.—</heading>
				<content>Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this section, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate a report that describes how the technologies and concepts studied under this program would impact reactor economics, the fuel cycle, operations, safety, proliferation, and the environment.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/b/qB/s953/b/4" id="HA71B6CB74758427D934BC119F0334B78" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1282">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> Authorization of appropriations.—</heading>
				<content>There are authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out the program under this subsection $125,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2025.”</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 953 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16273)

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H47F6ABC0B9764A5ABB1E7721EC083830" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/e/qB/s313" id="HE0E1AD82827147F697F701CC38D63EF3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1284">
		<num value="313">“SEC. 313.</num>
		<heading> University Nuclear Leadership Program.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/e/qB/s313/a" id="H95A38746C03C45B38D60A59BEF3CBE2C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1284">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary of Energy, the Administrator of the National Nuclear Security Administration, and the Chairman of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission shall jointly establish a program, to be known as the ‘<quotedText>University Nuclear Leadership Program</quotedText>’.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/e/qB/s313/b" id="HB43BE8200DD04092A2FEE3E4FD41C5DA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1284">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Use of funds.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/e/qB/s313/b/1" id="H7C32F5464F9C429692DA6C0DA24BBD77" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1284">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Except as provided in paragraph (2), amounts made available to carry out the Program shall be used to provide financial assistance for scholarships, fellowships, and research and development projects at institutions of higher education in areas relevant to the programmatic mission of the applicable Federal agency, with an emphasis on providing the financial assistance with respect to research, development, demonstration, and commercial application activities relevant to civilian advanced nuclear reactors including, but not limited to—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/e/qB/s313/b/1/A" id="HE45AC9FCC1144FB68D388CC268281E72" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1284">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> relevant fuel cycle technologies;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/e/qB/s313/b/1/B" id="H8B0F82930FF347BCAA5B98CBE7D78165" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1284">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> project management; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/e/qB/s313/b/1/C" id="H6F8D6920BF0C4288ABAF7C112DAA39FC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1284">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> advanced construction, manufacturing, and fabrication methods.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/e/qB/s313/b/2" id="HA00055D9CA354137A8735BF4849B8BCA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1284">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Exception.—</heading>
				<content>Notwithstanding paragraph (1), amounts made available to carry out the Program may be used to provide financial assistance for a scholarship, fellowship, or multiyear research and development project that does not align directly with a programmatic mission of the Department of Energy, if the activity for which assistance is provided would facilitate the maintenance of the discipline of nuclear science or engineering.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/e/qB/s313/c" id="H014739B5A53340B2A743D16F0DAB488A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1285">
			<num value="c">“(c)</num>
			<heading> Definitions.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In this section:</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/e/qB/s313/c/1" id="H793D21FF092A431AA8C499C9A12DD019" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1285">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> Advanced nuclear reactor; institution of higher education.—</heading>
				<content>The terms ‘<term>advanced nuclear reactor</term>’ and ‘<term>institution of higher education</term>’ have the meanings given those terms in section 951 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/16271">42 U.S.C. 16271</ref>).</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/e/qB/s313/c/2" id="H4C02BFCCEB384247BCF3D2042450112E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1285">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Program.—</heading>
				<content>The term ‘<term>Program</term>’ means the University Nuclear Leadership Program established under this section.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/e/qB/s313/d" id="HAAB663956A2749C093ADCFAFA0B04710" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1285">
			<num value="d">“(d)</num>
			<heading> Authorization of appropriations.—</heading>
			<chapeau>There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out the Program for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2025—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/e/qB/s313/d/1" id="HD129E073315E458CAA0D8192424EF93C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1285">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> $30,000,000 to the Secretary of Energy, of which $15,000,000 shall be for use by the Administrator of the National Nuclear Security Administration; and</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2003/e/qB/s313/d/2" id="HAFCBB2A1077F4583B79609DC2985DABB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1285">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> $15,000,000 to the Nuclear Regulatory Commission.”</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 313 of the Omnibus Appropriations Act, 2009 (42 U.S.C. 16274a),

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="HE3AD47C7F18D4ACF87C396356C853CB9" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dZ/tII/s2004/qB/d" id="HB79BE67112364DDBACE5371E81515EA1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1289">
		<num value="d">“(d)</num>
		<heading> Duplication.—</heading>
		<chapeau>The Secretary shall ensure the coordination of, and avoid unnecessary duplication of, the activities of the program under subsection (a) with the activities of—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2004/qB/d/1" id="HEF23B7C5AD764D9B981E60A4B1870D85" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1289">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> other research entities of the Department, including the National Laboratories, the Advanced Research Projects Agency–Energy, and the Advanced Scientific Computing Research program; and</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2004/qB/d/2" id="HA4D795A9A0DD4F9B94C0F4C39E6E7491" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1289">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> industry.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 957 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16277)
