cite.cite_text: Section 307 of the Department of Energy Research and Innovation Act (42 U.S.C. 18645)

doc_names: Department of Energy Research and Innovation Act

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H612127E49D6C492C902DB01CBE5CFCF0" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dZ/tII/s2008/b/qB/c" id="H26B05504A92542FE90ED98BD8B295D55" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1297">
		<num value="c">“(c)</num>
		<heading> United states participation in ITER.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2008/b/qB/c/1" id="HB2AC12BA9A4D48259C8E16AFF42C4A0B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1297">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>There is authorized United States participation in the construction and operations of the ITER project, as agreed to under the April 25, 2007 ‘<quotedText>Agreement on the Establishment of the ITER International Fusion Energy Organization for the Joint Implementation of the ITER Project</quotedText>’. The Director shall coordinate and carry out the responsibilities of the United States with respect to this Agreement.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2008/b/qB/c/2" id="HDDC5CC7B99E14D80A9ADA622808736A5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Report.—</heading>
			<content>Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this section, the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report providing an assessment of the most recent schedule for ITER that has been approved by the ITER Council.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2008/b/qB/c/3" id="HC75DCB8DA16C463A9F23DCB5349ABD3C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> Authorization of appropriations.—</heading>
			<chapeau>Out of funds authorized to be appropriated under section 307(o) of the Department of Energy Research and Innovation Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/18645">42 U.S.C. 18645</ref>), there shall be made available to the Secretary to carry out the construction of ITER—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2008/b/qB/c/3/A" id="HE660E6FC76394CB08AC8C20E7A469F77" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> $374,000,000 for fiscal year 2021; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tII/s2008/b/qB/c/3/B" id="HB590AC0C5F1A4D10B2142CE4AC529F0F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> $281,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2025.”</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 972(c) of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16312)

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H53A4BC46C359486BB0B8C1C51F06FD57" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subtitle identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC" id="HCD34A92810EA4448AA3B10CD8360CE83" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
		<num value="C">“Subtitle C—</num>
		<heading>Water Power Research and Development</heading>
		<section identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632" id="H7AB25A73AFA444708FF01EA5F66D1A23" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
			<num value="632">“SEC. 632.</num>
			<heading> Definitions.</heading>
			<chapeau class="block">In this subtitle:</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/1" id="H2A0F91A265A8445DBA5A9D1BEE18A112" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> Eligible entity.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The term ‘<term>eligible entity</term>’ means any of the following entities:</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/1/A" id="H1D51E9AD64094BD3AC7D893FBB885860" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> An institution of higher education.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/1/B" id="H4A6D25C7705E4E2595974FC7E1FDA02B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> A National Laboratory.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/1/C" id="HDC8E831843A44D3681349D5459A804CF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> A Federal research agency.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/1/D" id="HABC631A76C1047EDAD74332AE6D4B02E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> A State research agency.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/1/E" id="H630624A89F5E41189735BA73CF488BE8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<content> A nonprofit research organization.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/1/F" id="H1EABDB8F22E147388F92B02860BA1F9A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
					<num value="F">“(F)</num>
					<content> An industrial entity or a multi-institutional consortium thereof.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/2" id="H92E232A65B2546B2BC82074B16FD18EA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Institution of higher education.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The term ‘<term>institution of higher education</term>’ means—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/2/A" id="H7367F6EF1C1A4B33833210EB9BAF82AA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> an institution of higher education (as defined in section 101(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (<ref href="/us/usc/20/1001">20 U.S.C. 1001(a)</ref>)); or</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/2/B" id="H81F2C7D1B28343B588DBCA5DA31DB15B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> a postsecondary vocational institution (as defined in section 102(c) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (<ref href="/us/usc/20/1002">20 U.S.C. 1002(c)</ref>)).</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/3" id="HFF2479D30B39450F9732975E465C5C58" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Marine energy.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The term ‘<term>marine energy</term>’ means energy from—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/3/A" id="HB6E94DA04A6640ED8A2A59BFAAC688DE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> waves, tides, and currents in oceans, estuaries, and tidal areas;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/3/B" id="H1DCFE334E58145D2B86B9E10B4DDC7B3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1298">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> free flowing water in rivers, lakes, streams, and man-made channels;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/3/C" id="H64008705F0114CF4A7E7BAE527260D65" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> differentials in salinity and pressure gradients; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/3/D" id="H6777D577812241A6A5B38CF36F633736" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> differentials in water temperature, including ocean thermal energy conversion.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/4" id="H10F7CE2F60884D6FAD46F828BD31635D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> National laboratory.—</heading>
				<content>The term ‘<term>National Laboratory</term>’ has the meaning given such term in section 2(3) of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/15801">42 U.S.C. 15801(3)</ref>).</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/5" id="H9C1A4B4F236D435B8FBA32A031A9391B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<heading> Water power.—</heading>
				<content>The term ‘<term>water power</term>’ refers to hydropower, including conduit power, pumped storage, and marine energy technologies.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s632/6" id="H37FA617B5015480DABFC836A2CA100BF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
				<num value="6">“(6)</num>
				<heading> Microgrid.—</heading>
				<content>The term ‘<term>microgrid</term>’ has the meaning given such term in section 641 of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/17231">42 U.S.C. 17231</ref>).</content>
			</paragraph>
		</section>
		<section identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s633" id="H65E9EC027BCF448291602B00C8430CF4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
			<num value="633">“SEC. 633.</num>
			<heading> Water power technology research, development, and demonstration.</heading>
			<chapeau class="block">The Secretary shall carry out a program to conduct research, development, demonstration, and commercial application of water power technologies in support of each of the following purposes:</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s633/1" id="H39A6FC4B633B4AC9BE431C18A8620806" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> To promote research, development, demonstration, and commercial application of water power generation technologies in order to increase capacity and reduce the cost of those technologies.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s633/2" id="H2F8876861637479D99FE90BBDDD7308B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> To promote research and development to improve the environmental impact of water power technologies.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s633/3" id="HBC7BFE3AFA5D46B38FBE53D5BF61D1F5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<content> To provide grid reliability and resilience, including through technologies that facilitate new market opportunities, such as ancillary services, for water power.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s633/4" id="HE1728F9F63B341048B21E39F844F0117" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<content> To promote the development of water power technologies to improve economic growth and enhance cross-institutional foundational workforce development in the water power sector, including in coastal communities.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</section>
		<section identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634" id="H0099AD2C99C24EB1B9C2EB00EDAD1374" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
			<num value="634">“SEC. 634.</num>
			<heading> Hydropower research, development, and demonstration.</heading>
			<chapeau class="block">The Secretary shall conduct a program of research, development, demonstration, and commercial application for technologies that improve the capacity, efficiency, resilience, security, reliability, affordability, and environmental impact, including potential cumulative environmental impacts, of hydropower systems. In carrying out such program, the Secretary shall prioritize activities designed to—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/1" id="HCFAFF4F2412F449988E0EE2409DA7221" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<chapeau> develop technology for—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/1/A" id="H0D753F1E462241FA943B0028D6341146" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> non-powered dams, including aging and potentially hazardous dams;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/1/B" id="HBAFB8AD623F34F618733B8EBCC0CC32A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> pumped storage;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/1/C" id="HAF98A7CE53914713940C1DADDADE82B2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> constructed waterways;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/1/D" id="H9972F6FECA8746828AF0E48CD997056C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> new stream-reach development;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/1/E" id="H7869AB3B762245D586307EBEB6DC5145" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<content> modular and small dams;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/1/F" id="HCFD6D258665E475EBF2EB0C8A1EEC16C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
					<num value="F">“(F)</num>
					<content> increased operational flexibility; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/1/G" id="HB77E568AC09E41DBA71014F97942C85B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
					<num value="G">“(G)</num>
					<content> enhancement of relevant existing facilities;</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/2" id="H8667C9E1D8F04F5DB07E8042A5BD444E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<chapeau> develop new strategies and technologies, including analytical methods, physical and numerical tools, and advanced computing, as well as methods to validate such methods and tools, in order to—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/2/A" id="HD55E1B929A114919BE2A8B1D27D0F351" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1299">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> extend the operational lifetime of hydropower systems and their physical structures, while improving environmental impact, including potential cumulative environmental impacts;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/2/B" id="H43F63A1E74E4438995224FA186166FE7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> assist in device and system design, installation, operation, and maintenance; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/2/C" id="H4F5C9A7056BB4AA3B95B6209AD5320E7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> reduce costs, limit outages, and increase unit and plant efficiencies, including by examining the impact of changing water and electricity demand on hydropower generation, flexibility, and provision of grid services;</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/3" id="H105D188A5BBB45D5B164885E56F0C610" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<content> study, in conjunction with other relevant Federal agencies as appropriate, methods to improve the hydropower licensing process, including by compiling current and accepted best practices, public comments, and methodologies to assess the full range of potential environmental and economic impacts;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/4" id="H5147880471CE4B828B79B3E84AA3B250" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<chapeau> identify opportunities for joint research, development, and demonstration programs between hydropower systems, which may include—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/4/A" id="H57E26ED586F4442899F9840F44D9D740" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> pumped storage systems and other renewable energy systems;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/4/B" id="HBCA0DA9E7EB449509669D57A063F208B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> small hydro facilities and other energy storage systems;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/4/C" id="H492E86ED0E6F45AC864CECB9AC3F7C0B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> other hybrid energy systems;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/4/D" id="H8A73CB7F813147BAAA1100D44BE1CAA4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> small hydro facilities and critical infrastructure, including water infrastructure; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/4/E" id="H79C2FA2BAB5C45F0AACBAFCE6F5F7DCD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<content> hydro facilities and responsive load technologies, which may include smart buildings and city systems;</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/5" id="HF471EC8314714254B4033CA3CC1A32FF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<content> improve the reliability of hydropower technologies, including during extreme weather events;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/6" id="H7DCF93BB2D6F40049B9F3D977B2FBA1A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
				<num value="6">“(6)</num>
				<chapeau> develop methods and technologies to improve environmental impact, including potential cumulative environmental impacts, of hydropower and pumped storage technologies, including potential impacts on wildlife, such as—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/6/A" id="HBE02116EF7154FE69460640AF1ADFDF8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> fisheries;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/6/B" id="H0B14B4BDFC784D29A89204453CE5DEAB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> aquatic life and resources;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/6/C" id="HADA18BC588C34607860864F08DBA4593" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> navigation of waterways; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/6/D" id="H9A63073AEB384551BF99FF4E457825FC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> upstream and downstream environmental conditions, including sediment movement, water quality, and flow volumes;</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/7" id="H92EBA317230240B884EF6EE3BE8DE174" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
				<num value="7">“(7)</num>
				<chapeau> identify ways to increase power generation by—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/7/A" id="H3D9AD0E1BD8E4F0CB8D31E6C21F29C05" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> diversifying plant configuration options;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/7/B" id="H7041802AF3594130A482101D2472B452" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> improving pump-back efficiencies;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/7/C" id="H6C9B5650115E4C13B17F1F8F89D65799" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> investigating multi-phase systems;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/7/D" id="HD65385F9CB934A0B867B7DDFC0086DD3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> developing, testing, and monitoring advanced generators with faster cycling times, variable speeds, and improved efficiencies;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/7/E" id="HC0F78F4042034360A1D8949B603100A5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<content> developing, testing, and monitoring advanced turbines capable of improving environmental impact, including potential cumulative environmental impacts, including small turbine designs;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/7/F" id="HF591B9BBC18C4FB890BC338F151D30DE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="F">“(F)</num>
					<content> developing standardized powertrain components;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/7/G" id="HCBE0396465B04A6288206F5935DF88D3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="G">“(G)</num>
					<content> developing components with advanced materials and manufacturing processes, including additive manufacturing; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/7/H" id="H713A8297EB614F1894C34D1D6D268C13" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
					<num value="H">“(H)</num>
					<content> developing analytical tools that enable hydropower to provide grid services that, amongst other services, improve grid integration of other energy sources;</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/8" id="HF4CE005AC08E4C5BA16A32154DCF6346" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1300">
				<num value="8">“(8)</num>
				<chapeau> advance new pumped storage technologies, including—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/8/A" id="H5B96361E84E7487CAD7F37DA478EF497" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> systems with adjustable speed and other new pumping and generating equipment designs;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/8/B" id="HE55D426F0C6C4FF58A552D202DE6B94A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> modular systems;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/8/C" id="H0F03183C91A94590842A154F9A44187D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> alternative closed-loop systems, including mines and quarries; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/8/D" id="H7030EA827CFB4A0E90E6B1319216C435" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> other innovative equipment and materials as determined by the Secretary;</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/9" id="HFDAC78EC2D594F9D8C53E8530BBDF13C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
				<num value="9">“(9)</num>
				<content> reduce civil works costs and construction times for hydropower and pumped storage systems, including comprehensive data and systems analysis of hydropower and pumped storage construction technologies and processes in order to identify areas for whole-system efficiency gains;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/10" id="H6C684173AC184ECF97B3D2CAD83658E4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
				<num value="10">“(10)</num>
				<chapeau> advance efficient and reliable integration of hydropower and pumped storage systems with the electric grid by—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/10/A" id="H70D6E22C415C453ABBE0B52186275A5E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> improving methods for operational forecasting of renewable energy systems to identify opportunities for hydropower applications in pumped storage and hybrid energy systems, including forecasting of seasonal and annual energy storage;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/10/B" id="H8628445E302D452792B4154897E57103" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> considering aggregating small distributed hydropower assets; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/10/C" id="HE8ABBC81FCA34105A975638436147894" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> identifying barriers to grid scale implementation of hydropower and pumped storage technologies;</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/11" id="HC557E9B906544931B116D4C1524F37F3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
				<num value="11">“(11)</num>
				<content> improve computational fluid dynamic modeling methods;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/12" id="HFEB4E65D2778492494F8DFEA4234FEF3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
				<num value="12">“(12)</num>
				<content> improve flow measurement methods, including maintenance of continuous flow measurement equipment;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/13" id="H5F800E0DD8DD49DEABBF8C56F3F86E63" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
				<num value="13">“(13)</num>
				<content> identify best methods for compiling data on all hydropower resources and assets, including identifying potential for increased capacity; and</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s634/14" id="H7B2BCD44360647D1A002B3FAEDBBB975" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
				<num value="14">“(14)</num>
				<content> identify mechanisms to test and validate performance of hydropower and pumped storage technologies. </content>
			</paragraph>
		</section>
		<section identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635" id="H371F632E89DA4B9AB97E5D60F1A94FC0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
			<num value="635">“SEC. 635.</num>
			<heading> Marine energy research, development, and demonstration.</heading>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a" id="H001A5B6EA3424EA5BF892E3F321069E2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
				<num value="a">“(a)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of Defense, Secretary of Commerce (acting through the Under Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere) and other relevant Federal agencies, shall conduct a program of research, development, demonstration, and commercial application of marine energy technology, including activities to—</chapeau>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/1" id="H1583FC29AD09469FB16324009AB3AC2A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
					<num value="1">“(1)</num>
					<content> assist technology development to improve the components, processes, and systems used for power generation from marine energy resources at a variety of scales;</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/2" id="H484891A720EE42B7B55DAC5A793DA4BB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
					<num value="2">“(2)</num>
					<chapeau> establish and expand critical testing infrastructure and facilities necessary to—</chapeau>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/2/A" id="H0BD339BAC6444883AF96F688D0C47FA7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
						<num value="A">“(A)</num>
						<content> demonstrate and prove marine energy devices at a range of scales in a manner that is cost-effective and efficient; and</content>
					</subparagraph>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/2/B" id="H6B770F5E68F14D0A92F76140DEC46328" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
						<num value="B">“(B)</num>
						<content> accelerate the technological readiness and commercial application of such devices;</content>
					</subparagraph>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/3" id="H8315F0C635D641FFB87104A99B8BB769" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
					<num value="3">“(3)</num>
					<content> address marine energy resource variability issues, including through the application of energy storage technologies;</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/4" id="H1F5DA5660ACC45429226167AABA6732A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1301">
					<num value="4">“(4)</num>
					<content> advance efficient and reliable integration of marine energy with the electric grid, which may include smart building systems;</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/5" id="H2D5EADC4D5864506BB1AAF3D140E8F79" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
					<num value="5">“(5)</num>
					<content> identify and study critical short-term and long-term needs to maintaining a sustainable marine energy supply chain based in the United States;</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/6" id="H1776BD7C19F4456F8F53E4F88F9D6F92" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
					<num value="6">“(6)</num>
					<content> increase the reliability, security, and resilience of marine energy technologies;</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/7" id="HC150A52CE62C40F59B25BA8A2422C5FD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
					<num value="7">“(7)</num>
					<content> validate the performance, reliability, maintainability, and cost of marine energy device designs and system components in an operating environment;</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/8" id="HD43C316712334D55B880828100B77EA7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
					<num value="8">“(8)</num>
					<content> consider the protection of critical infrastructure, such as adequate separation between marine energy devices and submarine telecommunications cables, including through the development of voluntary, consensus-based standards for such purposes;</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/9" id="H244BA6B8046B478DB5A21AEF713BB6DF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
					<num value="9">“(9)</num>
					<content> identify opportunities for crosscutting research, development, and demonstration programs between existing energy research programs;</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/10" id="H68DC1A76C49F47A48AE79824D68C6503" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
					<num value="10">“(10)</num>
					<chapeau> identify and improve, in conjunction with the Secretary of Commerce, acting through the Under Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere, and other relevant Federal agencies as appropriate, the environmental impact, including potential cumulative environmental impacts, of marine energy technologies, including—</chapeau>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/10/A" id="H55C36639C86C469DAF7860EB6EA19CA6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
						<num value="A">“(A)</num>
						<content> potential impacts on fisheries and other marine resources; and</content>
					</subparagraph>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/10/B" id="H188ACA495A9C4A6FAB452A5C81F0913F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
						<num value="B">“(B)</num>
						<content> developing technologies, including mechanisms for self-evaluation, and other means available for improving environmental impact, including potential cumulative environmental impacts;</content>
					</subparagraph>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/11" id="HFA4D6324B7B14F27AC5C9FFA5AC0F10A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
					<num value="11">“(11)</num>
					<content> identify, in consultation with relevant Federal agencies, potential navigational impacts of marine energy technologies and strategies to prevent possible adverse impacts, in addition to opportunities for marine energy systems to aid the United States Coast Guard, such as remote sensing for coastal border security;</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/12" id="H056870AB34DC4B3D93F3E32B264AD416" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
					<num value="12">“(12)</num>
					<content> develop numerical and physical tools, including models and monitoring technologies, to assist industry in device and system design, installation, operation, and maintenance, including methods to validate such tools;</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/13" id="HDFA07CC14A8D4E78823864EBF14F0A08" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
					<num value="13">“(13)</num>
					<content> support materials science as it relates to marine energy technology, such as the development of corrosive-resistant materials;</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/14" id="HFC4A5E713D194CE7BCEA3055790DF510" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
					<num value="14">“(14)</num>
					<content> improve marine energy resource forecasting and general understanding of aquatic system behavior, including turbulence and extreme conditions;</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/15" id="HDF1B2EA20B0141099F76E22BDCEFD89A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
					<num value="15">“(15)</num>
					<chapeau> develop metrics and voluntary, consensus-based standards, in coordination with the National Institute of Standards and Technology and appropriate standard development organizations, for marine energy components, systems, and projects, including—</chapeau>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/15/A" id="HB6206BE999E94239B031C5AD6CF48F1D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
						<num value="A">“(A)</num>
						<content> measuring performance of marine energy technologies; and</content>
					</subparagraph>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/15/B" id="HBC7A2B787A4A44B0A92A82449E6F2453" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
						<num value="B">“(B)</num>
						<content> characterizing environmental conditions;</content>
					</subparagraph>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/16" id="HBEA8C1F0373F4FDF8B6BD12CC9A3C711" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
					<num value="16">“(16)</num>
					<content> enhance integration with hybrid energy systems, including desalination;</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/17" id="H27D6726C164D4A33AD941B2210815A7D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1302">
					<num value="17">“(17)</num>
					<content> identify opportunities to integrate marine energy technologies into new and existing infrastructure; and</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/18" id="H89A2F4EE921641DEAEA912C1F4CD955E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
					<num value="18">“(18)</num>
					<chapeau> to develop technology necessary to support the use of marine energy—</chapeau>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/18/A" id="H43297EF4A0854FD587022121C17C491D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
						<num value="A">“(A)</num>
						<content> for the generation and storage of power at sea; and</content>
					</subparagraph>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/18/B" id="HD25011ABDC1C483384B72EC4B57DC7DB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
						<num value="B">“(B)</num>
						<chapeau> for the generation and storage of power to promote the resilience of coastal communities, including in applications relating to—</chapeau>
						<clause identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/18/B/i" id="HF2A14ED7DB164DC3B0A195C6F30E4DB1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
							<num value="i">“(i)</num>
							<content> desalination;</content>
						</clause>
						<clause identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/18/B/ii" id="H214C8E523B744334B703C541919AFC2B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
							<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
							<content> disaster recovery and resilience; and</content>
						</clause>
						<clause identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/a/18/B/iii" id="HF93D62C3FB3545C78B826E868CE30B65" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
							<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
							<content> community microgrids in isolated power systems.</content>
						</clause>
					</subparagraph>
				</paragraph>
			</subsection>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/b" id="H6E8B000EC9964B7B8079C77FB80E5F87" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
				<num value="b">“(b)</num>
				<heading> Study of non-Power sector applications for advanced marine energy technologies.—</heading>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/b/1" id="H503D633FB60A4D97BDF573245BD17EF0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
					<num value="1">“(1)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<chapeau>The Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of Transportation and the Secretary of Commerce, shall conduct a study to examine opportunities for research and development in advanced marine energy technologies for non-power sector applications, including applications with respect to—</chapeau>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/b/1/A" id="H45AC1E2BAD69476A8171026138BBE544" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
						<num value="A">“(A)</num>
						<content> the maritime transportation sector;</content>
					</subparagraph>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/b/1/B" id="H1E24CC03E9AA47A4A367FDCE3C27E67F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
						<num value="B">“(B)</num>
						<content> associated maritime energy infrastructure, including infrastructure that serves ports, to improve system resilience and disaster recovery; and</content>
					</subparagraph>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/b/1/C" id="H3897F9FA78934FF79BF9BE81E58CD70F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
						<num value="C">“(C)</num>
						<content> enabling scientific missions at sea and in extreme environments, including the Arctic.</content>
					</subparagraph>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s635/b/2" id="H1C10B9239BFC43DC8655CFF07E037C72" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
					<num value="2">“(2)</num>
					<heading> Report.—</heading>
					<content>Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this section, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate and the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives a report that describes the results of the study conducted under paragraph (1).</content>
				</paragraph>
			</subsection>
		</section>
		<section identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636" id="H94822C14A57946329EB13A1D8A9DD2A1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
			<num value="636">“SEC. 636.</num>
			<heading> National Marine Energy Centers.</heading>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/a" id="H5E0917A156C44162934ED0D661C4A222" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
				<num value="a">“(a)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall award grants, each such grant up to $10,000,000 per year, to institutions of higher education (or consortia thereof) for—</chapeau>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/a/1" id="HB649C81887C342F998E57ED9E839BC14" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
					<num value="1">“(1)</num>
					<content> the continuation and expansion of the research, development, demonstration, testing, and commercial application activities at the National Marine Energy Centers (referred to in this section as ‘<quotedText>Centers</quotedText>’) established as of January 1, 2020; and</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/a/2" id="H09AD5F9CBB4246C0BD37F2C77DD063C9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
					<num value="2">“(2)</num>
					<content> the establishment of new National Marine Energy Centers.</content>
				</paragraph>
			</subsection>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/b" id="H9D61EDB242094F71AEAAAA9918279278" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
				<num value="b">“(b)</num>
				<heading> Location selection.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In selecting institutions of higher education for new Centers, the Secretary shall consider the following criteria:</chapeau>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/b/1" id="H4A266BF3E3C4414CAB7832C817EE1E62" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
					<num value="1">“(1)</num>
					<content> Whether the institution hosts an existing marine energy research and development program.</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/b/2" id="HDBFF6E315D4D41E6A44EBF60F7E26125" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
					<num value="2">“(2)</num>
					<content> Whether the institution has proven technical expertise to support marine energy research.</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/b/3" id="H04249F9E027C4C8D860155D711ABE0E5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
					<num value="3">“(3)</num>
					<content> Whether the institution has access to marine resources.</content>
				</paragraph>
			</subsection>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/c" id="HC1687BD8DFD14373ABEE39714D0150AA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
				<num value="c">“(c)</num>
				<heading> Purposes.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Centers shall coordinate among themselves, the Department, and National Laboratories to—</chapeau>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/c/1" id="HDA7D5485001F421D8CBA3CB3C88FE5BB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1303">
					<num value="1">“(1)</num>
					<content> advance research, development, demonstration, and commercial application of marine energy technologies in response to industry and commercial needs;</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/c/2" id="H90A9376E459D47BCBCCDF0AE8A684BF1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
					<num value="2">“(2)</num>
					<chapeau> support in-water testing and demonstration of marine energy technologies, including facilities capable of testing—</chapeau>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/c/2/A" id="H87EEFCCC798D463D8F0D82DC198DB74C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
						<num value="A">“(A)</num>
						<content> marine energy systems of various technology readiness levels and scales;</content>
					</subparagraph>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/c/2/B" id="H9A4BA8D99E5A495A94C0FEE7CB408B60" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
						<num value="B">“(B)</num>
						<content> a variety of technologies in multiple test berths at a single location;</content>
					</subparagraph>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/c/2/C" id="H27D93C6B63C340DEA1C9A92AE7FA3C63" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
						<num value="C">“(C)</num>
						<content> arrays of technology devices; and</content>
					</subparagraph>
					<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/c/2/D" id="H16F280BCC68F42E8A0EB1AAFBD6C18B6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
						<num value="D">“(D)</num>
						<content> interconnectivity to an electrical grid, including microgrids; and</content>
					</subparagraph>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/c/3" id="H8619FB5BE7B34916B8260B1F34FE78D6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
					<num value="3">“(3)</num>
					<content> collect and disseminate information on best practices in all areas relating to developing and managing marine energy resources and energy systems.</content>
				</paragraph>
			</subsection>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/d" id="HC94F84B332FF40B99FE53FBEC549625D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
				<num value="d">“(d)</num>
				<heading> Coordination.—</heading>
				<content>To the extent practicable, the Centers shall coordinate their activities with the Secretary of Commerce, acting through the Undersecretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere, and other relevant Federal agencies.</content>
			</subsection>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s636/e" id="H39366F678C5D4EC88ECA08F8CDE91ABD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
				<num value="e">“(e)</num>
				<heading> Termination.—</heading>
				<content>To the extent otherwise authorized by law, the Secretary may terminate funding for a Center described in paragraph (a) if such Center is under-performing.</content>
			</subsection>
		</section>
		<section identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637" id="HF8ADFC7EE44F4153918FFBA78AEFFA51" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
			<num value="637">“SEC. 637.</num>
			<heading> Organization and administration of programs.</heading>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/a" id="H154D63775798432889C552828CFC25CC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
				<num value="a">“(a)</num>
				<heading> Coordination.—</heading>
				<content>In carrying out this subtitle, the Secretary shall coordinate activities, and effectively manage cross-cutting research priorities across programs of the Department and other relevant Federal agencies, including the National Laboratories and the National Marine Energy Centers.</content>
			</subsection>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/b" id="H2315A59659BA4364BFD4A7F932E19C62" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
				<num value="b">“(b)</num>
				<heading> Collaboration.—</heading>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/b/1" id="HBAC87DAC751F4ACE8B56CF70CF4226EE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
					<num value="1">“(1)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<content>In carrying out this subtitle, the Secretary shall collaborate with industry, National Laboratories, other relevant Federal agencies, institutions of higher education, including Minority Serving Institutions, National Marine Energy Centers, Tribal entities, including Alaska Native Corporations, and international bodies with relevant scientific and technical expertise.</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/b/2" id="HE96C5276631B4440962E327A1671100A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
					<num value="2">“(2)</num>
					<heading> Participation.—</heading>
					<content>To the extent practicable, the Secretary shall encourage research projects that promote collaboration between entities specified in paragraph (1) and include entities not historically associated with National Marine Energy Centers, such as Minority Serving Institutions.</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/b/3" id="HE73C714DB5B94B1D8824E681BB530F31" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
					<num value="3">“(3)</num>
					<heading> International collaboration.—</heading>
					<content>The Secretary, in coordination with other appropriate Federal and multilateral agencies (including the United States Agency for International Development) shall support collaborative efforts with international partners to promote the research, development, and demonstration of water power technologies used to develop hydropower, pump storage, and marine energy resources.</content>
				</paragraph>
			</subsection>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/c" id="HD83AC893DC2148DAA4622439EC12CD64" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
				<num value="c">“(c)</num>
				<heading> Dissemination of results and public availability.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall—</chapeau>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/c/1" id="HC369A59B814E4D209966C80561DD4676" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
					<num value="1">“(1)</num>
					<content> publish the results of projects supported under this subtitle through Department websites, reports, databases, training materials, and industry conferences, including information discovered after the completion of such projects, withholding any industrial proprietary information; and</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/c/2" id="H904AB9181FC941D0A5C257696BA347BF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1304">
					<num value="2">“(2)</num>
					<content> share results of such projects with the public except to the extent that the information is protected from disclosure under section 552(b) of title 5, United States Code.</content>
				</paragraph>
			</subsection>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/d" id="H02E81879E0BE4C50BF8D59AB57A7E337" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1305">
				<num value="d">“(d)</num>
				<heading> Award frequency.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall solicit applications for awards under this subtitle no less frequently than once per fiscal year.</content>
			</subsection>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/e" id="H6A88488A064F4792AFC2954A5DFFDA13" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1305">
				<num value="e">“(e)</num>
				<heading> Education and outreach.—</heading>
				<content>In carrying out the activities described in this subtitle, the Secretary shall support education and outreach activities to disseminate information and promote public understanding of water power technologies and the water power workforce, including activities at the National Marine Energy Centers.</content>
			</subsection>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/f" id="H2DAF887F49584CF7ACA48B3653194FCB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1305">
				<num value="f">“(f)</num>
				<heading> Technical assistance and workforce development.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In carrying out this subtitle, the Secretary may also conduct, for purposes of supporting technical, non-hardware, and information-based advances in water power systems development and operations—</chapeau>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/f/1" id="HE26CC80DD91B4EB9BB1FDDA853AF5C22" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1305">
					<num value="1">“(1)</num>
					<content> technical assistance and analysis activities with eligible entities, including activities that support expanding access to advanced water power technologies for rural, Tribal, and low-income communities; and</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/f/2" id="HA0E09F5B31784257AEA57FE28B51CBFD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1305">
					<num value="2">“(2)</num>
					<content> workforce development and training activities, including to support the dissemination of standards and best practices for enabling water power production.</content>
				</paragraph>
			</subsection>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/g" id="HA339F7F062054B92903D5FE794EC797B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1305">
				<num value="g">“(g)</num>
				<heading> Strategic plan.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In carrying out the activities described in this subtitle, the Secretary shall—</chapeau>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/g/1" id="HB9B9ECDFF1FA4F9B8418251E6B5341EA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1305">
					<num value="1">“(1)</num>
					<content> not later than one year after the date of the enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>, draft a plan, considering input from relevant stakeholders such as industry and academia, to implement the programs described in this subtitle and update the plan on an annual basis; and</content>
				</paragraph>
				<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/g/2" id="HB2FF4C28B2AD44088DEA0CDF5E122574" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1305">
					<num value="2">“(2)</num>
					<content> the plan shall address near-term (up to 2 years), mid-term (up to 7 years), and long-term (up to 15 years) challenges to the advancement of water power systems.</content>
				</paragraph>
			</subsection>
			<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s637/h" id="H5E8968EB9B254D6FB96DF00333A7E4F1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1305">
				<num value="h">“(h)</num>
				<heading> Report to congress.—</heading>
				<content>Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>, and at least once every 2 years thereafter, the Secretary shall provide, and make available to the public and the relevant authorizing and appropriations committees of Congress, a report on the findings of research conducted and activities carried out pursuant to this subtitle, including the most current strategic plan under subsection (g) and the progress made in implementing such plan.</content>
			</subsection>
		</section>
		<section identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s638" id="H88043B24F2D543968B390E9B05C92426" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1305">
			<num value="638">“SEC. 638.</num>
			<heading> Applicability of other laws.</heading>
			<content class="indent0">Nothing in this subtitle shall be construed as waiving, modifying, or superseding the applicability of any requirement under any environmental or other Federal or State law.</content>
		</section>
		<section identifier="/dZ/tIII/stA/s3001/a/qB/stC/s639" id="HAC60AD553AB14F29A932C1813707622D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1305">
			<num value="639">“SEC. 639.</num>
			<heading> Authorization of appropriations.</heading>
			<content class="indent0">There are authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out this subtitle $186,600,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2025, including $137,428,378 for marine energy and $49,171,622 for hydropower research, development, and demonstration activities.”</content>
		</section>
	</subtitle>
</__xml__>;
