execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H1427D765757E4EDC982E6F0121B6EAD0" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stB/s3105/qB/4" id="H422B849E52D64003897E01CB2271D76C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1335">
		<num value="4">“(4)</num>
		<heading> Land subject to oil and gas lease.—</heading>
		<chapeau>Land under an oil and gas lease issued pursuant to the Mineral Leasing Act (<ref href="/us/usc/30/181">30 U.S.C. 181</ref> et seq.) or the Mineral Leasing Act for Acquired Lands (<ref href="/us/usc/30/351">30 U.S.C. 351</ref> et seq.) that is subject to an approved application for permit to drill and from which oil and gas production is occurring may be available for noncompetitive leasing under subsection (c) by the holder of the oil and gas lease—</chapeau>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stB/s3105/qB/4/A" id="H6DBC515DE78A4F5A8084628DC0A49124" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1336">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<content> on a determination that geothermal energy will be produced from a well producing or capable of producing oil and gas; and</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stB/s3105/qB/4/B" id="H2BC5B2EBAA3D4171A82A4C25BBFADF12" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1336">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<content> to provide for the coproduction of geothermal energy with oil and gas.”</content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 4(b) of the Geothermal Steam Act of 1970 (30 U.S.C. 1003(b))

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H324A57A7F96A4174B4B355748559E7C3" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIII/stC/s3201/e/qB/q" id="HF4A058EF9EA64EDAAD446D51CEECD885" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1342">
		<num value="q">“(q)</num>
		<heading> Critical material recycling and reuse research, development, and demonstration program.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stC/s3201/e/qB/q/1" id="HC966325EB78E470E8B32B873BC7B39AB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1342">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> Definitions.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In this subsection:</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stC/s3201/e/qB/q/1/A" id="HBA9F5C47B8CD4C0ABAE1716E1B5918C4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1342">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> Critical material.—</heading>
				<content>The term ‘<term>critical material</term>’ has the meaning given the term in 7002 of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stC/s3201/e/qB/q/1/B" id="H7AB0B9DAA30F4F83AD03250D40AAAC60" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1342">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Critical material recycling.—</heading>
				<content>The term ‘<term>critical material recycling</term>’ means the separation and recovery of critical materials embedded within an energy storage system through physical or chemical means for the purpose of reuse of those critical materials in other technologies.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stC/s3201/e/qB/q/2" id="H177D4A4124F3470FBD252924082063E1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1342">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Establishment.—</heading>
			<content>Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall establish a research, development, and demonstration program for critical material recycling and reuse of energy storage systems containing critical materials.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stC/s3201/e/qB/q/3" id="H30CF86E6138C4823A8B1FEFFBB2467FD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1342">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> Research, development, and demonstration.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In carrying out the program established under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall conduct—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stC/s3201/e/qB/q/3/A" id="HF4C1C778C86E48F6BA2063646BDD8A30" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1342">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<chapeau> research, development, and demonstration activities for—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tIII/stC/s3201/e/qB/q/3/A/i" id="HDA44862E929E41F495FFC4E587838452" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1343">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> technologies, process improvements, and design optimizations that facilitate and promote critical material recycling of energy storage systems, including separation and sorting of component materials of such systems, and extraction, recovery, and reuse of critical materials from such systems;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tIII/stC/s3201/e/qB/q/3/A/ii" id="HEFD5ED54737942ABAA6818D89D3A52CB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1343">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> technologies and methods that mitigate emissions and environmental impacts that arise from critical material recycling, including disposal of toxic reagents and byproducts related to critical material recycling processes;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tIII/stC/s3201/e/qB/q/3/A/iii" id="H66E4227950EE4F91976D9DB2F48B72A0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1343">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<content> technologies to enable extraction, recovery, and reuse of energy storage systems from electric vehicles and critical material recycling from such vehicles; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tIII/stC/s3201/e/qB/q/3/A/iv" id="HE5FB18A54EAC46828563181983186342" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1343">
					<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
					<content> technologies and methods to enable the safe transport, storage, and disposal of energy storage systems containing critical materials, including waste materials and components recovered during the critical material recycling process; and</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stC/s3201/e/qB/q/3/B" id="H73DC1EB1172840A198963B2A15C5256A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1343">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> research on nontechnical barriers to improve the collection and critical material recycling of energy storage systems, including strategies to improve consumer education of, acceptance of, and participation in, the critical material recycling of energy storage systems.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIII/stC/s3201/e/qB/q/4" id="HA8C9DF5DEEF645B3B5A1534B8870CDA8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1343">
			<num value="4">“(4)</num>
			<heading> Report to Congress.—</heading>
			<content>Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this subsection, and every 3 years thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology and the Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate a report summarizing the activities, findings, and progress of the program.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: The United States Energy Storage Competitiveness Act of 2007 (42 U.S.C. 17231)

doc_names: United States Energy Storage Competitiveness Act of 2007

cite.cite_text: Section 961(a) of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16291(a))

execution.ampl:
strike section("962"); insert <__xml__ id="HCB19229137F84698B43F2E518CD5977F" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962" id="H2D081087E8114F8EA082AF571C5D7370" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
		<num value="962">“SEC. 962.</num>
		<heading> Carbon Capture Technology Program.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a" id="HE845414011B04D038011A48D3A28C345" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> Definitions.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In this section:</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/1" id="HD6BB390CA77F4F359A18787DDAF9BB21" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> Large-scale pilot project.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The term ‘<term>large-scale pilot project</term>’ means a pilot project that—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/1/A" id="H1C05A608B87741AC9EE81B24FF2BED55" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> represents the scale of technology development beyond laboratory development and bench scale testing, but not yet advanced to the point of being tested under real operational conditions at commercial scale;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/1/B" id="H14961A2401D9422883CC0CE2F2E96AEB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> represents the scale of technology necessary to gain the operational data needed to understand the technical and performance risks of the technology before the application of that technology at commercial scale or in commercial-scale demonstration; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/1/C" id="H7E6CD33351034026A4B821B7A61755AD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<chapeau> is large enough—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/1/C/i" id="H1FDA5DAC15024163B6CCE438571D53CB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> to validate scaling factors; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/1/C/ii" id="HF805AFC1F5024AEEA7744527CAAD471C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> to demonstrate the interaction between major components so that control philosophies for a new process can be developed and enable the technology to advance from large-scale pilot project application to commercial-scale demonstration or application.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/2" id="H1BAF0170AC46424183DE300496370BE9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Natural gas.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The term ‘<term>natural gas</term>’ means any fuel consisting in whole or in part of—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/2/A" id="HEF8E680587FC47908CC0EAA69FAA3A4C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> natural gas;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/2/B" id="H5D76F30FF5B04DA5A1D504D2EE8B7F84" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> liquid petroleum gas;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/2/C" id="HE88294A9B97C4A74A2FBBF5A26D90ACF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> synthetic gas derived from petroleum or natural gas liquids;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/2/D" id="H605F278B14BF4ECFA8984D98DEEAFAD5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> any mixture of natural gas and synthetic gas; or</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/2/E" id="H0B07AF0F0400427D89C7AC05909F9D48" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<content> biomethane.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/3" id="H31F8FF44640A487FBC5265DEC80E407F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1347">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Natural gas electric generation facility.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/3/A" id="H8C8011F23D524BD1B01CB328A6310CC0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<content>The term ‘<term>natural gas electric generation facility</term>’ means a facility that generates electric energy using natural gas as the fuel.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/3/B" id="H387D15BC02494A799BE209A3E3A281E5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Inclusions.—</heading>
					<chapeau>The term ‘<term>natural gas electric generation facility</term>’ includes without limitation a new or existing—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/3/B/i" id="HD50CAC46C04F4C66ABC3DFEB9EF36227" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> simple cycle plant;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/3/B/ii" id="H9BEED64EBF68496BA67CCD1515999450" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> combined cycle plant;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/3/B/iii" id="H3B21293CE15D453D987D9191593CBEDA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> combined heat and power plant; or</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/3/B/iv" id="H773AFF788C624A2DA2D2428B78ABC002" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> steam methane reformer that produces hydrogen from natural gas for use in the production of electric energy.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/4" id="H979849190D554E3980421ACE21B80F0F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> Program.—</heading>
				<content>The term ‘<term>program</term>’ means the program established under subsection (b)(1).</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/5" id="H84D3EAF37B534667B3E6A12FEF66D8EF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<heading> Transformational technology.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/5/A" id="HFBFE5C17848948F0BAB9A1A81484751E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<content>The term ‘<term>transformational technology</term>’ means a technology that represents a significant change in the methods used to convert energy that will enable a step change in performance, efficiency, cost of electricity, and reduction of emissions as compared to the technology in existence on the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/5/B" id="H479532A17B7A421D88AA6AFAE15AFD04" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Inclusions.—</heading>
					<chapeau>The term ‘<term>transformational technology</term>’ includes a broad range of potential technology improvements, including—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/5/B/i" id="H58CC676542A143AA9C0BCB7C15DAE3F6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<chapeau> thermodynamic improvements in energy conversion and heat transfer, including—</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/5/B/i/I" id="H820D879558814940A2BC023EE31F2063" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> advanced combustion systems, including oxygen combustion systems and chemical looping; and</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/5/B/i/II" id="H299BB6EF26A040779981100920385054" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> the replacement of steam cycles with supercritical carbon dioxide cycles;</content>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/5/B/ii" id="H39834876429042C2AC198DC22137D191" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> improvements in steam or carbon dioxide turbine technology;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/5/B/iii" id="H0E1380AA02CB461BA3F048C37F6E1656" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> improvements in carbon capture, utilization, and storage systems technology;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/5/B/iv" id="H65EAE21B115A4A5FABAAD79E796F16C3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> improvements in small-scale and modular coal-fired technologies with reduced carbon output or carbon capture that can support incremental power generation capacity additions;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/5/B/v" id="HB3946ABDA1E1490AA53534AEA96847FD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
						<num value="v">“(v)</num>
						<content> fuel cell technologies for low-cost, high-efficiency modular power systems;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/5/B/vi" id="HB331C29A3DC148E7947E90B2595C5643" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
						<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
						<content> advanced gasification systems;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/5/B/vii" id="H2A609AC55FCC456C879BBB72603C533F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
						<num value="vii">“(vii)</num>
						<content> thermal cycling technologies; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/a/5/B/viii" id="HA9ABFCA339894E989C4B51AEE14CA983" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
						<num value="viii">“(viii)</num>
						<content> any other technology the Secretary recognizes as transformational technology.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b" id="H2956040A19F7497A9C7F302CD36F2B96" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Carbon Capture Technology Program.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/1" id="HE9983C6F3E664F2289A205A10338B3AA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall establish a carbon capture technology program for the development of transformational technologies that will significantly improve the efficiency, effectiveness, costs, emissions reductions, and environmental performance of coal and natural gas use, including in manufacturing and industrial facilities.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/2" id="H52830E39AAF545718105E0239AB14BE3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Requirements.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The program shall include—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/2/A" id="H8E42826F802E4F6E9E149A6D47570ADB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> a research and development program;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/2/B" id="H7C5E52AD871946E89B13B8891353749C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1348">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> large-scale pilot projects;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/2/C" id="H47F039D51C004D7B87488F4FC55B28B0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> demonstration projects, in accordance with paragraph (4); and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/2/D" id="H461BA1822DE24667BA85D07CD89315F8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> a front-end engineering and design program.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3" id="H91B7EB14425B42ECAB023797C52D9809" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Program goals and objectives.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In consultation with the interested entities described in paragraph (6)(C), the Secretary shall develop goals and objectives for the program to be applied to the transformational technologies developed within the program, taking into consideration the following:</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/A" id="HFC3227E513B34AC68CCB3BE6A14F2264" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<chapeau> Increasing the performance of coal electric generation facilities and natural gas electric generation facilities, including by—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/A/i" id="H2822933D12C34B19AFDAB53886CA1837" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> ensuring reliable, low-cost power from new and existing coal electric generation facilities and natural gas electric generation facilities;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/A/ii" id="H3333A05A46B5401988EDF063FC0A0BC6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> achieving high conversion efficiencies;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/A/iii" id="H3730F5F80C8849719AED83BF0BA6002D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> addressing emissions of carbon dioxide and other air pollutants;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/A/iv" id="H756D3112769C4C3F91147E6CDC0E01C2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> developing small-scale and modular technologies to support incremental capacity additions and load following generation, in addition to large-scale generation technologies;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/A/v" id="H5A7F9F2DAFC6415AA835339A3D0B69A3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
						<num value="v">“(v)</num>
						<content> supporting dispatchable operations for new and existing applications of coal and natural gas generation; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/A/vi" id="H2382175912364621BF737949D925DE22" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
						<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
						<content> accelerating the development of technologies that have transformational energy conversion characteristics.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/B" id="H8E85FF75E9C7439B88FB53CE2CC5C220" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<chapeau> Using carbon capture, utilization, and sequestration technologies to decrease the carbon dioxide emissions, and the environmental impact from carbon dioxide emissions, from new and existing coal electric generation facilities and natural gas electric generation facilities, including by—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/B/i" id="H2BEB814582BC4FFDA6ED76B7A3296CCE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> accelerating the development, deployment, and commercialization of technologies to capture and sequester carbon dioxide emissions from new and existing coal electric generation facilities and natural gas electric generation facilities;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/B/ii" id="H5D42F4DBE21B4297A737A581439EF2D1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> supporting sites for safe geological storage of large volumes of anthropogenic sources of carbon dioxide and the development of the infrastructure needed to support a carbon dioxide utilization and storage industry;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/B/iii" id="H86E2DA7A023D40DAABC6069F34F64DB4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> improving the conversion, utilization, and storage of carbon dioxide produced from fossil fuels and other anthropogenic sources of carbon dioxide;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/B/iv" id="H24D51608EBB846629DCDA5EDA6B405C7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> lowering greenhouse gas emissions for all fossil fuel production, generation, delivery, and use, to the maximum extent practicable;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/B/v" id="H82FB32D4F9B548978A88C1CE0E13A897" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
						<num value="v">“(v)</num>
						<content> developing carbon utilization technologies, products, and methods, including carbon use and reuse for commercial application;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/B/vi" id="H3AA7E6393FC24E5A80DCD4835F482700" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
						<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
						<content> developing net-negative carbon dioxide emissions technologies; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/B/vii" id="HBDA05DCA220447198E656D0C4E1BDDAF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1349">
						<num value="vii">“(vii)</num>
						<content> developing technologies for the capture of carbon dioxide produced during the production of hydrogen from natural gas.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/C" id="HA892A242F951492C8A88DBD6921A547A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<chapeau> Decreasing the non-carbon dioxide relevant environmental impacts of coal and natural gas production, including by—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/C/i" id="HC02A319C63BA49759596F755538F90F2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> further reducing non-carbon dioxide air emissions; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/C/ii" id="HAE3B8B9346D54F62B6AF16ABC592A10E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> reducing the use, and managing the discharge, of water in power plant operations.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/D" id="HC411931B27A74A6690F67D913D7F7E27" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<chapeau> Accelerating the development of technologies to significantly decrease emissions from manufacturing and industrial facilities, including—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/D/i" id="HC0C11F893F9E4A08B8F79FBE24F507F6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> nontraditional fuel manufacturing facilities, including ethanol or other biofuel production plants or hydrogen production plants; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/D/ii" id="H8925C544561241CFAB98F9072B734793" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> energy-intensive manufacturing facilities that produce carbon dioxide as a byproduct of operations.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/E" id="H7C3CA61044E2496D8E559E3F510284C1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<content> Entering into cooperative agreements to carry out and expedite demonstration projects (including pilot projects) to demonstrate the technical and commercial viability of technologies to reduce carbon dioxide emissions released from coal electric generation facilities and natural gas electric generation facilities for commercial deployment.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/3/F" id="HF64B8D2D6EAE46A1BBA6E0792251127D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
					<num value="F">“(F)</num>
					<content> Identifying any barriers to the commercial deployment of any technologies under development for the capture of carbon dioxide produced by coal electric generation facilities and natural gas electric generation facilities.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4" id="H978FC2A54C5346C2B89B590401CA0921" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> Demonstration projects.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/A" id="H3726D908CADE472AB8F79018069E99B8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<content>In carrying out the program, the Secretary shall establish a demonstration program under which the Secretary, through a competitive, merit-reviewed process, shall enter into cooperative agreements by not later than September 30, 2025, for demonstration projects to demonstrate the construction and operation of 6 facilities to capture carbon dioxide from coal electric generation facilities, natural gas electric generation facilities, and industrial facilities.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/B" id="HDE3EE5885624442CB99345B064442916" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Technical assistance.—</heading>
					<content>The Secretary, to the maximum extent practicable, shall provide technical assistance to any eligible entity seeking to enter into a cooperative agreement described in subparagraph (A) for the purpose of obtaining any necessary permits and licenses to demonstrate qualifying technologies.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/C" id="HAB6F32E859FC47CB84706EEEECC69340" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<heading> Eligible entities.—</heading>
					<content>The Secretary may enter into cooperative agreements under subparagraph (A) with industry stakeholders, including any industry stakeholder operating in partnership with the National Laboratories, institutions of higher education, multiinstitutional collaborations, and other appropriate entities.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/D" id="H01A8EBDA684145FF88AD8751F1B9A581" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<heading> Commercial-scale demonstration projects.—</heading>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/D/i" id="H9D2A9B0727C04796B5041D89456F871F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<heading> In general.—</heading>
						<content>In carrying out the program, the Secretary shall establish a carbon capture technology commercialization program to demonstrate substantial improvements in the efficiency, effectiveness, cost, and environmental performance of carbon capture technologies for power, industrial, and other commercial applications.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/D/ii" id="H52320021D8754EFC9837842C811610CF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1350">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<heading> Requirement.—</heading>
						<content>The program established under clause (i) shall include funding for commercial-scale carbon capture technology demonstrations of projects supported by the Department, including projects in addition to the projects described in subparagraph (A), including funding for not more than 2 projects to demonstrate substantial improvements in a particular technology type beyond the first of a kind demonstration and to account for considerations described in subparagraph (G).</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/E" id="HDA39A65492EE4C318FC61F6BA8D70D93" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<heading> Requirement.—</heading>
					<chapeau>Of the demonstration projects carried out under subparagraph (A)—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/E/i" id="HFACCAA9468E145DC8A243C7631FD0310" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> 2 shall be designed to capture carbon dioxide from a natural gas electric generation facility;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/E/ii" id="H91EDA19C42FB476193963BA7F59D568A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> 2 shall be designed to capture carbon dioxide from a coal electric generation facility; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/E/iii" id="H856F01145DE3413093FCC57F4A162016" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> 2 shall be designed to capture carbon dioxide from an industrial facility not purposed for electric generation.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/F" id="HA4E2D572521C45ABAFBC8BF563F722D2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
					<num value="F">“(F)</num>
					<heading> Goals.—</heading>
					<chapeau>Each demonstration project under the demonstration program under subparagraph (A)—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/F/i" id="HC75A2623551E41AF949E443CCB9B49E6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> shall be designed to further the development, deployment, and commercialization of technologies to capture and sequester carbon dioxide emissions from new and existing coal electric generation facilities, natural gas electric generation facilities, and industrial facilities;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/F/ii" id="H0355688215094FB7AF4F456A97CB4C85" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> shall be financed in part by the private sector; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/F/iii" id="HB51F8E9B6762471F8183DFA5C217E264" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> if necessary, shall secure agreements for the offtake of carbon dioxide emissions captured by qualifying technologies during the project.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/G" id="H8015DAF362184B7B8392400B925FAA2E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
					<num value="G">“(G)</num>
					<heading> Applications.—</heading>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/G/i" id="H14DFE02435534AF8814EDAFF0DFA1943" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<heading> In general.—</heading>
						<content>To be eligible to enter into an agreement with the Secretary for a demonstration project under subparagraphs (A) and (D), an entity shall submit to the Secretary an application at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary may require.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/G/ii" id="H7D20CEB28EE5491080AF3F70F99346FF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<heading> Review of applications.—</heading>
						<chapeau>In reviewing applications submitted under clause (i), the Secretary, to the maximum extent practicable, shall—</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/G/ii/I" id="HE17E584A05134A7C921E51A2518D2E79" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> ensure a broad geographic distribution of project sites;</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/G/ii/II" id="H70A340BB28C04F2A9B1785EF08942426" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> ensure that a broad selection of electric generation facilities are represented;</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/G/ii/III" id="H47C7A592D08B43E1B444163F500B34EF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
							<num value="III">“(III)</num>
							<content> ensure that a broad selection of technologies are represented; and</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/G/ii/IV" id="HE256018C3838415A90488D54D1D240B8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
							<num value="IV">“(IV)</num>
							<content> leverage existing public-private partnerships and Federal resources.</content>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/H" id="HCFF0A2734C864D6A909CFD95C0966BF2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
					<num value="H">“(H)</num>
					<heading> GAO study and report.—</heading>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/H/i" id="H079550A48CB04BC8BF401D7B4D99B74D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<heading> Study and report.—</heading>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/H/i/I" id="HDE48B994B9B240D5927E7D6C2BF853DD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1351">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<heading> In general.—</heading>
							<content>Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>, the Comptroller General of the United States shall conduct, and submit to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate and the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives a report on the results of, a study of the successes, failures, practices, and improvements of the Department in carrying out demonstration projects under this paragraph.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/H/i/II" id="H947B5DC9EBF542E6A68115C3D967DB15" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<heading> Considerations.—</heading>
							<chapeau>In conducting the study under subclause (I), the Comptroller General of the United States shall consider—</chapeau>
							<item identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/H/i/II/aa" id="H873139958D14475E9B8EB485D8A2B38E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
								<num value="aa">“(aa)</num>
								<content> applicant and contractor qualifications;</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/H/i/II/bb" id="H4528720785F3457F89E23698F32F48D7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
								<num value="bb">“(bb)</num>
								<content> project management practices at the Department;</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/H/i/II/cc" id="H9213D73CB5BB4CAAA727EEA1DEF2A5DB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
								<num value="cc">“(cc)</num>
								<content> economic or market changes and other factors impacting project viability;</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/H/i/II/dd" id="H12A5BBDC573D461B95D25EA656D35FF2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
								<num value="dd">“(dd)</num>
								<content> completion of third-party agreements, including power purchase agreements and carbon dioxide offtake agreements;</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/H/i/II/ee" id="H2DB6C4E82DBC4D488EBE5BCF399E456D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
								<num value="ee">“(ee)</num>
								<content> regulatory challenges; and</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/H/i/II/ff" id="H7D2B4D5A9CAA4EB6996619FE9478BF4D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
								<num value="ff">“(ff)</num>
								<content> construction challenges.</content>
							</item>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/H/ii" id="H94197ED2935141DFA5C2DFD7AB1EF175" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<heading> Recommendations.—</heading>
						<chapeau>The Secretary shall—</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/H/ii/I" id="H6616D0E0B988410D81FC205292F54E57" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> consider any relevant recommendations, as determined by the Secretary, provided in the report required under clause (i)(I); and</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/H/ii/II" id="H05444B2C665241BE9FB0D8F563A6BEAD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> adopt such recommendations as the Secretary considers appropriate.</content>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/I" id="HE1391DCBD1794E2F8117801EC8014A35" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<heading> Report.—</heading>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/I/i" id="H61773CFB3954465B8AE1F476F3DB4764" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<heading> In general.—</heading>
						<chapeau>Not later than 180 days after the date on which the Secretary solicits applications under subparagraph (G), and annually thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate committees of jurisdiction of the Senate and the House of Representatives a report that includes a detailed description of how the applications under the demonstration program established under subparagraph (A) were or will be solicited and how the applications were or will be evaluated, including—</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/I/i/I" id="H9D9AE47E52434745AE2DFE84EF9FAC32" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> a list of any activities carried out by the Secretary to solicit or evaluate the applications; and</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/I/i/II" id="H09B873B2E11342F5B34C89B7CB388E44" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> a process for ensuring that any projects carried out under a cooperative agreement entered into under subparagraph (A) are designed to result in the development or demonstration of qualifying technologies.</content>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/I/ii" id="H0D9C578DF5F3429EB9486002826F6C07" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<heading> Inclusions.—</heading>
						<chapeau>The Secretary shall include—</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/I/ii/I" id="HD88885ADB9EC407D9F5C7008766D75E4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> in the first report required under clause (i), a detailed list of technical milestones for the development and demonstration of each qualifying technology pursued under the demonstration program established under subparagraph (A);</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/I/ii/II" id="HB973D53C988E49F691FD9538074C274B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> in each subsequent report required under clause (i), a description of the progress made towards achieving the technical milestones described in subclause (I) during the applicable period covered by the report; and</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/I/ii/III" id="HCF6921ACA351409296DAFE02C8A9D639" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
							<num value="III">“(III)</num>
							<chapeau> in each report required under clause (i)—</chapeau>
							<item identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/I/ii/III/aa" id="HF560CA6ED22D4DBEBF79B2B2D2762179" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1352">
								<num value="aa">“(aa)</num>
								<content> an estimate of the cost of licensing, permitting, constructing, and operating each carbon capture facility expected to be constructed under the demonstration program established under subparagraph (A);</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/I/ii/III/bb" id="HA4E480B541544ABC8032920610D2C109" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
								<num value="bb">“(bb)</num>
								<content> a schedule for the planned construction and operation of each demonstration or pilot project under the demonstration program; and</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/4/I/ii/III/cc" id="HE99B727BFE2B4CD6A2467267C011F914" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
								<num value="cc">“(cc)</num>
								<content> an estimate of any financial assistance, compensation, or incentives proposed to be paid by the host State, Indian Tribe, or local government with respect to each facility described in item (aa).</content>
							</item>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/5" id="HB57B5D988F924D1F9149C36FFFF4E9A1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<heading> Intraagency coordination for carbon capture, utilization, and sequestration activities.—</heading>
				<content>The carbon capture, utilization, and sequestration activities described in paragraph (3)(B) shall be carried out by the Assistant Secretary for Fossil Energy, in coordination with the heads of other relevant offices of the Department and the National Laboratories.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/6" id="H4DA3CCACF46F4F178A76CFC91CC95BD4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
				<num value="6">“(6)</num>
				<heading> Consultations required.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In carrying out the program, the Secretary shall—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/6/A" id="HE27E635DB6144D18BCC7C357FBA05A23" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> undertake international collaborations, taking into consideration the recommendations of the National Coal Council and the National Petroleum Council;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/6/B" id="HD6B147CA3A94459F909997C859AC2911" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> use existing authorities to encourage international cooperation; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/6/C" id="HA0838A283E62438FB2E91934FAC3800C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<chapeau> consult with interested entities, including—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/6/C/i" id="HC800C16574074401B2248D400315732D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> coal and natural gas producers;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/6/C/ii" id="H57F9E77B90AB41E7BAA51F51DED30F9F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> industries that use coal and natural gas;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/6/C/iii" id="H4455F1F24A984529BE3EC8E32227C784" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> organizations that promote coal, advanced coal, and natural gas technologies;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/6/C/iv" id="H9B721E084E384DB2AB05C6C89DAB4AF2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> environmental organizations;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/6/C/v" id="H3541AC6047184E908C3C86E4CB4756D2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
						<num value="v">“(v)</num>
						<content> organizations representing workers; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/b/6/C/vi" id="H6A6B82B085CF4ADFB36C87819F871B52" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
						<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
						<content> organizations representing consumers.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/c" id="HE1AED553635B4910BC9CD3A90B8D93E0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
			<num value="c">“(c)</num>
			<heading> Report.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/c/1" id="HD2FC64A7D32C4E3698FA84C99FC9D1C4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>, the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report describing the program goals and objectives adopted under subsection (b)(3).</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/c/2" id="H0F27B00B734E48B88F91298950EA9854" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Update.—</heading>
				<content>Not less frequently than once every 2 years after the initial report is submitted under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report describing the progress made towards achieving the program goals and objectives adopted under subsection (b)(3).</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/d" id="H7F345D8BC70B446BBFA29CF85F33B203" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
			<num value="d">“(d)</num>
			<heading> Funding.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/d/1" id="H7B68AF6423FA4753B0B36C61E05E4A84" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> Authorization of appropriations.—</heading>
				<chapeau>There are authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out this section, to remain available until expended—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/d/1/A" id="H12EF218FE1DF4DB6A1C21A4EBAF906E3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<chapeau> for activities under the research and development program component described in subsection (b)(2)(A)—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/d/1/A/i" id="HE98CE9CC1B804D9BBD9C040BD53BDD58" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> $230,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 and 2022; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/d/1/A/ii" id="HC8C18CFB0F154C65AECDEFBF05F59C8A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> $150,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2023 through 2025;</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/d/1/B" id="H65FF3F0329264C39B5F5263F93B93EB6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1353">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<chapeau> subject to paragraph (2), for activities under the large-scale pilot projects program component described in subsection (b)(2)(B)—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/d/1/B/i" id="HA60AB8BD599A49B5B0743932645AD1DE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> $225,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 and 2022;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/d/1/B/ii" id="H60D538677A5044398C01AD62366A350F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> $200,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2023 and 2024; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/d/1/B/iii" id="HB6451D96B1D24564AC1C7238791D6194" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> $150,000,000 for fiscal year 2025;</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/d/1/C" id="H53E900BF20394516B05DF40A50B8D55A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<chapeau> for activities under the demonstration projects program component described in subsection (b)(2)(C)—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/d/1/C/i" id="H867B5202C8F348928E8C710FC246AF46" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> $500,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 though 2024; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/d/1/C/ii" id="HA6A92159E1924D57BF19B8CAD5AB3371" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> $600,000,000 for fiscal year 2025; and</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/d/1/D" id="HB2F9480E2CC346EC82D49CE5BD2184FB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> for activities under the front-end engineering and design program described in subsection (b)(2)(D), $50,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2024.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/d/2" id="HA8D64023A4A64117A6DA7AA7B2A10AEA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Cost sharing for large-scale pilot projects.—</heading>
				<content>Activities under subsection (b)(2)(B) shall be subject to the cost-sharing requirements of section 988(b).</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e" id="H3548DED2FA96404BB1669E859B3D8138" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
			<num value="e">“(e)</num>
			<heading> Carbon capture test centers.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/1" id="HF22DF6EA20F242A9AA89798ECDE82EC8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>, the Secretary shall award grants to 1 or more entities for the operation of 1 or more test centers (referred to in this subsection as a ‘<quotedText>Center</quotedText>’) to provide distinct testing capabilities for innovative carbon capture technologies.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/2" id="H2448CADA7D754B498BB991545C8BDE52" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Purpose.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Each Center shall—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/2/A" id="H4972946C4A8E4CBB81AC17CB47C405FC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> advance research, development, demonstration, and commercial application of carbon capture technologies;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/2/B" id="HF155B903774D462DB90A1E7B891B112A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> support large-scale pilot projects and demonstration projects and test carbon capture technologies; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/2/C" id="H21D1BEB1B53D47EF8EAAB12F6137C836" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> develop front-end engineering design and economic analysis.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/3" id="H873CD67093664B18BA65CEE3D871C3E3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Selection.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/3/A" id="H2D2320B56B354DE1811CF722378A5473" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<content>The Secretary shall select entities to receive grants under this subsection according to such criteria as the Secretary may develop.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/3/B" id="H03FDC474C01247C1AB2C4552BB64C1AC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Competitive basis.—</heading>
					<content>The Secretary shall select entities to receive grants under this subsection on a competitive basis.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/3/C" id="HB89EE3BB0FEB4818BA4FA148879A3DFD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<heading> Priority criteria.—</heading>
					<chapeau>In selecting entities to receive grants under this subsection, the Secretary shall prioritize consideration of applicants that—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/3/C/i" id="HF19852045E9E48E19172691966C68D0A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> have access to existing or planned research facilities for carbon capture technologies;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/3/C/ii" id="HCEAA3D7727E94160BF9621B17A6DA3CB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> are institutions of higher education with established expertise in engineering for carbon capture technologies, or partnerships with such institutions of higher education; or</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/3/C/iii" id="H4794B6EADD4946638E9D223A3CB5B023" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> have access to existing research and test facilities for bulk materials design and testing, component design and testing, or professional engineering design.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/3/D" id="HC0403FED97A5483AAC6F82AF44418910" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<heading> Existing centers.—</heading>
					<content>In selecting entities to receive grants under this subsection, the Secretary shall prioritize carbon capture test centers in existence on the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/4" id="HD96F99A0ADE941E7B43180A06381DDD3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> Formula for awarding grants.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary may develop a formula for awarding grants under this subsection.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/5" id="H80DED425D28F4CA9924E3DB2175E2421" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1354">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<heading> Schedule.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/5/A" id="H91DE5395C82E46EFB86F229BCACE3A03" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1355">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<content>Each grant awarded under this subsection shall be for a term of not more than 5 years, subject to the availability of appropriations.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/5/B" id="H7A428F8F747147D285573B15BB2E53A9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1355">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Renewal.—</heading>
					<content>The Secretary may renew a grant for 1 or more additional 5-year terms, subject to a competitive merit review and the availability of appropriations.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/6" id="H2142CA0F880A438A8369E2BBEEE67C69" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1355">
				<num value="6">“(6)</num>
				<heading> Termination.—</heading>
				<content>To the extent otherwise authorized by law, the Secretary may eliminate, and terminate grant funding under this subsection for, a Center during any 5-year term described in paragraph (5) if the Secretary determines that the Center is underperforming.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIV/s4002/a/qB/s962/e/7" id="H3F0A4BB9EE1341999603C82BAB347981" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1355">
				<num value="7">“(7)</num>
				<heading> Authorization of appropriations.—</heading>
				<content>There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this subsection $25,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2025.”</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H46CD7FAD1DD54F8BBBAAC67DEB0872B7" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/e" id="H1CA83378598E425C9C8CC2C98A2BFC1D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1416">
		<num value="e">“(e)</num>
		<heading> Technology commercialization fund.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/e/1" id="H99F43CF7DFCD4617845345FF03B21C15" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1416">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> Establishment.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary, acting through the Chief Commercialization Officer established in section 1001(a) of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/16391">42 U.S.C. 16391(a)</ref>), shall establish a Technology Commercialization Fund (hereafter referred to as the ‘<quotedText>Fund</quotedText>’), using nine-tenths of one percent of the amount of appropriations made available to the Department for applied energy research, development, demonstration, and commercial application for each fiscal year, to be used to provide, in accordance with the cost-sharing requirements under section 988, funds to private partners, including national laboratories, to promote promising energy technologies for commercial purposes.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/e/2" id="H2DFABC5E13CB4C5DAFDD715553AB49CB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1416">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Applications.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/e/2/A" id="H605A4F72A5904803AF5E8DCEC6707DEE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> Considerations.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall develop criteria for evaluating applications for funding under this section, which may include—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/e/2/A/i" id="H02B35606C0AB41C68379D0818D43E5AD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> the potential that a proposed technology will result in a commercially successful product within a reasonable timeframe; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/e/2/A/ii" id="H91C9EB12CFE3431696726A27302343D1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> the relative maturity of a proposed technology for commercial application.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/e/2/B" id="H4E527CD1BA534E4097B8E1369ED86488" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Selections.—</heading>
				<content>In awarding funds under this section, the Secretary may give special consideration to applications that involve at least one applicant that has participated in an entrepreneurial or commercialization training program, such as Energy Innovation Corps.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
	<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/f" id="HFFCDCABB3BC9460D9C4150A5A9C3CB48" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
		<num value="f">“(f)</num>
		<heading> Annual report.—</heading>
		<chapeau>The Secretary shall include in the annual report required under section 9007(a) of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/f/1" id="H7CDDDDDD16C946A9BC5431BA2B2A30BF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> description of the projects carried out with awards from the Fund for that fiscal year;</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/f/2" id="H0602DAFD5FE24141A2E74DD28CBF3770" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> each project’s cost-share for that fiscal year; and</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/f/3" id="HE71A926475724D43A9BE83AF9B86826D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<content> each project’s partners for that fiscal year.</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
	<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/g" id="HB1E87B6C252C4C8FBCB4940511907CEC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
		<num value="g">“(g)</num>
		<heading> Technology commercialization fund report.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/g/1" id="HD2F2DED1E5E7498B9C5A76858A3FBC1E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology and Committee on Appropriations of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources and Committee on Appropriations of the Senate a report on the current and recommended implementation of the Fund.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/g/2" id="HE27BBFA057344E20A5956998C01C507E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Contents.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The report under subparagraph (A) shall include—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/g/2/A" id="HAB5386D17D384D16AFB4184172B41AC1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> a summary, with supporting data, of how much Department program offices contribute to and use the Fund each year, including a list of current funding restrictions;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/g/2/B" id="H0C4CF290FF044E0CAED729D63D9D6805" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> recommendations on how to improve implementation and administration of the Fund; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9003/qB/g/2/C" id="HB4FD8F11A8C547DBBFDD664A16263D11" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<content> an analysis on how to spend funds optimally on technology areas that have the greatest need and opportunity for commercial application, rather than spending funds at the programmatic level or under current funding restrictions.”</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 1001(e) of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16391(e))

execution.ampl:
insert after(subsection( "(d)")) <__xml__ id="H85973F05DC374CE4B4FC5BFF8900DECA" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9004/qB/e" id="H1D205C46F1604141A7CD9B92697676A5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
		<num value="e">“(e)</num>
		<heading> Coordination.—</heading>
		<chapeau>In carrying out subsection (a), and for any prize competitions under section 105 of the America Creating Opportunities to Meaningfully Promote Excellence in Technology, Education, and Science Reauthorization Act of 2010, the Secretary shall—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9004/qB/e/1" id="H4CBA01597D1C4AE2A991EA96AAE4C87A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> issue Department-wide guidance on the design, development, and implementation of prize competitions;</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9004/qB/e/2" id="H8117FDBD4B014E1AAD591E8A7147386A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> collect and disseminate best practices on the design and administration of prize competitions;</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9004/qB/e/3" id="HCF9AE5FEF88E4C6BA4FA14C1B372A20D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1417">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<content> streamline contracting mechanisms for the implementation of prize competitions; and</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9004/qB/e/4" id="HB099C2DBA1214F56A85F5BDADB41CC9E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1418">
			<num value="4">“(4)</num>
			<content> provide training and prize competition design support, as necessary, to Department staff to develop prize competitions and challenges.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;
