insert end <__xml__ id="H2963E2621E144C2E876CEFED02535041" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9010/c/qB/c" id="H385EC656AD724C1280C199618A194558" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
		<num value="c">“(c)</num>
		<heading> Administrative and other expenses.—</heading>
		<chapeau>There are authorized to be appropriated—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9010/c/qB/c/1" id="HEEBA5C7484CA4FBEBA5AD81BA3684ED7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> $32,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2025 to carry out this title; and </content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9010/c/qB/c/2" id="H56F57638AD294E6898A3FDC3DB29A611" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> for fiscal year 2021, in addition to amounts authorized under paragraph (1), $25,000,000, to remain available until expended, for administrative expenses described in section 1702(h)(1) that are not covered by fees collected pursuant to section 1702(h).”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 1704 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16514)

execution.ampl:
strike paragraph( "(3)"); insert <__xml__ id="H5B6AC62500934DEA8A5C38B1415C06CB" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3" id="HF97A319D18DF4B1DA5FCFFFAB88171BC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
		<num value="3">“(3)</num>
		<heading> Established Program to Stimulate Competitive Research.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A" id="HE075562B1F7E4F0B823F547844131FD9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> Definitions.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In this paragraph:</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/i" id="H115DF2666224427FBC222DBA84D0D7E3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> Eligible entity.—</heading>
				<content>The term ‘<term>eligible entity</term>’ means an institution of higher education located in an eligible jurisdiction.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/ii" id="H1073773719784B368D0ED5F0F95F350F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Eligible jurisdiction.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The term ‘<term>eligible jurisdiction</term>’ means a State that, as determined by the Secretary—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/ii/I" id="HFA6CFCE310424372AC6F33387ACEC673" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<item identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/ii/I/aa" id="H6FCFD8934EDF4B85B058FD4E18728EF3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
						<num value="aa">(aa)</num>
						<content> historically has received relatively little Federal research and development funding; and</content>
					</item>
					<item identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/ii/I/bb" id="H9EE260320AAA4AA0BE77C8743B76B898" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
						<num value="bb">“(bb)</num>
						<chapeau> has demonstrated a commitment—</chapeau>
						<subitem identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/ii/I/bb/AA" id="H71EFC8392F7148489877F24441E8689B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
							<num value="AA">“(AA)</num>
							<content> to develop the research bases in the State; and</content>
						</subitem>
						<subitem identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/ii/I/bb/BB" id="H1C6A2DDFD5584C1C8A7E3DFA406B0B83" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
							<num value="BB">“(BB)</num>
							<content> to improve science and engineering research and education programs at institutions of higher education in the State; and</content>
						</subitem>
					</item>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/ii/II" id="H73D76731FD294F08A69B8B848869A8D7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> is an eligible jurisdiction under the criteria used by the Secretary to make awards under this paragraph on the day before the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>. </content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/iii" id="H38AFBA002A33469D91C4274DAACD7C15" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> EPSCoR.—</heading>
				<content>The term ‘<term>EPSCoR</term>’ means the Established Program to Stimulate Competitive Research operated under subparagraph (B).</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/iv" id="H4AC71BC6E0D74E5096CF8DFEAB20E411" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
				<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
				<heading> National Laboratory.—</heading>
				<content>The term ‘<term>National Laboratory</term>’ has the meaning given the term in section 2 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/15801">42 U.S.C. 15801</ref>).</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/v" id="HE80E24FB94A94E4892B51E98B823FF5E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
				<num value="v">“(v)</num>
				<heading> State.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The term ‘<term>State</term>’ means—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/v/I" id="HE2B5FD80925B473D81D1B36CB85F9685" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> a State;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/v/II" id="HD870D16696DC4EAE9C85ED2878CDC674" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> the District of Columbia;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/v/III" id="H8D7B18208C2C46379E9D13DCCA8F0A03" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/v/IV" id="H36728D8A072740BDAF1BFDEA7875C39A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
					<num value="IV">“(IV)</num>
					<content> Guam; </content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/v/V" id="HBD8201901A8E4CFB83F7F55C67C7AE72" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
					<num value="V">“(V)</num>
					<content> the United States Virgin Islands; </content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/v/VI" id="HE76CAEC3039B440A89DCF5EB6AD6B6EC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
					<num value="VI">“(VI)</num>
					<content> American Samoa; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/A/v/VII" id="HF9960AB1240E47CD86D38A736BCB6915" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1425">
					<num value="VII">“(VII)</num>
					<content> the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/B" id="H42F79B863CEA478091807D7337F33EC7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Program operation.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary shall operate an Established Program to Stimulate Competitive Research.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/C" id="HB1ACF254DE304F88B921D3A2D6756D67" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<heading> Objectives.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The objectives of EPSCoR shall be—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/C/i" id="H18161E8A9ECD48198D4CE6C61D1773DE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> to increase the number of researchers at institutions of higher education in eligible jurisdictions capable of performing nationally competitive science and engineering research in support of the mission of the Department of Energy in the areas of applied energy research, environmental management, and basic science;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/C/ii" id="H351C156D1FFC4F9E8DD9774DFC468BE3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> to enhance the capabilities of institutions of higher education in eligible jurisdictions to develop, plan, and execute research that is competitive in the peer-review process; and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/C/iii" id="H10165EBC4C1A40A2985034996DE75062" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<content> to increase the probability of long-term growth of competitive funding to institutions of higher education in eligible jurisdictions.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/D" id="H7E20D4DFB46C415589439B78E4289803" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
			<num value="D">“(D)</num>
			<heading> Grants in areas of applied energy research, environmental management, and basic science.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/D/i" id="H6D43CAD8A2D0401E9EC367D1AAF9324E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>EPSCoR shall make grants to eligible entities to carry out and support applied energy research and research in all areas of environmental management and basic science sponsored by the Department of Energy, including—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/D/i/I" id="H4CC82BA883794B1E8781E849FB8100A7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> energy efficiency, fossil energy, renewable energy, and other applied energy research;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/D/i/II" id="HDF744BAABFBF4C2C84C73630F76B0F16" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> electricity delivery research;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/D/i/III" id="HB457E4490B664E86ADE80831F8133275" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> cybersecurity, energy security, and emergency response;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/D/i/IV" id="H68ACEABB16C64C2682FC0C5C3A20D045" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
					<num value="IV">“(IV)</num>
					<content> environmental management; and </content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/D/i/V" id="HB7456E88CFD3427FB5BC351E7FB552DF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
					<num value="V">“(V)</num>
					<content> basic science research.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/D/ii" id="HEAFBBFD60F8A411BA5B7AE0263A43A8F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Activities.—</heading>
				<chapeau>EPSCOR may make grants under this subparagraph for any activities consistent with the objectives described in subparagraph (C) in the areas of applied energy research, environmental management, and basic science described in clause (i), including—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/D/ii/I" id="H82DBDFEB918948C9A6D7CD7C493BB0AA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> to support research at eligible entities that is carried out in partnership with the National Laboratories;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/D/ii/II" id="H717CCB649ED24CB9BADDC034F3A2884C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> to provide for graduate traineeships; </content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/D/ii/III" id="H56FFE2E1559A48C68791A7B554E3B4EF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> to support research by early career faculty; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/D/ii/IV" id="H647EABD88DBA4A41883FF8A5C78AA096" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
					<num value="IV">“(IV)</num>
					<content> to improve research capabilities at eligible entities through biennial implementation grants.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/D/iii" id="H32CE5DEAEF074773BE2B5BB2847E5C81" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> No cost sharing.—</heading>
				<content>EPSCoR shall not impose any cost-sharing requirement with respect to a grant made under this subparagraph. </content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/E" id="H4B836B0381E7478FA41CEF5921316D7A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
			<num value="E">“(E)</num>
			<heading> Other activities.—</heading>
			<content>EPSCoR may carry out such activities as may be necessary to meet the objectives described in subparagraph (C) in the areas of applied energy research, environmental management, and basic science described in subparagraph (D)(i).</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/F" id="H2524A3F753704F68871917360B9F626D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1426">
			<num value="F">“(F)</num>
			<heading> Program implementation.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/F/i" id="H880F8349FEB7414DA87B2589E107D428" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1427">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>Not later than 270 days after the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>, the Secretary shall submit to the Committees on Energy and Natural Resources and Appropriations of the Senate and the Committees on Energy and Commerce and Appropriations of the House of Representatives a plan describing how the Secretary shall implement EPSCoR.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/F/ii" id="H4FE9876BB4D048A8AD2BE4BAAFC9F6D8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1427">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Contents of plan.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The plan described in clause (i) shall include a description of—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/F/ii/I" id="H1ADDC4B95C354130BB79F85EF87614CB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1427">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> the management structure of EPSCoR, which shall ensure that all research areas and activities described in this paragraph are incorporated into EPSCoR;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/F/ii/II" id="H9BA371BA777C4A8DA723C0AFB96A7F0B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1427">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> efforts to conduct outreach to inform eligible entities and faculty of changes to, and opportunities under, EPSCoR;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/F/ii/III" id="H1F5078FFBC2647D78536D145EF3B2967" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1427">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> how EPSCoR plans to increase engagement with eligible entities, faculty, and State committees, including by holding regular workshops, to increase participation in EPSCoR; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/F/ii/IV" id="HA6700A4754334C6DB2325558F8127257" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1427">
					<num value="IV">“(IV)</num>
					<content> any other issues relating to EPSCoR that the Secretary determines appropriate.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/G" id="HA1CA6C10AE134785AF1F871EB7597260" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1427">
			<num value="G">“(G)</num>
			<heading> Program evaluation.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/G/i" id="HDD22C0CF75894DAC952932653BD1B744" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1427">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Not later than 5 years after the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>, the Secretary shall contract with a federally funded research and development center, the National Academy of Sciences, or a similar organization to carry out an assessment of the effectiveness of EPSCoR, including an assessment of—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/G/i/I" id="HEFE07A4E2E0A4F66AEBA363658499A42" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1427">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> the tangible progress made towards achieving the objectives described in subparagraph (C);</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/G/i/II" id="H56D6F92417A54AA1816ADCE7DDB7AAF3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1427">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> the impact of research supported by EPSCoR on the mission of the Department of Energy; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/G/i/III" id="HFFD086A15E914F66AC63E43F0B04BE2A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1427">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> any other issues relating to EPSCoR that the Secretary determines appropriate.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/G/ii" id="H0FF528087FB04BC9990035E0DB776BC7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1427">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Limitation.—</heading>
				<content>The organization with which the Secretary contracts under clause (i) shall not be a National Laboratory.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dZ/tIX/s9011/qB/3/G/iii" id="HC2EE6E4994DE42EEB9806776ED21BB6B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1427">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> Report.—</heading>
				<content>Not later than 6 years after the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Energy Act of 2020</shortTitle>, the Secretary shall submit to the Committees on Energy and Natural Resources and Appropriations of the Senate and the Committees on Energy and Commerce and Appropriations of the House of Representatives a report describing the results of the assessment carried out under clause (i), including recommendations for improvements that would enable the Secretary to achieve the objectives described in subparagraph (C).”</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

insert end <__xml__ id="H8078C7E9BE2A47F6B83A945A1F7AC446" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k" id="HBA606CDBF1E44E1297FC07E460296401" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1431">
		<num value="k">“(k)</num>
		<heading> Addressing insufficient compensation of employees and other personnel of the Commission.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/1" id="H941779633CF44E0EA46F967E63DDBFAA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1431">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>Notwithstanding any other provision of law, if the Chairman of the Commission publicly certifies that compensation for a category of employees or other personnel of the Commission is insufficient to retain or attract employees and other personnel to allow the Commission to carry out the functions of the Commission in a timely, efficient, and effective manner, the Chairman may fix the compensation for the category of employees or other personnel without regard to chapter 51 and subchapter III of <ref href="/us/usc-chapter/5/53">chapter 53</ref> of title 5, United States Code, or any other civil service law.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/2" id="H7EC5358425CC4CE1B754BF1ACEC84B23" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1432">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Certification requirements.—</heading>
			<chapeau>A certification issued under paragraph (1) shall—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/2/A" id="HDC55234969C44AE2860EE557651E44A0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1432">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> apply with respect to a category of employees or other personnel responsible for conducting work of a scientific, technological, engineering, or mathematical nature;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/2/B" id="H81097B106946490595A890E1C2F55D9E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1432">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> specify a maximum amount of reasonable compensation for the category of employees or other personnel;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/2/C" id="H5F86D3FE903C48C8A582557F0FFDC0D9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1432">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<content> be valid for a 5-year period beginning on the date on which the certification is issued;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/2/D" id="HC6A3B3C0F46B4CC3A93B9B1D611A91D7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1432">
				<num value="D">“(D)</num>
				<content> be no broader than necessary to achieve the objective of retaining or attracting employees and other personnel to allow the Commission to carry out the functions of the Commission in a timely, efficient, and effective manner; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/2/E" id="H8D23D7EE74FE4866AD2513E4959F0ECD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1432">
				<num value="E">“(E)</num>
				<content> include an explanation for why the other approaches available to the Chairman for retaining and attracting employees and other personnel are inadequate.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/3" id="HC6B4537241A741E98BE11D2AB65FF357" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1432">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> Renewal.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/3/A" id="H0499A218F3CC4578ACCFEA94D0A921B1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1432">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>Not later than 90 days before the date of expiration of a certification issued under paragraph (1), the Chairman shall determine whether the certification should be renewed for a subsequent 5-year period. <i />
				</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/3/B" id="H161CF8AD483D44E1863C5EF4EDB2BD5E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1432">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Requirement.—</heading>
				<content>If the Chairman determines that a certification should be renewed under subparagraph (A), the Chairman may renew the certification, subject to the certification requirements under paragraph (2) that were applicable to the initial certification.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/4" id="H7F595C1A0F024145B3572F1B5B5F5D9B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1432">
			<num value="4">“(4)</num>
			<heading> New hires.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/4/A" id="H09F1636B1A9E463F94A78346766A18B3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1432">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>An employee or other personnel that is a member of a category of employees or other personnel that would have been covered by a certification issued under paragraph (1), but was hired during a period in which the certification has expired and has not been renewed under paragraph (3) shall not be eligible for compensation at the level that would have applied to the employee or other personnel if the certification had been in effect on the date on which the employee or other personnel was hired.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/4/B" id="HC4BC7337497E4FCF82C5575EF58D051B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1432">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Compensation of new hires on renewal.—</heading>
				<content>On renewal of a certification under paragraph (3), the Chairman may fix the compensation of the employees or other personnel described in subparagraph (A) at the level established for the category of employees or other personnel in the certification.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/5" id="HE686588CCCBD4C448D6365C35261D63B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1432">
			<num value="5">“(5)</num>
			<heading> Retention of level of fixed compensation.—</heading>
			<content>A category of employees or other personnel, the compensation of which was fixed by the Chairman in accordance with paragraph (1), may, at the discretion of the Chairman, have the level of fixed compensation for the category of employees or other personnel retained, regardless of whether a certification described under that paragraph is in effect with respect to the compensation of the category of employees or other personnel.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/6" id="H17846146F47B4C54917CCB42C3915E8F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1432">
			<num value="6">“(6)</num>
			<heading> Consultation required.—</heading>
			<content>The Chairman shall consult with the Director of the Office of Personnel Management in implementing this subsection, including in the determination of the amount of compensation with respect to each category of employees or other personnel.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/7" id="H1753CC8A12AA4A9889ABE323E905C807" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1433">
			<num value="7">“(7)</num>
			<heading> Experts and consultants.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/7/A" id="H12CF3C6B615C40ACAE649FFD5AFC6C20" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1433">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Subject to subparagraph (B), the Chairman may—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/7/A/i" id="H87DD24DF39134898BA6F17A82AA9949F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1433">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> obtain the services of experts and consultants in accordance with section 3109 of title 5, United States Code;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/7/A/ii" id="HDF446B0C5B24457CB8E78CBCDC37C320" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1433">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> compensate those experts and consultants for each day (including travel time) at rates not in excess of the rate of pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule under <ref href="/us/usc/26/5315">section 5315</ref> of that title; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/7/A/iii" id="H7EF8DB62F65B4DAC89A781584494E543" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1433">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<content> pay to the experts and consultants serving away from the homes or regular places of business of the experts and consultants travel expenses and per diem in lieu of subsistence at rates authorized by <ref href="/us/usc/26/5702">sections 5702</ref> and <ref href="/us/usc/26/5703">5703</ref> of that title for persons in Government service employed intermittently.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/7/B" id="H01B202112CCA45B78DBB43374F5F9FE1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1433">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Limitations.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Chairman shall—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/7/B/i" id="H07C74037C09F416F994503443CD1384F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1433">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> to the maximum extent practicable, limit the use of experts and consultants pursuant to subparagraph (A); and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dZ/tXI/s11004/a/qB/k/7/B/ii" id="H8FFBC5C7D6E14070894AFB1EDCC6E5B3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1433">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> ensure that the employment contract of each expert and consultant employed pursuant to subparagraph (A) is subject to renewal not less frequently than annually.”</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 401 of the Department of Energy Organization Act (42 U.S.C. 7171)

rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H393F495040674F99B2338B306BA53BC4" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003" id="H0BF6B3F40B734D82B83D80D4EA6649D8" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
		<num value="14003">“Sec. 14003.</num>
		<chapeau> Any discretionary appropriation for the Corps of Engineers—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/1" id="H79DDC99037534A058416F59262589C94" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<chapeau> derived from the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund, in this fiscal year and thereafter, not to exceed the sum of—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/1/A" id="HECED263942724CCBBDE574B442402CE7" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> the total amount deposited in the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund in the fiscal year that is two years prior to the fiscal year for which the appropriation is being made; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/1/B" id="H009A61B931164358A40575F3F77B841A" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<clause identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/1/B/i" id="H657F4DAD207947DEB33B07F5A144C1A5" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
					<num value="i">(i)</num>
					<content> $500,000,000 for fiscal year 2021;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/1/B/ii" id="H50C73AB5BCC847DBBF1B3AA2717B651E" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> $600,000,000 for fiscal year 2022;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/1/B/iii" id="H1D79E73688514C86B065B2EF99419064" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<content> $700,000,000 for fiscal year 2023;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/1/B/iv" id="H0099767AB7A64127A0AB4C215D4CA6F5" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
					<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
					<content> $800,000,000 for fiscal year 2024;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/1/B/v" id="H71444964DEB547368CDCAEF51A2BD821" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
					<num value="v">“(v)</num>
					<content> $900,000,000 for fiscal year 2025;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/1/B/vi" id="HD458DEB1C605432BAF364042B5117440" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
					<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
					<content> $1,000,000,000 for fiscal year 2026;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/1/B/vii" id="H07EE87F026B7442CB633046992500DF9" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
					<num value="vii">“(vii)</num>
					<content> $1,200,000,000 for fiscal year 2027;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/1/B/viii" id="HFC90278E4AA84286B3575B6C5A037063" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
					<num value="viii">“(viii)</num>
					<content> $1,300,000,000 for fiscal year 2028;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/1/B/ix" id="HACDEDE9AA17F4830AD381E71CC29FC6F" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
					<num value="ix">“(ix)</num>
					<content> $1,400,000,000 for fiscal year 2029; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/1/B/x" id="H3225A3C1AE6C485EB53C7DEAB3E6AB0C" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
					<num value="x">“(x)</num>
					<content> $1,500,000,000 for fiscal year 2030 and thereafter; and</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/2" id="H26A4D650F23B4C448D1B01DD6FB1FEAB" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<chapeau> for the Operation and Maintenance account of the Corps of Engineers which is designated in statute as being to carry out subsection (c) of section 2106 of the Water Resources Reform and Development Act of 2014 (<ref href="/us/usc/33/2238c">33 U.S.C. 2238c</ref>), not to exceed—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/2/A" id="H5E594A834C184F7AAEAD78F0F57B2D66" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> $50,000,000 for fiscal year 2021;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/2/B" id="H08EE2BCBA5504A63A045F26D203C4B9A" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> $50,000,000 for fiscal year 2022;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/2/C" id="HDF135FEA20D046B8AB0A59118DFCA9C3" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<content> $56,000,000 for fiscal year 2023;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/2/D" id="HB8E0125BA437403DB2F7E66B81B14366" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
				<num value="D">“(D)</num>
				<content> $58,000,000 for fiscal year 2024;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/2/E" id="H9631FDC050C04123B6C8CF9F83D4571D" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
				<num value="E">“(E)</num>
				<content> $60,000,000 for fiscal year 2025;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/2/F" id="H50EEA78C96B941EA97130D5B808A3F86" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
				<num value="F">“(F)</num>
				<content> $62,000,000 for fiscal year 2026;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/2/G" id="HD38A92CFE5814A6E82DC2E60A8327949" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
				<num value="G">“(G)</num>
				<content> $64,000,000 for fiscal year 2027;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/2/H" id="HB1C6F6242012449EA527029FCA8353B9" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
				<num value="H">“(H)</num>
				<content> $66,000,000 for fiscal year 2028;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/2/I" id="H5C81EF4990AB40E298CBF02C5A4BD5E7" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
				<num value="I">“(I)</num>
				<content> $68,000,000 for fiscal year 2029; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s101/qB/s14003/2/J" id="H98EA1A8F3B1343008DA876FE7C08314E" class="bill-dtd-appropriations" pagenum="1437">
				<num value="J">“(J)</num>
				<content> $70,000,000 for fiscal year 2030;</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<continuation class="indent0 firstIndent0">shall be subtracted from the estimate of discretionary budget authority and outlays for any estimate of an appropriations Act under the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974 or the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985.”</continuation>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

insert after(subsection( "(a)")) <__xml__ id="H74DEE0A19290412AB5F24D94D5048812" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b" id="H523EB457A92E4EA9968C9D93084D5070" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1447">
		<num value="b">“(b)</num>
		<heading> Federal interest determination.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/1" id="HD8970ECDFFEA49FA91A86B0FFC5BBFCE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1447">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/1/A" id="H5AB7AE3B81294C32BE5E1DC3E2BD738E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1447">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> Economically disadvantaged communities.—</heading>
				<content>In preparing a feasibility report under subsection (a) for a study that will benefit an economically disadvantaged community, upon request by the non-Federal interest for the study, the Secretary shall first determine the Federal interest in carrying out the study and the projects that may be proposed in the study.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/1/B" id="H9A9CC2A5DAD7499AB955383EB35C9B63" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1447">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Other communities.—</heading>
				<clause identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/1/B/i" id="H951E3309EC7243CAA2093D4BC04EB261" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1447">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<heading> Authorization.—</heading>
					<content>In preparing a feasibility report under subsection (a) for a study that will benefit a covered community, upon request by the non-Federal interest for the study, the Secretary may, with respect to not more than 3 studies in each fiscal year, first determine the Federal interest in carrying out the study and the projects that may be proposed in the study.</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/1/B/ii" id="H33724DD9AFF948138B82DD3FF81043A8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1447">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<heading> Covered communities.—</heading>
					<chapeau>In this subparagraph, the term ‘<term>covered community</term>’ means a community that—</chapeau>
					<subclause identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/1/B/ii/I" id="H341AC54E69834C6190A4C2D5542E708E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1447">
						<num value="I">“(I)</num>
						<content> is not an economically disadvantaged community; and</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/1/B/ii/II" id="H51B137332D57491B96F3B8DF1ECCD76E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1447">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> the Secretary finds has a compelling need for the Secretary to make a determination under clause (i).</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/2" id="H2D1E56374A55453D8BB8B5EB9E2B6097" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1447">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Cost share.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The costs of a determination under paragraph (1)—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/2/A" id="H59A3EE3135744F6A91E4EA2ECE966685" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1447">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> shall be at Federal expense; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/2/B" id="HB1A2C1A7B73E40008F2773A073438006" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1447">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> shall not exceed $200,000.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/3" id="HDDFB10A482024B02AD8D239493907E4C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1447">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> Deadline.—</heading>
			<content>A determination under paragraph (1) shall be completed by not later than 120 days after the date on which funds are made available to the Secretary to carry out the determination.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/4" id="H3E364CC035D1437F9B8AC53AF2D59156" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1447">
			<num value="4">“(4)</num>
			<heading> Treatment.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/4/A" id="H54F86062218046BFA6319EAC5CEA6B81" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1447">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> Timing.—</heading>
				<content>The period during which a determination is being completed under paragraph (1) for a study shall not be included for purposes of the deadline to complete a final feasibility report under section 1001(a)(1) of the Water Resources Reform and Development Act of 2014 (<ref href="/us/usc/33/2282c">33 U.S.C. 2282c(a)(1)</ref>).</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/4/B" id="H55961014231647CD80A85CE0080B37BC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1448">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Cost.—</heading>
				<content>The cost of a determination under paragraph (1) shall not be included for purposes of the maximum Federal cost under section 1001(a)(2) of the Water Resources Reform and Development Act of 2014 (<ref href="/us/usc/33/2282c">33 U.S.C. 2282c(a)(2)</ref>).</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s117/qB/b/5" id="H591A845B1B6B401D94A7BE127E1F2807" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1448">
			<num value="5">“(5)</num>
			<heading> Report to non-Federal interest.—</heading>
			<content>If, based on a determination under paragraph (1), the Secretary determines that a study or project is not in the Federal interest because the project will not result, or is unlikely to result, in a recommended plan that will produce national economic development benefits greater than cost, but may result in a technically sound and environmentally acceptable plan that is otherwise consistent with section 904 of the Water Resources Development Act of 1986 (<ref href="/us/usc/33/2281">33 U.S.C. 2281</ref>), the Secretary shall issue a report to the non-Federal interest with recommendations on how the non-Federal interest might modify the proposal such that the project could be in the Federal interest and feasible.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 905 of the Water Resources Development Act of 1986 (33 U.S.C. 2282)
Section 5 of the Act of August 18, 1941 (33 U.S.C. 701n)
Section 1161(b) of the Water Resources Development Act of 2018 (33 U.S.C. 701n note)

rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H47632A4ECBD848C185C4A808400499A3" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002" id="HE6A8C525F77749738B9AF5FD9963656E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1454">
		<num value="6002">“SEC. 6002.</num>
		<heading> Review of Corps of Engineers assets.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/a" id="HFB123A03B00F445887BF13AC2A384BD9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1454">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> Assessment.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary shall conduct an assessment of projects constructed by the Secretary for which the Secretary continues to have financial or operational responsibility.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/b" id="H39743C2FCFBD40678EB76E438CE4D492" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1454">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Inventory.—</heading>
			<chapeau>Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Water Resources Development Act of 2020</shortTitle>, the Secretary shall, based on the assessment carried out under subsection (a), develop an inventory of projects or portions of projects—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/b/1" id="H2A6DE050AC5D4D4D8C4CF92DFE630087" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1454">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> that are not needed for the missions of the Corps of Engineers;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/b/2" id="H2E4CFE24EC6C4390B16F2EFEA3E60196" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1454">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> the modification of which, including though the use of structural features, nonstructural features, or natural features or nature-based features (as those terms are defined in section 1184(a) of the Water Resources Development Act of 2016 (<ref href="/us/usc/33/2289a">33 U.S.C. 2289a(a)</ref>), could improve the sustainable operations of the project, or reduce operation and maintenance costs for the project; or</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/b/3" id="H7DA13507DEFB40C0953FB546F5B75718" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1454">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<content> that are no longer having project purposes adequately met by the Corps of Engineers, because of deferment of maintenance or other challenges, and the divestment of which to a non-Federal entity could better meet the local and regional needs for operation and maintenance.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/c" id="HA716B95E935C40588F4C9A5DE096ECF7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1455">
			<num value="c">“(c)</num>
			<heading> Criteria.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In conducting the assessment under subsection (a) and developing the inventory under subsection (b), the Secretary shall use the following criteria:</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/c/1" id="HE192C8FAEFF649B09EAA43891A326566" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1455">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> The extent to which the project aligns with the current missions of the Corps of Engineers.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/c/2" id="H59104F6856474F49BA5B79B143B46338" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1455">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> The economic and environmental impacts of the project on existing communities in the vicinity of the project.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/c/3" id="H27E0EDF5EFF94DEB9444ECF833632517" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1455">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<content> The extent to which the divestment or modification of the project could reduce operation and maintenance costs of the Corps of Engineers.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/c/4" id="H868E68B07CEC4B1CA89EDE3C179E4FB5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1455">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<content> The extent to which the divestment or modification of the project is in the public interest.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/c/5" id="H79E98ED1949A4CEF8DA832E39F117CD7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1455">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<content> The extent to which investment of additional Federal resources in the project proposed for divestment or modification, including investment needed to bring the project to a good state of repair, is in the public interest.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/c/6" id="H55D8FC7594004BE7BCE1442C309C532F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1455">
				<num value="6">“(6)</num>
				<content> The extent to which the authorized purpose of the project is no longer being met.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/d" id="H2938B220B2684962809D42FB0EC3D730" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1455">
			<num value="d">“(d)</num>
			<heading> Recommendations of non-Federal interests.—</heading>
			<content>A non-Federal interest for a project may recommend that the Secretary include such project in the assessment or inventory required under this section.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/e" id="HBC7A7954EE9F4AACAA21C215C2C73627" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1455">
			<num value="e">“(e)</num>
			<heading> Report to congress.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/e/1" id="HE9C6E27EC5494D7DB64D00CF744BB363" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1455">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>Upon completion of the inventory required by subsection (b), the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives, and make publicly available, a report containing the findings of the Secretary with respect to the assessment and inventory required under this section.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s123/qB/s6002/e/2" id="HE6F8EBE29E2F4FADB30339DF51F7AE91" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1455">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Inclusion.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall list in an appendix any recommendation of a non-Federal interest made with respect to a project under subsection (d) that the Secretary determines not to include in the inventory developed under subsection (b), based on the criteria in subsection (c), including information about the request and the reasons for the Secretary’s determination.”</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 6002 of the Water Resources Reform and Development Act of 2014 (128 Stat. 1349)

doc_names: Water Resources Reform and Development Act of 2014

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H8926DB0B263346C9983161E102C816DD" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dAA/tI/s131/qB/d" id="H3FC80D465328439E82E6AE1EF3481E06" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1463">
		<num value="d">“(d)</num>
		<heading> Identification of deficiencies.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s131/qB/d/1" id="HBCE0485C3CBB40E3AE74F6DA95E37848" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1463">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<chapeau>For each levee included in an inventory established under subsection (b) or for which the Secretary has conducted a review under subsection (c), the Secretary shall—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s131/qB/d/1/A" id="H2FF06331B437423295C4979705B29362" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1463">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> identify the specific engineering and maintenance deficiencies, if any; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s131/qB/d/1/B" id="H9AA55C827F684E2D8684D31E371BE988" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1463">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> describe the recommended remedies to correct each deficiency identified under subparagraph (A), and, if requested by owner of a non-Federal levee, the associated costs of those remedies.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s131/qB/d/2" id="HBEF6E26D25AC4DC68C589336F6043413" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1464">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Consultation.—</heading>
			<content>In identifying deficiencies and describing remedies for a levee under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall consult with relevant non-Federal interests, including by providing an opportunity for comment by those non-Federal interests.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

Section 2 of the National Dam Safety Program Act (33 U.S.C. 467)

cite.cite_text: Section 516 of the Water Resources Development Act of 1996 (33 U.S.C. 2326b)

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H3F10B99EC68845AC94D8A901238D6CED" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dAA/tI/s157/qB/c" id="H39C95C4BF8394A50B50B0D84F0808ED5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1480">
		<num value="c">“(c)</num>
		<heading> Additional utilization of forecast-Informed reservoir operations.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s157/qB/c/1" id="HCFB6388C651E4FBEBB5C2F3B871EAADC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1480">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate a report on any additional opportunities identified for utilizing forecast-informed reservoir operations across the United States, including an assessment of the viability of forecast-informed reservoir operations in the Upper Missouri River Basin and the North Platte River Basin.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s157/qB/c/2" id="H17DC21704D984C428220D5C26E5528CB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1480">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Forecast-informed reservoir operations.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s157/qB/c/2/A" id="H8983B66E2F674FB6BBCB2206392CAEF8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1480">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> Authorization.—</heading>
				<content>If the Secretary determines, and includes in the report submitted under paragraph (1), that forecast-informed reservoir operations are viable at a reservoir in the Upper Missouri River Basin or the North Platte River Basin, including a reservoir for which the Secretary has flood control responsibilities under section 7 of the Act of December 22, 1944 (<ref href="/us/usc/33/709">33 U.S.C. 709</ref>), the Secretary is authorized to carry out forecast-informed reservoir operations at such reservoir.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dAA/tI/s157/qB/c/2/B" id="H98B875C2E2184680B812FE64663821B0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1481">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Requirement.—</heading>
				<content>Subject to the availability of appropriations, if the Secretary determines, and includes in the report submitted under paragraph (1), that forecast-informed reservoir operations are viable in the Upper Missouri River Basin or the North Platte River Basin, the Secretary shall carry out forecast-informed reservoir operations at not fewer than one reservoir in such basin.”</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

	<subsection identifier="/dAA/tII/s208/qB/d" id="H93A80E1A305A4F508DDEE0845328C2CD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1500">
		<num value="d">“(d)</num>
		<heading> Annual reports.—</heading>
		<content>Not later than 180 days after the enactment of the <shortTitle>Water Resources Development Act of 2020</shortTitle>, and not less frequently than annually thereafter until 2025, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a report on the status of the study under subsection (a), on a State-by-State basis, including information on the engagement of the Corps of Engineers with non-Federal interests, including detailed lists of all meetings and decision outcomes associated with those engagements. ”</content>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 1204 of the Water Resources Development Act of 2016 (130 Stat. 1685)

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H77417E2CF4E44D6B9B633AC60AA70400" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dAA/tII/s225/qB/s1210" id="H31CF38EBEED64AE8B6118497DF293D26" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1516">
		<num value="1210">“SEC. 1210.</num>
		<heading> Report on debris removal.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dAA/tII/s225/qB/s1210/a" id="HD1B3449A93D347E6B6E7FDB96D8EEB25" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1516">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<chapeau>Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>Water Resources Development Act of 2020</shortTitle>, the Secretary shall submit to Congress and make publicly available a report that describes—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tII/s225/qB/s1210/a/1" id="H8F031C0881F64A11B331CE13936E82C9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1516">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> the extent to which, during the 10 fiscal years prior to such date of enactment, the Secretary has carried out section 3 of the Act of March 2, 1945 (<ref href="/us/usc/33/603a">33 U.S.C. 603a</ref>);</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tII/s225/qB/s1210/a/2" id="H16D8F0295D1B4C9AAD6A037B8957223B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1516">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> how the Secretary has evaluated potential work to be carried out under that section; and</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tII/s225/qB/s1210/a/3" id="H699271AFD8144E62BACFAC7E5396043E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1516">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<content> the extent to which the Secretary plans to start, continue, or complete debris removal activities in the 3 years following submission of the report.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dAA/tII/s225/qB/s1210/b" id="H5B53501ADEBB4DFDA6EF924F478F3D47" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1516">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Focus areas.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The Secretary shall include in the report submitted under subsection (a)—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tII/s225/qB/s1210/b/1" id="H5B013D1A7B864A4C967487699A9CA737" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1516">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> identification of the debris removal activities to be started, continued, or completed during the first fiscal year following the date of enactment of this subsection within the boundaries of the North Atlantic Division of the Corps of Engineers;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tII/s225/qB/s1210/b/2" id="H4E48E84F4FF1400DA8E34E34D7A136F7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1516">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> the estimated total costs and completion dates for such activities; and</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dAA/tII/s225/qB/s1210/b/3" id="HFED69B227D10496F82D0DC5983F69697" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1516">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<content> identification of the non-Federal interest associated with such activities.”</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H642AA074116942D68CC63F14F510A615" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dAA/tIII/s316/a/qB/s114" id="HDA97F0CB83A245928C2264FCAFD6177A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1525">
		<num value="114">“SEC. 114.</num>
		<heading> San Francisco, California, Waterfront Area.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dAA/tIII/s316/a/qB/s114/a" id="HE568944CFBE34A398059536D9AC6F0A9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1525">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> Area To be declared nonnavigable.—</heading>
			<content>The following area is declared to be nonnavigable waters of the United States: All of that portion of the City and County of San Francisco, California, lying shoreward of a line beginning at the intersection of the southerly right of way line of Earl Street prolongation with the Pierhead United States Government Pierhead line, the Pierhead line as defined in the State of California Harbor and Navigation Code Section 1770, as amended in 1961; thence northerly along said Pierhead line to its intersection with a line parallel with and distant 10 feet easterly from, the existing easterly boundary line of Pier 30–32; thence northerly along said parallel line and its northerly prolongation, to a point of intersection with a line parallel with, and distant 10 feet northerly from, the existing northerly boundary of Pier 30–32; thence westerly along last said parallel line to its intersection with said Pierhead line; thence northerly along said Pierhead line, to the intersection of the easterly right of way line of Van Ness Avenue, formerly Marlette Street, prolongation to the Pierhead line.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dAA/tIII/s316/a/qB/s114/b" id="H96C428494D9C4B00A283FF3F32B9BC9C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1525">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Requirement that area be improved.—</heading>
			<content>The declaration of nonnavigability under subsection (a) applies only to those parts of the area described in subsection (a) that are or will be bulkheaded, filled, or otherwise occupied or covered by permanent structures and does not affect the applicability of any Federal statute or regulation that relates to filling of navigable waters or to other regulated activities within the area described in subsection (a), including sections 9 and 10 of the Act of March 3, 1899 (<ref href="/us/usc/33/401">33 U.S.C. 401</ref>, 403), section 404 of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act, and the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dAA/tIII/s316/a/qB/s114/c" id="HC8D0FA8C386A476B9943035E4206EC11" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1525">
			<num value="c">“(c)</num>
			<heading> Inclusion of Embarcadero Historic District.—</heading>
			<content>Congress finds and declares that the area described in subsection (a) contains the seawall, piers, and wharves that comprise the Embarcadero Historic District listed on the National Register of Historic Places on May 12, 2006.”</content>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H1A63BE73954D48219FEFFAFED8815E81" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dBB/tI/s102/d/1/qB/p" id="H43F8B634CA4147FBB96B91F238D4E15C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1616">
		<num value="p">“(p)</num>
		<content> Each contract under this chapter shall require the carrier to comply with requirements described in the provisions of sections 2799A–1, 2799A–2, and 2799A–7 of the Public Health Service Act, sections 716, 717, and 722 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, and sections 9816, 9817, and 9822 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (as applicable) in the same manner as such provisions apply to a group health plan or health insurance issuer offering group or individual health insurance coverage, as described in such sections. The provisions of sections 2799B–1, 2799B–2, 2799B–3, and 2799B–5 of the Public Health Service Act shall apply to a health care provider and facility and an air ambulance provider described in such respective sections with respect to an enrollee in a health benefits plan under this chapter in the same manner as such provisions apply to such a provider and facility with respect to an enrollee in a group health plan or group or individual health insurance coverage offered by a health insurance issuer, as described in such sections.”</content>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>#component(subsection());

insert end <__xml__ id="HEE4EC5BC568A41B595580D971372D699" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dBB/tI/s107/a/qB/e" id="H971515DC21894FF48DBC35CA027507B2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1677">
		<num value="e">“(e)</num>
		<heading> Transparency regarding in-network and out-of-network deductibles and out-of-pocket limitations.—</heading>
		<chapeau>A group health plan or a health insurance issuer offering group or individual health insurance coverage and providing or covering any benefit with respect to items or services shall include, in clear writing, on any physical or electronic plan or insurance identification card issued to the participants, beneficiaries, or enrollees in the plan or coverage the following:</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tI/s107/a/qB/e/1" id="H4B853A9125B4441BBF9F21391BCD71AE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1677">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> Any deductible applicable to such plan or coverage.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tI/s107/a/qB/e/2" id="H3E9ED9A32B7C4A6B96813508277EB5F9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1677">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> Any out-of-pocket maximum limitation applicable to such plan or coverage. </content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tI/s107/a/qB/e/3" id="H5894F4D955774143958F86A0C4CFADBE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1677">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<content> A telephone number and Internet website address through which such individual may seek consumer assistance information, such as information related to hospitals and urgent care facilities that have in effect a contractual relationship with such plan or coverage for furnishing items and services under such plan or coverage”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>#component(subsection());

HBF9971F090FA46B88BA6D247E32BF22F.label: dBB tI 107(d)
