cite.cite_text: Section 408(b)(2) of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (29 U.S.C. 1108(b)(2))

doc_names: Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="HAF1DECAACE154DE88D24D320062FCE87" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8" id="H353ED56B85634036BF6CF41D697987B9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1719">
		<num value="8">“(8)</num>
		<heading> Compliance requirements.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/A" id="HD70A220ADC574BB6A3758B32F332F13E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1719">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> Nonquantitative treatment limitation (NQTL) requirements.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In the case of a group health plan or a health insurance issuer offering group or individual health insurance coverage that provides both medical and surgical benefits and mental health or substance use disorder benefits and that imposes nonquantitative treatment limitations (referred to in this section as ‘<quotedText>NQTLs</quotedText>’) on mental health or substance use disorder benefits, such plan or issuer shall perform and document comparative analyses of the design and application of NQTLs and, beginning 45 days after the date of enactment of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021, make available to the applicable State authority (or, as applicable, to the Secretary of Labor or the Secretary of Health and Human Services), upon request, the comparative analyses and the following information:</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/A/i" id="H6E2FFAA8C4A1494CB9978D4AB23375AC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1719">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> The specific plan or coverage terms or other relevant terms regarding the NQTLs and a description of all mental health or substance use disorder and medical or surgical benefits to which each such term applies in each respective benefits classification.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/A/ii" id="H93FB4864DD15402BA83CD84F1F58C052" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1720">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> The factors used to determine that the NQTLs will apply to mental health or substance use disorder benefits and medical or surgical benefits.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/A/iii" id="H3577C870FC08487BBDFBD0789DB064AC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1720">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<content> The evidentiary standards used for the factors identified in clause (ii), when applicable, provided that every factor shall be defined, and any other source or evidence relied upon to design and apply the NQTLs to mental health or substance use disorder benefits and medical or surgical benefits.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/A/iv" id="H6F46E520C26F4B3B8B8720B90C61ADAA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1720">
				<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
				<content> The comparative analyses demonstrating that the processes, strategies, evidentiary standards, and other factors used to apply the NQTLs to mental health or substance use disorder benefits, as written and in operation, are comparable to, and are applied no more stringently than, the processes, strategies, evidentiary standards, and other factors used to apply the NQTLs to medical or surgical benefits in the benefits classification.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/A/v" id="HB52E48A844B34F2696DCAF803324BF50" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1720">
				<num value="v">“(v)</num>
				<content> The specific findings and conclusions reached by the group health plan or health insurance issuer with respect to the health insurance coverage, including any results of the analyses described in this subparagraph that indicate that the plan or coverage is or is not in compliance with this section.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/B" id="HF292C744FA044A73AF56CE182BD2F77B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1720">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Secretary request process.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/B/i" id="H57E3DE5F2BA6456D9F93007DF8CEF9A0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1720">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> Submission upon request.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall request that a group health plan or a health insurance issuer offering group or individual health insurance coverage submit the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A) for plans that involve potential violations of this section or complaints regarding noncompliance with this section that concern NQTLs and any other instances in which the Secretary determines appropriate. The Secretary shall request not fewer than 20 such analyses per year.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/B/ii" id="HF0DC7A950F104CCF85ED7887D979147B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1720">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Additional information.—</heading>
				<content>In instances in which the Secretary has concluded that the group health plan or health insurance issuer with respect to health insurance coverage has not submitted sufficient information for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A), as requested under clause (i), the Secretary shall specify to the plan or issuer the information the plan or issuer must submit to be responsive to the request under clause (i) for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A) for compliance with this section. Nothing in this paragraph shall require the Secretary to conclude that a group health plan or health insurance issuer is in compliance with this section solely based upon the inspection of the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A), as requested under clause (i).</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/B/iii" id="H084204866A3A41688E72730B8433BF7B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1720">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> Required action.—</heading>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/B/iii/I" id="H8736EFBF300D439A80CE68CAE2512952" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1720">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<chapeau>In instances in which the Secretary has reviewed the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A), as requested under clause (i), and determined that the group health plan or health insurance issuer is not in compliance with this section, the plan or issuer—</chapeau>
					<item identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/B/iii/I/aa" id="HB29CACAFA16644DB80078C8647B8BD04" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1721">
						<num value="aa">“(aa)</num>
						<content> shall specify to the Secretary the actions the plan or issuer will take to be in compliance with this section and provide to the Secretary additional comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A) that demonstrate compliance with this section not later than 45 days after the initial determination by the Secretary that the plan or issuer is not in compliance; and </content>
					</item>
					<item identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/B/iii/I/bb" id="HC80A253590A24C2F857D416B49DD513E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1721">
						<num value="bb">“(bb)</num>
						<content> following the 45-day corrective action period under item (aa), if the Secretary makes a final determination that the plan or issuer still is not in compliance with this section, not later than 7 days after such determination, shall notify all individuals enrolled in the plan or applicable health insurance coverage offered by the issuer that the plan or issuer, with respect to such coverage, has been determined to be not in compliance with this section. </content>
					</item>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/B/iii/II" id="H8764C9B9C24846B0A9FE67586A73BDD3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1721">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<heading> Exemption from disclosure.—</heading>
					<content>Documents or communications produced in connection with the Secretary’s recommendations to a group health plan or health insurance issuer shall not be subject to disclosure pursuant to section 552 of title 5, United States Code.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/B/iv" id="H3C0D30FDA1AB4C24BE3750AE7B173151" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1721">
				<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
				<heading> Report.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this paragraph, and not later than October 1 of each year thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to Congress, and make publicly available, a report that contains—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/B/iv/I" id="H94C53AB1BF664A12BCC9DB5EB09343D4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1721">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> a summary of the comparative analyses requested under clause (i), including the identity of each group health plan or health insurance issuer, with respect to particular health insurance coverage that is determined to be not in compliance after the final determination by the Secretary described in clause (iii)(I)(bb);</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/B/iv/II" id="H3E21762B9DB64C549F4D22C7A30D688E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1721">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> the Secretary’s conclusions as to whether each group health plan or health insurance issuer submitted sufficient information for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses requested under clause (i) for compliance with this section;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/B/iv/III" id="H8C075BDF3FA64DC5B2B0DE9C4364C97A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1721">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> for each group health plan or health insurance issuer that did submit sufficient information for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses requested under clause (i), the Secretary’s conclusions as to whether and why the plan or issuer is in compliance with the requirements under this section;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/B/iv/IV" id="HED5B852C87564EFF9EF6AC4E6C318D4B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1721">
					<num value="IV">“(IV)</num>
					<content> the Secretary’s specifications described in clause (ii) for each group health plan or health insurance issuer that the Secretary determined did not submit sufficient information for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses requested under clause (i) for compliance with this section; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/B/iv/V" id="HCBBEDA0441FD4389A4FDE8E7F418F95F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1722">
					<num value="V">“(V)</num>
					<content> the Secretary’s specifications described in clause (iii) of the actions each group health plan or health insurance issuer that the Secretary determined is not in compliance with this section must take to be in compliance with this section, including the reason why the Secretary determined the plan or issuer is not in compliance.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/C" id="H169305F9176D4F5FBD36AED30AE20F17" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1722">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<heading> Compliance program guidance document update process.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/C/i" id="H46B272743F0C451B958BFFEB042B8BEC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1722">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall include instances of noncompliance that the Secretary discovers upon reviewing the comparative analyses requested under subparagraph (B)(i) in the compliance program guidance document described in paragraph (6), as it is updated every 2 years, except that such instances shall not disclose any protected health information or individually identifiable information.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/C/ii" id="H1CDDF373FB2344EBBF43B46C70B8740B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1722">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Guidance and regulations.—</heading>
				<content>Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this paragraph, the Secretary shall finalize any draft or interim guidance and regulations relating to mental health parity under this section. Such draft guidance shall include guidance to clarify the process and timeline for current and potential participants and beneficiaries (and authorized representatives and health care providers of such participants and beneficiaries) with respect to plans to file complaints of such plans or issuers being in violation of this section, including guidance, by plan type, on the relevant State, regional, or national office with which such complaints should be filed.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/1/qB/8/C/iii" id="HE4EBAEE063114305B3BA98979C4327D1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1722">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> State.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall share information on findings of compliance and noncompliance discovered upon reviewing the comparative analyses requested under subparagraph (B)(i) shall be shared with the State where the group health plan is located or the State where the health insurance issuer is licensed to do business for coverage offered by a health insurance issuer in the group market, in accordance with paragraph (6)(B)(iii)(II).”</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 2726(a) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300gg–26(a))

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H8A1C91ED6BD54DC69D3F772A34103290" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/6" id="H5224134A7FDA496493FBF8C4E76D317A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1722">
		<num value="6">“(6)</num>
		<heading> Compliance program guidance document.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/6/A" id="HF9AB7B0905BA447C93002E51056A862B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1722">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary, the Secretary of Health and Human Services, and the Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Inspector General of the Department of Health and Human Services, the Inspector General of the Department of Labor, and the Inspector General of the Department of the Treasury, shall issue a compliance program guidance document to help improve compliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, and <ref href="/us/usc/26/9812">section 9812</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as applicable. In carrying out this paragraph, the Secretaries may take into consideration the 2016 publication of the Department of Health and Human Services and the Department of Labor, entitled ‘<quotedText>Warning Signs - Plan or Policy Non-Quantitative Treatment Limitations (NQTLs) that Require Additional Analysis to Determine Mental Health Parity Compliance</quotedText>’.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/6/B" id="HA3F3E1AB638843F6B2E24F79CBCC4C29" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1723">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Examples illustrating compliance and noncompliance.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/6/B/i" id="HC2EE4C2102A144BDBC058C94C8976E0F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1723">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The compliance program guidance document required under this paragraph shall provide illustrative, de-identified examples (that do not disclose any protected health information or individually identifiable information) of previous findings of compliance and noncompliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or <ref href="/us/usc/26/9812">section 9812</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as applicable, based on investigations of violations of such sections, including—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/6/B/i/I" id="H6E4A69A1E19348AB800423FD997895AF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1723">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> examples illustrating requirements for information disclosures and nonquantitative treatment limitations; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/6/B/i/II" id="HF881727D8BDF48B382A08282D61795CF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1723">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> descriptions of the violations uncovered during the course of such investigations.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/6/B/ii" id="H5AF1AC3E30C944FAAB9C185AA0BEEBF4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1723">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Nonquantitative treatment limitations.—</heading>
				<content>To the extent that any example described in clause (i) involves a finding of compliance or noncompliance with regard to any requirement for nonquantitative treatment limitations, the example shall provide sufficient detail to fully explain such finding, including a full description of the criteria involved for approving medical and surgical benefits and the criteria involved for approving mental health and substance use disorder benefits.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/6/B/iii" id="H3EAAE9BC12964156961150793E8C1C3E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1723">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> Access to additional information regarding compliance.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In developing and issuing the compliance program guidance document required under this paragraph, the Secretaries specified in subparagraph (A)—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/6/B/iii/I" id="H97372D624EA84A0D9E66A087E2CF0EA4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1723">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> shall enter into interagency agreements with the Inspector General of the Department of Health and Human Services, the Inspector General of the Department of Labor, and the Inspector General of the Department of the Treasury to share findings of compliance and noncompliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or <ref href="/us/usc/26/9812">section 9812</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as applicable; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/6/B/iii/II" id="H972CBE7EFD2040799E626AC53846077F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1723">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> shall seek to enter into an agreement with a State to share information on findings of compliance and noncompliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or <ref href="/us/usc/26/9812">section 9812</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as applicable.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/6/C" id="H555F728EFB824B118CDE8F5531459B51" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1723">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<heading> Recommendations.—</heading>
			<content>The compliance program guidance document shall include recommendations to advance compliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or <ref href="/us/usc/26/9812">section 9812</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as applicable, and encourage the development and use of internal controls to monitor adherence to applicable statutes, regulations, and program requirements. Such internal controls may include illustrative examples of nonquantitative treatment limitations on mental health and substance use disorder benefits, which may fail to comply with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or <ref href="/us/usc/26/9812">section 9812</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as applicable, in relation to nonquantitative treatment limitations on medical and surgical benefits.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/6/D" id="H1EB9870CC3FA4269A24A321C213E0B3D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1724">
			<num value="D">“(D)</num>
			<heading> Updating the compliance program guidance document.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary, the Secretary of Health and Human Services, and the Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Inspector General of the Department of Health and Human Services, the Inspector General of the Department of Labor, and the Inspector General of the Department of the Treasury, shall update the compliance program guidance document every 2 years to include illustrative, de-identified examples (that do not disclose any protected health information or individually identifiable information) of previous findings of compliance and noncompliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or <ref href="/us/usc/26/9812">section 9812</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as applicable. </content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
	<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7" id="H37AE5C87E65445EB9388EC7DF425B21D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1724">
		<num value="7">“(7)</num>
		<heading> Additional guidance.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/A" id="H544B842F8B9240E6981221350ECAF430" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1724">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary, the Secretary of Health and Human Services, and the Secretary of the Treasury shall issue guidance to group health plans and health insurance issuers offering group health insurance coverage to assist such plans and issuers in satisfying the requirements of this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or <ref href="/us/usc/26/9812">section 9812</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as applicable.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/B" id="H44CF881C88D94C88BED8E672DA134545" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1724">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Disclosure.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/B/i" id="HF04FB93A2B544FBA9617217807A3A415" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1724">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> Guidance for plans and issuers.—</heading>
				<content>The guidance issued under this paragraph shall include clarifying information and illustrative examples of methods that group health plans and health insurance issuers offering group or individual health insurance coverage may use for disclosing information to ensure compliance with the requirements under this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or <ref href="/us/usc/26/9812">section 9812</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as applicable, (and any regulations promulgated pursuant to such sections, as applicable).</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/B/ii" id="H59E4A5381B824A908EE141FEC493E3C1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1724">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Documents for participants, beneficiaries, contracting providers, or authorized representatives.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The guidance issued under this paragraph shall include clarifying information and illustrative examples of methods that group health plans and health insurance issuers offering group health insurance coverage may use to provide any participant, beneficiary, contracting provider, or authorized representative, as applicable, with documents containing information that the health plans or issuers are required to disclose to participants, beneficiaries, contracting providers, or authorized representatives to ensure compliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or <ref href="/us/usc/26/9812">section 9812</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as applicable, compliance with any regulation issued pursuant to such respective section, or compliance with any other applicable law or regulation. Such guidance shall include information that is comparative in nature with respect to—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/B/ii/I" id="HA1B0ACDB55574CEB8E71854448821F99" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1725">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> nonquantitative treatment limitations for both medical and surgical benefits and mental health and substance use disorder benefits;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/B/ii/II" id="H3BB418C9A8FA49FC90A13E4A83FBB371" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1725">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> the processes, strategies, evidentiary standards, and other factors used to apply the limitations described in subclause (I); and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/B/ii/III" id="H625808E11482465D8A4CA49E3D1EF8F9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1725">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> the application of the limitations described in subclause (I) to ensure that such limitations are applied in parity with respect to both medical and surgical benefits and mental health and substance use disorder benefits.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C" id="HC44282650C854F5EBBECC54F05C9D6EE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1725">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<heading> Nonquantitative treatment limitations.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The guidance issued under this paragraph shall include clarifying information and illustrative examples of methods, processes, strategies, evidentiary standards, and other factors that group health plans and health insurance issuers offering group health insurance coverage may use regarding the development and application of nonquantitative treatment limitations to ensure compliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or <ref href="/us/usc/26/9812">section 9812</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as applicable, (and any regulations promulgated pursuant to such respective section), including—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C/i" id="H5257DAE875E342BD8CBCD7DD772E6950" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1725">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<chapeau> examples of methods of determining appropriate types of nonquantitative treatment limitations with respect to both medical and surgical benefits and mental health and substance use disorder benefits, including nonquantitative treatment limitations pertaining to—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C/i/I" id="H0D3BCF74011D47B8A2AE8457C5C77828" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1725">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> medical management standards based on medical necessity or appropriateness, or whether a treatment is experimental or investigative;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C/i/II" id="HD48A14E4536A48CEAE36EE098AA28B12" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1725">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> limitations with respect to prescription drug formulary design; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C/i/III" id="H97C3BDF306254D3DBA7846E07E0284FD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1725">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> use of fail-first or step therapy protocols;</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C/ii" id="H0C2697CE72474949BC6BF4F4C81591AC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1725">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<chapeau> examples of methods of determining—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C/ii/I" id="HB9D81AF94AC247C4991F8CE92935BAE7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1725">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> network admission standards (such as credentialing); and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C/ii/II" id="H2F4566E1E6F44EA0863D3DE5065F5238" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1725">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> factors used in provider reimbursement methodologies (such as service type, geographic market, demand for services, and provider supply, practice size, training, experience, and licensure) as such factors apply to network adequacy;</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C/iii" id="H81AA89843FD6411BA2759B00D3FE1BF4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1725">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<content> examples of sources of information that may serve as evidentiary standards for the purposes of making determinations regarding the development and application of nonquantitative treatment limitations;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C/iv" id="H94799900B9564CA29287FC38876AC65C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1725">
				<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
				<content> examples of specific factors, and the evidentiary standards used to evaluate such factors, used by such plans or issuers in performing a nonquantitative treatment limitation analysis;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C/v" id="H60AECEBB101645D2962171555087A9E9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1726">
				<num value="v">“(v)</num>
				<content> examples of how specific evidentiary standards may be used to determine whether treatments are considered experimental or investigative;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C/vi" id="H3234498E6087472EA68104B547A8846C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1726">
				<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
				<content> examples of how specific evidentiary standards may be applied to each service category or classification of benefits;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C/vii" id="HDEFB632015E34E9EA151A0912351B878" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1726">
				<num value="vii">“(vii)</num>
				<content> examples of methods of reaching appropriate coverage determinations for new mental health or substance use disorder treatments, such as evidence-based early intervention programs for individuals with a serious mental illness and types of medical management techniques;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C/viii" id="H6A851A4DA7744EFFA755821FD09804DB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1726">
				<num value="viii">“(viii)</num>
				<content> examples of methods of reaching appropriate coverage determinations for which there is an indirect relationship between the covered mental health or substance use disorder benefit and a traditional covered medical and surgical benefit, such as residential treatment or hospitalizations involving voluntary or involuntary commitment; and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/C/ix" id="H0CA6EB02A31F4AE08BF265688975225D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1726">
				<num value="ix">“(ix)</num>
				<content> additional illustrative examples of methods, processes, strategies, evidentiary standards, and other factors for which the Secretary determines that additional guidance is necessary to improve compliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or <ref href="/us/usc/26/9812">section 9812</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as applicable.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/7/D" id="HB08130CBE44141829ABE4A9D7FAA8AAB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1726">
			<num value="D">“(D)</num>
			<heading> Public comment.—</heading>
			<content>Prior to issuing any final guidance under this paragraph, the Secretary shall provide a public comment period of not less than 60 days during which any member of the public may provide comments on a draft of the guidance.</content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
	<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8" id="H8CA4B019EEDA48B6813F399D4298C223" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1726">
		<num value="8">“(8)</num>
		<heading> Compliance requirements.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/A" id="HE8CBA0D31A1343BB97243DD63D5C96E7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1726">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> Nonquantitative treatment limitation (nqtl) requirements.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In the case of a group health plan or a health insurance issuer offering group health insurance coverage that provides both medical and surgical benefits and mental health or substance use disorder benefits and that imposes nonquantitative treatment limitations (referred to in this section as ‘<quotedText>NQTLs</quotedText>’) on mental health or substance use disorder benefits, such plan or issuer shall perform and document comparative analyses of the design and application of NQTLs and, beginning 45 days after the date of enactment of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021, make available to the Secretary, upon request, the comparative analyses and the following information:</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/A/i" id="HC4EC5466D767426B8C83D5528FF4F845" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1726">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> The specific plan or coverage terms or other relevant terms regarding the NQTLs, that applies to such plan or coverage, and a description of all mental health or substance use disorder and medical or surgical benefits to which each such term applies in each respective benefits classification.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/A/ii" id="H8ECE0E73F332430C95E603B163167F9D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1726">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> The factors used to determine that the NQTLs will apply to mental health or substance use disorder benefits and medical or surgical benefits.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/A/iii" id="H3433861B9A624BB5A063189ED7D59BDB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1727">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<content> The evidentiary standards used for the factors identified in clause (ii), when applicable, provided that every factor shall be defined, and any other source or evidence relied upon to design and apply the NQTLs to mental health or substance use disorder benefits and medical or surgical benefits.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/A/iv" id="H6694AAD8CFFB421E8C514299E2C17780" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1727">
				<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
				<content> The comparative analyses demonstrating that the processes, strategies, evidentiary standards, and other factors used to apply the NQTLs to mental health or substance use disorder benefits, as written and in operation, are comparable to, and are applied no more stringently than, the processes, strategies, evidentiary standards, and other factors used to apply the NQTLs to medical or surgical benefits in the benefits classification.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/A/v" id="HC04219AF737543FAB2FF4F7A67F52DAB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1727">
				<num value="v">“(v)</num>
				<content> The specific findings and conclusions reached by the group health plan or health insurance issuer with respect to the health insurance coverage, including any results of the analyses described in this subparagraph that indicate that the plan or coverage is or is not in compliance with this section.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/B" id="H39A94173A51B4A41B47D6ACEBAD71288" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1727">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Secretary request process.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/B/i" id="H1128BF8F369042DB97E1ECF2A6A894EE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1727">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> Submission upon request.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall request that a group health plan or a health insurance issuer offering group health insurance coverage submit the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A) for plans that involve potential violations of this section or complaints regarding noncompliance with this section that concern NQTLs and any other instances in which the Secretary determines appropriate. The Secretary shall request not fewer than 20 such analyses per year.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/B/ii" id="HDC50582658B444DEBDDBED7D00349B31" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1727">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Additional information.—</heading>
				<content>In instances in which the Secretary has concluded that the group health plan or health insurance issuer with respect to group health insurance coverage has not submitted sufficient information for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A), as requested under clause (i), the Secretary shall specify to the plan or issuer the information the plan or issuer must submit to be responsive to the request under clause (i) for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A) for compliance with this section. Nothing in this paragraph shall require the Secretary to conclude that a group health plan or health insurance issuer is in compliance with this section solely based upon the inspection of the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A), as requested under clause (i).</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/B/iii" id="H95719F2212D24601AA1512E86A9429A9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1727">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> Required action.—</heading>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/B/iii/I" id="H013810300AEB4115A0F4B770E3DA0829" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1727">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<chapeau>In instances in which the Secretary has reviewed the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A), as requested under clause (i), and determined that the group health plan or health insurance issuer is not in compliance with this section, the plan or issuer—</chapeau>
					<item identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/B/iii/I/aa" id="H02F90EA8B9A1423A8262DA0961F27B31" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1728">
						<num value="aa">“(aa)</num>
						<content> shall specify to the Secretary the actions the plan or issuer will take to be in compliance with this section and provide to the Secretary additional comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A) that demonstrate compliance with this section not later than 45 days after the initial determination by the Secretary that the plan or issuer is not in compliance; and </content>
					</item>
					<item identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/B/iii/I/bb" id="H47D372922D764B2FAE1F8742F9729F44" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1728">
						<num value="bb">“(bb)</num>
						<content> following the 45-day corrective action period under item (aa), if the Secretary makes a final determination that the plan or issuer still is not in compliance with this section, not later than 7 days after such determination, shall notify all individuals enrolled in the plan or applicable health insurance coverage offered by the issuer that the plan or issuer, with respect to such coverage, has been determined to be not in compliance with this section. </content>
					</item>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/B/iii/II" id="H2814F026CFE8407B88EC5893ABE84AB1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1728">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<heading> Exemption from disclosure.—</heading>
					<content>Documents or communications produced in connection with the Secretary’s recommendations to a group health plan or health insurance issuer shall not be subject to disclosure pursuant to section 552 of title 5, United States Code.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/B/iv" id="HBBF47CC3F388432498C7DC0349D01257" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1728">
				<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
				<heading> Report.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this paragraph, and not later than October 1 of each year thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to Congress, and make publicly available, a report that contains—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/B/iv/I" id="HB7C303584D3D4474B9FDDB682F91745E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1728">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> a summary of the comparative analyses requested under clause (i), including the identity of each group health plan or health insurance issuer, with respect to certain health insurance coverage that is determined to be not in compliance after the final determination by the Secretary described in clause (iii)(I)(bb);</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/B/iv/II" id="HF353D7AF112145E6AE7168063BD3322D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1728">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> the Secretary’s conclusions as to whether each group health plan or health insurance issuer submitted sufficient information for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses requested under clause (i) for compliance with this section;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/B/iv/III" id="H05113D93B0FF42FAA53355CEB83B3AA9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1728">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> for each group health plan or health insurance issuer that did submit sufficient information for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses requested under clause (i), the Secretary’s conclusions as to whether and why the plan or issuer is in compliance with the disclosure requirements under this section;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/B/iv/IV" id="H70FC54FDA316430EBD236B4880596808" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1728">
					<num value="IV">“(IV)</num>
					<content> the Secretary’s specifications described in clause (ii) for each group health plan or health insurance issuer that the Secretary determined did not submit sufficient information for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses requested under clause (i) for compliance with this section; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/B/iv/V" id="HD77E808A30A342FF86593D6E3B015624" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1729">
					<num value="V">“(V)</num>
					<content> the Secretary’s specifications described in clause (iii) of the actions each group health plan or health insurance issuer that the Secretary determined is not in compliance with this section must take to be in compliance with this section, including the reason why the Secretary determined the plan or issuer is not in compliance.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/C" id="HA41DE92611ED44229F99251C65CB5EA2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1729">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<heading> Compliance program guidance document update process.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/C/i" id="H9CEA09336F57430D9F5E60EFDCE43EEC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1729">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall include instances of noncompliance that the Secretary discovers upon reviewing the comparative analyses requested under subparagraph (B)(i) in the compliance program guidance document described in paragraph (6), as it is updated every 2 years, except that such instances shall not disclose any protected health information or individually identifiable information.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/C/ii" id="HBC4597BC3ECA4D2BB50EA34ED27C1230" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1729">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Guidance and regulations.—</heading>
				<content>Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this paragraph, the Secretary shall finalize any draft or interim guidance and regulations relating to mental health parity under this section. Such draft guidance shall include guidance to clarify the process and timeline for current and potential participants and beneficiaries (and authorized representatives and health care providers of such participants and beneficiaries) with respect to plans to file complaints of such plans or issuers being in violation of this section, including guidance, by plan type, on the relevant State, regional, or national office with which such complaints should be filed.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/2/qB/8/C/iii" id="H41EBFE15773240699461F3E27FE5C70E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1729">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> State.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall share information on findings of compliance and noncompliance discovered upon reviewing the comparative analyses requested under subparagraph (B)(i) shall be shared with the State where the group health plan is located or the State where the health insurance issuer is licensed to do business for coverage offered by a health insurance issuer in the group market, in accordance with paragraph (6)(B)(iii)(II).”</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 712(a) of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (29 U.S.C. 1185a(a))

doc_names: Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H9AFDA0558EAA466FA105DC58E65EDA37" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/6" id="H3A69E62C320A4EB886B31291BFE4DC68" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1729">
		<num value="6">“(6)</num>
		<heading> Compliance program guidance document.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/6/A" id="H550A97CAEBB5463C9FAF48F76CE7D9D2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1729">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary, the Secretary of Health and Human Services, and the Secretary of Labor, in consultation with the Inspector General of the Department of Health and Human Services, the Inspector General of the Department of Labor, and the Inspector General of the Department of the Treasury, shall issue a compliance program guidance document to help improve compliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, and section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as applicable. In carrying out this paragraph, the Secretaries may take into consideration the 2016 publication of the Department of Health and Human Services and the Department of Labor, entitled ‘<quotedText>Warning Signs - Plan or Policy Non-Quantitative Treatment Limitations (NQTLs) that Require Additional Analysis to Determine Mental Health Parity Compliance</quotedText>’.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/6/B" id="H903EADBACA4D4860ABABB8C358431818" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1730">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Examples illustrating compliance and noncompliance.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/6/B/i" id="H7E1921002DCC4F09AF78096B60823C8A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1730">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The compliance program guidance document required under this paragraph shall provide illustrative, de-identified examples (that do not disclose any protected health information or individually identifiable information) of previous findings of compliance and noncompliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as applicable, based on investigations of violations of such sections, including—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/6/B/i/I" id="HF5644B5083FD42B7BA0B73F79F209BDD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1730">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> examples illustrating requirements for information disclosures and nonquantitative treatment limitations; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/6/B/i/II" id="H32FFFF776E1541689F79A978468AC86C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1730">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> descriptions of the violations uncovered during the course of such investigations.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/6/B/ii" id="H1F2E0EF1C96745FB9E6F8A576762B953" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1730">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Nonquantitative treatment limitations.—</heading>
				<content>To the extent that any example described in clause (i) involves a finding of compliance or noncompliance with regard to any requirement for nonquantitative treatment limitations, the example shall provide sufficient detail to fully explain such finding, including a full description of the criteria involved for approving medical and surgical benefits and the criteria involved for approving mental health and substance use disorder benefits.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/6/B/iii" id="HAA85FFF5E943411AAED8844FC85439EE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1730">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> Access to additional information regarding compliance.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In developing and issuing the compliance program guidance document required under this paragraph, the Secretaries specified in subparagraph (A)—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/6/B/iii/I" id="H39F273A9149E4A899BC86507EE9EC43F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1730">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> shall enter into interagency agreements with the Inspector General of the Department of Health and Human Services, the Inspector General of the Department of Labor, and the Inspector General of the Department of the Treasury to share findings of compliance and noncompliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as applicable; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/6/B/iii/II" id="H032068A873C74756BACFF56001C7C81B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1730">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> shall seek to enter into an agreement with a State to share information on findings of compliance and noncompliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as applicable.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/6/C" id="H022C4E93F9B24E37900231978237C195" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1730">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<heading> Recommendations.—</heading>
			<content>The compliance program guidance document shall include recommendations to advance compliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as applicable, and encourage the development and use of internal controls to monitor adherence to applicable statutes, regulations, and program requirements. Such internal controls may include illustrative examples of nonquantitative treatment limitations on mental health and substance use disorder benefits, which may fail to comply with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as applicable, in relation to nonquantitative treatment limitations on medical and surgical benefits.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/6/D" id="HE58AF3CE74124487B37AD5FF396D5D35" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1731">
			<num value="D">“(D)</num>
			<heading> Updating the compliance program guidance document.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary, the Secretary of Health and Human Services, and the Secretary of Labor, in consultation with the Inspector General of the Department of Health and Human Services, the Inspector General of the Department of Labor, and the Inspector General of the Department of the Treasury, shall update the compliance program guidance document every 2 years to include illustrative, de-identified examples (that do not disclose any protected health information or individually identifiable information) of previous findings of compliance and noncompliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as applicable. </content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
	<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7" id="H0DDA580CA3374B2798E7F64825BB53F5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1731">
		<num value="7">“(7)</num>
		<heading> Additional guidance.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/A" id="H11E52EFC1BBA43EDBE869BF3E2B57EF6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1731">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary, the Secretary of Health and Human Services, and the Secretary of Labor shall issue guidance to group health plans to assist such plans in satisfying the requirements of this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as applicable.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/B" id="H7AFD98673DBB4786BEBC8EA683F0E865" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1731">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Disclosure.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/B/i" id="HD83CC950779344A78CD450B489DE02E4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1731">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> Guidance for plans.—</heading>
				<content>The guidance issued under this paragraph shall include clarifying information and illustrative examples of methods that group health plans may use for disclosing information to ensure compliance with the requirements under this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as applicable, (and any regulations promulgated pursuant to such sections, as applicable).</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/B/ii" id="H48D0B348FE1144068DF44F7B7DEEEC72" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1731">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Documents for participants, beneficiaries, contracting providers, or authorized representatives.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The guidance issued under this paragraph shall include clarifying information and illustrative examples of methods that group health plans may use to provide any participant, beneficiary, contracting provider, or authorized representative, as applicable, with documents containing information that the health plans are required to disclose to participants, beneficiaries, contracting providers, or authorized representatives to ensure compliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as applicable, compliance with any regulation issued pursuant to such respective section, or compliance with any other applicable law or regulation. Such guidance shall include information that is comparative in nature with respect to—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/B/ii/I" id="HAD5C0C195D204DC89E3C799AA85AB301" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1732">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> nonquantitative treatment limitations for both medical and surgical benefits and mental health and substance use disorder benefits;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/B/ii/II" id="H9F64340B4E3B4C91A7E869F5879BA0C3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1732">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> the processes, strategies, evidentiary standards, and other factors used to apply the limitations described in subclause (I); and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/B/ii/III" id="H7DD056052D7D43ACA14D72684580B7BA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1732">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> the application of the limitations described in subclause (I) to ensure that such limitations are applied in parity with respect to both medical and surgical benefits and mental health and substance use disorder benefits.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C" id="HC929C4F4720F4E0197E917C99D66F281" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1732">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<heading> Nonquantitative treatment limitations.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The guidance issued under this paragraph shall include clarifying information and illustrative examples of methods, processes, strategies, evidentiary standards, and other factors that group health plans may use regarding the development and application of nonquantitative treatment limitations to ensure compliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as applicable, (and any regulations promulgated pursuant to such respective section), including—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C/i" id="HD386A36997BB4885877BA8C58CC09060" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1732">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<chapeau> examples of methods of determining appropriate types of nonquantitative treatment limitations with respect to both medical and surgical benefits and mental health and substance use disorder benefits, including nonquantitative treatment limitations pertaining to—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C/i/I" id="H2927989E34524CCAB3F6FD4C67FB03DC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1732">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> medical management standards based on medical necessity or appropriateness, or whether a treatment is experimental or investigative;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C/i/II" id="H80FDAAA5B4984C78AA20065F59A02A35" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1732">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> limitations with respect to prescription drug formulary design; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C/i/III" id="HA32179945F8A4F9F8F6677DCB390568E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1732">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> use of fail-first or step therapy protocols;</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C/ii" id="H71E064FC53DC4B219E7854F7184D4FFD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1732">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<chapeau> examples of methods of determining—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C/ii/I" id="H8B37123886F14C77B196134E7CEAAE2F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1732">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> network admission standards (such as credentialing); and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C/ii/II" id="H12CAD68696DF4E5A99D7400A0E257310" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1732">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> factors used in provider reimbursement methodologies (such as service type, geographic market, demand for services, and provider supply, practice size, training, experience, and licensure) as such factors apply to network adequacy;</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C/iii" id="H7721265DC87A4C23B697B15ED28E9E5F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1732">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<content> examples of sources of information that may serve as evidentiary standards for the purposes of making determinations regarding the development and application of nonquantitative treatment limitations;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C/iv" id="H11E7662FCB144C0BB689E2E7C6E3AD07" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1732">
				<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
				<content> examples of specific factors, and the evidentiary standards used to evaluate such factors, used by such plans in performing a nonquantitative treatment limitation analysis;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C/v" id="H8F4ACDDDCF574E8497EEA6E6BAC452E0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1732">
				<num value="v">“(v)</num>
				<content> examples of how specific evidentiary standards may be used to determine whether treatments are considered experimental or investigative;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C/vi" id="HD28605AC208B4B90B11CE11D8E073520" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1733">
				<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
				<content> examples of how specific evidentiary standards may be applied to each service category or classification of benefits;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C/vii" id="H3D19C48845BC4E4C9AC16AAE59C3B99F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1733">
				<num value="vii">“(vii)</num>
				<content> examples of methods of reaching appropriate coverage determinations for new mental health or substance use disorder treatments, such as evidence-based early intervention programs for individuals with a serious mental illness and types of medical management techniques;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C/viii" id="HB73EB8874B3847828A63F3D5B4E12740" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1733">
				<num value="viii">“(viii)</num>
				<content> examples of methods of reaching appropriate coverage determinations for which there is an indirect relationship between the covered mental health or substance use disorder benefit and a traditional covered medical and surgical benefit, such as residential treatment or hospitalizations involving voluntary or involuntary commitment; and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/C/ix" id="HCAA44308CF5946D091632FDFB52A2E10" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1733">
				<num value="ix">“(ix)</num>
				<content> additional illustrative examples of methods, processes, strategies, evidentiary standards, and other factors for which the Secretary determines that additional guidance is necessary to improve compliance with this section, section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act, or section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as applicable.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/7/D" id="HA0C26381F55841EEA533EA3EA98FCA86" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1733">
			<num value="D">“(D)</num>
			<heading> Public comment.—</heading>
			<content>Prior to issuing any final guidance under this paragraph, the Secretary shall provide a public comment period of not less than 60 days during which any member of the public may provide comments on a draft of the guidance.</content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
	<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8" id="H18CFE82BD1684EDA93D0BBEA8FE94945" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1733">
		<num value="8">“(8)</num>
		<heading> Compliance requirements.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/A" id="H364893F89E2D422D9DB7C9C87FFA47EE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1733">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> Nonquantitative treatment limitation (nqtl) requirements.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In the case of a group health plan that provides both medical and surgical benefits and mental health or substance use disorder benefits and that imposes nonquantitative treatment limitations (referred to in this section as ‘<quotedText>NQTLs</quotedText>’) on mental health or substance use disorder benefits, such plan shall perform and document comparative analyses of the design and application of NQTLs and, beginning 45 days after the date of enactment of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021, make available to the Secretary, upon request, the comparative analyses and the following information:</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/A/i" id="HF671F681940645F1B05F39A70B43020E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1733">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> The specific plan terms or other relevant terms regarding the NQTLs and a description of all mental health or substance use disorder and medical or surgical benefits to which each such term applies in each respective benefits classification.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/A/ii" id="HC4F610214435422CADB3FF4D9DB18CEE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1733">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> The factors used to determine that the NQTLs will apply to mental health or substance use disorder benefits and medical or surgical benefits.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/A/iii" id="HFDE88799EAE540BE83902C7E5F8DEDFC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1733">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<content> The evidentiary standards used for the factors identified in clause (ii), when applicable, provided that every factor shall be defined, and any other source or evidence relied upon to design and apply the NQTLs to mental health or substance use disorder benefits and medical or surgical benefits.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/A/iv" id="HE5D4E9288815469AB074D02ADBB1B3C8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1733">
				<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
				<content> The comparative analyses demonstrating that the processes, strategies, evidentiary standards, and other factors used to apply the NQTLs to mental health or substance use disorder benefits, as written and in operation, are comparable to, and are applied no more stringently than, the processes, strategies, evidentiary standards, and other factors used to apply the NQTLs to medical or surgical benefits in the benefits classification.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/A/v" id="H621AD247FC4846FDB8D20A39A78CA067" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1734">
				<num value="v">“(v)</num>
				<content> A disclosure of the specific findings and conclusions reached by the group health plan, including any results of the analyses described in this subparagraph that indicate that the plan is or is not in compliance with this section.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/B" id="H59DC15A8F28C4104B5231565D3199A8A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1734">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Secretary request process.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/B/i" id="H964923CF705E422BA7F2DEA35FD98D48" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1734">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> Submission upon request.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall request that a group health plan submit the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A) for plans that involve potential violations of this section or complaints regarding noncompliance with this section that concern NQTLs and any other instances in which the Secretary determines appropriate. The Secretary shall request not fewer than 20 such analyses per year.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/B/ii" id="HBF22965B55EE4BEFA6A99487C02BA018" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1734">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Additional information.—</heading>
				<content>In instances in which the Secretary has concluded that the group health plan has not submitted sufficient information for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A), as requested under clause (i), the Secretary shall specify to the plan the information the plan must submit to be responsive to the request under clause (i) for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A) for compliance with this section. Nothing in this paragraph shall require the Secretary to conclude that a group health plan is in compliance with this section solely based upon the inspection of the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A), as requested under clause (i).</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/B/iii" id="HCAEC01840CA54CAE8D4C6580486D1EAF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1734">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> Required action.—</heading>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/B/iii/I" id="H1EDEFF8345A64C9D8E822A3DF14CB70F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1734">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<chapeau>In instances in which the Secretary has reviewed the comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A), as requested under clause (i), and determined that the group health plan is not in compliance with this section, the plan—</chapeau>
					<item identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/B/iii/I/aa" id="H8904772F442A401286F656840DC5FDFD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1734">
						<num value="aa">“(aa)</num>
						<content> shall specify to the Secretary the actions the plan will take to be in compliance with this section and provide to the Secretary additional comparative analyses described in subparagraph (A) that demonstrate compliance with this section not later than 45 days after the initial determination by the Secretary that the plan is not in compliance; and </content>
					</item>
					<item identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/B/iii/I/bb" id="H3F9A3D1DD6654E9AB0F5284EDA9CB633" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1734">
						<num value="bb">“(bb)</num>
						<content> following the 45-day corrective action period under item (aa), if the Secretary makes a final determination that the plan still is not in compliance with this section, not later than 7 days after such determination, shall notify all individuals enrolled in the plan that the plan has been determined to be not in compliance with this section. </content>
					</item>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/B/iii/II" id="HF4714692D53D4281AA1E53E052247AA6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1735">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<heading> Exemption from disclosure.—</heading>
					<content>Documents or communications produced in connection with the Secretary’s recommendations to a group health plan shall not be subject to disclosure pursuant to section 552 of title 5, United States Code.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/B/iv" id="H5F4AD5DFF4114DF0BD2EFD0B56D44081" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1735">
				<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
				<heading> Report.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this paragraph, and not later than October 1 of each year thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to Congress, and make publicly available, a report that contains—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/B/iv/I" id="HF12CFB835EC0436E84E5E03D4A56C8E0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1735">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> a summary of the comparative analyses requested under clause (i), including the identity of each group plan that is determined to be not in compliance after the final determination by the Secretary described in clause (iii)(I)(bb);</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/B/iv/II" id="HE18E0E8DD4D044CBA0CA8C7B2B6B511F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1735">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> the Secretary’s conclusions as to whether each group health plan submitted sufficient information for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses requested under clause (i) for compliance with this section;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/B/iv/III" id="H5D117CD2A37F4469B2721F8F3C991137" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1735">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> for each group health plan that did submit sufficient information for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses requested under clause (i), the Secretary’s conclusions as to whether and why the plan is in compliance with the disclosure requirements under this section;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/B/iv/IV" id="HAB68562C6CCD4DEA8FF9CF9C9D041994" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1735">
					<num value="IV">“(IV)</num>
					<content> the Secretary’s specifications described in clause (ii) for each group health plan that the Secretary determined did not submit sufficient information for the Secretary to review the comparative analyses requested under clause (i) for compliance with this section; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/B/iv/V" id="H1064855F6FE044EF88990BF20A36EE10" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1735">
					<num value="V">“(V)</num>
					<content> the Secretary’s specifications described in clause (iii) of the actions each group health plan that the Secretary determined is not in compliance with this section must take to be in compliance with this section, including the reason why the Secretary determined the plan is not in compliance.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/C" id="HC6E8650BD5D74AFEA8D0C72094A2CAF1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1735">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<heading> Compliance program guidance document update process.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/C/i" id="HD07810A73FFA4C6EBD8FD475003602DF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1735">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall include instances of noncompliance that the Secretary discovers upon reviewing the comparative analyses requested under subparagraph (B)(i) in the compliance program guidance document described in paragraph (6), as it is updated every 2 years, except that such instances shall not disclose any protected health information or individually identifiable information.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/C/ii" id="H2B03B1CEE4354E219CF67D091791D776" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1735">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Guidance and regulations.—</heading>
				<content>Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this paragraph, the Secretary shall finalize any draft or interim guidance and regulations relating to mental health parity under this section. Such draft guidance shall include guidance to clarify the process and timeline for current and potential participants and beneficiaries (and authorized representatives and health care providers of such participants and beneficiaries) with respect to plans to file complaints of such plans being in violation of this section, including guidance, by plan type, on the relevant State, regional, or national office with which such complaints should be filed.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tII/s203/a/3/qB/8/C/iii" id="H8FE106C8B72741E3B39CB8687D721BE4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1736">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> State.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall share information on findings of compliance and noncompliance discovered upon reviewing the comparative analyses requested under subparagraph (B)(i) shall be shared with the State where the group health plan is located, in accordance with paragraph (6)(B)(iii)(II).”</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;
