strike this#component(act):section("313"); insert <__xml__ id="H6993C0FC217B4BCC9B828131FCE6A30B" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313" id="H75E7D2BC672C4F7DAE75B2031D3C57DE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1742">
		<num value="313">“SEC. 313.</num>
		<heading> Public awareness campaign on the importance of vaccinations.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/a" id="HAEF3B54BFE324912A7C8EE7DAA894CC5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1742">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary, acting through the Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and in coordination with other offices and agencies, as appropriate, shall award competitive grants or contracts to one or more public or private entities to carry out a national, evidence-based campaign to increase awareness and knowledge of the safety and effectiveness of vaccines for the prevention and control of diseases, combat misinformation about vaccines, and disseminate scientific and evidence-based vaccine-related information, with the goal of increasing rates of vaccination across all ages, as applicable, particularly in communities with low rates of vaccination, to reduce and eliminate vaccine-preventable diseases.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/b" id="H79CBFF5A6A98456A9DB25E85169D0418" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1742">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Consultation.—</heading>
			<content>In carrying out the campaign under this section, the Secretary shall consult with appropriate public health and medical experts, including the National Academy of Medicine and medical and public health associations and nonprofit organizations, in the development, implementation, and evaluation of the evidence-based public awareness campaign.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/c" id="H0A520EBBA46C4F1C834D78CA21DC30B4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1742">
			<num value="c">“(c)</num>
			<heading> Requirements.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The campaign under this section shall—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/c/1" id="H987C0037C9FB4E6E90CEF6E14A7C87B2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1742">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> be a nationwide, evidence-based media and public engagement initiative;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/c/2" id="H78A2CDE6CEC04FD7B55E82BC13EBE7E4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1742">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> include the development of resources for communities with low rates of vaccination, including culturally and linguistically appropriate resources, as applicable;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/c/3" id="H527E4E10C5914FFA8384E98D3AC15092" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1742">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<content> include the dissemination of vaccine information and communication resources to public health departments, health care providers, and health care facilities, including such providers and facilities that provide prenatal and pediatric care;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/c/4" id="H75BE786C2B8D45AFBDC76F0982C57685" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1742">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<content> be complementary to, and coordinated with, any other Federal, State, local, or Tribal efforts, as appropriate; and</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/c/5" id="H236D87462ADD4AC986E721DD314AE998" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1742">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<content> assess the effectiveness of communication strategies to increase rates of vaccination.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/d" id="H309CF073A63B48F8B941034C0278B5BA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1742">
			<num value="d">“(d)</num>
			<heading> Additional activities.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The campaign under this section may—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/d/1" id="HBCCEEB891DB54B119D8D8DA245B3FB43" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1743">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> include the use of television, radio, the internet, and other media and telecommunications technologies;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/d/2" id="HFED19F3EA9F54A85B430090376C4F112" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1743">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> include the use of in-person activities;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/d/3" id="H42A21FA555594989A9CDD8B8887F6CAB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1743">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<content> be focused to address specific needs of communities and populations with low rates of vaccination; and</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/d/4" id="HDD3124A9EC8D493B93C39F65866F0CEA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1743">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<chapeau> include the dissemination of scientific and evidence-based vaccine-related information, such as—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/d/4/A" id="H51CAEDC5583947F592EF852A72EAFF2A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1743">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> advancements in evidence-based research related to diseases that may be prevented by vaccines and vaccine development;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/d/4/B" id="H40A660030EE94C069DC8093A20F261C7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1743">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> information on vaccinations for individuals and communities, including individuals for whom vaccines are not recommended by the Advisory Committee for Immunization Practices, and the effects of low vaccination rates within a community on such individuals;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/d/4/C" id="H4A5CFABDEB9B4C019D2B3EED2B08010E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1743">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> information on diseases that may be prevented by vaccines; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/d/4/D" id="H959876C0CF6D45AF88E100BC853BB645" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1743">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> information on vaccine safety and the systems in place to monitor vaccine safety.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/e" id="H6458490867B94E5C8DEEEB58AC5AD1FC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1743">
			<num value="e">“(e)</num>
			<heading> Evaluation.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The Secretary shall—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/e/1" id="H6195B02FDCE14B859D2CD4E259DF6DA9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1743">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> establish benchmarks and metrics to quantitatively measure and evaluate the awareness campaign under this section;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/e/2" id="HE3C3AB0C05B24072A2CA20326CB870B5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1743">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> conduct qualitative assessments regarding the awareness campaign under this section; and</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/e/3" id="H090F1621DDB24A4397313F96DF0E0270" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1743">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<content> prepare and submit to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions of the Senate and Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives an evaluation of the awareness campaign under this section.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/f" id="HC99D0D050685412E947C4190C0765EEA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1743">
			<num value="f">“(f)</num>
			<heading> Supplement not supplant.—</heading>
			<content>Funds appropriated under this section shall be used to supplement and not supplant other Federal, State, and local public funds provided for activities described in this section.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s311/a/qB/s313/g" id="H8FBA4F602F3944929DA68B3BE5388866" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1743">
			<num value="g">“(g)</num>
			<heading> Authorization of appropriations.—</heading>
			<content>There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section and subsections (k) and (n) of section 317, $15,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2025.”</content>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

insert after(paragraph( "(3)")) <__xml__ id="H04FD79CC097D4261B4DCEA8DAE413D5C" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stB/s315/qB/4" id="H587F8B3A909F43CBAA1133F17688B458" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1751">
		<num value="4">“(4)</num>
		<heading> Consultation.—</heading>
		<content>An entity described in paragraph (1)(A) or (1)(B) that applies for a grant or cooperative agreement under this section shall agree to consult or confer with entities described in paragraph (1)(C) and Native Hawaiian Health Care Systems, as applicable, in the applicable State with respect to the development and implementation of a statewide early intervention strategy.”</content>
	</paragraph>

	<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stC/s323/qB/3" id="H6EFCC6F7C40F479596D78E42238A896C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1752">
		<num value="3">“(3)</num>
		<heading> Applicability.—</heading>
		<content>This subsection applies to any drug designated under section 526 for which an application was approved under section 505 of this Act or licensed under section 351 of the Public Health Service Act after the date of enactment of the FDA Reauthorization Act of 2017, regardless of the date on which such drug was designated under section 526.”</content>

insert end <__xml__ id="HC44C68B0D1AF426C8B27A89B64845FC9" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stC/s325/a/qB/9" id="H27320F0C1B5E411CB417499F855BC642" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1755">
		<num value="9">“(9)</num>
		<heading> Public listing.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stC/s325/a/qB/9/A" id="H0777850E11A245AF91445BB857E7E82E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1755">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tIII/stC/s325/a/qB/9/A/i" id="H3CD9ED8E692F4010A05B0119255A2117" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1755">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> Initial publication.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this paragraph, the Secretary shall publish and make available to the public in a searchable, electronic format—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tIII/stC/s325/a/qB/9/A/i/I" id="H7E961892A9BC43F8904B247109EE93FA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1755">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> a list of each biological product, by nonproprietary name (proper name), for which, as of such date of enactment, a biologics license under subsection (a) or this subsection is in effect, or that, as of such date of enactment, is deemed to be licensed under this section pursuant to section 7002(e)(4) of the Biologics Price Competition and Innovation Act of 2009;</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tIII/stC/s325/a/qB/9/A/i/II" id="H5086C84D0129484E8DAAD34EE0622278" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1756">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> the date of licensure of the marketing application and the application number; and</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dBB/tIII/stC/s325/a/qB/9/A/i/III" id="H3054F166DA744D22A2906AB12A9A98BC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1756">
					<num value="III">“(III)</num>
					<content> with respect to each biological product described in subclause (I), the licensure status, and, as available, the marketing status.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tIII/stC/s325/a/qB/9/A/ii" id="HB3CBE966D39C406A9563FE9EC11C8427" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1756">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Revisions.—</heading>
				<content>Every 30 days after the publication of the first list under clause (i), the Secretary shall revise the list to include each biological product which has been licensed under subsection (a) or this subsection during the 30-day period or deemed licensed under this section pursuant to section 7002(e)(4) of the Biologics Price Competition and Innovation Act of 2009.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tIII/stC/s325/a/qB/9/A/iii" id="H92E2221931B34216A28A607D63F21696" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1756">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> Patent information.—</heading>
				<content>Not later than 30 days after a list of patents under subsection (l)(3)(A), or a supplement to such list under subsection (l)(7), has been provided by the reference product sponsor to the subsection (k) applicant respecting a biological product included on the list published under this subparagraph, the reference product sponsor shall provide such list of patents (or supplement thereto) and their corresponding expiry dates to the Secretary, and the Secretary shall, in revisions made under clause (ii), include such information for such biological product. Within 30 days of providing any subsequent or supplemental list of patents to any subsequent subsection (k) applicant under subsection (l)(3)(A) or (l)(7), the reference product sponsor shall update the information provided to the Secretary under this clause with any additional patents from such subsequent or supplemental list and their corresponding expiry dates.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tIII/stC/s325/a/qB/9/A/iv" id="H7806F7C57831466E95A3987DBCD37C29" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1756">
				<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
				<heading> Listing of exclusivities.—</heading>
				<content>For each biological product included on the list published under this subparagraph, the Secretary shall specify each exclusivity period under paragraph (6) or paragraph (7) for which the Secretary has determined such biological product to be eligible and that has not concluded. </content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dBB/tIII/stC/s325/a/qB/9/B" id="HC30D798F009C4A30AC045D816752E866" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1756">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Revocation or suspension of license.—</heading>
			<chapeau>If the license of a biological product is determined by the Secretary to have been revoked or suspended for safety, purity, or potency reasons, it may not be published in the list under subparagraph (A). If such revocation or suspension occurred after inclusion of such biological product in the list published under subparagraph (A), the reference product sponsor shall notify the Secretary that—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tIII/stC/s325/a/qB/9/B/i" id="H8DBBFDA25238435EBFCD2738BA873328" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1756">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> the biological product shall be immediately removed from such list for the same period as the revocation or suspension; and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dBB/tIII/stC/s325/a/qB/9/B/ii" id="H747F23374F454EDE9AC085C3B05495E0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1756">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> a notice of the removal shall be published in the Federal Register.”</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

	<subsection identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s120/a/2/A/qB/m" id="H5B94859A64D3441B96D3D7BCAE555AF1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1773">
		<num value="m">“(m)</num>
		<content> Beginning January 1, 2023, the Secretary may establish special enrollment periods in the case of individuals who satisfy paragraph (1) or (2) of section 1836(a) and meet such exceptional conditions as the Secretary may provide.”</content>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>#component(subsection());

insert end <__xml__ id="H463413AB219F431B849022E9EE111EE2" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s120/a/2/B/qB/g" id="H7DE5BAA24ED542CA93E4FEE090671235" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1773">
		<num value="g">“(g)</num>
		<content> Notwithstanding subsection (a), in the case of an individual who enrolls during a special enrollment period pursuant to section 1837(m), the coverage period shall begin on a date the Secretary provides in a manner consistent (to the extent practicable) with protecting continuity of health benefit coverage.”</content>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>#component(subsection());

	<subsection identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s120/b/qB/e" id="H617105595B7E458CB8457305AB04F0EC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1774">
		<num value="e">“(e)</num>
		<heading> Funding for implementation of beneficiary enrollment simplification.—</heading>
		<content>For purposes of carrying out the provisions of and the amendments made by section 120 of division CC of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021, the Secretary shall provide for the transfer, from the Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Fund under section 1817 and the Federal Supplementary Medical Insurance Trust Fund under section 1841 (in such proportion as the Secretary determines appropriate), to the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services Program Management Account, of $2,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2030, to remain available until expended.”</content>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>#component(subsection());

cite.cite_text: Section 1808 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395b–9)

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H86936122E9364F59AAEDDC3B0507B7D3" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6" id="H8AD10FB4224B483EA6F35FFB2FBE798F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1776">
		<num value="6">“(6)</num>
		<heading> Public-private partnership for waste, fraud, and abuse detection.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/A" id="HD3A1837078944D39AEEFAA00A2CCC6BA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1776">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>Under the program described in paragraph (1), there is established a public-private partnership (in this paragraph referred to as the ‘<quotedText>partnership</quotedText>’) of health plans, Federal and State agencies, law enforcement agencies, health care anti-fraud organizations, and any other entity determined appropriate by the Secretary (in this paragraph referred to as ‘<quotedText>partners</quotedText>’) for purposes of detecting and preventing health care waste, fraud, and abuse.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/B" id="HA83AC68561FC4D60B79B7E4BC458B592" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1776">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Contract with trusted third party.—</heading>
			<content>In carrying out the partnership, the Secretary shall enter into a contract with a trusted third party for purposes of carrying out the duties of the partnership described in subparagraph (C).</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/C" id="H651A06D1B01142188246E60F36A74950" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1776">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<heading> Duties of partnership.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The partnership shall—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/C/i" id="HC1076E0DE0CA420D8DE2864EEC1FE580" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1776">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> provide technical and operational support to facilitate data sharing between partners in the partnership;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/C/ii" id="H62586A959A6F43A3BA6A418640AED283" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1776">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> analyze data so shared to identify fraudulent and aberrant billing patterns;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/C/iii" id="H0A04A78997844D31A644AD679480B56B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<content> conduct aggregate analyses of health care data so shared across Federal, State, and private health plans for purposes of detecting fraud, waste, and abuse schemes;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/C/iv" id="H07EEEAF244AF49E5BB0FAD8B8D197E10" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
				<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
				<content> identify outlier trends and potential vulnerabilities of partners in the partnership with respect to such schemes;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/C/v" id="HAA7D003AE6054DB0811FBBAADCEA1E4F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
				<num value="v">“(v)</num>
				<content> refer specific cases of potential unlawful conduct to appropriate governmental entities;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/C/vi" id="H11B12E55FA784AA9A9B42BC70EBAD02A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
				<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
				<content> convene, not less than annually, meetings with partners in the partnership for purposes of providing updates on the partnership’s work and facilitating information sharing between the partners;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/C/vii" id="H7742A4A6516E46DCA5393969075A8AC0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
				<num value="vii">“(vii)</num>
				<content> enter into data sharing and data use agreements with partners in the partnership in such a manner so as to ensure the partnership has access to data necessary to identify waste, fraud, and abuse while maintaining the confidentiality and integrity of such data;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/C/viii" id="H522CF2461B3445F99DF5E8CF25FD415B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
				<num value="viii">“(viii)</num>
				<content> provide partners in the partnership with plan-specific, confidential feedback on any aberrant billing patterns or potential fraud identified by the partnership with respect to such partner;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/C/ix" id="H57306B1728A7430095E83C011810C219" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
				<num value="ix">“(ix)</num>
				<content> establish a process by which entities described in subparagraph (A) may enter the partnership and requirements such entities must meet to enter the partnership;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/C/x" id="HCF81BCB1FD904CE994C8814C3FF96D20" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
				<num value="x">“(x)</num>
				<content> provide appropriate training, outreach, and education to partners based on the results of data analyses described in clauses (ii) and (iii); and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/C/xi" id="H4DE0954AAEB543D4AF1D0D72E42BC9BC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
				<num value="xi">“(xi)</num>
				<content> perform such other duties as the Secretary determines appropriate.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/D" id="HAC5C2C84125B4B40A68A1D1AEAA4A6EC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
			<num value="D">“(D)</num>
			<heading> Substance use disorder treatment analysis.—</heading>
			<content>Not later than 2 years after the date of the enactment of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021, the trusted third party with a contract in effect under subparagraph (B) shall perform an analysis of aberrant or fraudulent billing patterns and trends with respect to providers and suppliers of substance use disorder treatments from data shared with the partnership.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/E" id="H6FDC3AD6726843BA924A6C626DF2F60F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
			<num value="E">“(E)</num>
			<heading> Executive Board.—</heading>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/E/i" id="HFE254CA790BD414BA490F8B4C833139D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<heading> Executive Board composition.—</heading>
				<subclause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/E/i/I" id="H61AA687BCAF94150825A1B6F0D67AEA6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<content>There shall be an executive board of the partnership comprised of representatives of the Federal Government and representatives of the private sector selected by the Secretary.</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/E/i/II" id="H9534BFB0D6F442CEBF7CE125862CD7F7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<heading> Chairs.—</heading>
					<content>The executive board shall be co-chaired by one Federal Government official and one representative from the private sector.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/E/ii" id="HC477307F72134C559324A2C737A856F7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<heading> Meetings.—</heading>
				<content>The executive board of the partnership shall meet at least once per year.</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/E/iii" id="H7DA7A199E79A4517903D31338108DAF5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<heading> Executive board duties.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The duties of the executive board shall include the following:</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/E/iii/I" id="H5C65416AB1C642B99F0287B5120AE5B5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1777">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> Providing strategic direction for the partnership, including membership criteria and a mission statement.</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/E/iii/II" id="H6D89E384A94A4005AB0F4FF2CD341C8C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> Communicating with the leadership of the Department of Health and Human Services and the Department of Justice and the various private health sector associations.</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/F" id="H587DE15299934E37AEE7FAD9EE93A91D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
			<num value="F">“(F)</num>
			<heading> Reports.—</heading>
			<chapeau>Not later than January 1, 2023, and every 2 years thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to Congress and make available on the public website of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services a report containing—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/F/i" id="H72B017F87A9D4D88AAB51195B4D50FE9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> a review of activities conducted by the partnership over the 2-year period ending on the date of the submission of such report, including any progress to any objectives established by the partnership;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/F/ii" id="HA4BF5700B9CB4ED5A5AD4137FD7C98D7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> any savings voluntarily reported by health plans participating in the partnership attributable to the partnership during such period;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/F/iii" id="H3B145ACAEA3741B48909492D4BA099E7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<content> any savings to the Federal Government attributable to the partnership during such period;</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/F/iv" id="H3183F9BE93A74EDDBBF149D7F7DD8DBC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
				<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
				<content> any other outcomes attributable to the partnership, as determined by the Secretary, during such period; and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/F/v" id="H7DD6316EEF8042E28E04054C5005D9C1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
				<num value="v">“(v)</num>
				<content> a strategic plan for the 2-year period beginning on the day after the date of the submission of such report, including a description of any emerging fraud and abuse schemes, trends, or practices that the partnership intends to study during such period.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/G" id="H19D9C358DE124AF49987C9A6AF118C9E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
			<num value="G">“(G)</num>
			<heading> Funding.—</heading>
			<content>The partnership shall be funded by amounts otherwise made available to the Secretary for carrying out the program described in paragraph (1).</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/H" id="H4DCC79A9B80248DE8B3FFE0ED9C78668" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
			<num value="H">“(H)</num>
			<heading> Transitional provisions.—</heading>
			<content>To the extent consistent with this subsection, all functions, personnel, assets, liabilities, and administrative actions applicable on the date before the date of the enactment of this paragraph to the National Fraud Prevention Partnership established on September 17, 2012, by charter of the Secretary shall be transferred to the partnership established under subparagraph (A) as of the date of the enactment of this paragraph.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/I" id="H047D71F359744615BBBCDA84BD58575C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
			<num value="I">“(I)</num>
			<heading> Nonapplicability of FACA.—</heading>
			<content>The provisions of the Federal Advisory Committee Act shall not apply to the partnership established by subparagraph (A).</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/J" id="HD4810D193214408A8DB07B1CDC6E8B75" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
			<num value="J">“(J)</num>
			<heading> Implementation.—</heading>
			<content>Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Secretary may implement the partnership established by subparagraph (A) by program instruction or otherwise.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/K" id="HBFC2F560F86A4A3F86F4BDE67F5B641C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
			<num value="K">“(K)</num>
			<heading> Definition.—</heading>
			<chapeau>For purposes of this paragraph, the term ‘<quotedText>trusted third party</quotedText>’ means an entity that—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/K/i" id="H5B046B283A544382B7F07C25E2D8114A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> demonstrates the capability to carry out the duties of the partnership described in subparagraph (C);</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/K/ii" id="HCD3C97B8641B483E9700892762A0F98C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> complies with such conflict of interest standards determined appropriate by the Secretary; and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s124/a/qB/6/K/iii" id="HA001A7B8E27243E485EB84B8FD177409" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1778">
				<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
				<content> meets such other requirements as the Secretary may prescribe.”</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>#component(paragraph());

cite.cite_text: Section 1128C(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1320a–7c(a))
Section 1861 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395x)
Section 1833(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395l(a))

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H5A38F22102F8424990E6B6F4D5AFE123" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x" id="H693F2FF79E644068BFA6E182C66FFC16" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1783">
		<num value="x">“(x)</num>
		<heading> Payment rules relating to rural emergency hospitals.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/1" id="HE822E8E0E9764D97928A499F52E5CE90" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1783">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> Payment for rural emergency hospital services.—</heading>
			<content>In the case of rural emergency hospital services (as defined in section 1861(kkk)(1)), furnished by a rural emergency hospital (as defined in section 1861(kkk)(2)) on or after January 1, 2023, the amount of payment for such services shall be equal to the amount of payment that would otherwise apply under section 1833(t) for covered OPD services (as defined in section 1833(t)(1)(B) (other than clause (ii) of such section)), increased by 5 percent to reflect the higher costs incurred by such hospitals, and shall include the application of any copayment amount determined under section 1833(t)(8) as if such increase had not occurred.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/2" id="HBCD00EDF3921466486FA44CE109B7CE5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1783">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Additional facility payment.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/2/A" id="H5F89420986F44B419485B715C07770C9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1783">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall make monthly payments to a rural emergency hospital in an amount that is equal to 1/12 of the annual additional facility payment specified in subparagraph (B).</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/2/B" id="H4FEE37CD8F2846CA991E7BFBFB46E913" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1783">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Annual additional facility payment amount.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The annual additional facility payment amount specified in this subparagraph is—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/2/B/i" id="HE1EF6B499FB64DA6820621377E6B70A2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1783">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> for 2023, a Medicare subsidy amount determined under subparagraph (C); and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/2/B/ii" id="H82F90E380B144093977FA10C363B454F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1783">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> for 2024 and each subsequent year, the amount determined under this subparagraph for the preceding year, increased by the hospital market basket percentage increase.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/2/C" id="H1C1AAB64D23D4092AC5B85EC8E0906C4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1783">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<heading> Determination of Medicare subsidy amount.—</heading>
				<chapeau>For purposes of subparagraph (B)(i), the Medicare subsidy amount determined under this subparagraph is an amount equal to—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/2/C/i" id="H48D80635C5FD4EA48AA4A0F41E8F8771" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1783">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<chapeau> the excess (if any) of—</chapeau>
					<subclause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/2/C/i/I" id="HE15BB5BBA872471889C21B74EC8FE235" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1783">
						<num value="I">“(I)</num>
						<content> the total amount that the Secretary determines was paid under this title to all critical access hospitals in 2019; over</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/2/C/i/II" id="H1221B4BDD07D4B73B0D2253834381942" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1783">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> the estimated total amount that the Secretary determines would have been paid under this title to such hospitals in 2019 if payment were made for inpatient hospital, outpatient hospital, and skilled nursing facility services under the applicable prospective payment systems for such services during such year; divided by</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/2/C/ii" id="H3DF28E4187154922BEDB773BC3BAACEA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1783">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> the total number of such hospitals in 2019.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/2/D" id="H47C02E2E56BF4AE48EABDFCF90163F69" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1783">
				<num value="D">“(D)</num>
				<heading> Reporting on use of the additional facility payment.—</heading>
				<content>A rural emergency hospital receiving the additional facility payment under this paragraph shall maintain detailed information as specified by the Secretary as to how the facility has used the additional facility payments. Such information shall be made available to the Secretary upon request. </content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/3" id="HC398CAC4643F43B192B2D157A3CEEC95" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1784">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> Payment for ambulance services.—</heading>
			<content>For provisions relating to payment for ambulance services furnished by an entity owned and operated by a rural emergency hospital, see section 1834(l).</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/4" id="H9B6EC51BA9C444D8BD2CCA33AB6E3708" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1784">
			<num value="4">“(4)</num>
			<heading> Payment for post-hospital extended care services.—</heading>
			<content>For provisions relating to payment for post-hospital extended care services furnished by a rural emergency hospital that has a unit that is a distinct part licensed as a skilled nursing facility, see section 1888(e).</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/5" id="HAB34CC83A3D64F0FA43E4F3D7C25CC37" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1784">
			<num value="5">“(5)</num>
			<heading> Source of payments.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/5/A" id="H632C20403E42432C8BB6369DD7E64CE4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1784">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>Except as provided in subparagraph (B), payments under this subsection shall be made from the Federal Supplementary Medical Insurance Trust Fund under section 1841.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/a/2/B/qB/x/5/B" id="H9798C7B5168242949E9355F806AFB474" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1784">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Additional facility payment and post-hospital extended care services.—</heading>
				<content>Payments under paragraph (2) shall be made from the Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Fund under section 1817.”</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>#component(subsection());

	<subclause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s125/c/qB/XI" id="H6943170326924ED88456F108827E3B4E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1785">
		<num value="XI">“(XI)</num>
		<content> A rural emergency hospital (as defined in section 1861(kkk)(2)).”</content>
	</subclause>
</__xml__>#component(subclause());

execution.ampl: insert before(is_end_of(nth(1,sentence()),search('.'))) ", or whether a facility is a rural emergency hospital as defined in section 1861(kkk)(2).;

	<subclause identifier="/dCC/tI/stB/s134/a/qB/VI" id="H17D65DEFDA7F4FCAA815BC6DAF141DE3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1796">
		<num value="VI">“(VI)</num>
		<content> Blood clotting factors indicated for the treatment of patients with hemophilia and other bleeding disorders (identified as of July 1, 2020, by HCPCS codes J7170, J7175, J7177–J7183, J7185–J7190, J7192–J7195, J7198–J7203, J7205, J7207–J7211, and as subsequently modified by the Secretary) and items and services related to the furnishing of such factors under section 1842(o)(5)(C), and any additional blood clotting factors identified by the Secretary and items and services related to the furnishing of such factors under such section.”</content>
	</subclause>

cite.cite_text: Section 1888(e)(2)(A)(iii) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395yy(e)(2)(A)(iii))

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H4C1FDB7D85B7431CA9F385D888E23895" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb" id="HE22D8D8C4ED24BB596F6C6C917665973" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1796">
		<num value="bb">“(bb)</num>
		<heading> Supplemental payment reporting requirements.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/1" id="H51E045FBB5024110AACB9B67CD5DDB63" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1796">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> Collection and availability of supplemental payment data.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/1/A" id="HF87BB3139B8940CBA7C8F24CA7CAE56A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1796">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>Not later than October 1, 2021, the Secretary shall establish a system for each State to submit reports, as determined appropriate by the Secretary, on supplemental payments data, as a requirement for a State plan or State plan amendment that would provide for a supplemental payment.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/1/B" id="HF219AA35E9DA4C4D854D0056A8CB0F68" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1797">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Requirements.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Each report submitted by a State in accordance with the requirement established under subparagraph (A) shall include the following:</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/1/B/i" id="HAE08FE1AB71D474FA395656B273C6502" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1797">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> An explanation of how supplemental payments made under the State plan or a State plan amendment will result in payments that are consistent with section 1902(a)(30)(A), including standards with respect to efficiency, economy, quality of care, and access, along with the stated purpose and intended effects of the supplemental payment.</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/1/B/ii" id="H84E301C50E63444C9B82DBCFAC1445A2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1797">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> The criteria used to determine which providers are eligible to receive the supplemental payment.</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/1/B/iii" id="H51BD02EA4E004E85B4FB1760B0ED9FC5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1797">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<chapeau> A comprehensive description of the methodology used to calculate the amount of, and distribute, the supplemental payment to each eligible provider, including—</chapeau>
					<subclause identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/1/B/iii/I" id="H9F1F7C4FCAE24797A5FFD72F199551DB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1797">
						<num value="I">“(I)</num>
						<content> data on the amount of the supplemental payment made to each eligible provider, if known, or, if the total amount is distributed using a formula based on data from 1 or more fiscal years, data on the total amount of the supplemental payments for the fiscal year or years available to all providers eligible to receive a supplemental payment;</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/1/B/iii/II" id="H9F5DA0DDA2EE4A8F987D8204A8F14C3A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1797">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> if applicable, the specific criteria with respect to Medicaid service, utilization, or cost data to be used as the basis for calculations regarding the amount or distribution of the supplemental payment; and</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/1/B/iii/III" id="H68ABF72A0AE749739301E3EB87E514A6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1797">
						<num value="III">“(III)</num>
						<content> the timing of the supplemental payment made to each eligible provider.</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/1/B/iv" id="H431E088FBEA94F298E0A6D2727CAB344" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1797">
					<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
					<content> An assurance that the total Medicaid payments made to an inpatient hospital provider, including the supplemental payment, will not exceed upper payment limits.</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/1/B/v" id="HE640F73F96804CB8B4B70C817C6C2A34" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1797">
					<num value="v">“(v)</num>
					<content> If not already submitted, an upper payment limit demonstration under section 447.272 of title 42, Code of Federal Regulations (as such section is in effect as of the date of enactment of this subsection).</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/1/C" id="H94E2018698E34F31BAA63B7F92E1E53B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1797">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<heading> Public availability.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall make all reports and related data submitted under this paragraph publicly available on the website of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services on a timely basis.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/2" id="H32DB78EEF5784BAA9A83FF7E72E836ED" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1797">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Supplemental payment defined.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/2/A" id="HE9915C772F034F43A2EE059670924A6D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1797">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>Subject to subparagraph (B), in this subsection, the term ‘<quotedText>supplemental payment</quotedText>’ means a payment to a provider that is in addition to any base payment made to the provider under the State plan under this title or under demonstration authority.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s202/qB/bb/2/B" id="H883DD1375AAD4CFCB7B94F4360EB412D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1797">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> DSH payments excluded.—</heading>
				<content>Such term does not include a disproportionate share hospital payment made under section 1923.”</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>#component(subsection());

cite.cite_text: Section 1903 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396b)

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H6CE063E3EC044D13BE50F1E65EC30A94" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g" id="H7284D17A685C4CE2B71E642579FE5A34" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1797">
		<num value="g">“(g)</num>
		<heading> Limit on amount of payment to hospital.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/1" id="H681EF9C5167C4BBCB1ECC7A232D660D1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/1/A" id="H58562E18930A48B49A9F0275930E5190" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> Amount of adjustment subject to uncompensated costs.—</heading>
				<chapeau>A payment adjustment during a fiscal year shall not be considered to be consistent with subsection (c) with respect to a hospital (other than a hospital described in paragraph (2)(B)) if the payment adjustment exceeds an amount equal to— </chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/1/A/i" id="H71317BD4FAEB481EAFDE7FA1500A2B96" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> the costs incurred during the year of furnishing hospital services by the hospital to individuals described in subparagraph (B) minus—</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/1/A/ii" id="H6E56FB3C5EB74B7FB38E4D37644A77E8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<chapeau> the sum of—</chapeau>
					<subclause identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/1/A/ii/I" id="H81A72048A7E745C28D1D2412DF092047" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
						<num value="I">“(I)</num>
						<content> payments under this title (other than under this section) for such services; and</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/1/A/ii/II" id="H8C1DBF3A81DF4E289252CC1276D8A2FB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> payments by uninsured patients for such services.</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/1/B" id="H879947D4331A4788806AAC2D072BA51D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Individuals described.—</heading>
				<chapeau>For purposes of subparagraph (A), the individuals described in this clause are the following:</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/1/B/i" id="H8EFA2627CCDF4C09AE3015725F4D1C0C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> Individuals who are eligible for medical assistance under the State plan or under a waiver of such plan and for whom the State plan or waiver is the primary payor for such services.</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/1/B/ii" id="H686151A6B29E4A00BD2269151B5931A2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> Subject to subparagraph (C), individuals who have no health insurance (or other source of third party coverage) for services provided during the year, as determined by the Secretary.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/1/C" id="HD3F8FF1F67AF475693053BFD8E59C069" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<heading> Exclusion of certain payments.—</heading>
				<content>For purposes of subparagraph (B)(ii), payments made to a hospital for services provided to indigent patients made by a State or a unit of local government within a State shall not be considered to be a source of third party coverage.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/2" id="HBC47DCF39278406091DCE08A8A081015" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Application of limits for certain hospitals.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/2/A" id="HE8F1D9A7C0734D939A4444FADD4FE949" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>A payment adjustment during a fiscal year shall not be considered to be consistent with subsection (c) with respect to a hospital described in subparagraph (B) if the payment adjustment exceeds the higher of—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/2/A/i" id="H0D0FDB5297C14AB9AE73EF75911D52CB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> the amount determined for the hospital and fiscal year under paragraph (1)(A); and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/2/A/ii" id="H299FE98699FD420ABBA7417F2BBF7E25" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> the amount determined for the hospital under paragraph (1)(A) as in effect on January 1, 2020.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/2/B" id="HF2F1692705D540F2ADEA699A4FB881FC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Hospitals described.—</heading>
				<chapeau>A hospital is described in this subparagraph for a fiscal year if, for the most recent cost reporting period, the hospital is in at least the 97th percentile of all hospitals with respect to—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/2/B/i" id="H1254CBB97B2B4A8A8D996D8C81407579" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> the number of inpatient days for such period that were made up of patients who (for such days) were entitled to benefits under part A of title XVIII and were entitled to supplemental security income benefits under title XVI (excluding any State supplementary benefits paid with respect to such patients); or</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dCC/tII/s203/a/qB/g/2/B/ii" id="H33BEB6B841224588B7434F35ADC62E4C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1798">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> the percentage of total inpatient days that were made up of patients who (for such days) were described in clause (i).”</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

	<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tII/s208/a/qB/G" id="H505ADD80DF404926A098FD88F3555DAC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1804">
		<num value="G">“(G)</num>
		<heading> Medicaid exception for citizens of Freely Associated States.—</heading>
		<content>With respect to eligibility for benefits for the designated Federal program defined in paragraph (3)(C) (relating to the Medicaid program), paragraph (1) shall not apply to any individual who lawfully resides in 1 of the 50 States or the District of Columbia in accordance with the Compacts of Free Association between the Government of the United States and the Governments of the Federated States of Micronesia, the Republic of the Marshall Islands, and the Republic of Palau and shall not apply, at the option of the Governor of Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, or American Samoa as communicated to the Secretary of Health and Human Services in writing, to any individual who lawfully resides in the respective territory in accordance with such Compacts.”</content>
	</subparagraph>
</__xml__>#component(subparagraph());

		<num value="3">“(3)</num>
		<heading> Exception for citizens of freely associated States.—</heading>
		<content>An individual described in section 402(b)(2)(G), but only with respect to the designated Federal program defined in section 402(b)(3)(C).”</content>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>#component(paragraph());

	<subsection identifier="/dCC/tIV/s405/qB/g" id="H524BCE655F074181A4466C830FEB03D4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1821">
		<num value="g">“(g)</num>
		<heading> Payment adjustment for certain drugs for which there is a self-administered NDC.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dCC/tIV/s405/qB/g/1" id="H509139A0551B4DB2BE81CE6EF723ED90" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1821">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> OIG studies.—</heading>
			<content>The Inspector General of the Department of Health and Human Services shall conduct periodic studies to identify National Drug Codes for drug or biological products that are self-administered for which payment may not be made under this part because such products are not covered pursuant to section 1861(s)(2) and which the Inspector General determines (based on the same or similar methodologies to the methodologies used in the final recommendation followup report of the Inspector General described in paragraph (3) or in the November 2017 final report of the Inspector General entitled ‘<quotedText>Excluding Noncovered Versions When Setting Payment for Two Part B Drugs Would Have Resulted in Lower Drug Costs for Medicare and its Beneficiaries</quotedText>’) should be excluded from the determination of the payment amount under this section. </content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dCC/tIV/s405/qB/g/2" id="H44A8C2CAD3FA44A5A4D3D550D111387A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1822">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Payment adjustment.—</heading>
			<chapeau>If the Inspector General identifies a National Drug Code for a drug or biological product under paragraph (1), the Inspector General shall inform the Secretary (at such times as the Secretary may specify to carry out this paragraph) and the Secretary shall, to the extent the Secretary deems appropriate, apply as the amount of payment under this section for the applicable billing and payment code the lesser of—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tIV/s405/qB/g/2/A" id="H5F4800282B764C09B2990A9432056608" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1822">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> the amount of payment that would be determined under this section for such billing and payment code if such National Drug Code for such product so identified under paragraph (1) were excluded from such determination; or </content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tIV/s405/qB/g/2/B" id="HA3A78BB69A0B48C8BACFC43C609C136E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1822">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> the amount of payment otherwise determined under this section for such billing and payment code without application of this subsection.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dCC/tIV/s405/qB/g/3" id="HB39EC0CD8E22480392C34DC328C7A2B4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1822">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> Application to certain identified products.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In the case of a National Drug Code for a drug or biological product that is self-administered for which payment is not made under this part because such product is not covered pursuant to section 1861(s)(2) that was identified by the Inspector General of the Department of Health and Human Services in the final recommendation followup report of the Inspector General published July 2020, entitled Loophole in Drug Payment Rule Continues To Cost Medicare and Beneficiaries Hundreds of Millions of Dollars, beginning July 1, 2021, the amount of payment under this section for the applicable billing and payment code shall be the lesser of—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tIV/s405/qB/g/3/A" id="H1681964BCA0F42B3BDDEDBC40598F1A3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1822">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> the amount of payment that would be determined under this section for such billing and payment code if such National Drug Code for such drug or biological products so identified were excluded from such determination; or</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dCC/tIV/s405/qB/g/3/B" id="H82F68AA5980149298DE7E8C5FDF3EDE5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1822">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> the amount of payment otherwise determined under this section for such billing and payment code without application of this subsection.”</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

	<paragraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s106/a/1/qB/4" id="H9E86730D77DF488784046FD0BFE310C1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1860">
		<num value="4">“(4)</num>
		<heading> Exemption for aging process of beer, wine, and distilled spirits.—</heading>
		<chapeau>For purposes of this subsection, the production period shall not include the aging period for—</chapeau>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s106/a/1/qB/4/A" id="HB6A4912150D945C3A7952373219E0B0A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1860">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<content> beer (as defined in section 5052(a)),</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s106/a/1/qB/4/B" id="H89BBFB24089145718A6F66746B2AB0FF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1861">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<content> wine (as described in section 5041(a)), or</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s106/a/1/qB/4/C" id="H30BC77EBD2A147468286FBF6488FCF12" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1861">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<content> distilled spirits (as defined in section 5002(a)(8)), except such spirits that are unfit for use for beverage purposes.”</content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 263A(f)(4)

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="HA33F4254731A4AE8AB8223D1E51D4CB0" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s106/c/1/qB/s5414" id="HC4FE8C3700D74B9289C67A4A376A5DC3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1862">
		<num value="5414">“SEC. 5414.</num>
		<heading> Transfer of beer between bonded facilities.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s106/c/1/qB/s5414/a" id="H9C23E73E82F94EC6BA22C372D9CEC578" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1862">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<chapeau>Beer may be removed from one brewery to another brewery, without payment of tax, and may be mingled with beer at the receiving brewery, subject to such conditions, including payment of the tax, and in such containers, as the Secretary by regulations shall prescribe, which shall include—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s106/c/1/qB/s5414/a/1" id="H5CD55B1520BA40B1B35AF48B1A8EBAE3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1862">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> any removal from one brewery to another brewery belonging to the same brewer,</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s106/c/1/qB/s5414/a/2" id="H02B72BF38F8D4C8D8CFE6D0ECFDBEA84" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1862">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<chapeau> any removal from a brewery owned by one corporation to a brewery owned by another corporation when—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s106/c/1/qB/s5414/a/2/A" id="H46549F51ACDA4333AA714AB46E98BDB3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1862">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> one such corporation owns the controlling interest in the other such corporation, or</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s106/c/1/qB/s5414/a/2/B" id="H7437271AA4F24378BD9A3238E833FD42" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1862">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> the controlling interest in each such corporation is owned by the same person or persons, and</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s106/c/1/qB/s5414/a/3" id="H50276B6C5698419AA57FF9B49A56D703" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1862">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<chapeau> any removal from one brewery to another brewery when—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s106/c/1/qB/s5414/a/3/A" id="HB02F60A157674955A27866A331141379" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1862">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> the proprietors of transferring and receiving premises are independent of each other and neither has a proprietary interest, directly or indirectly, in the business of the other, and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s106/c/1/qB/s5414/a/3/B" id="HCC2CE75BBFA741F1BB3EF684DC0DAD75" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1862">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> the transferor has divested itself of all interest in the beer so transferred and the transferee has accepted responsibility for payment of the tax.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s106/c/1/qB/s5414/b" id="H82867F34D64740F2A72EBF718AA3D7AD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1862">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Transfer of liability for tax.—</heading>
			<content>For purposes of subsection (a)(3), such relief from liability shall be effective from the time of removal from the transferor’s premises, or from the time of divestment of interest, whichever is later.”</content>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

insert end <__xml__ id="H8DDAB2D9A19442B9A51EBEF49672104B" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/a/1/qB/4" id="HF091BC8D45AA4D1BA7DBEAF354333DD9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1864">
		<num value="4">“(4)</num>
		<heading> Refunds in lieu of reduced rates for foreign production removed after December 31, 2022.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/a/1/qB/4/A" id="H38985EF1EAFA48CEA964AE6FB18011CF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1864">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In the case of any proof gallons of distilled spirits which have been produced outside the United States and imported into the United States, if such proof gallons of distilled spirits are removed after December 31, 2022—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/a/1/qB/4/A/i" id="H5FB2686ED9EB4D7797E1DF9CA6F5386B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1864">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> paragraph (1) shall not apply, and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/a/1/qB/4/A/ii" id="H3426AC1B8839487984588DB63CF88902" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1864">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> the amount determined under subparagraph (B) shall be allowed as a refund, determined for periods not less frequently than quarterly, to the importer in the same manner as if such amount were an overpayment of tax imposed by this section.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/a/1/qB/4/B" id="H06F25BE04C064D4CA2FBD5072532AB82" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1864">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Amount of refund.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The amount determined under this subparagraph with respect to any importer for any period is an amount equal to the sum of—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/a/1/qB/4/B/i" id="H36FD45B688AF4C8F99001EB1F1BA2E52" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1864">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<chapeau> the excess (if any) of—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/a/1/qB/4/B/i/I" id="H88AC9152BE7D4D78BE74670E5F9185BB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1864">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> the amount of tax imposed under this subpart on proof gallons of distilled spirits referred to in subparagraph (A) which were removed during such period, over</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/a/1/qB/4/B/i/II" id="H54A1024DF94244D3B57E0AE6046413D1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1865">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> the amount of tax which would have been imposed under this subpart on such proof gallons of distilled spirits if this section were applied without regard to this paragraph, plus</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/a/1/qB/4/B/ii" id="H32C855D43D804AB19211B70FACE603B4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1865">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> the amount of interest which would be allowed and paid on an overpayment of tax at the overpayment rate established under section 6621(a)(1) (without regard to the second sentence thereof) were such rate applied to the excess (if any) determined under clause (i) for the number of days in the filing period for which the refund under this paragraph is being determined.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/a/1/qB/4/C" id="HAB69704180084F54A2A673FC3974DC67" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1865">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<heading> Application of rules related to elections and assignments.—</heading>
			<content>Subparagraph (A)(ii) shall apply only if the importer is an electing importer under paragraph (3) and the proof gallons of distilled spirits have been assigned to the importer pursuant to such paragraph.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/a/1/qB/4/D" id="HE2AB19037EA6426BA2A1799A7A5A8462" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1865">
			<num value="D">“(D)</num>
			<heading> Rules for refunds within 90 days.—</heading>
			<content>For purposes of refunds allowed under this paragraph, section 6611(e) shall be applied by substituting ‘<quotedText>90 days</quotedText>’ for ‘<quotedText>45 days</quotedText>’ each place it appears.”</content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>#component(paragraph());

				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>

			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/b/1/qB/6/B" id="H3EF8316D513D44D48A6669E2A111B955" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1865">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Amount of refund.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The amount determined under this subparagraph with respect to any importer for any period is an amount equal to the sum of—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/b/1/qB/6/B/i" id="H8E84A235F7BE444EB5C9AF28A5A694BF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1865">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<chapeau> excess (if any) of—</chapeau>
				<subclause identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/b/1/qB/6/B/i/I" id="H2B735AC5FCF54FF1869D161773CB6259" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1866">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content> the amount of tax imposed under this section on barrels of beer referred to in subparagraph (A) which were removed during such period, over</content>
				</subclause>
				<subclause identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/b/1/qB/6/B/i/II" id="HD0D666B6D71048B78740D4AFCE0DDA52" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1866">
					<num value="II">“(II)</num>
					<content> the amount of tax which would have been imposed under this section on such barrels of beer if this section were applied without regard to this paragraph, plus</content>
				</subclause>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/b/1/qB/6/B/ii" id="H76E57E166AB444AA8E61E2FE0DB09AA5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1866">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> the amount of interest which would be allowed and paid on an overpayment of tax at the overpayment rate established under section 6621(a)(1) (without regard to the second sentence thereof) were such rate applied to the excess (if any) determined under clause (i) for the number of days in the filing period for which the refund under this paragraph is being determined.</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/b/1/qB/6/C" id="H971CA48200554FDBBB823A1299FD037E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1866">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<heading> Application of rules related to elections and assignments.—</heading>
			<content>Subparagraph (A)(ii) shall apply only if the importer is an electing importer under paragraph (4) and the barrels of beer have been assigned to the importer pursuant to such paragraph.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s107/b/1/qB/6/D" id="HD26DCBE01EDF46AABEA37904EFC7593D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1866">
			<num value="D">“(D)</num>
			<heading> Rules for refunds within 90 days.—</heading>
			<content>For purposes of refunds allowed under this paragraph, section 6611(e) shall be applied by substituting ‘<quotedText>90 days</quotedText>’ for ‘<quotedText>45 days</quotedText>’ each place it appears.”</content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>#component(paragraph());

	<section identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s108/a/qB/s5067" id="H6C1B79B03F344A40AD904216336DF76D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1868">
		<num value="5067">“SEC. 5067.</num>
		<heading> Reduced rates not allowed for smuggled or illegally produced beer, wine, or spirits.</heading>
		<chapeau class="block">In the case of beer, wine, or distilled spirits that are smuggled into the United States or produced other than as authorized by this chapter—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s108/a/qB/s5067/1" id="HE742524CF5824E37B1B76844A4730E47" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1868">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> the rates of tax under paragraphs (1)(A)(i) and (2) of section 5051(a) shall not apply in the case of any such beer,</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s108/a/qB/s5067/2" id="HE2C9882940834A3AA1F033234616D3D8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1868">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> the credit under section 5041(c) shall not apply in the case of any such wine, and</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dEE/tI/stA/s108/a/qB/s5067/3" id="H40B9C0F0A01C47C99CF120D5084048F2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1868">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<content> the rates of tax under section 5001(c) shall not apply in the case of any such distilled spirits.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</section>
</__xml__>#component(section());

insert end <__xml__ id="HA957D86551FC4E9D8C7251A868AB3D32" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tII/s204/a/qB/F" id="HE45993BC1064425C87B3E77A422C5D07" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1876">
		<num value="F">“(F)</num>
		<heading> Qualified offshore wind facilities.—</heading>
		<clause identifier="/dEE/tII/s204/a/qB/F/i" id="H66B7EEB3E2CE4E27AF41608A7B90B61F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1876">
			<num value="i">“(i)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In the case of any qualified offshore wind facility—</chapeau>
			<subclause identifier="/dEE/tII/s204/a/qB/F/i/I" id="HBA17C98F9C5E4F00A20A9689E28386F8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1876">
				<num value="I">“(I)</num>
				<content> subparagraph (C)(ii) shall be applied by substituting ‘<quotedText>January 1, 2026</quotedText>’ for ‘<quotedText>January 1, 2022</quotedText>’, </content>
			</subclause>
			<subclause identifier="/dEE/tII/s204/a/qB/F/i/II" id="HEE944A42EB454B5BA5C504C09D409CF9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1876">
				<num value="II">“(II)</num>
				<content> subparagraph (E) shall not apply, and </content>
			</subclause>
			<subclause identifier="/dEE/tII/s204/a/qB/F/i/III" id="H7589ABFE21024F1CB484E580FDBDA5E9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1876">
				<num value="III">“(III)</num>
				<content> for purposes of this paragraph, section 45(d)(1) shall be applied by substituting ‘<quotedText>January 1, 2026</quotedText>’’ for ‘<quotedText>January 1, 2022</quotedText>’.</content>
			</subclause>
		</clause>
		<clause identifier="/dEE/tII/s204/a/qB/F/ii" id="HB616431C0DA149BA9A4D5B0CA45680BE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1877">
			<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
			<heading> Qualified offshore wind facility.—</heading>
			<content>For purposes of this subparagraph, the term ‘<term>qualified offshore wind facility</term>’ means a qualified facility (within the meaning of section 45) described in paragraph (1) of section 45(d) (determined without regard to any date by which the construction of the facility is required to begin) which is located in the inland navigable waters of the United States or in the coastal waters of the United States.”</content>
		</clause>
	</subparagraph>
</__xml__>#component(subparagraph());

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H34824F23ED004A3D9A13CE749D3F98C7" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dEE/tII/s208/a/qB/36" id="H80E4372E8DE64B969B60A3C128B1F2CF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1884">
		<num value="36">“(36)</num>
		<heading> Distributions during working retirement.—</heading>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tII/s208/a/qB/36/A" id="H989AB1BEC9744FB4AD83111B8F2D7F5F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1884">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>A trust forming part of a pension plan shall not be treated as failing to constitute a qualified trust under this section solely because the plan provides that a distribution may be made from such trust to an employee who has attained age 59½ and who is not separated from employment at the time of such distribution.</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dEE/tII/s208/a/qB/36/B" id="HAD7C2C8A00314289951BE85FECD5B38A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1884">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<heading> Certain employees in the building and construction industry.—</heading>
			<chapeau>Subparagraph (A) shall be applied by substituting ‘<quotedText>age 55</quotedText>’ for ‘<quotedText>age 59½</quotedText>’ in the case of a multiemployer plan described in section 4203(b)(1)(B)(i) of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, with respect to individuals who were participants in such plan on or before April 30, 2013, if—</chapeau>
			<clause identifier="/dEE/tII/s208/a/qB/36/B/i" id="H0ED262D45E55470396BE4C77F7E3B74A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1884">
				<num value="i">“(i)</num>
				<content> the trust to which subparagraph (A) applies was in existence before January 1, 1970, and</content>
			</clause>
			<clause identifier="/dEE/tII/s208/a/qB/36/B/ii" id="H473CEA2497234A2D80514F026E1926C1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1884">
				<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
				<content> before December 31, 2011, at a time when the plan provided that distributions may be made to an employee who has attained age 55 and who is not separated from employment at the time of such distribution, the plan received at least 1 written determination from the Internal Revenue Service that the trust to which subparagraph (A) applies constituted a qualified trust under this section.”</content>
			</clause>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Paragraph (36) of section 401(a)
Section 274(n)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

rename subsection( "(p)") as subsection( "(q)"); insert after(subsection( "(o)")) <__xml__ id="HAB3CAF2D88854A618A6C8E1CF5F4AAED" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dEE/tII/s212/a/qB/p" id="HA10E84E82FBF4351937B4679483BAE14" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1886">
		<num value="p">“(p)</num>
		<heading> Special rule for taxpayers who do not elect to itemize deductions.—</heading>
		<chapeau>In the case of any taxable year beginning in 2021, if the individual does not elect to itemize deductions for such taxable year, the deduction under this section shall be equal to the deduction, not in excess of $300 ( $600 in the case of a joint return), which would be determined under this section if the only charitable contributions taken into account in determining such deduction were contributions made in cash during such taxable year (determined without regard to subsections (b)(1)(G)(ii) and (d)(1)) to an organization described in section 170(b)(1)(A) and not—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dEE/tII/s212/a/qB/p/1" id="H8F4D9EAE07D243A582D6F11276700944" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1886">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> to an organization described in section 509(a)(3), or</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dEE/tII/s212/a/qB/p/2" id="H9D9435354F4A4372BD161AD19F044CDC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1886">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> for the establishment of a new, or maintenance of an existing, donor advised fund (as defined in section 4966(d)(2)).”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>#component(subsection());
