	<subsection identifier="/dFF/tI/s102/a/qB/g" id="H2DF70E85F3684739A68C7EC63DD5B00B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1902">
		<num value="g">“(g)</num>
		<chapeau> Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, the Commissioner of Social Security shall enter into an agreement with the Secretary of the Treasury under which—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tI/s102/a/qB/g/1" id="H8089AF90AC614431AE6C5BFE0E06025C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1902">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> if the Secretary provides the Commissioner with the information described in <ref href="/us/usc/26/6103">section 6103(k)(15)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 with respect to any individual, the Commissioner shall indicate to the Secretary as to whether such individual receives disability insurance benefits under section 223 or supplemental security income benefits under title XVI (including State supplementary payments of the type referred to in section 1616(a) or payments of the type described in section 212(a) of <ref href="/us/pl/93/66">Public Law 93–66</ref>);</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tI/s102/a/qB/g/2" id="HD58905E365DE4BB090D68A4DEFB82181" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1903">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> appropriate safeguards are included to assure that the indication described in paragraph (1) will be used solely for the purpose of determining if tax receivables involving such individual are not eligible for collection pursuant to a qualified tax collection contract by reason of <ref href="/us/usc/26/6306">section 6306(d)(3)(E)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986; and</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tI/s102/a/qB/g/3" id="H93087355042E419FAFAAC68ED1F0EF02" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1903">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<content> the Secretary shall pay the Commissioner of Social Security the full costs (including systems and administrative costs) of providing the indication described in paragraph (1).”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H40BD69B4FB5D471992D7E1B9C462CF36" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/a/1/qB/s471" id="H113F6BB26BFD44ADA3894E97E8CA186D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1957">
		<num value="471">“SEC. 471.</num>
		<heading> Amount of need.</heading>
		<chapeau class="block">Except as otherwise provided therein, for award year 2023–2024 and each subsequent award year, the amount of need of any student for financial assistance under this title (except subpart 1 or 2 of part A) is equal to—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/a/1/qB/s471/1" id="H8A6F40AD64324FD68957A57F027B9002" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1957">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> the cost of attendance of such student, minus</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/a/1/qB/s471/2" id="HF358E7B6C7404EAF918FA3B52CC4F3B7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1957">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> the student aid index (as defined in section 473) for such student, minus</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/a/1/qB/s471/3" id="HE78C5A7FFC78440C8DCFA600D7A1E86B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1957">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<content> other financial assistance not received under this title (as defined in section 480(i)).”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 471 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087kk)

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="HAF1475F80F4245A9BE0172B61CA23085" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/a/2/qB/c" id="H8B72876610A64C978A34686BE792CD80" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1957">
		<num value="c">“(c)</num>
		<heading> Maximum aid.—</heading>
		<content>The maximum dollar amount of financial assistance provided under this part to a student shall not exceed the cost of attendance for such student.”</content>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 451 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087a)

H8C937AB60D9344A4A06FBAC335BF451F.label: dFF tVII 702(a)(3)
H8C937AB60D9344A4A06FBAC335BF451F.author: jwagner
H8C937AB60D9344A4A06FBAC335BF451F.privateComment: Ref to "this Act" probably means "this title"

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H8026A8423AA24AC28F83278F4FD053B8" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472" id="H760C1AEDEC504595B73F530BE28380BC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1957">
		<num value="472">“SEC. 472.</num>
		<heading> Cost of attendance.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a" id="H9E5622D0677045ACA596364B45D6C0ED" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1957">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<chapeau>For the purpose of this title, the term ‘<term>cost of attendance</term>’ means—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/1" id="H08C4F01B36C045989573992F91C363C6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1957">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> tuition and fees normally assessed a student carrying the same academic workload as determined by the institution;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/2" id="H8B9D89916594470BA61CB34E2FF122C8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1957">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> an allowance for books, course materials, supplies, and equipment, which shall include all such costs required of all such students in the same course of study, including a reasonable allowance for the documented rental or upfront purchase of a personal computer, as determined by the institution;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/3" id="H35B4300DAA644A7AB8E14AC4EC96ABC9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1957">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<content> an allowance for transportation, which may include transportation between campus, residences, and place of work, as determined by the institution; </content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/4" id="H2835AD045CD34170BD6D7F955970A379" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1957">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<content> an allowance for miscellaneous personal expenses, for a student attending the institution on at least a half-time basis, as determined by the institution; </content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/5" id="H5D35C896528D455F985F95E8EFF36707" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1957">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<chapeau> an allowance for living expenses, including food and housing costs, to be incurred by the student attending the institution on at least a half-time basis, as determined by the institution, which shall include—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/5/A" id="HB8D14DF0511A4671A26EA993355E71A5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1958">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> for a student electing institutionally owned or operated food services, such as board or meal plans, a standard allowance for such services that provides the equivalent of three meals each day;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/5/B" id="HC39DBA2F48CC410AB64F7E93ECB75928" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1958">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> for a student not electing institutionally owned or operated food services, such as board or meal plans, a standard allowance for purchasing food off campus that provides the equivalent of three meals each day;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/5/C" id="H9E2D64FDC91440C182F9B6350BFB0615" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1958">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> for a student without dependents residing in institutionally owned or operated housing, a standard allowance determined by the institution based on the average or median amount assessed to such residents for housing charges, whichever is greater;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/5/D" id="HAD0529A563CA4083BC09F8CADFAD58CB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1958">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> for a student with dependents residing in institutionally owned or operated housing, a standard allowance determined by the institution based on the average or median amount assessed to such residents for housing charges, whichever is greater;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/5/E" id="H1228B09391EA477E8C459065779E75E6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1958">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<content> for a student living off campus, and not in institutionally owned or operated housing, a standard allowance for rent or other housing costs;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/5/F" id="H0AB3528731A14A38AA9ABFC6C983C6C8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1958">
					<num value="F">“(F)</num>
					<content> for a dependent student residing at home with parents, a standard allowance that shall not be zero determined by the institution;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/5/G" id="H704952F9705343BABBE6CBEA3DB01939" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1958">
					<num value="G">“(G)</num>
					<content> for a student living in housing located on a military base or for which a basic allowance is provided under section 403(b) of title 37, United States Code, a standard allowance for food based upon such student’s choice of purchasing food on-campus or off-campus (determined respectively in accordance with subparagraph (A) or (B)), but not for housing costs; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/5/H" id="HF6E63365AA4040DFB978D01FEA2FB2F0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1958">
					<num value="H">“(H)</num>
					<content> for all other students, an allowance based on the expenses reasonably incurred by such students for housing and food;</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/6" id="HA7BCFF8EDB41407799A4C65B057A0509" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1958">
				<num value="6">“(6)</num>
				<content> for a student engaged in a program of study by correspondence, only tuition and fees and, if required, books and supplies, travel, and housing and food costs incurred specifically in fulfilling a required period of residential training;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/7" id="HCE4EA169048348D084A7145F4EEC92D6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1958">
				<num value="7">“(7)</num>
				<content> for a confined or incarcerated student, only tuition, fees, books, course materials, supplies, equipment, and the cost of obtaining a license, certification, or a first professional credential in accordance with paragraph (14);</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/8" id="H562EE5448A6C48DDA73E76690FFFEFC2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1958">
				<num value="8">“(8)</num>
				<content> for a student enrolled in an academic program in a program of study abroad approved for credit by the student’s home institution, reasonable costs associated with such study (as determined by the institution at which such student is enrolled);</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/9" id="HE75E868F2FF640B3B6DE145C5ADB91AD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1958">
				<num value="9">“(9)</num>
				<chapeau> for a student with one or more dependents, an allowance based on the estimated actual expenses incurred for such dependent care, based on the number and age of such dependents, except that—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/9/A" id="HABF77F4279B54F089A00A13D11870A83" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1958">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> such allowance shall not exceed the reasonable cost in the community in which such student resides for the kind of care provided; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/9/B" id="H564599E1DFF84B6DAEC7CFADB725240C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1958">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> the period for which dependent care is required includes, but is not limited to, class-time, study-time, field work, internships, and commuting time;</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/10" id="HF94E0C4549414F67B36EF5CEBD1E4AE5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1959">
				<num value="10">“(10)</num>
				<content> for a student with a disability, an allowance (as determined by the institution) for those expenses related to the student’s disability, including special services, personal assistance, transportation, equipment, and supplies that are reasonably incurred and not provided for by other assisting agencies;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/11" id="H6E81CCA097A84D18927C7BEEBB85F216" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1959">
				<num value="11">“(11)</num>
				<content> for a student receiving all or part of the student’s instruction by means of telecommunications technology, no distinction shall be made with respect to the mode of instruction in determining costs;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/12" id="H0379463E3C9447AFA793A01C6CC93ECB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1959">
				<num value="12">“(12)</num>
				<content> for a student engaged in a work experience under a cooperative education program, an allowance for reasonable costs associated with such employment (as determined by the institution);</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/13" id="H3B0300C4214D41769D2EF3B5B549A67B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1959">
				<num value="13">“(13)</num>
				<content> for a student who receives a Federal student loan made under this title or any other Federal law, to cover a student’s cost of attendance at the institution, an allowance for the actual cost of any loan fee, origination fee, or insurance premium charged to such student or the parent of such student on such loan; and</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/a/14" id="H767CCD0FB2B342C1B0CBB7F8F251A8AC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1959">
				<num value="14">“(14)</num>
				<content> for a student in a program requiring professional licensure, certification, or a first professional credential, the cost of obtaining the license, certification, or a first professional credential.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/b" id="HB191A7E326E44B26B99F3D75690BB9C0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1959">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Special rule for living expenses for less-than-half-time students.—</heading>
			<content>For students attending an institution of higher education less than half-time, an institution of higher education may include an allowance for living expenses, including food and housing costs in accordance with subsection (a)(4) for up to three semesters, or the equivalent, with no more than two semesters being consecutive.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s472/c" id="H5F7284ED6AA7497F8763599350E37D76" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1959">
			<num value="c">“(c)</num>
			<heading> Disclosure of cost of attendance elements.—</heading>
			<content>Each institution shall make publicly available on the institution’s website a list of all the elements of cost of attendance described in paragraphs (1) through (14) of subsection (a), and shall disclose such elements on any portion of the website describing tuition and fees of the institution. </content>
		</subsection>
	</section>
	<section identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s473" id="HAD940BF37D564A55A04CC649C72CC2F7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1959">
		<num value="473">“SEC. 473.</num>
		<heading> Special rules for student aid index.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s473/a" id="H58A5121098B64F41AFE9F95550FD75D6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1959">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>For the purpose of this Act, the term ‘<term>student aid index</term>’ means, with respect to a student, an index that reflects an evaluation of a student’s approximate financial resources to contribute toward the student’s postsecondary education for the academic year, as determined in accordance with this part.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s473/b" id="H3E5963F8EEF341B7BE61F43D0E2578B3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1959">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Special rule for students eligible for the total maximum pell grant.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary shall consider an applicant to automatically have a student aid index equal to zero if the applicant is eligible for the total maximum Federal Pell Grant under section 401(b)(1)(A), except that, if the applicant has a calculated student aid index of less than zero the Secretary shall consider the negative number as the student aid index for the applicant.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/b/qB/s473/c" id="H443094184D06421282A12DDCF59C5A3A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1959">
			<num value="c">“(c)</num>
			<heading> Special rule for nonfilers.—</heading>
			<content>Notwithstanding subsection (b), for an applicant (or, as applicable, an applicant and spouse, or an applicant’s parents) who is not required to file a Federal tax return for the second preceding tax year, the Secretary shall for the purposes of this title consider the student aid index as equal to – $1,500 for the applicant.”</content>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Sections 472 and 473 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087ll and 1087mm)

	<section identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/c/qB/s474" id="H449787ED46C54ABCBE13007C0D163223" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1960">
		<num value="474">“SEC. 474.</num>
		<heading> Determination of student aid index.</heading>
		<chapeau class="block">The student aid index—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/c/qB/s474/1" id="H65048792378B4168AC9DC8636B00F9A3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1960">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> for a dependent student shall be determined in accordance with section 475;</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/c/qB/s474/2" id="HD416A9C74C6C4021B8909D4A3C02B600" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1960">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> for a single independent student or a married independent student without dependents (other than a spouse) shall be determined in accordance with section 476; and</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/c/qB/s474/3" id="H125AB9CF44F14E2B93EFB32BF98FABD8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1960">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<content> for an independent student with dependents other than a spouse shall be determined in accordance with section 477.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

“SEC. 475. Student aid index for dependent students. “(a) Computation of student aid index.— “(1) In general.— Except as provided in paragraph (2), for each dependent student, the student aid index is equal to the sum of— “(A) the assessment of the parents’ adjusted available income (determined in accordance with subsection (b)); “(B) the assessment of the student’s available income (determined in accordance with subsection (g)); and “(C) the student’s available assets (determined in accordance with subsection (h)). “(2) Exception.— If the sum determined under paragraph (1) with respect to a dependent student is less than – $1,500, the student aid index for the dependent student shall be – $1,500. “(b) Assessment of parents’ adjusted available income.— The assessment of parents’ adjusted available income is equal to the amount determined by— “(1) computing adjusted available income by adding— “(A) the parents’ available income (determined in accordance with subsection (c)); and “(B) the parents’ available assets (determined in accordance with subsection (d)); “(2) assessing such adjusted available income in accordance with the assessment schedule set forth in subsection (e); and “(3) considering such assessment resulting under paragraph (2) as the amount determined under this subsection. “(c) Parents’ available income.— “(1) In general.— The parents’ available income is determined by subtracting from total income (as defined in section 480)— “(A) Federal income taxes; “(B) an allowance for payroll taxes, determined in accordance with paragraph (2); “(C) an income protection allowance, determined in accordance with paragraph (3); and “(D) an employment expense allowance, determined in accordance with paragraph (4). “(2) Allowance for payroll taxes.— The allowance for payroll taxes is equal to the sum of— “(A) the total amount earned by the parents, multiplied by the rate of tax under section 3101(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986; and “(B) the amount earned by the parents that does not exceed such contribution and benefit base (twice such contribution and benefit base, in the case of a joint return) for the year of the earnings, multiplied by the rate of tax applicable to such earnings under section 3101(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. “(3) Income protection allowance.— The income protection allowance shall equal the amount determined in the following table, as adjusted by the Secretary pursuant to section 478(b):
“Income Protection Allowance (to be adjusted for 2023–2024 and succeeding years)
Family Size (including student) Amount
2 $23,330

4 $35,870
5 $42,320
6 $49,500
For each additional add $5,590.
“(4) Employment expense allowance.— The employment expense allowance is equal to the lesser of $4,000 or 35 percent of the single parent’s earned income or married parents’ combined earned income (as adjusted by the Secretary pursuant to section 478(g)). “(d) Parents’ available assets.— “(1) In general.— “(A) Determination.— Except as provided in subparagraph (B), the parents’ available assets are equal to— “(i) the difference between the parents’ assets and the asset protection allowance (determined in accordance with paragraph (2)); multiplied by “(ii) 12 percent. “(B) Not less than zero.— The parents’ available assets under this subsection shall not be less than zero. “(2) Asset protection allowance.— The asset protection allowance is calculated based on the following table (as revised by the Secretary pursuant to section 478(d)):

“(e) Assessment schedule.— The assessment of the parents’ adjusted available income (as determined under subsection (b)(1) and hereafter in this subsection referred to as ‘AAI’) is calculated based on the following table (as revised by the Secretary pursuant to section 478(e)):
“Parents' Contribution From AAI
If the parents' AAI is— Then the parents' contribution from AAI is—

$30,701 to $35,100 $7,734 + 40% of AAI over $30,700
$35,101 or more $9,494 + 47% of AAI over $35,100.
“(f) Consideration of parental income.— “(1) Parents who live together.— Parental income and assets in the case of student whose parents are married and not separated, or who are unmarried but live together, shall include the income and assets of both parents. “(2) Divorced or separated parents.— Parental income and assets for a student whose parents are divorced or separated, but not remarried, is determined by including only the income and assets of the parent who provides the greater portion of the student’s financial support. “(3) Death of a parent.— Parental income and assets in the case of the death of any parent is determined as follows: “(A) If either of the parents has died, the surviving parent shall be considered a single parent, until that parent has remarried. “(B) If both parents have died, the student shall not report any parental income or assets. “(4) Remarried parents.— If a parent whose income and assets are taken into account under paragraph (2), or if a parent who is a widow or widower and whose income is taken into account under paragraph (3), has remarried, the income of that parent’s spouse shall be included in determining the parent’s assessment of adjusted available income if the student’s parent and the stepparent are married as of the date of application for the award year concerned. “(5) Single parent who is not divorced or separated.— Parental income and assets in the case of a student whose parent is not described in paragraph (1) and is a single parent who is not divorced, separated, or remarried, shall include the income and assets of such single parent. “(g) Student’s available income.— “(1) In general.— The student’s available income is equal to— “(A) the difference between the student’s total income (determined in accordance with section 480) and the adjustment to student income (determined in accordance with paragraph (2)); multiplied by “(B) 50 percent. “(2) Adjustment to student income.— The adjustment to student income is equal to the sum of— “(A) Federal income taxes; “(B) an allowance for payroll taxes determined in accordance with paragraph (3); “(C) an income protection allowance that is equal to $9,410, as adjusted pursuant to section 478(b); and “(D) an allowance for parents’ negative available income, determined in accordance with paragraph (4). “(3) Allowance for payroll taxes.— The allowance for payroll taxes is equal to the sum of— “(A) the total amount earned by the student, multiplied by the rate of tax under section 3101(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986; and “(B) the amount earned by the student that does not exceed such contribution and benefit base for the year of the earnings, multiplied by the rate of tax applicable to such earnings under section 3101(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. “(4) Allowance for parents’ negative available income.— The allowance for parents’ negative available income is the amount, if any, by which the sum of the amounts deducted under subsection (c)(1) exceeds the sum of the parents’ total income (as defined in section 480) and the parents’ available assets (as determined in accordance with subsection (d)). “(h) Student’s assets.— The student’s assets are determined by calculating the assets of the student and multiplying such amount by 20 percent, except that the result shall not be less than zero.”
;

“SEC. 476. Student aid index for independent students without dependents other than a spouse. “(a) Computation of student aid index.— “(1) In general.— For each independent student without dependents other than a spouse, the student aid index is equal to (except as provided in paragraph (2)) the sum of— “(A) the family’s available income (determined in accordance with subsection (b)); and “(B) the family’s available assets (determined in accordance with subsection (c)). “(2) Exception.— If the sum determined under paragraph (1) with respect to an independent student without dependents other than a spouse is less than – $1,500, the student aid index for the independent student shall be – $1,500. “(b) Family’s available income.— “(1) In general.— The family’s available income is determined by— “(A) deducting from total income (as defined in section 480)— “(i) Federal income taxes; “(ii) an allowance for payroll taxes, determined in accordance with paragraph (2); “(iii) an income protection allowance that is equal to— “(I) in the case of a single independent student without dependents, $14,630, as adjusted pursuant to section 478(b); and “(II) in the case of a married independent student without dependents, $23,460, as adjusted pursuant to section 478(b); and “(iv) in the case of a married independent student, an employment expense allowance, as determined in accordance with paragraph (3); and “(B) multiplying the amount determined under subparagraph (A) by 50 percent. “(2) Allowance for payroll taxes.— The allowance for payroll taxes is equal to the sum of— “(A) the total amount earned by the student (and spouse, if appropriate), multiplied by the rate of tax under section 3101(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986; and “(B) the amount earned by the student (and spouse, if appropriate) that does not exceed such contribution and benefit base (twice such contribution and benefit base, in the case of a joint return) for the year of the earnings, multiplied by the rate of tax applicable to such earnings under section 3101(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. “(3) Employment expense allowance.— The employment expense allowance is equal to the following: “(A) If the student is married, such allowance is equal to the lesser of $4,000 or 35 percent of the couple’s combined earned income (as adjusted by the Secretary pursuant to section 478(g)). “(B) If the student is not married, the employment expense allowance is zero. “(c) Family’s available assets.— “(1) In general.— “(A) Determination.— Except as provided in subparagraph (B), the family’s available assets are equal to— “(i) the difference between the family’s assets (as defined in section 480(f)) and the asset protection allowance (determined in accordance with paragraph (2)); multiplied by “(ii) 20 percent. “(B) Not less than zero.— The family’s available assets under this subsection shall not be less than zero. “(2) Asset protection allowance.— The asset protection allowance is calculated based on the following table (as revised by the Secretary pursuant to section 478(d)):

“SEC. 477. Student aid index for independent students with dependents other than a spouse. “(a) Computation of student aid index.— “(1) In general.— For each independent student with dependents other than a spouse, the student aid index is equal to the amount determined by— “(A) computing adjusted available income by adding— “(i) the family’s available income (determined in accordance with subsection (b)); and “(ii) the family’s available assets (determined in accordance with subsection (c)); “(B) assessing such adjusted available income in accordance with an assessment schedule set forth in subsection (d); and “(C) considering such assessment resulting under subparagraph (B) as the amount determined under this subsection. “(2) Exception.— If the sum determined under paragraph (1) with respect to an independent student with dependents other than a spouse is less than – $1,500, the student aid index for the independent student shall be – $1,500. “(b) Family’s available income.— “(1) In general.— The family’s available income is determined by deducting from total income (as defined in section 480)— “(A) Federal income taxes; “(B) an allowance for payroll taxes, determined in accordance with paragraph (2); “(C) an income protection allowance, determined in accordance with paragraph (3); and “(D) an employment expense allowance, determined in accordance with paragraph (4). “(2) Allowance for payroll taxes.— The allowance for payroll taxes is equal to the sum of— “(A) the total amount earned by the student (and spouse, if appropriate), multiplied by the rate of tax under section 3101(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986; and “(B) the amount earned by the student (and spouse, if appropriate) that does not exceed such contribution and benefit base (twice such contribution and benefit base, in the case of a joint return) for the year of the earnings, multiplied by the rate of tax applicable to such earnings under section 3101(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. “(3) Income protection allowance.— The income protection allowance shall equal the amount determined in the following table, as adjusted by the Secretary pursuant to section 478(b): “(A) In the case of a married independent student with dependents:

“Assessment From Adjusted Available Income
If AAI is— Then the assessment is—
Less than – $6,820 – $1,500
– $6,820 to $17,400 22% of AAI
$17,401 to $21,800 $3,828 + 25% of AAI over $17,400
$21,801 to $26,200 $4,928 + 29% of AAI over $21,800
$26,201 to $30,700 $6,204 + 34% of AAI over $26,200
$30,701 to $35,100 $7,734 + 40% of AAI over $30,700
$35,101 or more $9,494 + 47% of AAI over $35,100.
“(e) Computations in case of separation, divorce, or death.— In the case of a student who is divorced or separated, or whose spouse has died, the spouse’s income and assets shall not be considered in determining the family’s available income or assets.”
;

cite.cite_text: Section 477 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087qq)

rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H4FD7AA8A1BAC45D4890F99208F855C90" orig_name="quotedContent">
“SEC. 478. Regulations; updated tables. “(a) Authority To prescribe regulations restricted.— Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Secretary shall not have the authority to prescribe regulations to carry out this part except— “(1) to prescribe updated tables in accordance with subsections (b) through (g); and “(2) with respect to the definition of cost of attendance under section 472, excluding section 472(a)(1). “(b) Income protection allowance adjustments.— For award year 2023–2024 and each subsequent award year, the Secretary shall publish in the Federal Register revised income protection allowances for the purposes of subsections (c)(3) and (g)(2)(C) of section 475, subclauses (I) and (II) of section 476(b)(1)(A)(iii), and section 477(b)(3), by increasing the income protection allowances in each of such provisions, by a percentage equal to the percentage increase in the Consumer Price Index, as defined in subsection (f), between April 2020 and the April in the year prior to the beginning of the award year and rounding the result to the nearest $10. “(c) Adjusted net worth of a farm or business.— “(1) Table.— The table of the net worth of a farm or business for purposes of making determinations of assets as defined under section 480(f) is the following:
“Farm/Business Net Worth Adjustment
If the net worth of a farm or business is— Then the adjusted net worth is—
Less than $1 $0
$1 to $140,000 40% of net worth of farm/business
$140,001 to $415,000 $56,000 + 50% of net worth over $140,000
$415,001 to $695,000 $193,500 + 60% of net worth over $415,000
$695,001 or more $361,500 + 100% of net worth over $695,000.
“(2) Revised tables.— For award year 2023–2024 and each subsequent award year, the Secretary shall publish in the Federal Register a revised table of the adjusted net worth of a farm or business for purposes of section 480(f). Such revised table shall be developed— “(A) by increasing each dollar amount that refers to net worth of a farm or business by a percentage equal to the percentage increase in the Consumer Price Index between April 2020 and the April in the year prior to the beginning of such award year, and rounding the result to the nearest $5,000; and “(B) by adjusting the dollar amounts in the column referring to the adjusted net worth to reflect the changes made pursuant to subparagraph (A). “(d) Asset protection allowance.— For award year 2023–2024 and each subsequent award year, the Secretary shall publish in the Federal Register a revised table of allowances for the purpose of sections 475(d)(2), 476(c)(2), and 477(c)(2). Such revised table shall be developed by determining the present value cost, rounded to the nearest $100, of an annuity that would provide, for each age cohort of 40 and above, a supplemental income at age 65 (adjusted for inflation) equal to the difference between the moderate family income (as most recently determined by the Bureau of Labor Statistics), and the current average social security retirement benefits. For each age cohort below 40, the allowance shall be computed by decreasing the allowance for age 40, as updated, by one-fifteenth for each year of age below age 40 and rounding the result to the nearest $100. In making such determinations— “(1) the tables of allowances specified in sections 475(d)(2), 476(c)(2), and 477(c)(2) shall be considered to be for award year 2021–2022 for the purposes of calculating inflation; “(2) inflation shall be presumed to be 6 percent per year; “(3) the rate of return of an annuity shall be presumed to be 8 percent; and “(4) the sales commission on an annuity shall be presumed to be 6 percent. “(e) Assessment schedules and rates.— For award year 2023–2024 and each subsequent award year, the Secretary shall publish in the Federal Register a revised table of assessments from adjusted available income for the purpose of sections 475(e) and 477(d). Such revised table shall be developed— “(1) by increasing each dollar amount that refers to adjusted available income by a percentage equal to the percentage increase in the Consumer Price Index between April 2020 and the April in the year prior to the beginning of such academic year, rounded to the nearest $100; and “(2) by adjusting the other dollar amounts to reflect the changes made pursuant to paragraph (1). “(f) Consumer price index defined.— In this section, the term ‘Consumer Price Index’ means the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers published by the Department of Labor. Each annual update of tables to reflect changes in the Consumer Price Index shall be corrected for misestimation of actual changes in such Index in previous years. “(g) Employment expense allowance.— For award year 2023–2024 and each succeeding award year, the Secretary shall publish in the Federal Register a revised table of employment expense allowances for the purpose of sections 475(c)(4), 476(b)(3), and 477(b)(4). Such revised table shall be developed by increasing the dollar amount specified in sections 475(c)(4), 476(b)(3), and 477(b)(4) by a percentage equal to the percentage increase in the Consumer Price Index, as defined in subsection (f), between April 2020 and the April in the year prior to the beginning of the award year and rounding the result to the nearest $10. “(h) Clarification for award year 2023–2024.— For award year 2023–2024, the Secretary shall determine adjusted amounts and prescribe revised tables with respect to the income protection, employment expense, and asset protection allowances and the assessment schedules under sections 475, 476, and 477, pursuant to this section. The amounts and tables specified in sections 475, 476, and 477 with respect to such allowances and schedules shall only be used by the Secretary as a baseline for adjustments and table revisions prescribed in accordance with this section.”
;

cite.cite_text: Section 478 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087rr)

rewrite this as <__xml__ id="HE2BE6C3F5B8C494DBDF2C3CB429C713E" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479" id="HA1344FC386E14ADE9344EEC427ED30A2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
		<num value="479">“SEC. 479.</num>
		<heading> Eligible applicants exempt from asset reporting.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/a" id="HD3F8AE7AF02B495286059D10B7B5E3CD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>Notwithstanding any other provision of law, this section shall be effective for each individual seeking to apply for Federal financial aid under this title, as part of the simplified application for Federal student financial aid under section 483, on or after July 1, 2023.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b" id="HF8D18D318EA240BBB8B2920482102530" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Applicants exempt from asset reporting.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/1" id="HEEF5518B62F94C09BF05C1B3DA97C541" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>Except as provided in paragraph (3), in carrying out section 483, the Secretary shall not use asset information from an eligible applicant or, as applicable, the parent or spouse of an eligible applicant.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/2" id="HC61A16A86D3F459794564863CE242593" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Eligible applicants.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In this subsection, the term ‘<term>eligible applicant</term>’ means an applicant who meets at least one of the following criteria:</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/2/A" id="HA91B6EC286AA4102893AFC5D7E37487D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> Is an applicant who qualifies for an automatic zero student aid index or negative student aid index under subsection (b) or (c) of section 473.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/2/B" id="H872B7CCDA7F5434DA7D55E8F7AFBE9DF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<chapeau> Is an applicant who is a dependent student and the student’s parents have a total adjusted gross income (excluding any income of the dependent student) that is less than $60,000 and do not file a Schedule A, B, D, E, F, or H (or equivalent successor schedules) with the Federal income tax return for the second preceding tax year, and—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/2/B/i" id="HCFC94E3F90964133B5A4981D9C0414F1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> do not file a Schedule C (or the equivalent successor schedule) with the Federal income tax return for the second preceding tax year; or</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/2/B/ii" id="HF99D8631C67C45039C711A325348A0C0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> file a Schedule C (or the equivalent successor schedule) with net business income of not more than a $10,000 loss or gain with the Federal income tax return for the second preceding tax year.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/2/C" id="H3830A47ED23540DF9E1A3B3FDBFA49F6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<chapeau> Is an applicant who is an independent student and the student (including the student’s spouse, if any) has a total adjusted gross income that is less than $60,000 and does not file a Schedule A, B, D, E, F, or H (or equivalent successor schedules), with the Federal income tax return for the second preceding tax year, and—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/2/C/i" id="HF85D52AABBDB4C31908ABCFD2AEE7E34" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> does not file a Schedule C (or the equivalent successor schedule) with the Federal income tax return for the second preceding tax year; or</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/2/C/ii" id="HFE4190EB009C47529253699CFC2A3554" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> files a Schedule C (or the equivalent successor schedule) with net business income of not more than a $10,000 loss or gain with the Federal income tax return for the second preceding tax year.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/2/D" id="H69A5DA243E7F4F9C97376FDCFE5D2030" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> Is an applicant who, at any time during the previous 24-month period, received a benefit under a means-tested Federal benefit program (or whose parent or spouse received such a benefit, as applicable).</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/3" id="H14AAC3D451FA48A9899DBCBB15EB00EB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Special rule.—</heading>
				<chapeau>An eligible applicant shall not be exempt from asset reporting under this section if the applicant is a dependent student and the students’ parents do not—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/3/A" id="HFB2616439BDA4AA0819B3D0A1BB85E2D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> reside in the United States or a United States territory; or</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/3/B" id="HAA323993FC5A4620B01C5C054343F4D6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1972">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> file taxes in the United States or a United States territory, except if such nonfiling is due to not being required to file a Federal tax return for the applicable tax year due to a low income.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4" id="H6804B914B63048E897CB60A9C7D0E45F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> Definitions.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In this section:</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/A" id="HA0304756F4B64656BE80176C7772BADF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> Schedule a.—</heading>
					<content>The term ‘<quotedText>Schedule A</quotedText>’ means a form or information by a taxpayer to report itemized deductions.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/B" id="HC3012E3D43054866878ADB09898B930F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Schedule b.—</heading>
					<content>The term ‘<quotedText>Schedule B</quotedText>’ means a form or information filed by a taxpayer to report interest and ordinary dividend income.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/C" id="HBE101C9C7F594220A05118647D3A07B5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<heading> Schedule c.—</heading>
					<content>The term ‘<quotedText>Schedule C</quotedText>’ means a form or information filed by a taxpayer to report income or loss from a business operated or a profession practiced as a sole proprietor.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/D" id="HA94A15B2BE2D415FB127985368527DE4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<heading> Schedule d .—</heading>
					<content>The term ‘<quotedText>Schedule D</quotedText>’ means a form or information filed by a taxpayer to report sales, exchanges or some involuntary conversions of capital assets, certain capital gain distributions, and nonbusiness bad debts.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/E" id="H01D11A555D114426BD9CFB9166B7BD3B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<heading> Schedule e .—</heading>
					<content>The term ‘<quotedText>Schedule E</quotedText>’ means a form or information filed by a taxpayer to report income from rental properties, royalties, partnerships, S corporations, estates, trusts, and residual interests in real estate mortgage investment conduits.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/F" id="H41C49CE73B98419DBE25CE069675616F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
					<num value="F">“(F)</num>
					<heading> Schedule f.—</heading>
					<content>The term ‘<quotedText>Schedule F</quotedText>’ means a form or information filed by a taxpayer to report farm income and expenses.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/G" id="H47A34A6E4A99478BAEBB49EF3F7F8C33" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
					<num value="G">“(G)</num>
					<heading> Schedule h.—</heading>
					<content>The term ‘<quotedText>Schedule H</quotedText>’ means a form or information filed by a taxpayer to report household employment taxes.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/H" id="H4EE64971F56648B4B0A34262849A5959" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
					<num value="H">“(H)</num>
					<heading> Means-tested Federal benefit program.—</heading>
					<chapeau>The term ‘<term>means-tested Federal benefit program</term>’ means any of the following:</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/H/i" id="HAD716AF24E32489A8D0AA122A744D015" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> The supplemental security income program under title XVI of the Social Security Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/1381">42 U.S.C. 1381</ref> et seq.).</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/H/ii" id="HE5B3AF8E99FA41D2A4AFA41CADB62F95" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> The supplemental nutrition assistance program under the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (<ref href="/us/usc/7/2011">7 U.S.C. 2011</ref> et seq.), a nutrition assistance program carried out under section 19 of such Act (<ref href="/us/usc/7/2028">7 U.S.C. 2028</ref>), and a supplemental nutrition assistance program carried out under section 3(c) of the Act entitled ‘<quotedText>An Act to authorize appropriations for certain insular areas of the United States, and for other purposes</quotedText>’ (<ref href="/us/pl/95/348">Public Law 95–348</ref>).</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/H/iii" id="H885BCA4A0E1B425E9AFE739C08C473C7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> The program of block grants for States for temporary assistance for needy families established under part A of title IV of the Social Security Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/601">42 U.S.C. 601</ref> et seq.).</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/H/iv" id="H52AAA6E6CEF942379650B41E2A07F12C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> The special supplemental nutrition program for women, infants, and children established by section 17 of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/1786">42 U.S.C. 1786</ref>).</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/H/v" id="HE0F1D4255EE84F809285147259DF2C41" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
						<num value="v">“(v)</num>
						<content> The Medicaid program under title XIX of the Social Security Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/1396">42 U.S.C. 1396</ref> et seq.).</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/H/vi" id="HABE6876C68E04332B97A222CD6C20200" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1973">
						<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
						<content> Federal housing assistance programs, including tenant-based assistance under section 8(o) of the United States Housing Act of 1937 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/1437f">42 U.S.C. 1437f(o)</ref>), and public housing, as defined in section 3(b)(1) of such Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/1437a">42 U.S.C. 1437a(b)(1)</ref>).</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/h/qB/s479/b/4/H/vii" id="H626AA28509014104930A10729ED3AC70" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
						<num value="vii">“(vii)</num>
						<content> Other means-tested programs determined by the Secretary to be approximately consistent with the income eligibility requirements of the means-tested programs under clauses (i) through (vi).”</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 479 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087ss)

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H9B879DAFE8FD41C891965E6306586FB1" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A" id="HA0A0AE832CDA4A5E951D535DD5B77A87" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
		<num value="479A">“SEC. 479A.</num>
		<heading> Discretion of student financial aid administrators.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a" id="H663141EB252E40B89B5FEAC80EB6A0C2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/1" id="HAF75636D3B24476EBB8E5BC4BEA77863" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> Authority of financial aid administrators.—</heading>
				<chapeau>A financial aid administrator shall have the authority to, on the basis of adequate documentation, make adjustments to any or all of the following on a case-by-case basis:</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/1/A" id="HB9896182BC414A978253783AB71463EA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<chapeau> For an applicant with special circumstances under subsection (b) to—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/1/A/i" id="HE7D87E42F87B444B9519ADD74114F547" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> the cost of attendance;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/1/A/ii" id="H4FAEEA412E5D440690F4727FF04233A6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> the values of the data used to calculate the student aid index; or</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/1/A/iii" id="H56BB5D8173A2476CA6AC8C833AF99EFA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> the values of the data used to calculate the Federal Pell Grant award.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/1/B" id="HBA29DA6BCBF14E7AB4B8228F2D6712B0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> For an applicant with unusual circumstances under subsection (c), to the dependency status of such applicant.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/2" id="H349C3BF9DF844F52B605EB0D7089D044" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Limitations on authority.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/2/A" id="HCFF201A7DE7D4FC4A253A8B4878752F9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> Use of authority.—</heading>
					<content>No institution of higher education or financial aid administrator shall maintain a policy of denying all requests for adjustments under this section.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/2/B" id="HE50E85CFDD0E475488CFE4DA18E866D0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> No additional fee.—</heading>
					<content>No student or parent shall be charged a fee for a documented interview of the student by the financial aid administrator or for the review of a student or parent’s request for adjustments under this section including the review of any supplementary information or documentation of a student or parent’s special circumstances or a student’s unusual circumstances.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/2/C" id="H9CDF9F62CF494FB0BBE16752B5037B60" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<heading> Rule of construction.—</heading>
					<content>The authority to make adjustments under paragraph (1)(A) shall not be construed to permit financial aid administrators to deviate from the cost of attendance, the values of data used to calculate the student aid index or the values of data used to calculate the Federal Pell Grant award (or both) for awarding aid under this title in the absence of special circumstances.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/3" id="HEB14AF4C865445869368DDBF9203EED1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Adequate documentation.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Adequate documentation for adjustments under this section must substantiate the special circumstances or unusual circumstances of an individual student, and may include, to the extent relevant and appropriate—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/3/A" id="HED8B9EBFDA2B4856938DA3A5D46FD60F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> a documented interview between the student and the financial aid administrator;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/3/B" id="HCBF9BDF06EE84A85B1AACCCA0A8E4F02" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<chapeau> for the purposes of determining that a student qualifies for an adjustment under paragraph (1)(B)—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/3/B/i" id="HD7F730F1A4414FDEB052A4CB9EE906CF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1974">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> submission of a court order or official Federal or State documentation that the student or the student’s parents or legal guardians are incarcerated in any Federal or State penal institution;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/3/B/ii" id="H7DB438F126074363915B71D83C23E97C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1975">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<chapeau> a documented phone call or a written statement, which confirms the specific unusual circumstances with—</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/3/B/ii/I" id="HA636FF20D97D4BC38EC0B19600FF0AA8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1975">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> a child welfare agency authorized by a State or county;</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/3/B/ii/II" id="HF8C79CFA1A4E474B8121F58C350C89F2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1975">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> a Tribal welfare authority or agency;</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/3/B/ii/III" id="H7520C47D48554598BF777E686039D229" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1975">
							<num value="III">“(III)</num>
							<content> an independent living case worker, such as a case worker who supports current and former foster youth with the transition to adulthood; or</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/3/B/ii/IV" id="H9A0046E42B534EE0981044F55F3DD849" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1975">
							<num value="IV">“(IV)</num>
							<content> a public or private agency, facility, or program servicing the victims of abuse, neglect, assault, or violence, which may include domestic violence;</content>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/3/B/iii" id="H9CDE2F82A967473A8BED91A0C20A944E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1975">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> a documented phone call or a written statement from an attorney, a guardian ad litem, or a court-appointed special advocate, or a person serving in a similar capacity which confirms the specific unusual circumstances and documents the person’s relationship to the student;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/3/B/iv" id="HCB7FA89879D34C53B569B56AE9CB7E79" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1975">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> a documented phone call or written statement from a representative under chapter 1 or 2 of subpart 2 of part A, which confirms the specific unusual circumstances and documents the representative’s relationship to the student; </content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/3/B/v" id="H6FD17CA5EC8E4FCFA9F9C7B28145DF90" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1975">
						<num value="v">“(v)</num>
						<content> documents, such as utility bills or health insurance documentation, that demonstrate a separation from parents or legal guardians; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/3/B/vi" id="H018FD65DA7EA448794AF8FCD21B265D9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1975">
						<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
						<content> in the absence of documentation described in this subparagraph, other documentation the financial aid administrator determines is adequate to confirm the unusual circumstances, pursuant to section 480(d)(9); and</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/3/C" id="H90E9BFC50B9743AA80518AF58BA782FC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1975">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> supplementary information, as necessary, about the financial status or personal circumstances of eligible applicants as it relates to the special circumstances or unusual circumstances based on which the applicant is requesting an adjustment.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/4" id="H11398A7E328C4C9A8F023DC0A65AD719" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1975">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> Special rule.—</heading>
				<content>In making adjustments under paragraph (1), a financial aid administrator may offer a dependent student financial assistance under a Federal Direct Unsubsidized Stafford Loan without requiring the parents of such student to provide their parent information on the Free Application for Federal Student Aid if the student does not qualify for, or does not choose to use, the unusual circumstance option described in section 480(d)(9), and the financial aid administrator determines that the parents of such student ended financial support of such student or refuse to file such form.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/a/5" id="HC1FA554F8EA34E938791014E5444249A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1975">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<heading> Public disclosure.—</heading>
				<content>Each institution of higher education shall make publicly available information that students applying for aid under this title have the opportunity to pursue adjustments under this section.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b" id="HA3D1FD8184644551BF234867CADFD57D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1975">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Adjustments for students with special circumstances.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/1" id="HCC2C64C5D81E453CBB943390CF447916" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1975">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> Special circumstances for adjustments related to pell grants.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Special circumstances for adjustments to calculate a Federal Pell Grant award—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/1/A" id="HBC641E7608DE49F8832FB98FFCEE74AB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> shall be conditions that differentiate an individual student from a group of students rather than conditions that exist across a group of students; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/1/B" id="H6FC61ADB8CDE47E5AC2F9301FD80C126" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<chapeau> may include—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/1/B/i" id="HE260830E6809422F8A52629C816C7A41" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> recent unemployment of a family member or student;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/1/B/ii" id="HE9B20A9BC21A4A27B3041CEB2ABD6FCC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> a student or family member who is a dislocated worker (as defined in section 3 of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act);</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/1/B/iii" id="HEEBA0767B60F43589C4539D046925D0D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> a change in housing status that results in an individual being a homeless youth; </content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/1/B/iv" id="HEA9B316FF70F4DB7B1AEB31036640338" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> an unusual amount of claimed losses against income on the Federal tax return that substantially lower adjusted gross income, such as business, investment, or real estate losses;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/1/B/v" id="H1BF8A2F36CEB49F4A14628C612C582C8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="v">“(v)</num>
						<content> receipt of foreign income of permanent residents or United States citizens exempt from Federal taxation, or the foreign income for which a permanent resident or citizen received a foreign tax credit;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/1/B/vi" id="H99908FFBCF444D4C9C8CD319A603EB18" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
						<content> in the case of an applicant who does not qualify for the exemption from asset reporting under section 479, assets as defined in section 480(f); or</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/1/B/vii" id="H4B51661C3F0346388064ECE8628FC19D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="vii">“(vii)</num>
						<content> other changes or adjustments in the income, assets, or size of a family, or a student’s dependency status.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/2" id="H12D5DD8B911F4DBAAE3C2327B2935C10" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Special circumstances for adjustments related to cost of attendance and student aid index.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Special circumstances for adjustments to the cost of attendance or the values of the data used to calculate the student aid index—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/2/A" id="HC0C9EE53AE9647748C75793AC8F3BCD9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> shall be conditions that differentiate an individual student from a group of students rather than conditions that exist across a group of students, except as provided in sections 479B and 479C; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/2/B" id="H02D1C59CA1004E5F82920A274CAFE88E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<chapeau> may include—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/2/B/i" id="HCB8E8BCF1A374B8F8774029E0285D726" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> tuition expenses at an elementary school or secondary school;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/2/B/ii" id="HA52BE84290EC4005B8A7B5B4D7C7F40F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> medical, dental, or nursing home expenses not covered by insurance;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/2/B/iii" id="H910C33692E724D50820C2546841C7207" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> child care or dependent care costs not covered by the dependent care cost allowance calculated in accordance with section 472;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/2/B/iv" id="H6ABFFB8E294D4D91A65B65D0687331D1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> recent unemployment of a family member or student;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/2/B/v" id="H8B1104D73D7E4D2DB5473F6A663820FB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="v">“(v)</num>
						<content> a student or family member who is a dislocated worker (as defined in section 3 of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act);</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/2/B/vi" id="HECD78876A8FD417385B1DCC72E3DE785" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
						<content> the existence of additional family members enrolled in a degree, certificate, or other program leading to a recognized educational credential at an institution with a program participation agreement under section 487;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/2/B/vii" id="H0D1ED198C26742ED9F60DA8506DF6231" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="vii">“(vii)</num>
						<content> a change in housing status that results in an individual being a homeless youth; </content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/2/B/viii" id="H161E893FE9774A7C99D4476B2A8E178E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1976">
						<num value="viii">“(viii)</num>
						<content> a condition of severe disability of the student, or in the case of a dependent student, the dependent student’s parent or guardian, or in the case of an independent student, the independent student’s dependent or spouse;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/2/B/ix" id="HB2E2A75F5DF44EB78EF03A808C8FA829" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1977">
						<num value="ix">“(ix)</num>
						<content> unusual amount of claimed losses against income on the Federal tax return that substantially lower adjusted gross income, such as business, investment, or real estate losses; or</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/b/2/B/x" id="HA3C137BABD31434E8E4D2401A731EFA9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1977">
						<num value="x">“(x)</num>
						<content> other changes or adjustments in the income, assets, or size of a family, or a student’s dependency status.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c" id="HD58C8189FC54402680C7B0BB4F41C1A0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1977">
			<num value="c">“(c)</num>
			<heading> Unusual circumstances adjustments.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/1" id="H9CF26EE572AF4E099D3C11F16782D1F0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1977">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Unusual circumstances for adjustments to the dependency status of an applicant shall be—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/1/A" id="H85DFC9FFAFD947B9BE1D55BA0AF7AE1E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1977">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> conditions that differentiate an individual student from a group of students; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/1/B" id="H5C09FEB6B1CF4684AFF3984C8D4420B5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1977">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> based on unusual circumstances, pursuant to section 480(d)(9).</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/2" id="H56267882B8974D96BE82CF793F45ACAF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1977">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Provisional independent students.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/2/A" id="HCC08E86BABC8418A9A2BA7C32F676E2C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1977">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> Requirements for the secretary.—</heading>
					<chapeau>The Secretary shall—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/2/A/i" id="H4E90FA96C6A340059164625A2834BD1A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1977">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> enable each student who, based on an unusual circumstance described in section 480(d)(9), may qualify for an adjustment under subsection (a)(1)(B) that will result in a determination of independence under this section or section 479D to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid as an independent student for the purpose of a provisional determination of the student’s Federal financial aid award, with the final determination of the award subject to the documentation requirements of subsection (a)(3);</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/2/A/ii" id="HB97612D055544C438F7AB8A6BCDE79A7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1977">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> upon completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid provide an estimate of the student’s Federal Pell Grant award, and other information as specified in section 483(a)(3)(A), based on the assumption that the student is determined to be an independent student; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/2/A/iii" id="H1CA6FA5178EB43F1B78E60B7F00FF478" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1977">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> specify, on the Free Application for Federal Student Aid, the consequences under section 490(a) of knowingly and willfully completing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid as an independent student under clause (i) without meeting the unusual circumstances to qualify for such a determination.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/2/B" id="H801C8B861835428A8F2F9049D932ABE3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1977">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Requirements for financial aid administrators.—</heading>
					<chapeau>With respect to a student accepted for admission who completes the Free Application for Federal Student Aid as an independent student under subparagraph (A), a financial aid administrator shall—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/2/B/i" id="H616771277BCF4808999A9054ED1EA26F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1977">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> notify the student of the institutional process, requirements, and timeline for an adjustment under this section and section 480(d)(9) that will result in a review of the student’s request for an adjustment and a determination of the student’s dependency status under such sections within a reasonable time after the student completes the Free Application for Federal Student Aid;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/2/B/ii" id="H7283A207FF02437F85DEAECDD4E433F3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1977">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> provide the student a final determination of the student’s dependency status and Federal financial aid award as soon as practicable after all requested documentation is provided;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/2/B/iii" id="H40291A11F0834D9CA3AD4571934B4C19" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1978">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> retain all documents related to the adjustment under this section and section 480(d)(9), including documented interviews, for at least the duration of the student’s enrollment, and shall abide by all other record keeping requirements of this Act; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/2/B/iv" id="H1C122A47C1684DD29F02844B8004B8E4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1978">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<chapeau> presume that any student who has obtained an adjustment under this section and section 480(d)(9) and a final determination of independence for any preceding award year at an institution of higher education to be independent for each subsequent award year at the same institution unless—</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/2/B/iv/I" id="H482159335202494A8B5F7F0C87A0207A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1978">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> the student informs the institution that circumstances have changed; or</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/2/B/iv/II" id="H9D96F6C91C8D414F91605595C3B98A9C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1978">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> the institution has specific conflicting information about the student’s independence.</content>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/c/2/C" id="H214BBE7DA141492C8B0A720E960CCF8E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1978">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<heading> Eligibility.—</heading>
					<content>If a student pursues provisional independent student status and is not determined to be an independent student by a financial aid administrator, such student shall only be eligible for a Federal Direct Unsubsidized Stafford Loan for that award year unless such student subsequently completes the Free Application for Federal Student Aid as a dependent student.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/d" id="H3338F9F38B3A4A6EA0E039F0DBC02E52" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1978">
			<num value="d">“(d)</num>
			<heading> Adjustments to assets or income taken into account.—</heading>
			<chapeau>A financial aid administrator shall be considered to be making a necessary adjustment in accordance with this section if—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/d/1" id="H607C831C9D68485D93D3074F5092B386" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1978">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> the administrator makes adjustments excluding from family income or assets any proceeds or losses from a sale of farm or business assets of a family if such sale results from a voluntary or involuntary foreclosure, forfeiture, or bankruptcy or a voluntary or involuntary liquidation; or</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/d/2" id="H0BC678FD71594128A9A799572D11607C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1978">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> the administrator makes adjustments for a condition of disability of a student, or in the case of a dependent student, the dependent student’s parent or guardian, or in the case of an independent student, the independent student’s dependent or spouse, so as to take into consideration the additional costs incurred as a result of such disability.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/e" id="H3F1F0ADFC6DC45DF8E90558EB3D09668" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1978">
			<num value="e">“(e)</num>
			<heading> Refusal or adjustment of loan certifications.—</heading>
