			<content>On a case-by-case basis, an eligible institution may refuse to use the authority provided under this section, certify a statement that permits a student to receive a loan under part D, certify a loan amount, or make a loan that is less than the student’s determination of need (as determined under this part), if the reason for the action is documented and provided in writing to the student. No eligible institution shall discriminate against any borrower or applicant in obtaining a loan on the basis of race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sex, marital status, age, or disability status.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/f" id="H58AED9B4C596444482D9B6851CC0FF4B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1978">
			<num value="f">“(f)</num>
			<heading> Special rule regarding professional judgment during a disaster, emergency, or economic downturn.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/f/1" id="H13CD947EC90643A785741E7F4687A023" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1978">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>For the purposes of making a professional judgment under this section, financial aid administrators may, during a qualifying emergency—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/f/1/A" id="HB92FE52EA5BA4BB7B170A8B3E6427E96" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1978">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> determine that the income earned from work for an applicant is zero, if the applicant can provide paper or electronic documentation of receipt of unemployment benefits or confirmation that an application for unemployment benefits was submitted; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/f/1/B" id="HAF1ECDDE6BFE4275B08252405BAE18C6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1979">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> make additional appropriate adjustments to the income earned from work for a student, parent, or spouse, as applicable, based on the totality of the family’s situation, including consideration of unemployment benefits.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/f/2" id="H8868807C9D2A427898B40A7E802477EF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1979">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Documentation.—</heading>
				<content>For the purposes of documenting unemployment under paragraph (1), documentation shall be accepted if such documentation is submitted not more than 90 days from the date on which such documentation was issued, except if a financial aid administrator knows that the student, parent, or spouse, as applicable, has already obtained other employment.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/f/3" id="HF1F28E26DD7B4E2C94D2D38DF9FA74C0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1979">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Program reviews.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall make adjustments to the model used to select institutions of higher education participating under this title for program reviews in order to account for any rise in the use of professional judgment under this section during the award years applicable to the qualifying emergency, as determined by the Secretary.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/f/4" id="H9BFF49EE3C654999A7DAC8D9BEB90958" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1979">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> Qualifying emergency.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In this subsection, the term ‘<term>qualifying emergency</term>’ means—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/f/4/A" id="H1E635B15CB1E42F2819ED7EEDF489D12" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1979">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> an event for which the President declared a major disaster or an emergency under section 401 or 501, respectively, of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/5170">42 U.S.C. 5170</ref> and 5191);</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/f/4/B" id="H75F250C340D74F7C9FF81A17009CD830" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1979">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> a national emergency related to the coronavirus declared by the President under section 201 of the National Emergencies Act (<ref href="/us/usc/50/1601">50 U.S.C. 1601</ref> et seq.); or</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/i/qB/s479A/f/4/C" id="H2B93773400094C5F80BA5BA85F8CF61D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1979">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> a period of recession or economic downturn as determined by the Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of Labor.”</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 479A of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087tt)

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="HC8A83F7AC0AA43DCB46D85ECDB13E440" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/j/qB/s479B" id="H037A24327FF047FBB5CE1213AC6999EE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1979">
		<num value="479B">“SEC. 479B.</num>
		<heading> Disregard of student aid in other programs.</heading>
		<content class="indent0">Notwithstanding any other provision of law, student financial assistance received under this title, Bureau of Indian Education student assistance programs, and employment and training programs under section 134 of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (<ref href="/us/usc/29/3174">29 U.S.C. 3174</ref> et. seq.) shall not be taken into account in determining the need or eligibility of any person for benefits or assistance, or the amount of such benefits or assistance, under any Federal, State, or local program financed in whole or in part with Federal funds.”</content>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 479B of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087uu)

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="HF6AC6EF7DFA24D318A0660F948DA4C6F" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/k/qB/s479C" id="H8FDA90B227834A0D9CF0BB24FE4D8CF3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1979">
		<num value="479C">“SEC. 479C.</num>
		<heading> Native american students.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/k/qB/s479C/a" id="HB553DE9BA53942A3B3D034D63A3FF32F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1979">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<chapeau>In determining the student aid index for Native American students, computations performed pursuant to this part shall exclude—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/k/qB/s479C/a/1" id="HBFBD82D25EAA4CFBBBDE12B0A4AD250F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1979">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> any income and assets of $2,000 or less per individual payment received by the student (and spouse) and student’s parents under <ref href="/us/pl/98/64">Public Law 98–64</ref> (<ref href="/us/usc/25/117a">25 U.S.C. 117a</ref> et seq.; 97 Stat. 365) (commonly known as the ‘<quotedText>Per Capita Act</quotedText>’) or the Indian Tribal Judgment Funds Use or Distribution Act (<ref href="/us/usc/25/1401">25 U.S.C. 1401</ref> et seq.); and</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/k/qB/s479C/a/2" id="HF628FBADE5A54239AA6ACDDB86C22617" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1980">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> any income received by the student (and spouse) and student’s parents under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act (<ref href="/us/usc/43/1601">43 U.S.C. 1601</ref> et seq.) or the Maine Indian Claims Settlement Act of 1980 (<ref href="/us/usc/25/1721">25 U.S.C. 1721</ref> et seq.).</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/k/qB/s479C/b" id="H2846ABB9B9534BD1B500C781362A4158" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1980">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Guidance.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary shall develop guidance, in consultation with Tribal Colleges and Universities (as defined in section 316) and the State higher education agency in Alaska and Maine, to implement the determination under subsection (a) without adding additional questions to the FAFSA, including through the use of the authority under section 479A.”</content>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 479C of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087uu–1)

execution.ampl:
rewrite section("480") as <__xml__ id="H708807588C884DF1985FD6FB09E80098" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480" id="H48D765EAF2454829B8CF8FC01D916B45" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
		<num value="480">“SEC. 480.</num>
		<heading> Definitions.</heading>
		<chapeau class="block">In this part:</chapeau>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/a" id="H95976A45834144DF836675A8F0DCED86" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> Total income.—</heading>
			<content>The term ‘<term>total income</term>’ means the amount equal to adjusted gross income for the second preceding tax year plus untaxed income and benefits for the second preceding tax year minus excludable income for the second preceding tax year. The factors used to determine total income shall be derived from the Federal income tax return, if available, except for the applicant’s ability to indicate a qualified rollover in the second preceding tax year as outlined in section 483 or foreign income described in subsection (b)(5).</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/b" id="H08861E4E390D43528C3F2D188EBDA36A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Untaxed income and benefits.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The term ‘<term>untaxed income and benefits</term>’ means—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/b/1" id="H4481E8A307264FB29CAE78569269EDA8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> deductions and payments to self-employed SEP, SIMPLE, Keogh, and other qualified individual retirement accounts excluded from income for Federal tax purposes, except such term shall not include payments made to tax-deferred pension and retirement plans, paid directly or withheld from earnings, that are not delineated on the Federal tax return;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/b/2" id="HE2023FF691AF412B8B31D8174B1EB9C4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> tax-exempt interest income;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/b/3" id="H2178E17362D140D2B54592D2F7BB2AAF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<content> untaxed portion of individual retirement account distributions;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/b/4" id="HF8B5A3BFFE524EFD90DFE6ABC59F24A2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<content> untaxed portion of pensions; and</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/b/5" id="HE7EA3C9944F14E769E2213EF4A42750B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<content> foreign income of permanent residents of the United States or United States citizens exempt from Federal taxation, or the foreign income for which such a permanent resident or citizen receives a foreign tax credit.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c" id="H44E2E4286D0944268E03A538A212EB9D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
			<num value="c">“(c)</num>
			<heading> Veterans and veterans’ education benefits.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c/1" id="H65995B0629634190BD51D1EB1E5C9AE6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
				<num value="1">(1)</num>
				<content> The term ‘<term>veteran</term>’ has the meaning given the term in section 101(2) of title 38, United States Code, and includes individuals who served in the United States Armed Forces as described in sections 101(21), 101(22), and 101(23) of title 38, United States Code.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c/2" id="HA3BCFCB846B14F79BA06DD96BB75C5B0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<chapeau> The term ‘<term>veterans</term>’ education benefits’ means veterans’ benefits under the following provisions of law:</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c/2/A" id="H66777EADC44A47A1A3B465F9AD84065C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content>
						<ref href="/us/usc-chapter/10/103">Chapter 103</ref> of title 10, United States Code (Senior Reserve Officers’ Training Corps).</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c/2/B" id="H62687E2F3CC8449F969DC41732DDD8A1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content>
						<ref href="/us/usc-chapter/10/106A">Chapter 106A</ref> of title 10, United States Code (Educational Assistance for Persons Enlisting for Active Duty).</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c/2/C" id="H03ECEAB34254441F8426EA4A3F06D391" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content>
						<ref href="/us/usc-chapter/10/1606">Chapter 1606</ref> of title 10, United States Code (Selected Reserve Educational Assistance Program).</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c/2/D" id="H525D161F36FD49048F85854AAEA75ACB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content>
						<ref href="/us/usc-chapter/10/1607">Chapter 1607</ref> of title 10, United States Code (Educational Assistance Program for Reserve Component Members Supporting Contingency Operations and Certain Other Operations).</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c/2/E" id="HF3DC396946EB487BA5848F4692EBA6B6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1982">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<content>
						<ref href="/us/usc-chapter/38/30">Chapter 30</ref> of title 38, United States Code (All-Volunteer Force Educational Assistance Program, also known as the ‘<quotedText>Montgomery GI Bill—active duty</quotedText>’).</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c/2/F" id="HCEACC6D45A0B4FA29CEE3C8CA6BD21BF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
					<num value="F">“(F)</num>
					<content>
						<ref href="/us/usc-chapter/38/31">Chapter 31</ref> of title 38, United States Code (Training and Rehabilitation for Veterans with Service-Connected Disabilities).</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c/2/G" id="H38B74869929446D591F58D40BC7582BC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
					<num value="G">“(G)</num>
					<content>
						<ref href="/us/usc-chapter/38/32">Chapter 32</ref> of title 38, United States Code (Post-Vietnam Era Veterans’ Educational Assistance Program).</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c/2/H" id="HDF19D82BF0FA4C51BB51229404F451E5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
					<num value="H">“(H)</num>
					<content>
						<ref href="/us/usc-chapter/38/33">Chapter 33</ref> of title 38, United States Code (Post-9/11 Educational Assistance).</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c/2/I" id="HAEC8A5E3AD1741E4B036F3EB4202EAF4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
					<num value="I">“(I)</num>
					<content>
						<ref href="/us/usc-chapter/38/35">Chapter 35</ref> of title 38, United States Code (Survivors’ and Dependents’ Educational Assistance Program).</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c/2/J" id="H8B6E7256F0DC4080A1ECABBC77380FC7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
					<num value="J">“(J)</num>
					<content> Section 903 of the Department of Defense Authorization Act, 1981 (<ref href="/us/usc/10/2141">10 U.S.C. 2141</ref> note) (Educational Assistance Pilot Program).</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c/2/K" id="HC560AF6F90A7408DBBAA44955E3C6FF6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
					<num value="K">“(K)</num>
					<content> Section 156(b) of the ‘<quotedText>Joint Resolution making further continuing appropriations and providing for productive employment for the fiscal year 1983, and for other purposes</quotedText>’ (<ref href="/us/usc/42/402">42 U.S.C. 402</ref> note) (Restored Entitlement Program for Survivors, also known as ‘<quotedText>Quayle benefits</quotedText>’).</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/c/2/L" id="HB7D4256BBAF54728B82FE2F79351C3E6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
					<num value="L">“(L)</num>
					<content> The provisions of <ref href="/us/usc-chapter/37/3">chapter 3</ref> of title 37, United States Code, related to subsistence allowances for members of the Reserve Officers Training Corps.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d" id="H6F9C56E5073E43CDB1F63E24AB28F74A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
			<num value="d">“(d)</num>
			<heading> Independent students and determinations.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The term ‘<term>independent</term>’, when used with respect to a student, means any individual who—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/1" id="H8054A92E6DBD42A8B43C98B245BC764E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> is 24 years of age or older by December 31 of the award year;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/2" id="HC675FC6A60B44383B9C5D7093E424D48" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<chapeau> is, or was at any time when the individual was 13 years of age or older—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/2/A" id="H9AB4EACFB9C74DBB96B0D926B19E5374" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> an orphan;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/2/B" id="H0F0C3BE968B944F58458D45062171E75" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> a ward of the court; or</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/2/C" id="H6BF2A1C7195A4F0D8561C5C764ADCA64" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> in foster care;</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/3" id="HCEC71FAD112F4CBF983A94FF47668881" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<content> is, or was immediately prior to attaining the age of majority, an emancipated minor or in legal guardianship as determined by a court of competent jurisdiction in the individual’s State of legal residence;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/4" id="H9052CF183AE74CBBB87D944D6E50581F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<content> is a veteran of the Armed Forces of the United States (as defined in subsection (c)) or is currently serving on active duty in the Armed Forces for other than training purposes;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/5" id="H3F115404248E4BC99811A2DFD1649031" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<content> is a graduate or professional student;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/6" id="H2EDAB775C2BA448C8445445CA9C474B1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
				<num value="6">“(6)</num>
				<content> is married and not separated;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/7" id="H602A2D88EB2944EAB4594F42AD87A28A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
				<num value="7">“(7)</num>
				<content> has legal dependents other than a spouse;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/8" id="HA655C2F53AF349F3A8BF8F22B12EF0DF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
				<num value="8">“(8)</num>
				<content> is an unaccompanied homeless youth or is unaccompanied, at risk of homelessness, and self-supporting, without regard to such individual's age; and</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/9" id="H787C2535458C4D208F1613B992E7899B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
				<num value="9">“(9)</num>
				<chapeau> is a student for whom a financial aid administrator makes a documented determination of independence by reason of other unusual circumstances pursuant to section 479A(c) in which the student is unable to contact a parent or where contact with parents poses a risk to such student, which includes circumstances of—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/9/A" id="H66AB9272DD0249A286EF44D470DE87D2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> human trafficking, as described in the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000 (<ref href="/us/usc/22/7101">22 U.S.C. 7101</ref> et seq.);</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/9/B" id="H64667AAFF85C4305A260487AC59F701B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> legally granted refugee or asylum status;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/9/C" id="H50D31C5D27B64E3EB61347E63D701254" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> parental abandonment or estrangement; or</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/d/9/D" id="H636B84EBA5764269AADA8D7ED6590316" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> student or parental incarceration.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/e" id="H9F65BE6A72A844A9803B4B803E7AACDA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1983">
			<num value="e">“(e)</num>
			<heading> Excludable income.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The term ‘<term>excludable income</term>’ means—</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/e/1" id="H83E305E9588C4227B79BBD9E4DE3F8CB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> an amount equal to the education credits described in paragraphs (1) and (2) of <ref href="/us/usc/26/25A">section 25A(a)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986;</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/e/2" id="H3C64F2F48D4648EABB2C3E643244C07C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> if an applicant elects to report it, college grant and scholarship aid included in gross income on a Federal tax return, including amounts attributable to grant and scholarship portions of fellowships and assistantships and any national service educational award or post-service benefit received by an individual under title I of the National and Community Service Act of 1990 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/12511">42 U.S.C. 12511</ref> et seq.), including awards, living allowances, and interest accrual payments; and</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/e/3" id="H0EF0C7944BC443719B777190E731ECF1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<content> income earned from work under part C of this title.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/f" id="H74A54CB9FB08456BA105D65534646741" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
			<num value="f">“(f)</num>
			<heading> Assets.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/f/1" id="HD2347033A80548588B5B69C206946133" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>The term ‘<term>assets</term>’ means the amount in checking and savings accounts, time deposits, money market funds, investments, trusts, stocks, bonds, derivatives, securities, mutual funds, tax shelters, qualified education benefits (except as provided in paragraph (3)), the annual amount of child support received and the net value of real estate, vacation homes, income producing property, and business and farm assets, determined in accordance with section 478(c).</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/f/2" id="HF79CF548C33C4577AF4A32A8B66CB7D7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Exclusions.—</heading>
				<content>With respect to determinations of need under this title, the term ‘<term>assets</term>’ shall not include the net value of the family’s principal place of residence.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/f/3" id="HCCE81A35CE9C430CB2DA9BCD99DE7797" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Consideration of qualified education benefit.—</heading>
				<chapeau>A qualified education benefit shall be considered an asset of—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/f/3/A" id="H63A6A97D19F1466182CDA0E7223FB811" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> the student if the student is an independent student; or</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/f/3/B" id="HCD159AE8241E41E1844FA3DF7BAC7545" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> the parent if the student is a dependent student and the account is designated for the student, regardless of whether the owner of the account is the student or the parent.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/f/4" id="HB54771A37FD4422DABBAA327FB7030F7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> Definition of qualified education benefit.—</heading>
				<chapeau>In this subsection, the term ‘<term>qualified education benefit</term>’ means—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/f/4/A" id="H3A4273DBA3CE4F9A94E8AF90E998F158" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> a qualified tuition program (as defined in <ref href="/us/usc/26/529">section 529(b)(1)(A)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) or other prepaid tuition plan offered by a State; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/f/4/B" id="H10DBFA72F6464134A1CE8F6F2C06BA38" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> a Coverdell education savings account (as defined in <ref href="/us/usc/26/530">section 530(b)(1)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986).</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/g" id="H98D67BAF0AA347D5901423742B6C812A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
			<num value="g">“(g)</num>
			<heading> Net value.—</heading>
			<content>The term ‘<term>net value</term>’ means the market value at the time of application of the assets (as defined in subsection (f)), minus the outstanding liabilities or indebtedness against the assets.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/h" id="H03035DD9A67C496BBB1CD2E392A85652" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
			<num value="h">“(h)</num>
			<heading> Treatment of income taxes paid to other jurisdictions.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/h/1" id="H1AFEEC59EA0D40B78F40AF6DBEFDF914" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> The tax on income paid to the Governments of the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the Virgin Islands, or the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, the Republic of the Marshall Islands, the Federated States of Micronesia, or Palau under the laws applicable to those jurisdictions, or the comparable tax paid to the central government of a foreign country, shall be treated as Federal income taxes.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/h/2" id="H775189A3757E4EC7941C71F49DB1D1A6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1984">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> References in this part to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, Federal income tax forms, and the Internal Revenue Service shall, for purposes of the tax described in paragraph (1), be treated as references to the corresponding laws, tax forms, and tax collection agencies of those jurisdictions, respectively, subject to such adjustments as the Secretary may provide by regulation.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/i" id="H14349C37CC004F00BEE69C31F269ACCE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1985">
			<num value="i">“(i)</num>
			<heading> Other financial assistance.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/i/1" id="HFF69D2AE9D5841FEA6927E9FE052E667" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1985">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> For purposes of determining a student’s eligibility for funds under this title, other financial assistance not received under this title shall include all scholarships, grants, loans, or other assistance known to the institution at the time the determination of the student’s need is made, including national service educational awards or post-service benefits under title I of the National and Community Service Act of 1990 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/12511">42 U.S.C. 12511</ref> et seq.), but excluding veterans’ education benefits.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/i/2" id="HE51AA516556642DCA81F4F0C2E8EB33C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1985">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> Notwithstanding paragraph (1), a tax credit taken under <ref href="/us/usc/26/25A">section 25A</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, or a distribution that is not includable in gross income under section 529 of such Code, under another prepaid tuition plan offered by a State, or under a Coverdell education savings account under section 530 of such Code, shall not be treated as other financial assistance for purposes of section 471(a)(3).</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/i/3" id="H6A3BEEB17F8148EDA445CBEC7F81DCBD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1985">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<content> Notwithstanding paragraph (1) and section 472, assistance not received under this title may be excluded from both other financial assistance and cost of attendance, if that assistance is provided by a State and is designated by such State to offset a specific component of the cost of attendance. If that assistance is excluded from either other financial assistance or cost of attendance, it shall be excluded from both.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/i/4" id="H51B69B6ABB2944FF990CF029BE06F5EA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1985">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<content> Notwithstanding paragraph (1), payments made and services provided under part E of title IV of the Social Security Act to or on behalf of any child or youth over whom the State agency has responsibility for placement, care, or supervision, including the value of vouchers for education and training and amounts expended for room and board for youth who are not in foster care but are receiving services under section 477 of such Act, shall not be treated as other financial assistance for purposes of section 471(a)(3).</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/i/5" id="H1300CA96BCBA40448960F12EE109A2F8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1985">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<content> Notwithstanding paragraph (1), emergency financial assistance provided to the student for unexpected expenses that are a component of the student’s cost of attendance, and not otherwise considered when the determination of the student’s need is made, shall not be treated as other financial assistance for purposes of section 471(a)(3).</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/j" id="H05F06E91F3BD4A8FBBAB59DC827E9B10" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1985">
			<num value="j">“(j)</num>
			<heading> Dependents.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/j/1" id="H820661B07F0B4E3A8FCDB653AA97D890" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1985">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<content> Except as otherwise provided, the term ‘<term>dependent of the parent</term>’ means the student who is deemed to be a dependent student when applying for aid under this title, and any other person who lives with and receives more than one-half of their support from the parent (or parents) and will continue to receive more than half of their support from the parent (or parents) during the award year.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/j/2" id="H52907C6E89D2420CB1902A37FDEA139F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1985">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<content> Except as otherwise provided, the term ‘<term>dependent of the student</term>’ means the student’s dependent children and other persons (except the student’s spouse) who live with and receive more than one-half of their support from the student and will continue to receive more than half of their support from the student during the award year.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/k" id="H5641E00E5F48415DA3D8706EB5755F97" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1985">
			<num value="k">“(k)</num>
			<heading> Family size.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/k/1" id="HB2D6994E4E404268AFCE3E2ED8F6DC7D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1986">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> Dependent student.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Except as provided in paragraph (3), in determining family size in the case of a dependent student—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/k/1/A" id="HA14C213A9A324872B8F55F47C08D024E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1986">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> if the parents are not divorced or separated, family members include the student’s parents, and any dependent (within the meaning of <ref href="/us/usc/26/152">section 152</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 or an eligible individual for purposes of the credit under <ref href="/us/usc/26/24">section 24</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) of the student’s parents for the taxable year used in determining the amount of need of the student for financial assistance under this title;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/k/1/B" id="HDEF66D7CD115467A9F1056A7EC1402AA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1986">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> if the parents are divorced or separated, family members include the parent whose income is included in computing available income and any dependent (within the meaning of <ref href="/us/usc/26/152">section 152</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 or an eligible individual for purposes of the credit under <ref href="/us/usc/26/24">section 24</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) of that parent for the taxable year used in determining the amount of need of the student for financial assistance under this title;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/k/1/C" id="H6C0AD3DB4AFC47769E81DC92824995B6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1986">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> if the parents are divorced and the parents whose income is so included are remarried, or if the parent was a widow or widower who has remarried, family members also include, in addition to those individuals referred to in subparagraph (B), the new spouse and any dependent (within the meaning of <ref href="/us/usc/26/152">section 152</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 or an eligible individual for purposes of the credit under <ref href="/us/usc/26/24">section 24</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) of the new spouse for the taxable year used in determining the amount of need of the student for financial assistance under this title, if that spouse’s income is included in determining the parent’s adjusted available income; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/k/1/D" id="H24703AAFFF1B491DBA203A44228DC037" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1986">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> if the student is not considered as a dependent (within the meaning of <ref href="/us/usc/26/152">section 152</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 or an eligible individual for purposes of the credit under <ref href="/us/usc/26/24">section 24</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) of any parent, the parents’ family size shall include the student and the family members applicable to the parents’ situation under subparagraph (A), (B), or (C).</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/k/2" id="HFF3659BC50AF49A2AA71BADC5670B231" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1986">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Independent student.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Except as provided in paragraph (3), in determining family size in the case of an independent student—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/k/2/A" id="H12FE26FDC28D40EE946B4606DB8C75E9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1986">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> family members include the student, the student’s spouse, and any dependent (within the meaning of <ref href="/us/usc/26/152">section 152</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 or an eligible individual for purposes of the credit under <ref href="/us/usc/26/24">section 24</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) of that student for the taxable year used in determining the amount of need of the student for financial assistance under this title; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/k/2/B" id="H7D0D3D7F0BA7495EB705C884237E90D6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1986">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> if the student is divorced or separated, family members do not include the spouse (or ex-spouse), but do include the student and any dependent (within the meaning of <ref href="/us/usc/26/152">section 152</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 or an eligible individual for purposes of the credit under <ref href="/us/usc/26/24">section 24</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) of that student for the taxable year used in determining the amount of need of the student for financial assistance under this title.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/k/3" id="H64F20626B120469399079A49323DEA3A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Procedures and modification.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall provide procedures for determining family size in cases in which information for the taxable year used in determining the amount of need of the student for financial assistance under this title has changed or does not accurately reflect the applicant’s current household size, including when a divorce settlement only allows a parent to file for the Earned Income Tax Credit available under <ref href="/us/usc/26/32">section 32</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/l" id="HCEDF177B67FB40A19C6996D5F5FE8012" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
			<num value="l">“(l)</num>
			<heading> Business assets.—</heading>
			<content>The term ‘<term>business assets</term>’ means property that is used in the operation of a trade or business, including real estate, inventories, buildings, machinery, and other equipment, patents, franchise rights, and copyrights.</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/m" id="H12C7E24602E5433D868BC07B1EA1BF5C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
			<num value="m">“(m)</num>
			<heading> Homeless youth.—</heading>
			<content>The term ‘<term>homeless youth</term>’ has the meaning given the term ‘<term>homeless children and youths</term>’ in section 725 of the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/11434a">42 U.S.C. 11434a</ref>).</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/l/2/qB/s480/n" id="H8632C0A031254158AE6728E8F12AF617" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
			<num value="n">“(n)</num>
			<heading> Unaccompanied.—</heading>
			<content>The terms ‘<term>unaccompanied</term>’, ‘<term>unaccompanied youth</term>’, or ‘<term>unaccompanied homeless youth</term>’ have the meaning given the term ‘<term>unaccompanied youth</term>’ in section 725 of the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/11434a">42 U.S.C. 11434a</ref>).”</content>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Part F of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087kk et seq.)

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H5C83A52B4B1D47F4B1FAE4EAA96B27C2" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<section identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483" id="HD8ADCAEDF35E4BFC94FA658E859CA96E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
		<num value="483">“SEC. 483.</num>
		<heading> Free application for federal student aid.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a" id="H15C6CEF0788845049F636D431BFF3EB8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> Simplified application for federal student financial aid.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/1" id="H369DF4CCE99E402DA087CD356A2423F0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>Each individual seeking to apply for Federal financial aid under this title for award year 2023–2024 and any subsequent award year shall file a free application with the Secretary, known as the ‘<quotedText>Free Application for Federal Student Aid</quotedText>’, to determine eligibility for such aid, as described in paragraph (2), and in accordance with section 479.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2" id="H138705A1FAF649E9B073004BB89608BC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Free application.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/A" id="H9502AFC3F0EC4620BD804B1F21326DEE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<content>The Secretary shall make available, for the purposes of paragraph (1), a free application to determine the eligibility of a student for Federal financial aid under this title.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B" id="H239C990C33914D688AD89CC574C3E904" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Information required by the applicant.—</heading>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/i" id="HF963C7A68AB847AFAF4DAB9B4A58E004" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<heading> In general.—</heading>
						<content>The applicant, and, if necessary, the parents or spouse of the applicant, shall provide the Secretary with the applicable information described in clause (ii) in order to be eligible for Federal financial aid under this title.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii" id="H3CB465787E0E42E782238D39E3DD086A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<heading> Information to be provided.—</heading>
						<chapeau>The information described in this clause is the following:</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/I" id="H2EE9A39074B241A289D11055371D77FC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> Name.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/II" id="H9A8735E920E14336AE578E98853B5AD5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> Contact information, including address, phone number, email address, or other electronic address.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/III" id="HAC55F607ED324149860C8425EB4C27DA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
							<num value="III">“(III)</num>
							<content> Social security number.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/IV" id="H1F50B2F2FFD8437495BD1AD346088CC8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1987">
							<num value="IV">“(IV)</num>
							<content> Date of birth.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/V" id="HE6FFAB7EF17C4EB3838EB4BB338AED72" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
							<num value="V">“(V)</num>
							<content> Marital status.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/VI" id="H0C12DD72D7974FC6BBAAB138174C5ECE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
							<num value="VI">“(VI)</num>
							<content> Citizenship status, including alien registration number, if applicable.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/VII" id="H92D0F0FC151F41FDB6854414CB4319E9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
							<num value="VII">“(VII)</num>
							<content> Sex.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/VIII" id="H62AE3278DBE74BB294D9A47B9A7E50F5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
							<num value="VIII">“(VIII)</num>
							<content> Race or ethnicity, using categories developed in consultation with the Bureau of the Census and the Director of the Institute of Education Sciences that, to the greatest extent practicable, separately capture the racial groups specified in the American Community Survey of the Bureau of the Census.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/IX" id="H2A57867992754601AB7E3E46B7D2EF45" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
							<num value="IX">“(IX)</num>
							<content> State of legal residence and date of residency.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/X" id="H8FE3FDACCFFC4521A659D7C7608FC3AB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
							<num value="X">“(X)</num>
							<chapeau> The following information on secondary school completion:</chapeau>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/X/aa" id="H8BA6A10AD51A4DF49976892FBEBF422F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
								<num value="aa">“(aa)</num>
								<content> Name and location of the high school from which the applicant received, or will receive prior to the period of enrollment for which aid is sought, a regular high school diploma;</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/X/bb" id="HC72EF24D27A24AFC9616BD8362D4D3A8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
								<num value="bb">“(bb)</num>
								<content> name and location of the entity from which the applicant received, or will receive prior to the period of enrollment for which aid is sought, a recognized equivalent of a regular high school diploma; or</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/X/cc" id="HBDF76D078DB547269E137A7FFC2A1750" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
								<num value="cc">“(cc)</num>
								<content> if the applicant completed or will complete prior to the period of enrollment for which aid is sought, a secondary school education in a home school setting that is treated as a home school or private school under State law.</content>
							</item>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XI" id="H341A5D514B8C4BD9B8CBD579B2FC2144" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
							<num value="XI">“(XI)</num>
							<content> Name of each institution where the applicant intends to apply for enrollment or continue enrollment.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XII" id="H583B1862305D40FC89DCFAF1AEE0C213" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
							<num value="XII">“(XII)</num>
							<content> Year in school for period of enrollment for which aid is sought, including whether applicant will have finished first bachelor’s degree prior to the period of enrollment for which aid is sought.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XIII" id="H32F978C19BAE407AA602121DE63973B7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
							<num value="XIII">“(XIII)</num>
							<content> Whether one or both of the applicant’s parents attended college.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XIV" id="H7272D388B7904568BEFF168D0B627CE8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
							<num value="XIV">“(XIV)</num>
							<chapeau> Any required asset information, unless exempt under section 479, in which the applicant shall indicate—</chapeau>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XIV/aa" id="H5418938FE8924D59A54BF367A7F90A88" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
								<num value="aa">“(aa)</num>
								<content> the annual amount of child support received, if applicable; and</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XIV/bb" id="H4D6FC92FEC954FAC84D1493D3241F234" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
								<num value="bb">“(bb)</num>
								<content> all required asset information not described in item (aa).</content>
							</item>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XV" id="H605A042DACAB4A4B80B578CEF3727EB4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
							<num value="XV">“(XV)</num>
							<content> The number of members of the applicant’s family who will also be enrolled in an eligible institution of higher education on at least a half-time basis during the same enrollment period as the applicant.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVI" id="HAC80D809C90B4E788B29361853B124AF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1988">
							<num value="XVI">“(XVI)</num>
							<chapeau> If the applicant meets any of the following designations:</chapeau>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVI/aa" id="HEA8F1266D5A54C3A9D0028816B256EED" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="aa">“(aa)</num>
								<content> Is an unaccompanied homeless youth, or is unaccompanied, at risk of homelessness, and self-supporting.</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVI/bb" id="HDF2B462DEB6945DF96540B642ED29A8F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="bb">“(bb)</num>
								<content> Is an emancipated minor.</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVI/cc" id="H04CB437EF772453CAF0134E3707689AE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="cc">“(cc)</num>
								<content> Is in legal guardianship.</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVI/dd" id="H2B1BEF7DE3AE4D7FABE6F1D92E8571F7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="dd">“(dd)</num>
								<content> Has been a dependent ward of the court at any time since the applicant turned 13.</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVI/ee" id="HEBA5C7FAEAA9421291F9D74E3ABA6A80" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="ee">“(ee)</num>
								<content> Has been in foster care at any time since the applicant turned 13.</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVI/ff" id="HA4ED5AEDB47D4520BFC4A389AA4DA200" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="ff">“(ff)</num>
								<content> Both parents have died since the applicant turned 13.</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVI/gg" id="HB309B98EB75349FAB329C094B0501FA4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="gg">“(gg)</num>
								<content> Is a veteran of the Armed Forces of the United States or is serving (on the date of the application) on active duty in the Armed Forces for other than training purposes.</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVI/hh" id="H5F2FCF5F31BB4769897CF1A597E1D718" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="hh">“(hh)</num>
								<content> Is under the age of 24 and has a dependent child or relative.</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVI/ii" id="H197F3FC446CB4B2BA3A57FE47A484471" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
								<content> Does not have access to parental information due to an unusual circumstance described in section 480(d)(9). </content>
							</item>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVII" id="H25818EB714D8472F98C7C08E58A748DD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
							<num value="XVII">“(XVII)</num>
							<chapeau> If the applicant receives or has received any of the following means-tested Federal benefits within the last two years:</chapeau>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVII/aa" id="H4CD37A5813434D4EA55F3E4B694DB6FB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="aa">“(aa)</num>
								<content> The supplemental security income program under title XVI of the Social Security Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/1381">42 U.S.C. 1381</ref> et seq.).</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVII/bb" id="HE8EDFD98B2C54CC48676730962614CCF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="bb">“(bb)</num>
								<content> The supplemental nutrition assistance program under the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (<ref href="/us/usc/7/2011">7 U.S.C. 2011</ref> et seq.), a nutrition assistance program carried out under section 19 of such Act (<ref href="/us/usc/7/2028">7 U.S.C. 2028</ref>), or a supplemental nutrition assistance program carried out under section 3(c) of the Act entitled ‘<quotedText>An Act to authorize appropriations for certain insular areas of the United States, and for other purposes</quotedText>’ (<ref href="/us/pl/95/348">Public Law 95–348</ref>).</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVII/cc" id="H588045978FBF4AB19D827CD03ADE437B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="cc">“(cc)</num>
								<content> The free and reduced price school lunch program established under the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/1751">42 U.S.C. 1751</ref> et seq.).</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVII/dd" id="HCEAD799E97B84BBAA3FFA9CC45F0E1B3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="dd">“(dd)</num>
								<content> The program of block grants for States for temporary assistance for needy families established under part A of title IV of the Social Security Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/601">42 U.S.C. 601</ref> et seq.).</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVII/ee" id="HD3E218CFCD894ECC9F30A3D6B224C151" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="ee">“(ee)</num>
								<content> The special supplemental nutrition program for women, infants, and children established by section 17 of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/1786">42 U.S.C. 1786</ref>).</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVII/ff" id="H3ABAF3BB80454B23867B803036F0E830" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="ff">“(ff)</num>
								<content> The Medicaid program under title XIX of the Social Security Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/1396">42 U.S.C. 1396</ref> et seq.).</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVII/gg" id="H2642EE7CDA5446E888AD64668CBE248D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1989">
								<num value="gg">“(gg)</num>
								<content> Federal housing assistance programs, including tenant-based assistance under section 8(o) of the United States Housing Act of 1937 (<ref href="/us/usc/42/1437f">42 U.S.C. 1437f(o)</ref>), and public housing, as defined in section 3(b)(1) of such Act (<ref href="/us/usc/42/1437a">42 U.S.C. 1437a(b)(1)</ref>).</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVII/hh" id="H44EEEA325F2A4B358FB0E7B6F6F54D65" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1990">
								<num value="hh">“(hh)</num>
								<content> Refundable credit for coverage under a qualified health plan under <ref href="/us/usc/26/36B">section 36B</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVII/ii" id="HE5156AE49A5B4AA1B9F3FDA8D096AC02" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1990">
								<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
								<content> The Earned Income Tax Credit under <ref href="/us/usc/26/32">section 32</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. </content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVII/jj" id="H2EF938B020B64B11BE9E848D0F0AAE4C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1990">
								<num value="jj">“(jj)</num>
								<content> Any other means-tested program determined by the Secretary to be appropriate. </content>
							</item>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XVIII" id="H4A246EE2A6C44773B5BFFA3238CC1FFD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1990">
							<num value="XVIII">“(XVIII)</num>
							<content> If the applicant, or, if necessary, the parents or spouse of the applicant, reported receiving tax exempt payments from an individual retirement plan (as defined in <ref href="/us/usc/26/7701">section 7701</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) distribution or from pensions or annuities on a Federal tax return, information as to how much of the individual retirement plan distribution or pension or annuity disbursement was a qualified rollover.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XIX" id="H8915E938258B41E98068A29B4969F313" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1990">
							<num value="XIX">“(XIX)</num>
							<content> If the applicant, or, if necessary, the parents or spouse of the applicant, reported receiving foreign income that is exempt from Federal taxation or for which a permanent resident of the United States or United States citizen receives a foreign tax credit, information regarding the amount of such foreign income.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/ii/XX" id="H9C1B9DFD41C3486A8B2CE7E80CCACD65" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1990">
							<num value="XX">“(XX)</num>
							<content> If the applicant, or, if applicable, the parents or spouse of the applicant, elects to report receiving college grant and scholarship aid included in gross income on a Federal tax return described in section 480(e)(2), information regarding the amount of such aid</content>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/iii" id="HC135B0D7605D4D85844BA5245374E5A2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1990">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<heading> Prohibition against requesting information more than once.—</heading>
						<content>Any information requested during the process of creating an account for completing the free application under this subsection, shall, to the fullest extent possible, not be required a second time for the same award year, or in a duplicative manner, when completing such free application except in the case of an unusual situation, such as a temporary inability to access an account for completing such free application.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/iv" id="H6119BD7EC4254A178CDC526F65637568" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1990">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<heading> Change in family size.—</heading>
						<content>The Secretary shall provide a process by which an applicant shall confirm the accuracy of family size or update the family size with respect to such applicant for purposes of determining the need of such applicant for financial assistance under this title based on a change in family size from the tax year data used for such determination.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/v" id="H3E995B5AE76E47F182E788E28651B92B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1990">
						<num value="v">“(v)</num>
						<heading> Single question for homeless status.—</heading>
						<chapeau>The Secretary shall ensure that—</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/v/I" id="H562905011B8A46CE8E9DD6661B1A8B4A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1990">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> on the form developed under this section for which the information is applicable, there is a single, easily understood screening question to identify an applicant who is an unaccompanied homeless youth or is unaccompanied, at risk of homelessness, and self-supporting; and</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/v/II" id="H67AA25F104764B3BA5825DA964C8B3E4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1991">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> such question is distinct from those relating to an individual who does not have access to parental income due to an unusual circumstance.</content>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/B/vi" id="H42E7077AC0944124AD257796063034D1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1991">
						<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
						<heading> Adjustments.—</heading>
						<content>The Secretary shall disclose on the FAFSA that the student may, on a case-by-case basis, qualify for an adjustment under section 479A to the cost of attendance or the values of the data items required to calculate the student’s eligibility for a Federal Pell Grant or the student aid index for the student or parent.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/C" id="H07C5F38D0F38498BA90BD24A75246BB8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1991">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<heading> Notification and approval of request for tax return information.—</heading>
					<content>The Secretary shall notify students and borrowers who wish to submit an application for Federal student financial aid under this title (as well as parents and spouses who must sign such an application or request or a Master Promissory Note on behalf of those students and borrowers) of the authority of the Secretary to require that such persons affirmatively approve that the Internal Revenue Service disclose their tax return information as described in section 494.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/D" id="HF036190712A547FD87DBC7653C69BB1D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1991">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<heading> Authorizations available to the applicant.—</heading>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/D/i" id="HA5A32679D5A6445BBA172FF5FFB946E1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1991">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<heading> Authorization to disclose fafsa information, including a redisclosure of tax return information, to institution, state higher education agency, and designated scholarship organizations.—</heading>
						<chapeau>An applicant and, if necessary, the parents or spouse of the applicant shall provide the Secretary with authorization to disclose to an institution, State higher education agency, and scholarship organizations (designated (prior to the date of enactment of the FUTURE Act (<ref href="/us/pl/116/91">Public Law 116–91</ref>)) by the Secretary under section 483(a)(3)(E)) as in effect on such date of enactment, as specified by the applicant and in accordance with section 494, in order for the applicant’s eligibility for Federal financial aid programs, State financial aid programs, institutional financial aid programs, and scholarship programs at scholarship organizations (designated (prior to the date of enactment of the FUTURE Act (<ref href="/us/pl/116/91">Public Law 116–91</ref>)) by the Secretary under section 483(a)(3)(E)) as in effect on such date of enactment, to be determined, the following:</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/D/i/I" id="H9268398908D241ED95B4D81BF1925F33" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1991">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> Information described under <ref href="/us/usc/26/6103">section 6103(l)(13)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/D/i/II" id="HF9E1A961C0D14600BB496638D1A8A855" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1991">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> All information provided by the applicant on the application described by this subsection to determine the applicant’s eligibility for Federal financial aid under this title and for the application, award, and administration of such Federal financial aid, except the name of an institution to which an applicant selects to redisclose information shall not be disclosed to any other institution.</content>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/D/ii" id="HF9684696B41644608AC41BF0CFF6E550" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1991">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<heading> Authorization to disclose to benefits programs.—</heading>
						<content>An applicant and, if necessary, the parents or spouse of the applicant may provide the Secretary with authorization to disclose to applicable agencies that handle applications for means-tested Federal benefit programs, as defined in section 479(b)(4)(H), all information provided by the applicant on the application described by this subsection as well as such applicant’s student aid index and scheduled Federal Pell Grant award to assist in identification, outreach and application efforts for the application, award, and administration of such means-tested Federal benefits programs, except such information shall not include Federal tax information as specified in <ref href="/us/usc/26/6103">section 6103(l)(13)(C)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/E" id="H231F6F2467AF4BB8A1DF9335CD89A871" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1992">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<heading> Action by the secretary.—</heading>
					<chapeau>Upon receiving—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/E/i" id="HB19BA48465354F1181C9E8A4746D4453" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1992">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> an application under this section, the Secretary shall, as soon as practicable, perform the necessary functions with the Commissioner of Internal Revenue to calculate the applicant’s student aid index and scheduled award for a Federal Pell Grant, if applicable, assuming full-time enrollment for an academic year, and note to the applicant the assumptions relationship to the scheduled award; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/E/ii" id="H4F4BE73C42BE4F8BB99F58123B9DE7B7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1992">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> an authorization under subparagraph (D), the Secretary shall, as soon as practicable, disclose the information described under such subparagraph, as specified by the applicant, in order for the applicant’s eligibility for Federal, State, or institutional student financial aid programs or means-tested Federal benefit programs to be estimated or determined.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/2/F" id="H7887DFA412FD45C596E392ECF1043717" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1992">
					<num value="F">“(F)</num>
					<heading> Work study wages.—</heading>
					<content>With respect to an applicant who has received income earned from work under part C of this title, the Secretary shall take the steps necessary to collect information on the amount of such income for the purposes of calculating such applicant’s student aid index and scheduled award for a Federal Pell Grant, if applicable, without adding additional questions to the FAFSA, including by collecting such information from institutions of higher education participating in work-study programs under part C of this title.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3" id="H343518EE0F9B416D893D2FE3440DB03B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1992">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Information to be supplied by the secretary of education.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A" id="HCA469E4FA9CD4FECA2A8F15886198EEE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1992">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<chapeau>Upon receiving and timely processing a free application that contains the information described in paragraph (2), the Secretary shall provide to the applicant the following information based on full-time attendance for an academic year:</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A/i" id="H4DA6EF1555D542B9BAA4D7ABB811A53C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1992">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> The estimated dollar amount of a Federal Pell Grant scheduled award for which the applicant is eligible for such award year.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A/ii" id="H3A5FCDC925244B3AB89C868F29B76C70" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1992">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> Information on other types of Federal financial aid for which the applicant may be eligible (including situations in which the applicant could qualify for 150 percent of a scheduled Federal Pell Grant award and loans made under this title) and how the applicant can find additional information regarding such aid.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A/iii" id="H298665A31A3745979836A753021BB1C5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1992">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<chapeau> Consumer-tested information regarding each institution selected by the applicant in accordance with paragraph (2)(B)(ii)(XI), which may include the following:</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A/iii/I" id="H041F29F608FC48138FC47984F02C8390" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<chapeau> The following information, as collected through the Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System or a successor Federal data system as designated by the Secretary:</chapeau>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A/iii/I/aa" id="H98848366CDCB46719C43C3222DC59260" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
								<num value="aa">“(aa)</num>
								<content> Net price by the income categories, as described under section 132(i)(6), and disaggregated by undergraduate and graduate programs, as applicable.</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A/iii/I/bb" id="H1CACCF9C6DDC499682C6CC685EC4F180" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
								<num value="bb">“(bb)</num>
								<content> Graduation rate.</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A/iii/I/cc" id="HEC42CA1FDBE74BAA8C8CAE52A5218BDC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
								<num value="cc">“(cc)</num>
								<content> Retention rate.</content>
							</item>
							<item identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A/iii/I/dd" id="HD6B034CAD3E94296B38EB3C5CC377526" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
								<num value="dd">“(dd)</num>
								<content> Transfer rate, if available.</content>
							</item>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A/iii/II" id="HBBCFEB6A3C4D48C59A5A3E72A3C30C69" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> Median debt of students upon completion.</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A/iii/III" id="HFE9E1EB3E8034D3BAC1D74AADD53AEA6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
							<num value="III">“(III)</num>
							<content> Institutional default rate, as calculated under section 435.</content>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A/iv" id="H70043B499F9A45C3B7FB03693E1513B4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> If the student is eligible for a student aid index of less than or equal to zero under section 473, a notification of the Federal means-tested benefits that they have not already indicated they receive, but for which they may be eligible, and relevant links and information on how to apply for such benefits. </content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A/v" id="H0DA63275AD5942B893CFF5AF5F5D4DDD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
						<num value="v">“(v)</num>
						<content> Information on education tax benefits described in paragraphs (1) and (2) of <ref href="/us/usc/26/25A">section 25A(a)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 or other applicable education tax benefits determined in consultation with the Secretary of the Treasury.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A/vi" id="H77EB9F6F603148A48586D9C98994BF3E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
						<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
						<content> If the individual identified as a veteran, or as serving (on the date of the application) on active duty in the Armed Forces for other than training purposes, information on benefits administered by the Department of Veteran Affairs or Department of Defense, respectively.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/A/vii" id="H2AA8058D61174D889C85C8CF41D33E4B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
						<num value="vii">“(vii)</num>
						<content> If applicable, the applicant’s current outstanding balance of loans under this title.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/B" id="H1998DCE8014B43AE82D304B024260A53" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Information provided to the state.—</heading>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/B/i" id="HE602FED3FB674242A6FD285A3BBB85CF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<heading> In general.—</heading>
						<content>The Secretary shall redisclose, with authorization from the applicant in accordance with paragraph (2)(D)(i), to a State higher education agency administering State-based financial aid and serving the applicant’s State of residence, the information described under <ref href="/us/usc/26/6103">section 6103(l)(13)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and information described in paragraph (2)(B) for the application, award, and administration of grants and other student financial aid provided directly from the State to be determined by such State. Such information shall include the list of institutions provided by the applicant on the application.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/B/ii" id="H83B95D3422FD43A4836D65AFA80949BE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<heading> Use of information.—</heading>
						<chapeau>A State agency administering State-based financial aid—</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/B/ii/I" id="HEAF260FCACE44AE6958E63003B1A670E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> shall use the information provided under clause (i) solely for the application, award, and administration of State-based financial aid for which the applicant is eligible;</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/B/ii/II" id="H249D43938EB64F2B89516A93E5039EBC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1993">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> may use the information, except for the information described under <ref href="/us/usc/26/6103">section 6103(l)(13)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, for State agency research that does not release any individually identifiable information on any applicant to promote college attendance, persistence, and completion;</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/B/ii/III" id="H0483030382B148819C61C474093424B1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1994">
							<num value="III">“(III)</num>
							<content> may use identifying information provided by student applicants on the FAFSA to determine whether or not a graduating secondary student has filed the application in coordination with local educational agencies or secondary schools to encourage students to complete the application; and</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/B/ii/IV" id="H6E91A37D51624DA29787DF2DB2F38416" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1994">
							<num value="IV">“(IV)</num>
							<content> may share the application information, excluding the information described under <ref href="/us/usc/26/6103">section 6103(l)(13)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, with any other entity, only if such applicant provides explicit written consent of the applicant, except as provided in subclause (III).</content>
						</subclause>
