					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/B/iii" id="H5AD7909BF2104B1385907B052951AFFA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1994">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<heading> Limitation on consent process.—</heading>
						<content>A State may provide a consent process whereby an applicant may elect to share the information described in clause (i), except for the information described in <ref href="/us/usc/26/6103">section 6103(l)(13)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, through explicit written consent to Federal, State, or local government agencies or tribal organizations to assist such applicant in applying for and receiving Federal, State, or local government assistance, or tribal assistance for any component of the applicant’s cost of attendance that may include financial assistance or non-monetary assistance.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/B/iv" id="H819D4BB6A0024869834B2A3D3E0A4C1D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1994">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<heading> Prohibition.—</heading>
						<content>Any entity that receives applicant information under clause (iii) shall not sell, share, or otherwise use applicant information other than for the purposes outlined in clause (iii).</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/C" id="H871CAD9C58754225BB7A22AA89AB2DE8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1994">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<heading> Use of information provided to the institution.—</heading>
					<chapeau>An institution—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/C/i" id="H1AA9FED5A87F420687C97549920303D2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1994">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> shall use the information provided to it solely for the application, award, and administration of financial aid to the applicant;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/C/ii" id="H2B4A6592DF8E4399AE396D7D64D1D3A7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1994">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> may use the information provided, excluding the information described under <ref href="/us/usc/26/6013">section 6013(l)(13)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, for research that does not release any individually identifiable information on any applicant, to promote college attendance, persistence, and completion; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/C/iii" id="HC309CE9EEC474ACFB0A6C9BA4CC6D1A8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1994">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> shall not share such educational record information with any other entity without the explicit written consent of the applicant.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/D" id="H98D5CF8F1B8B4F78A9DEB0EA64771745" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1994">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<heading> Prohibition.—</heading>
					<content>Any entity that receives applicant information under subparagraph (C)(iii) shall not sell, share, or otherwise use applicant information other than for the purposes outlined in subparagraph (C).</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/3/E" id="H574EE540FAFE44348FC39CBEB56A7121" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1994">
					<num value="E">“(E)</num>
					<heading> Fafsa information that includes tax return information.—</heading>
					<content>An applicant’s FAFSA information that includes return or return information as described in <ref href="/us/usc/26/6103">section 6103(l)(13)</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 may be disclosed or redisclosed (which shall include obtaining, sharing, or discussing such information) only in accordance with the procedures described in section 494.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/4" id="H12ED4182C4FB41D3B1C4B9A20B39BB99" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1995">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> Development of form and information exchange.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Prior to the design of the free application under this subsection, the Secretary shall, to the maximum extent practicable, on an annual basis—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/4/A" id="H54A8CCD9ECCE45D3B5CF1522A2DA11AF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1995">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<chapeau> consult with stakeholders to gather information about innovations and technology available to—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/4/A/i" id="H08B08CCB737348CFBD53E9DB9BA5C9AE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1995">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> ensure an efficient and effective process;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/4/A/ii" id="HE3EF5C9CE2594E77B1A9A3FE9479B27B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1995">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> mitigate unintended consequences; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/4/A/iii" id="H926F1CA8DE2948A396174D60BA5472B3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1995">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> determine the best practices for outreach to students and families during the transition to the streamlined process for the determination of Federal financial aid and Federal Pell Grant eligibility while reducing the data burden on applicants and families; and</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/4/B" id="H99B72063FBC24A2CA741D3610E8767F9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1995">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> solicit public comments for the format of the free application that provides for adequate time to incorporate feedback prior to development of the application for the succeeding award year.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/5" id="HB3CFF115B1BB47F79ABBB59FEA1CF33F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1995">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<heading> No additional information requests permitted.—</heading>
				<content>In carrying out this subsection, the Secretary may not require additional information to be submitted by an applicant (or the parents or spouse of an applicant) for Federal financial aid through other requirements or reporting, except as required under a process or procedure exercised in accordance with the authority under section 479A.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/6" id="HEC972605A76D4603936816D8112649D0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1995">
				<num value="6">“(6)</num>
				<heading> State-run programs.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/6/A" id="HFC82D0B5DCB94D4692C50BC15100DA22" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1995">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<content>The Secretary shall conduct outreach to States in order to research the benefits to students of States relying solely on the student aid index, scheduled Pell Grant Award, or the financial data made available, upon authorization by the applicant, as a result of an application for aid under this subsection for determining the eligibility of the applicant for State provided financial aid.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/6/B" id="H739C8D739A1B4E56856528B151E40714" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1995">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Secretarial review.—</heading>
					<chapeau>If a State determines that there is a need for additional data elements beyond those provided pursuant to this subsection for determining the eligibility of an applicant for State provided financial aid, the State shall forward a list of those additional data elements determined necessary, but not provided by virtue of the application under this subsection, to the Secretary. The Secretary shall make readily available to the public through the Department’s websites and other means—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/6/B/i" id="HCF96E5E00913472182833447CC574BA1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1995">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> a list of States that do not require additional financial information separate from the Free Application for Federal Student Aid and do not require asset information from students who qualify for the exemption from asset reporting under section 479 for the purposes of awarding State scholarships and grant aid;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/6/B/ii" id="H17ACC68A0E504E14A84FD113AAD1B890" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1995">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> a list of States that require asset information from students who qualify for the exemption from asset reporting under section 479 for the purposes of awarding State scholarships and grant aid;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/6/B/iii" id="HDFB4DB95FB2E472D98DEABBB49EF875A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1995">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> a list of States that have indicated that they require additional financial information separate from the Free Application for Federal Student Aid for purposes of awarding State scholarships and grant aid; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/6/B/iv" id="HA1E5810714DE45B28D62C9F15275CB2F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1996">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> with the publication of the lists under this subparagraph, information about additional resources available to applicants, including links to such State websites.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/7" id="H7C367B22827F4E57916B096803C10E50" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1996">
				<num value="7">“(7)</num>
				<heading> Institution-run financial aid.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/7/A" id="H2804A72F3D5D4617A59E9AD4963DC596" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1996">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<chapeau>The Secretary shall conduct outreach to institutions of higher education to describe the benefits to students of relying solely on the student aid index, scheduled Pell Grant Award, or the financial data made available, upon authorization for release by the applicant, as a result of an application for aid under this subsection for determining the eligibility of the applicant for institutional financial aid. The Secretary shall make readily available to the public through its websites and other means—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/7/A/i" id="H3A590195E3AE4A6E8603238F8BA88456" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1996">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> a list of institutions that do not require additional financial information separate from the Free Application for Federal Student Aid and do not require asset information from students who qualify for the exemption from asset reporting under section 479 for the purpose of awarding institution-run financial aid;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/7/A/ii" id="H30590C3F71324D6B852C2614B898AB47" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1996">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> a list of institutions that require asset information from students who qualify for the exemption from asset reporting under section 479 for the purpose of awarding institution-run financial aid;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/7/A/iii" id="H665CD8C7900D48EE920CCD553F334E1A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1996">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> a list of institutions that require additional financial information separate from the Free Application for Federal Student Aid for the purpose of awarding institution-run financial aid; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/7/A/iv" id="H75CD25CCB0E848BE8BAAB90B282678EB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1996">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> with the publication of the list in clause (iii), information about additional resources available to applicants.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/8" id="H0618494B5267468EADEEBFF4178B92AA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1996">
				<num value="8">“(8)</num>
				<heading> Security of data.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall, in consultation with the Secretary of the Treasury—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/8/A" id="HFEC9A867233C4DE1AABF38DC91892DC5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1996">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> take all necessary steps to safeguard the data required to be transmitted for the purpose of this section between Federal agencies and to States and institutions of higher education and secure the transmittal of such data;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/8/B" id="H4F439363F2764FB9B1CEA4293DDC9792" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1996">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> provide guidance to States and institutions of higher education regarding their obligation to ensure the security of the data provided under this section and <ref href="/us/usc/26/6103">section 6103</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/8/C" id="H20BC03C5B3004F0D8B78D9CE615FBD57" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1996">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> provide guidance on the implementation of <ref href="/us/usc/26/6103">section 6103</ref> of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including how it intersects with the provisions of section 444 of the General Education Provisions Act (commonly known as the ‘<quotedText>Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act of 1974</quotedText>’), and any additional consent processes that may be available to applicants in accordance with the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding sharing of Federal tax information.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/9" id="H3411141A749B4ECD8640A567CCF8C4DC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1996">
				<num value="9">“(9)</num>
				<heading> Report to congress.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/9/A" id="HAB981A4871A4409B866111383E6FAB5A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1996">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<chapeau>Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the <shortTitle>FAFSA Simplification Act</shortTitle>, the Secretary shall report to the authorizing committees on the progress of the Secretary in carrying out this subsection, including planning and stakeholder consultation. Such report shall include—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/9/A/i" id="HFDB5FA5025BD4B3AAC7427ECC525069B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> benchmarks for implementation;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/9/A/ii" id="H00722049F9FE406A92C203CE0D1CF592" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> entities and organizations that the Secretary consulted;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/9/A/iii" id="H75B8BA7401B24D41B9D2503093FE0AC0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> system requirements for such implementation and how they will be addressed;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/9/A/iv" id="H71F95F61EE224993AF8E87D651A3C6EB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> any areas of concern and potential problem issues uncovered that may hamper such implementation; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/9/A/v" id="HC887A149EED84F518A9852E313858EE9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
						<num value="v">“(v)</num>
						<content> solutions determined to address such issues.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/9/B" id="HF939DEDCAF2A410C98CCFB4C423B6FDA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Updates.—</heading>
					<chapeau>The Secretary shall provide updates to the authorizing committees—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/9/B/i" id="H2FE7CF2CB0834BE18CF55234AD53BD07" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> as to the progress and planning described in subparagraph (A) prior to implementation of the revisions to the Free Application for Federal Student Aid under this subsection not less often than quarterly; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/a/9/B/ii" id="HEF876A4EE3624E25ABA2A7C3D534707D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> at least 6 months and 1 year after implementation of the revisions to the Free Application for Federal Student Aid.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b" id="H9B3C0E778D1D4143931DA7568A0F114D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Adjustments and improvements.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/1" id="HD870409FBA4D48AC91228C19C5E44102" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall disclose in a consumer-tested format, upon completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid under this section, that the student may, on a case-by-case basis, qualify for an adjustment under section 479A to the cost of attendance or the values of the data items required to calculate the Federal Pell Grant or the need analysis for the student or parent. Such disclosure shall specify—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/1/A" id="HE3F012791C384E3793891E8EF8C2EB60" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> examples of the special circumstances under which a student or family member may qualify for such adjustment or determination of independence; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/1/B" id="HA84AE1AEEC9C453AA461C720C9BB00D2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> additional information regarding the steps a student or family member may take in order to seek an adjustment under section 479A.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/2" id="H0D3D596F9447498DBB2C2388B13A87DE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Consumer testing.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/2/A" id="H5ED21850E1644E88866DCFB2E8B64AF9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<content>Not later than 9 months after the date of enactment of the FAFSA Simplification Act, the Secretary shall begin consumer testing the design of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid under this section with prospective first-generation college students, representatives of students (including low-income students, English learners, first-generation college students, adult students, veterans, servicemembers, and prospective students), students’ families (including low-income families, families with English learners, families with first-generation college students, and families with prospective students), institutions of higher education, secondary school and postsecondary counselors, and nonprofit consumer groups.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/2/B" id="H734B774D4FB040D2B25B87D1D113FF57" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1997">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Updates.—</heading>
					<content>For award year 2023–2024 and at least each fourth succeeding award year thereafter, the Secretary shall update the design of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid based on additional consumer testing with the populations described in subparagraph (A) in order to improve the usability and accessibility of the application.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/3" id="H9376C64957484B778DB946CE89C94E33" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Accessibility of the fafsa.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/3/A" id="H935BF5D154704D92A2FA78616A7E62AF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> in conjunction with the Bureau of the Census, determine the most common languages spoken by English learner students and their parents in the United States;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/3/B" id="H213658364FA447AA9C318B5BBA9D3F23" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> develop and make publicly available versions of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid form in not fewer than 11 of the most common languages determined under subparagraph (A) and make such versions available and accessible to applicants in paper and electronic formats; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/3/C" id="H1B5343EE4D904D3CBA0907AEB69ABF27" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> ensure that the Free Application for Federal Student Aid is available in formats accessible to individuals with disabilities and compliant with the most recent Web Content Accessibility Guidelines, or successor guidelines.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/4" id="HA295A89C98C2430F8297E1D77A457284" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> Reapplication in a succeeding academic year.—</heading>
				<content>In order to streamline an applicant’s experience in applying for financial aid, the Secretary shall allow an applicant who electronically applies for financial assistance under this title for an academic year subsequent to an academic year for which such applicant applied for financial assistance under this title to automatically electronically import all of the applicant’s (including parents', guardians', or spouses', as applicable) identifying, demographic, and school data from the previous application and to update such information to reflect any circumstances that have changed.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/5" id="H892FED452D344AF99A0C391777B83B95" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<heading> Technology accessibility.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall make the application under this section available through prevalent technology. Such technology shall, at a minimum, enable applicants to—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/5/A" id="H3BA72D5DE0CF44108903E051A47035D3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> save data; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/5/B" id="H08C4CEBEAE4E4B4EB5BC12496D39BF2E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> submit the application under this title to the Secretary through such technology.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/6" id="HCB5CEC16FD824CDB9CAFAB9D3FD1211A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
				<num value="6">“(6)</num>
				<heading> Verification burden.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/6/A" id="HF25D039ABD9B41C29AB3210850AA6327" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> to the maximum extent practicable, streamline and simplify the process of verification for applicants for Federal financial aid;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/6/B" id="H48CC1046490542C793FDAF06E978C922" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<chapeau> in establishing policies and procedures to verify applicants’ eligibility for Federal financial aid, consider—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/6/B/i" id="HB2D9AE312AC54655AFC2DD99AE4C8191" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> the burden placed on low-income applicants;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/6/B/ii" id="H247B382FBD3A4B4B8C7942A30688060D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> the risk to low-income applicants of failing to complete the application, enroll in college, or complete a postsecondary credential as a result of being selected for verification;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/6/B/iii" id="HFA1AD49B72C3466FB88EDC8783A6412E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> the effectiveness of the policies and procedures in preventing overpayments; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/6/B/iv" id="HFA34A8B2C7E3450EB8E7A88A1CA467F0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> the reasons for the source of any improper payments; and</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/6/C" id="H7C849AD481054331B2F5C37CFD7CE8AB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1998">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> issue a public report not less often than annually that includes the number and percentage of applicants subject to verification, whether the applicants ultimately received Federal financial aid disbursements, the extent to which the student aid index changed for such applicants as a result of verification, and the extent to which such applicants’ eligibility for Federal financial aid under this title changed.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/7" id="H7408C1E8100B45A5B2504FE2A7491EE3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
				<num value="7">“(7)</num>
				<heading> Studies.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall periodically conduct studies on—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/7/A" id="HBFCAA9238B8F45A49B42CDE7038C0FF6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<chapeau> whether the Free Application for Federal Student Aid is a barrier to college enrollment by examining—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/7/A/i" id="H54E5808023E14F35B8990F61CD086FF8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<chapeau> the effect of States requiring additional information specified in clauses (ii) and (iii) of subsection (a)(6)(B) on the determination of State financial aid awards, including—</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/7/A/i/I" id="H5B3430E87C9C464F8C43B28EFC5EE826" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> how much financial aid awards would change if the additional information were not required; and</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/7/A/i/II" id="HABFB8E1766A34B6BB6E593FE6D9CD6F6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> the number of students who started but did not finish the Free Application for Federal Student Aid, compared to the baseline year of 2021; and</content>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/7/A/ii" id="HB7450B141DE7430C82C834BC51CA3113" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<chapeau> the number of students who—</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/7/A/ii/I" id="HC388072D4E5C458C8F9F7275F76BBE8E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> started a Free Application for Federal Student Aid but did not receive financial assistance under this title for the applicable academic year; and</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/7/A/ii/II" id="HBF347E457FF64C31ADD1DF5E7120CBCF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> if available, did not enroll in an institution of higher education in the applicable academic year;</content>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/7/B" id="H6C29B3FB78E7421B93D052ECDF05A352" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> the most common barriers faced by applicants in completing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/b/7/C" id="H0FA7BCE5C3AF415EA2C8644B7626DF0A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> the most common reasons that students and families do not fill out the Free Applications for Federal Student Aid.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/c" id="HF4B36F4AE3D64C249DAC79E245F419D9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
			<num value="c">“(c)</num>
			<heading> Data and information.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/c/1" id="H17D5ECF1734E430896936EAB41DAEAF6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall publish data in a publicly accessible manner—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/c/1/A" id="H4F3D3D9A769E45EB9419787E9326AE70" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> annually on the total number of Free Applications for Federal Student Aid submitted by application cycle, disaggregated by demographic characteristics, type of institution or institutions of higher education to which the applicant applied, the applicant’s State of legal residence, and high school and public school district;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/c/1/B" id="H95EAAB44694C4244849FB7FBBC9297BE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> quarterly on the total number of Free Applications for Federal Student Aid submitted by application cycle, disaggregated by type of institution or institutions of higher education to which the applicant applied, the applicant’s State of legal residence, and high school and public school district;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/c/1/C" id="H2B5C1C37E5A2404D8FEC94EF4AFB9053" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> weekly on the total number of Free Applications for Federal Student Aid submitted, disaggregated by high school and public school district; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/c/1/D" id="H160476D2381941C3B57F10B086781C73" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<chapeau> annually on the number of individuals who apply for federal financial aid pursuant to this section who indicated that they are—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/c/1/D/i" id="HA10EEE350AB14E1593B2F82906E7FCA7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> an unaccompanied homeless youth or unaccompanied, at risk of homelessness, and self-supporting; or</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/c/1/D/ii" id="H14F5A338C2F5469C9EB00BE36DF52540" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> a foster care youth. </content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/c/2" id="H559F4C87D7E24929B1DAF25AF4082180" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="1999">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Contents.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The data described in paragraph (1)(D) with respect to homeless youth shall include, at a minimum, for each application cycle—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/c/2/A" id="H554FECE477BD4187A88B7AF80CDF28DA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2000">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> the total number of all applicants who were determined to be individuals described in section 480(d)(8); and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/c/2/B" id="H1C206D54FF414050A32E8D0DCB970D0E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2000">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<chapeau> the number of applicants described in subparagraph (A), disaggregated—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/c/2/B/i" id="H25D367C138DD456CA990DF8CD115F8B7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2000">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> by State; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/c/2/B/ii" id="HDC00F401320443CBB4ED30DEF032AD66" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2000">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> by the sources of determination as described in section 479D(b).</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/c/3" id="H37644B13B43D4C338457F30B6A66CD93" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2000">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Data sharing.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary may enter into data sharing agreements with the appropriate Federal or State agencies to conduct outreach regarding, and connect applicants directly with, the means-tested Federal benefit programs described in subsection (a)(2)(B)(ii)(XVII) for which the applicants may be eligible.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/d" id="H7C999C9359794898864F4EFD427FB974" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2000">
			<num value="d">“(d)</num>
			<heading> Ensuring form usability.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/d/1" id="H68B77424EAA44E1496107E7DE574C4A8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2000">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> Signature.—</heading>
				<content>Notwithstanding any other provision of this title, the Secretary may permit the Free Application for Federal Student Aid to be submitted without a signature, if a signature is subsequently submitted by the applicant, or if the applicant uses an access device provided by the Secretary.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/d/2" id="H40578DB386684CE19CDF539F657FDF83" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2000">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Free preparation authorized.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Notwithstanding any other provision of this title, an applicant may use a preparer for consultative or preparation services for the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid without charging a fee to the applicant if the preparer—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/d/2/A" id="H59C3B8CCF4BC4B88A101812DB52812EC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2000">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> includes, at the time the application is submitted to the Department, the name, address or employer’s address, social security number or employer identification number, and organizational affiliation of the preparer on the applicant’s form;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/d/2/B" id="H2BD5E1819FA2433E82614154BB382231" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2000">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> is subject to the same penalties as an applicant for purposely giving false or misleading information in the application;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/d/2/C" id="HDE5DF04701C4480585BB6708672DB109" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2000">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> clearly informs each individual upon initial contact, that the Free Application for Federal Student Aid is a free form that may be completed without professional assistance; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/d/2/D" id="H1C524E259F574D7EABD0F490C71BB019" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2000">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<content> does not produce, use, or disseminate any other form for the purpose of applying for Federal financial aid other than the Free Application for Federal Student Aid developed by the Secretary under this section.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/d/3" id="H7B8F44565B65431FBD6D363276D53C39" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2000">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Charges to students and parents for use of forms prohibited.—</heading>
				<content>The need for and eligibility of a student for financial assistance under this title may be determined only by using the Free Application for Federal Student Aid developed by the Secretary under this section. Such application shall be produced, distributed, and processed by the Secretary, and no parent or student shall be charged a fee by the Secretary, a contractor, a third-party servicer or private software provider, or any other public or private entity for the collection, processing, or delivery of Federal financial aid through the use of such application. No data collected on a form for which a fee is charged shall be used to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid prescribed under this section, except that a Federal or State income tax form prepared by a paid income tax preparer or preparer service for the primary purpose of filing a Federal or State income tax return may be used to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid prescribed under this section.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/d/4" id="H703719CAE8BA4AADA8C9811A892A2989" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2001">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> Application processing cycle.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall enable applicants to submit a Free Application for Federal Student Aid developed under this section and initiate the processing of such application, not later than January 1 of the applicant’s planned year of enrollment, to the maximum extent practicable, on or around October 1 prior to the applicant’s planned year of enrollment.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/d/5" id="H3BAB9791E0C34831AF7AB4954CC6D59F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2001">
				<num value="5">“(5)</num>
				<heading> Early estimates.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall maintain an electronic method for applicants to enter income and family size information to calculate a non-binding estimate of the applicant’s Federal financial aid available under this title and shall place such calculator on a prominent location at the beginning of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/m/1/qB/s483/d/6" id="H57FD4BDE1AC54094A6145D2D23884A05" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2001">
				<num value="6">“(6)</num>
				<heading> Additional forms.—</heading>
				<content>Notwithstanding any other provision of this title, an institution may not condition the packaging or receipt of Federal financial aid on the completion of additional requests for financial information beyond the Free Application for Federal Student Aid, unless such information is required for verification, a determination of independence, or professional judgement.”</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 483 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1090)
Section 484 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1091)
Section 428B(f)(2) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1078–2(f)(2))
Section 485 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1092)

	<section identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E" id="H194002A9FC254DF3964233930EAE31CE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2005">
		<num value="485E">“SEC. 485E.</num>
		<heading> Early awareness and outreach of financial aid eligibility.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/a" id="H320B63BFD43742BFA66636406AF27820" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2005">
			<num value="a">“(a)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>The Secretary shall implement early outreach activities in order to provide prospective students and their families with information about financial aid and estimates of financial aid. Such early outreach activities shall include the activities described in subsections (b), (c), and (d).</content>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b" id="HE5DC2157D0D844D3BFA0F7C7CEC4715C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2005">
			<num value="b">“(b)</num>
			<heading> Pell grant early awareness estimates.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/1" id="HBB259C9952EE46B49F058184D58D4257" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2005">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall produce a consumer-tested method of estimating student eligibility for Federal Pell Grants under section 401(b) utilizing the variables of family size and adjusted gross income, presented in electronic format. There shall be a method for students to indicate whether they are, or will be in—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/1/A" id="HB13BDED61E19456DAF5234DF2A71946B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> a single-parent household;</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/1/B" id="H88CD55CA687D4F1D8ED36DFB18325A7F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<content> a household with two parents; or</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/1/C" id="HA77A631FE147454E86CBDAF41F39FAC9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<content> a household with no children or dependents.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/2" id="HB2816C032A464D4BB80C36F1722C43D9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Consumer testing.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/2/A" id="H538A9ADA499C4C738F64C399CBA1271A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<content>The method of estimating eligibility described in paragraph (1) shall be consumer tested with prospective first-generation students and families as well as low-income individuals and families.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/2/B" id="H847C7DA823E04955A15B94B3C44A4664" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Updates.—</heading>
					<content>For award year 2023–2024 and each fourth succeeding award year thereafter, the design of the method of estimating eligibility shall be updated based on additional consumer testing with the populations described in subparagraph (A).</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/3" id="H15FCEAA8E02A4C29B6C2820D04A60947" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Distribution.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The method of estimating eligibility described in paragraph (1) shall be—</chapeau>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/3/A" id="HC173D0841358467C9CB27A88C47936D0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<content> made publicly and prominently available on the Department's website; and</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/3/B" id="H2ECFE54C32EB4C20BAC268FFE0FB26B5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<chapeau> actively shared by the Secretary with—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/3/B/i" id="H1DB8C2CBBBD04CF6B87F44CF6D981B73" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> institutions of higher education participating in programs under this title;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/3/B/ii" id="H09F0BE246CA9460487BBB025DAAC500F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> all middle and secondary schools eligible for funds under part A of title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/3/B/iii" id="H5F085E58A17E442998E913DD0298AE78" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> local educational agencies and middle schools and high schools that serve students not less than 25 percent of whom meet a measure of poverty as described in section 1113(a)(5) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/3/B/iv" id="H47F60BCA7D944913AEAD4573BCA2ECFF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> agencies responsible for administering means-tested Federal benefit programs, as defined in section 479(b)(4)(H).</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/b/4" id="HFF520FEA509542E49A603884809E2CBB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
				<num value="4">“(4)</num>
				<heading> Electronic estimator on fafsa.—</heading>
				<content>In accordance with subsection (d)(5) of section 483, the Secretary shall maintain an electronic method for applicants to enter income and family size, and level of education sought information to calculate a non-binding estimate (which may include a range, ceiling, or minimum) of the applicant’s Federal financial aid available under this title and shall place such calculator on a prominent location on the FAFSA website and in a manner that encourages students to fill out the FAFSA.</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c" id="H8F8FA5B67FA144F7B893C276CF8B0007" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
			<num value="c">“(c)</num>
			<heading> Early awareness plans.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The Secretary shall establish and implement early awareness and outreach plans to provide early information about the availability of Federal financial aid and estimates of prospective students’ eligibility for Federal financial aid as well as to promote the attainment of postsecondary education specifically among prospective first-generation students and families as well as low-income individuals and families, as follows:</chapeau>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1" id="HD52FAC2391464586834B0960D9AEB652" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> Outreach plans for low-income families.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1/A" id="HB4E8169D6AB248C1A0B62105225EC3DD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2006">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<chapeau>The Secretary shall develop plans for each population described in this subparagraph to disseminate information about the availability of Federal financial aid under this title, in addition to and in coordination with the distribution of the method of estimating eligibility under subsection (b), to—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1/A/i" id="HC1DF868BB9A243319148BDB9BF564F70" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> all middle schools and secondary schools eligible for funds under part A of title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1/A/ii" id="H371785B843044AEF951CFA12D97EB913" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> local educational agencies and middle schools and high schools that serve students not less than 25 percent of whom meet a measure of poverty as described in section 1113(a)(5) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1/A/iii" id="H19174F4F9C3D44538DB7312CEEAE7C60" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> households receiving assistance under the supplemental nutrition assistance program established under the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (<ref href="/us/usc/7/2011">7 U.S.C. 2011</ref> et seq.); and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1/A/iv" id="H725D36648DF049C7994674C5D23D710C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> agencies responsible for administering means-tested Federal benefit programs, as defined in section 479(b)(4)(H).</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1/B" id="HA8ABAB1EE21C440FB829E8A2D6EEB831" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Content of plans.—</heading>
					<chapeau>The plans described in paragraph (A) shall—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1/B/i" id="H7CD42CF280934E5283C8B2DCC731D6C7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<chapeau> provide students and their families with information on—</chapeau>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1/B/i/I" id="HD19E23C111B448ED9DE1ED18A385C090" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
							<num value="I">“(I)</num>
							<content> the availability of the College Scorecard or any similar successor website;</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1/B/i/II" id="H889D5AB8BD44495BB0F3A50EE13A50D5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
							<num value="II">“(II)</num>
							<content> the electronic estimates of financial aid available under subsection (b);</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1/B/i/III" id="H23BC62113E524BE1A6B2ACE999CF5362" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
							<num value="III">“(III)</num>
							<content> Federal financial aid available to students, including eligibility criteria for the Federal financial aid and an explanation of the Federal financial aid programs (including applicable Federal educational tax credits); and</content>
						</subclause>
						<subclause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1/B/i/IV" id="H3AFFBC8AA20446AC8E06600914E00EC8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
							<num value="IV">“(IV)</num>
							<content> resources that can inform students of financial aid that may be available from state-based financial aid, state-based college savings programs, and scholarships and other non-governmental sources;</content>
						</subclause>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1/B/ii" id="H6AF4A0495B26438FBEA0833C518BFEC6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> describe how the dissemination of information will be conducted by the Secretary.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1/C" id="H7F6423DAF1364CA09D31F74CA53A1AE0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<heading> Reporting and updates.—</heading>
					<content>The Secretary shall post the information about the plans under subparagraph (A) and associated goals publicly on the Department's website. On an annual basis, the Secretary shall report qualitative and quantitative outcomes regarding the implementation of the plans under subparagraph (A). The Secretary shall review and update such plans not less often than every 4 award years with the goal of progressively increasing the impact of the activities under this paragraph.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/1/D" id="H4CABD0BB1E404E42BA9D433DDB1C9E53" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<heading> Partnership.—</heading>
					<content>The Secretary may partner with States, State systems of higher education, institutions of higher education, or college access organizations to carry out this paragraph.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2" id="HBFF8DCE43FD2427E8783D23C1A49E8E7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Interagency coordination plans.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/A" id="HBCE24FEB1DC8459189C7B2B1E78363A8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2007">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<chapeau>The Secretary shall develop interagency coordination plans in order to inform more students and families, including low-income individuals or families and recipients of means-tested Federal benefits, about the availability of Federal financial aid under this title through participation in existing Federal programs or tax benefits that serve low-income individuals or families, in coordination with the following Secretaries:</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/A/i" id="HC9294AAF65244ECE9CFD87906D323FE4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> The Secretary of the Treasury.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/A/ii" id="H5CEF7DA4D3784AB5B8386ACECE762BD2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> The Secretary of Labor.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/A/iii" id="H17337D6626684A44A263EB22BC8ABC6A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> The Secretary of Health and Human Services.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/A/iv" id="H235F5E0F070045EDBAB6CC152FF9E529" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> The Secretary of Agriculture.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/A/v" id="H8000712E11974B198A27DECE1FFBE2B4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
						<num value="v">“(v)</num>
						<content> The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/A/vi" id="H087F9FC5871D44F6BD4E9E8885857A98" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
						<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
						<content> The Secretary of Commerce.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/A/vii" id="H50E91C2FC09D4A08B43CDA3FAEAB73C5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
						<num value="vii">“(vii)</num>
						<content> The Secretary of Veterans Affairs.</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/A/viii" id="H506C44EF0C2543399B8A2DD1DD17BF0D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
						<num value="viii">“(viii)</num>
						<content> The Secretary of the Interior.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/B" id="HC6A55B2D8D604867966FF66A3032CC1E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Process, activities, and goals.—</heading>
					<chapeau>Each interagency coordination plan under subparagraph (A) shall—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/B/i" id="H98A87E97FD974AAA981F06D04BCD56D7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> identify opportunities in which low-income individuals and families could be informed of the availability of Federal financial aid under this title through access to other Federal programs that serve low-income individuals and families;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/B/ii" id="H638EFD07B2D846328F95149C07D41E30" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> identify methods to effectively inform low-income individuals and families of the availability of Federal financial aid for postsecondary education under this title and assist such individuals in completing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/B/iii" id="H5675AA1DFE4C4CA590F48F39D9A07C19" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> develop early awareness and FAFSA completion activities that align with the opportunities and methods identified under clauses (i) and (ii);</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/B/iv" id="H57BF3718145D40C28D8BDA122D657799" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
						<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
						<content> establish goals regarding the effects of the activities to be implemented under clause (iii); and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/B/v" id="H2649F7DDE57C4C0FBF54CEC225E8301F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
						<num value="v">“(v)</num>
						<content> provide information on how students and families can maintain access to Federal programs that serve low-income individuals and families operated by the agencies identified under subsection (A) while attending an institution of higher education.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/C" id="HDBDA3BC2A405482EA9A47574A0C7FBB0" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<heading> Plan with secretary of the treasury.—</heading>
					<content>The interagency coordination plan under subparagraph (A)(i) between the Secretary and the Secretary of the Treasury shall further include specific methods to increase the application for Federal financial aid under this title from individuals who file Federal tax returns, including collaboration with tax preparation entities or other third parties, as appropriate.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/2/D" id="HBE33CC22938A43029A9C924DC036D3AF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
					<num value="D">“(D)</num>
					<heading> Reporting and updates.—</heading>
					<content>The Secretary shall post the information about the interagency coordination plans under this paragraph and associated goals publicly on the Department's website. The plans shall have the goal of progressively increasing the impact of the activities under this paragraph by increasing the number of low-income applicants for, and recipients of, Federal financial aid. The plans shall be updated not less than once every 4 years.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/3" id="H7D3D0210DEF141929AE461A5DA8873DC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Nationwide participation in early awareness plans.—</heading>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/3/A" id="H3944774C1BA14800B18237C6EB18483D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2008">
					<num value="A">“(A)</num>
					<heading> In general.—</heading>
					<chapeau>The Secretary shall solicit voluntary public commitments from entities, such as States, State systems of higher education, institutions of higher education, and other interested organizations, to carry out early awareness plans, which shall include goals, to—</chapeau>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/3/A/i" id="HAAE8BE4251DC40B5BA57C01D8438FEC7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2009">
						<num value="i">“(i)</num>
						<content> notify prospective and existing students who are low-income individuals and families about their eligibility for Federal aid under this title, as well as State-based financial aid, if applicable, on an annual basis;</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/3/A/ii" id="HDAD16CA7D01C48E8A1DE08D24A51617B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2009">
						<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
						<content> increase the number of prospective and current students who are low-income individuals and families filing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid; and</content>
					</clause>
					<clause identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/3/A/iii" id="H03100A4B7AE144E4B2128B002A4D1E1A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2009">
						<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
						<content> increase the number of prospective and current students who are low-income individuals and families enrolling in postsecondary education.</content>
					</clause>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/3/B" id="H559557CF01114C918BFD06B0E71CA5E7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2009">
					<num value="B">“(B)</num>
					<heading> Reporting and updates.—</heading>
					<content>Each entity that makes a voluntary public commitment to carry out an early awareness plan may submit quantitative and qualitative data based on the entity’s progress toward the goals of the plan annually prior to a date selected by the Secretary.</content>
				</subparagraph>
				<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/c/3/C" id="H54EF2783A4AF4ED692D7545077ACFC8D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2009">
					<num value="C">“(C)</num>
					<heading> Early awareness champions.—</heading>
					<content>Based on data submitted by entities, the Secretary shall select and designate entities submitting public commitments, plans, and goals, as Early Awareness Champions on an annual basis. Those entities designated as Early Awareness Champions shall provide one or more case studies regarding the activities the entity undertook under this paragraph which shall be made public by the Secretary on the Department of Education website to promote best practices.</content>
				</subparagraph>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
		<subsection identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/d" id="HDFEAD9CBE82E4AA18DA0555F5FB7B5BB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2009">
			<num value="d">“(d)</num>
			<heading> Public awareness campaign.—</heading>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/d/1" id="H314AD8771F0842BA80EA3146A630C946" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2009">
				<num value="1">“(1)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall develop and implement a public awareness campaign designed using current and relevant independent research regarding strategies and media platforms found to be most effective in communicating with low-income populations in order to increase national awareness regarding the availability of Federal Pell Grants and financial aid under this title and, at the option of the Secretary, potential availability of state need-based financial aid.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/d/2" id="H6C785B2502A94ACC8AD05A097DC3CFCC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2009">
				<num value="2">“(2)</num>
				<heading> Coordination.—</heading>
				<content>The public awareness campaign described in paragraph (1) shall leverage the activities in subsections (b) and (c) to highlight eligibility among low-income populations. In developing and implementing the campaign, the Secretary may work in coordination with States, institutions of higher education, early intervention and outreach programs under this title, other Federal agencies, agencies responsible for administering means-tested Federal benefit programs (as defined in section 479(b)(4)(H)), organizations involved in college access and student financial aid, secondary schools, local educational agencies, public libraries, community centers, businesses, employers, workforce investment boards, and organizations that provide services to individuals who are or were homeless, in foster care, or are disconnected youth.</content>
			</paragraph>
			<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tVII/s702/o/qB/s485E/d/3" id="H4DBB7BF304D54541B7B0AEC82DBCB395" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2009">
				<num value="3">“(3)</num>
				<heading> Reporting.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary shall report on the success of the public awareness campaign described in paragraph (1) annually regarding the extent to which the public and target populations were reached using data commonly used to evaluate advertising and outreach campaigns and data regarding whether the campaign produced any increase in applicants for Federal aid under this title publicly on the Department of Education website.”</content>
			</paragraph>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 485E of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1092f)
Section 494(a)(1) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1098h(a)(1))
