cite.cite_text: Section 541(b) of title 11, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 11 of the United States Code

cite.cite_text: Effective on the date that is 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, section 541(b) of title 11, United States Code,

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H8E20934C86564A179F7CEDEE6832786D" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/b/1/qB/i" id="H8A048AE26955447BBDFCCA5050149F87" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2036">
		<num value="i">“(i)</num>
		<chapeau> Subject to subsection (d), after notice and a hearing, the court may grant a discharge of debts dischargeable under subsection (a) to a debtor who has not completed payments to the trustee or a creditor holding a security interest in the principal residence of the debtor if—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/b/1/qB/i/1" id="HCF1F03B3DBCE4097B0D3F3427A60F1AB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2036">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> the debtor defaults on not more than 3 monthly payments due on a residential mortgage under section 1322(b)(5) on or after March 13, 2020, to the trustee or creditor caused by a material financial hardship due, directly or indirectly, by the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID–19) pandemic; or </content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/b/1/qB/i/2" id="H05075BEC16934F4DB1124B7677B9E400" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2036">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/b/1/qB/i/2/A" id="HFAE3A8B1463C40CBB2FD0231A0DDF9FF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2036">
				<num value="A">(A)</num>
				<content> the plan provides for the curing of a default and maintenance of payments on a residential mortgage under section 1322(b)(5); and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/b/1/qB/i/2/B" id="H89AE2EE4B59A4D05AB4DE9ADCEE4D965" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2036">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> the debtor has entered into a forbearance agreement or loan modification agreement with the holder or servicer (as defined in section 6(i) of the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act of 1974 (<ref href="/us/usc/12/2605">12 U.S.C. 2605(i)</ref>) of the mortgage described in subparagraph (A).”</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 1328 of title 11, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 11 of the United States Code

execution.ampl: strike subsection( "(i)");

cite.cite_text: Effective on the date that is 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, section 1328 of title 11, United States Code,

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H05B787D720B84B6B80CAD56C5743E420" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/c/1/qB/d" id="H292480EC91A34AC783B65DE3C8C6478C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2036">
		<num value="d">“(d)</num>
		<content> A person may not be denied relief under sections 4022 through 4024 of the CARES Act (<ref href="/us/usc/15/9056">15 U.S.C. 9056</ref>, 9057, 9058) because the person is or has been a debtor under this title.”</content>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 525 of title 11, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 11 of the United States Code

execution.ampl: strike subsection( "(d)");

cite.cite_text: Effective on the date that is 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, section 525 of title 11, United States Code,

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H5BFF18460C684FB989404B60B62B5220" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/1/qB/f" id="H83A8B3DE0F464A1F81AD4CC0EA48C711" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2036">
		<num value="f">“(f)</num>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/1/qB/f/1" id="H44A400B746704CBB83A813A3AD64D96D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2036">
			<num value="1">(1)</num>
			<chapeau> In this subsection—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/1/qB/f/1/A" id="HA144AF731C624C61A47AE6CB74D4D187" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2036">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> the term ‘<term>CARES forbearance claim</term>’ means a supplemental claim for the amount of a Federally backed mortgage loan or a Federally backed multifamily mortgage loan that was not received by an eligible creditor during the forbearance period of a loan granted forbearance under section 4022 or 4023 of the CARES Act (<ref href="/us/usc/15/9056">15 U.S.C. 9056</ref>, 9057);</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/1/qB/f/1/B" id="HC07BD53A593E46B799BBD9DFAC1B8945" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2036">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> the term ‘<term>eligible creditor</term>’ means a servicer (as defined in section 6(i) of the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act of 1974 (<ref href="/us/usc/12/2605">12 U.S.C. 2605(i)</ref>) with a claim for a Federally backed mortgage loan or a Federally backed multifamily mortgage loan of the debtor that is provided for by a plan under section 1322(b)(5);</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/1/qB/f/1/C" id="H71B57C7589164334817C0B238782F313" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2036">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<content> the term ‘<term>Federally backed mortgage loan</term>’ has the meaning given the term in section 4022(a) of the CARES Act (<ref href="/us/usc/15/9056">15 U.S.C. 9056(a)</ref>); and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/1/qB/f/1/D" id="HFFDA42EAA62543E48751EB0A13FE449C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2036">
				<num value="D">“(D)</num>
				<content> the term ‘<term>Federally backed multifamily mortgage loan</term>’ has the meaning given the term in section 4023(f) of the CARES Act (<ref href="/us/usc/15/9057">15 U.S.C. 9057(f)</ref>).</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/1/qB/f/2" id="HD33D7C5FAE7F4C1D976BB0AE8C661FEF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2037">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/1/qB/f/2/A" id="H5628D927E04E4F1F81F1ACFB170C986C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2037">
				<num value="A">(A)</num>
				<content> Only an eligible creditor may file a supplemental proof of claim for a CARES forbearance claim.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/1/qB/f/2/B" id="H4DA262BF1A9F4D9B92E20EFAAC25AC6E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2037">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<chapeau> If an underlying mortgage loan obligation has been modified or deferred by an agreement of the debtor and an eligible creditor of the mortgage loan in connection with a mortgage forbearance granted under section 4022 or 4023 of the CARES Act (<ref href="/us/usc/15/9056">15 U.S.C. 9056</ref>, 9057) in order to cure mortgage payments forborne under the forbearance, the proof of claim filed under subparagraph (A) shall include—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/1/qB/f/2/B/i" id="HFEBE13FD289D4D66BD8862D32CA49ED1" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2037">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> the relevant terms of the modification or deferral;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/1/qB/f/2/B/ii" id="H2F9361DDEF354411835000E9D3F7D4A4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2037">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> for a modification or deferral that is in writing, a copy of the modification or deferral; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/1/qB/f/2/B/iii" id="HF1B7754F4C854BD4B01E3C23D4282F03" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2037">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<content> a description of the payments to be deferred until the date on which the mortgage loan matures.”</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 501 of title 11, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 11 of the United States Code

execution.ampl:
rewrite this as <__xml__ id="H1BA318AABE0848769DC41499149B549C" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/2/qB/9" id="H348AF53710434F69999A784005B648D9" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2037">
		<num value="9">“(9)</num>
		<chapeau> proof of such claim is not timely filed, except to the extent tardily filed as permitted under paragraph (1), (2), or (3) of section 726(a) or under the Federal Rules of Bankruptcy Procedure, except that—</chapeau>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/2/qB/9/A" id="H506156FF63A243FAAE6818363680257F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2037">
			<num value="A">“(A)</num>
			<content> a claim of a governmental unit shall be timely filed if it is filed before 180 days after the date of the order for relief or such later time as the Federal Rules of Bankruptcy Procedure may provide;</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/2/qB/9/B" id="HED8DC5395D374C0CBB723D63041DE8F8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2037">
			<num value="B">“(B)</num>
			<content> in a case under chapter 13, a claim of a governmental unit for a tax with respect to a return filed under section 1308 shall be timely if the claim is filed on or before the date that is 60 days after the date on which such return was filed as required; and</content>
		</subparagraph>
		<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/d/2/qB/9/C" id="H6E176A2868A94F01A17AACB6D275B0B2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2037">
			<num value="C">“(C)</num>
			<content> a CARES forbearance claim (as defined in section 501(f)(1)) shall be timely filed if the claim is filed before the date that is 120 days after the expiration of the forbearance period of a loan granted forbearance under section 4022 or 4023 of the CARES Act (<ref href="/us/usc/15/9056">15 U.S.C. 9056</ref>, 9057).”</content>
		</subparagraph>
	</paragraph>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 502(b)(9) of title 11, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 11 of the United States Code

execution.ampl: strike subsection( "(f)");

cite.cite_text: Effective on the date that is 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act—## section 501 of title 11, United States Code,
section 502(b)(9) of title 11, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 11 of the United States Code

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="HCA8C978B12EB49AF8BC865EA258E2AEA" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/e/1/qB/e" id="H22665F6596D044BCAB4D4C7E4D3E6457" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2037">
		<num value="e">“(e)</num>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/e/1/qB/e/1" id="H2D510780D50245C4A30CFB0F9EB12C54" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2037">
			<num value="1">(1)</num>
			<content> A debtor of a case for which a creditor files a proof of claim under section 501(f) may file a request for a modification of the plan to provide for the proof of claim.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/e/1/qB/e/2" id="H931700465C4441C39301445E16A01092" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2037">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> If the debtor does not file a request for a modification of the plan under paragraph (1) on or before the date that is 30 days after the date on which a creditor files a claim under section 501(f), after notice, the court, on a motion of the court or on a motion of the United States trustee, the trustee, a bankruptcy administrator, or any party in interest, may request a modification of the plan to provide for the proof of claim.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 1329 of title 11, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 11 of the United States Code

execution.ampl: strike subsection( "(e)");

cite.cite_text: Effective on the date that is 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, section 1329 of title 11, United States Code,
Section 365(d) of title 11, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 11 of the United States Code

cite.cite_text: Effective on the date that is 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, section 365(d) of title 11, United States Code,
Section 547 of title 11, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 11 of the United States Code

cite.cite_text: Effective on the date that is 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, section 547 of title 11, United States Code,

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="H2F7E446A49DB4ECEBF62944D4BE11A69" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/h/1/qB/d" id="H001447212B8443FDBC556FEF448BADB5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2040">
		<num value="d">“(d)</num>
		<chapeau> Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, a utility may not alter, refuse, or discontinue service to a debtor who does not furnish adequate assurance of payment under this section if the debtor—</chapeau>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/h/1/qB/d/1" id="H44F8971F46074F309394F9DF5A79FBDA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2040">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<content> is an individual;</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/h/1/qB/d/2" id="HBF66CE9AB0CB4D59920B9E60361DBFB8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2040">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<content> makes a payment to the utility for any debt owed to the utility for service provided during the 20-day period beginning on the date of the order for relief; and</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tX/s1001/h/1/qB/d/3" id="HF3F901623C204B96AFDC673F47914840" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2040">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<content> after the date on which the 20-day period beginning on the date of the order for relief ends, makes a payment to the utility for services provided during the pendency of case when such a payment becomes due.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 366 of title 11, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 11 of the United States Code

execution.ampl: strike subsection( "(d)");

cite.cite_text: Effective on the date that is 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, section 366 of title 11, United States Code,
Section 507(d) of title 11, United States Code,

doc_names: Title 11 of the United States Code

cite.cite_text: Effective on the date that is 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, section 507(d) of title 11, United States Code,

execution.ampl:
insert end <__xml__ id="HB9F5A73DA277409A895C6E00D471E591" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d" id="HC63FF492FE2E4077BCC404EE36A611BD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2040">
		<num value="d">“(d)</num>
		<heading> Aging infrastructure account.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/1" id="H5511C973965B4AFBA425E6A56BFE5C47" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2040">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> Establishment.—</heading>
			<chapeau>There is established in the general fund of the Treasury a special account, to be known as the ‘<quotedText>Aging Infrastructure Account</quotedText>’ (referred to in this subsection as the ‘<quotedText>Account</quotedText>’), to provide funds to, and provide for the extended repayment of the funds by, a transferred works operating entity or project beneficiary responsible for repayment of reimbursable costs for the conduct of extraordinary operation and maintenance work at a project facility, which shall consist of—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/1/A" id="H8D365E1FAD4E419FBA8421A86C4357A2" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> any amounts that are specifically appropriated to the Account under section 9605; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/1/B" id="HAA9FA3894C9240D4BB73C9A7B7275B09" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> any amounts deposited in the Account under paragraph (3)(B).</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/2" id="H3826F3DFB7974A54BFBDF533E31F5E31" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Expenditures.—</heading>
			<content>Subject to paragraphs (3) and (6), the Secretary may expend amounts in the Account to fund and provide for extended repayment of the funds for eligible projects identified in a report submitted under paragraph (5)(B).</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/3" id="H5591763BADBF4FC08D43CDE9D30FB1DE" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
			<num value="3">“(3)</num>
			<heading> Repayment contract.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/3/A" id="H56B85650DD2A47FDBAE0352BC047F7AA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>The Secretary may not expend amounts under paragraph (2) with respect to an eligible project described in that paragraph unless the transferred works operating entity or project beneficiary responsible for repayment of reimbursable costs has entered into a contract to repay the amounts under subsection (b)(2).</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/3/B" id="H437C6E0A47024102A5BBD55CE92AE257" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Deposit of repaid funds.—</heading>
				<content>Amounts repaid by a transferred works operating entity or project beneficiary responsible for repayment of reimbursable costs receiving funds under a repayment contract entered into under this subsection shall be deposited in the Account and shall be available to the Secretary for expenditure, subject to paragraph (6), in accordance with this subsection, and without further appropriation.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4" id="HD235442ED43D4B7C9A05768265567E60" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
			<num value="4">“(4)</num>
			<heading> Application for funding.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/A" id="H8CD16A006B1F400CBA9D95BF45EEB2F6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>Beginning with fiscal year 2022, not less than once per fiscal year, the Secretary shall accept, during an application period established by the Secretary, applications from transferred works operating entities or project beneficiaries responsible for payment of reimbursable costs for funds and extended repayment for eligible projects.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/B" id="H7207EEF91C6E4491B89C5FF733E8B092" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Eligible project.—</heading>
				<chapeau>A project eligible for funding and extended repayment under this subsection is a project that—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/B/i" id="H2CFA672F2BF4406785152416EFD96818" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> qualifies as an extraordinary operation and maintenance work under this section;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/B/ii" id="H6AC18FBF9C2C4FED82717D1DAAF9E90E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> is for the major, non-recurring maintenance of a mission-critical asset; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/B/iii" id="H5D5E7E5C26D342299F83796962F19EDF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<content> is not eligible to be carried out or funded under the repayment provisions of section 4(c) of the Reclamation Safety of Dams Act of 1978 (<ref href="/us/usc/43/508">43 U.S.C. 508(c)</ref>).</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/C" id="HCABFE2D1E0CF42B19A5882DE162B395B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<heading> Guidelines for applications.—</heading>
				<chapeau>Not later than 60 days after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall issue guidelines describing the information required to be provided in an application for funds and extended repayment under this subsection that require, at a minimum—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/C/i" id="H49A13438C1B7458D83AB1683F7758F19" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> a description of the project for which the funds are requested;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/C/ii" id="H35ED6AE93FB44A8B852B6C1BC4A94793" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2041">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> the amount of funds requested;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/C/iii" id="HB592568E2A0C42DE808C3CF2AD1888E5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<content> the repayment period requested by the transferred works operating entity or project beneficiary responsible for repayment of reimbursable costs;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/C/iv" id="HBCF11526028F41CDA047F7F47D34A1B8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
					<num value="iv">“(iv)</num>
					<content> alternative non-Federal funding options that have been evaluated;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/C/v" id="H153FBAE5174243A2B6E75B5649FEFFB4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
					<num value="v">“(v)</num>
					<content> the financial justification for requesting an extended repayment period; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/C/vi" id="H8A7AA3157CC341BE89DFBF34A175E080" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
					<num value="vi">“(vi)</num>
					<content> the financial records of the transferred works operating entity or project beneficiary responsible for repayment of reimbursable costs.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/D" id="H2DEFE74FF1B248A1B581893EB044E312" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
				<num value="D">“(D)</num>
				<heading> Review by the secretary.—</heading>
				<chapeau>The Secretary shall review each application submitted under subparagraph (A)—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/D/i" id="H4955C56E20CF48C989F61B6A4D97B829" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<content> to determine whether the project is eligible for funds and an extended repayment period under this subsection;</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/D/ii" id="H6821133B902B4CC286DE5885FBCB9EC5" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<content> to determine if the project has been identified by the Bureau of Reclamation as part of the major rehabilitation and replacement of a project facility; and</content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/D/iii" id="HFAC59834A1F74B56BE7BD0C4D45B9445" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<chapeau> to conduct a financial analysis of—</chapeau>
					<subclause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/D/iii/I" id="H8A34DE047D2B402CA0C2ADA2A3226A4F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
						<num value="I">“(I)</num>
						<content> the project; and</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/4/D/iii/II" id="HA18AD5B0FF7C4FE283488C8BE60BD01D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> repayment capability of the transferred works operating entity or project beneficiary responsible for repayment of reimbursable costs.</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5" id="H265287EFD6D14FD3B8A7F530F92E1BE6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
			<num value="5">“(5)</num>
			<heading> Report.—</heading>
			<chapeau>Not later than 90 days after the date on which an application period closes under paragraph (4)(A), the Secretary shall submit to the Committees on Energy and Natural Resources and Appropriations of the Senate and the Committees on Natural Resources and Appropriations of the House of Representatives a report that—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/A" id="HF4AB75F53F154450947DC374E688FC1F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> describes the results of the Secretary’s review of each application under paragraph (4)(D), including a determination of whether the project is eligible;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/B" id="HB5D4F0DC14654CD291E381EA327A553D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> identifies each project eligible for funds and extended repayment under this subsection;</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/C" id="H931DF2B8A1674CEFAD818AE03F7F6E34" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
				<num value="C">“(C)</num>
				<chapeau> with respect to each eligible project identified under subparagraph (B), includes—</chapeau>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/C/i" id="H0D7E3225F40143F493676BB9E4994CC3" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<chapeau> a description of—</chapeau>
					<subclause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/C/i/I" id="H201E01C5ECC04A9A970565062CCC658D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
						<num value="I">“(I)</num>
						<content> the eligible project;</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/C/i/II" id="HFD82AD50C041419296C0F8FD8E11CD00" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> the anticipated cost and duration of the eligible project;</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/C/i/III" id="H1BA3AD5D3B004135AC2C1AC878CF1CFD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
						<num value="III">“(III)</num>
						<content> any remaining engineering or environmental compliance that is required before the eligible project commences;</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/C/i/IV" id="HCE2B69ABC79E408DBEF57C547733978F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
						<num value="IV">“(IV)</num>
						<content> any recommendations the Secretary may have concerning the plan or design of the project; and</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/C/i/V" id="HFF8E4F0E2E1243699303703BD4008652" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
						<num value="V">“(V)</num>
						<content> any conditions the Secretary may require for construction of the project;</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/C/ii" id="HEEB4E734A62B47FB8CBACFB8BE10814B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<chapeau> an analysis of—</chapeau>
					<subclause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/C/ii/I" id="H612D9A4FCA7843798A8878F790A5A66F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
						<num value="I">“(I)</num>
						<content> the repayment period proposed in the application; and</content>
					</subclause>
					<subclause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/C/ii/II" id="HF0BE36895E254362A1350D779C7265CF" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2042">
						<num value="II">“(II)</num>
						<content> if the Secretary recommends a minimum necessary repayment period that is different than the repayment period proposed in the application, the minimum necessary repayment period recommended by the Secretary; and</content>
					</subclause>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/C/iii" id="HEC1E2D6C2EE64C35BB9BCADFDC6602CC" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2043">
					<num value="iii">“(iii)</num>
					<content> an analysis of alternative non-Federal funding options; </content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/D" id="H956278E624A34E5F8FC91DC0137D46C8" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2043">
				<num value="D">“(D)</num>
				<content> describes the allocation of funds from deposits into the Account under paragraph (3)(B); and </content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/5/E" id="HC5AE1E75012D4063A66B458105FF0C4E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2043">
				<num value="E">“(E)</num>
				<content> describes the balance of funds in the Account as of the date of the report.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/6" id="H52A377181513497EAB19EDED0F76A47A" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2043">
			<num value="6">“(6)</num>
			<heading> Alternative allocation.—</heading>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/6/A" id="HD753B592270E4157A3BEE38413726F9C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2043">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<heading> In general.—</heading>
				<content>Appropriations Acts may provide for alternate allocation of amounts reported pursuant to paragraph (5)(D) that are made available under this subsection.</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/6/B" id="HA2A21FF7E1A24C46B9DFE0EAAB0CAD48" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2043">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<heading> Allocation by secretary.—</heading>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/6/B/i" id="HE85E16C562E14645841F54D441F11184" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2043">
					<num value="i">“(i)</num>
					<heading> No alternate allocations.—</heading>
					<content>If Congress has not enacted legislation establishing alternate allocations by the date on which the Act making full-year appropriations for energy and water development and related agencies for the applicable fiscal year is enacted into law, amounts made available under paragraph (1) shall be allocated by the Secretary. </content>
				</clause>
				<clause identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/6/B/ii" id="HE9D55970F082420EB47BA7C5CE4F5C02" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2043">
					<num value="ii">“(ii)</num>
					<heading> Insufficient alternate allocations.—</heading>
					<content>If Congress enacts legislation establishing alternate allocations for amounts made available under paragraph (1) that are less than the full amount appropriated under that paragraph, the difference between the amount appropriated and the alternate allocation shall be allocated by the Secretary.</content>
				</clause>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/7" id="HEB5F7B3CE0CF4766A93547310D65A4DA" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2043">
			<num value="7">“(7)</num>
			<heading> Effect of subsection.—</heading>
			<chapeau>Nothing in this subsection affects—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/7/A" id="H6F1A4C61CCA14640A6B8C97479E939FD" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2043">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> any funding provided, or contracts entered into, under subsection (a) before the date of enactment of this subsection; or</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/dFF/tXI/s1101/qB/d/7/B" id="H799784FBCCE647E08F5E86675A33F61D" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="2043">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> the use of funds otherwise made available to the Secretary to carry out subsection (a).”</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

The requirements set forth by section 105 of the Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2012 (Public Law 112–55), as amended by section 105 of title I of division B of Public Law 113–6, are hereby adopted by reference and made applicable with respect to fiscal year 2021:

Funds for any announced prize otherwise authorized shall remain available, without fiscal year limitation, until a prize is claimed or the offer is withdrawn.
This title may be cited as the “Science Appropriations Act, 2021”.

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, amounts deposited or available in the Fund established by section 1402 of chapter XIV of title II of Public Law 98–473 (34 U.S.C. 20101) in any fiscal year in excess of $2,015,000,000 shall not be available for obligation until the following fiscal year:

That funds appropriated, transferred, or otherwise credited to the Central Intelligence Agency Central Services Working Capital Fund during this or any prior or subsequent fiscal year shall remain available until expended:

That notwithstanding any other provision of law, not to exceed $404,350,000 of revenues from fees and annual charges, and other services and collections in fiscal year 2021 shall be retained and used for expenses necessary in this account, and shall remain available until expended: Provided further, That the sum herein appropriated from the general fund shall be reduced as revenues are received during fiscal year 2021 so as to result in a final fiscal year 2021 appropriation from the general fund estimated at not more than $0.
This division may be cited as the “Energy and Water Development and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2021”.

That sections (7)(b) and (8) of that Act shall be amended by striking “July 1, 2021” and inserting “July 1, 2022”.

That no part of this appropriation shall be used to pay more than one-half the cost of topographic mapping or water resources data collection and investigations carried on in cooperation with States and municipalities.

That appropriations for the Office of Surface Mining Reclamation and Enforcement may provide for the travel and per diem expenses of State and tribal personnel attending Office of Surface Mining Reclamation and Enforcement sponsored training:
That fees assessed and collected by the Office pursuant to such section 507 shall be credited to this account as discretionary offsetting collections, to remain available until expended:

That in the event the sums appropriated for any fiscal year for payments pursuant to this chapter are insufficient to make the full payments authorized by that chapter to all units of local government, then the payment to each local government shall be made proportionally:

That all financial transactions of the territorial and local governments herein provided for, including such transactions of all agencies or instrumentalities established or used by such governments, may be audited by the Government Accountability Office, at its discretion, in accordance with chapter 35 of title 31, United States Code:

, That notwithstanding section 33 of the Bankhead Jones Farm Tenant Act (7 U.S.C. 1012), the Secretary of Agriculture, in calculating a fee for grazing on a National Grassland, may provide a credit of up to 50 percent of the calculated fee to a Grazing Association or direct permittee for a conservation practice approved by the Secretary in advance of the fiscal year in which the cost of the conservation practice is incurred, and that the amount credited shall remain available to the Grazing Association or the direct permittee, as appropriate, in the fiscal year in which the credit is made and each fiscal year thereafter for use on the project for conservation practices approved by the Secretary:

That notwithstanding section 33 of the Bankhead Jones Farm Tenant Act (7 U.S.C. 1012), the Secretary of Agriculture, in calculating a fee for grazing on a National Grassland, may provide a credit of up to 50 percent of the calculated fee to a Grazing Association or direct permittee for a conservation practice approved by the Secretary in advance of the fiscal year in which the cost of the conservation practice is incurred, and that the amount credited shall remain available to the Grazing Association or the direct permittee, as appropriate, in the fiscal year in which the credit is made and each fiscal year thereafter for use on the project for conservation practices approved by the Secretary:

None of the funds made available to the Forest Service in this Act or any other Act with respect to any fiscal year shall be subject to transfer under the provisions of section 702(b) of the Department of Agriculture Organic Act of 1944 (7 U.S.C. 2257), section 442 of Public Law 106–224 (7 U.S.C. 7772), or section 10417(b) of Public Law 107–171 (7 U.S.C. 8316(b)).

That amounts obligated but not expended by a tribe or tribal organization for contract support costs for such agreements for the current fiscal year shall be applied to contract support costs due for such agreements for subsequent fiscal years.

That notwithstanding any other provision of law, the individual appointed to the position of Inspector General of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) shall, by virtue of such appointment, also hold the position of Inspector General of the Board: Provided further, That notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Inspector General of the Board shall utilize personnel of the Office of Inspector General of EPA in performing the duties of the Inspector General of the Board, and shall not appoint any individuals to positions within the Board.
This division may be cited as the “Department of the Interior, Environment, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2021”.

Holmes Safety Association as a principal safety association and, notwithstanding any other provision of law, may provide funds and, with or without reimbursement, personnel, including service of Mine Safety and Health Administration officials as officers in local chapters or in the national organization: Provided further, That any funds available to the Department of Labor may be used, with the approval of the Secretary, to provide for the costs of mine rescue and survival operations in the event of a major disaster.
This title may be cited as the “Department of Labor Appropriations Act, 2021”.

That the Secretary shall establish procedures regarding the disposition of intangible assets and program income that permit such assets acquired with, and program income derived from, grant funds authorized under section 680 of the CSBG Act to become the sole property of such grantees after a period of not more than 12 years after the end of the grant period for any activity consistent with section 680(a)(2)(A) of the CSBG Act: Provided further, That intangible assets in the form of loans, equity investments and other debt instruments, and program income may be used by grantees for any eligible purpose consistent with section 680(a)(2)(A) of the CSBG Act: Provided further, That these procedures shall apply to such grant funds made available after November 29, 1999:
This title may be cited as the “Department of Health and Human Services Appropriations Act, 2021”.

That the amount by which a State's allocation under section 611(d) of the IDEA is reduced under section 612(a)(18)(B) and the amounts distributed to States under the previous provisos in fiscal year 2012 or any subsequent year shall not be considered in calculating the awards under section 611(d) for fiscal year 2013 or for any subsequent fiscal years:

That the Secretary may, in any fiscal year in which a State's allocation under section 611 is reduced in accordance with section 612(a)(18)(B), reduce the amount a State may reserve under section 611(e)(1) by an amount that bears the same relation to the maximum amount described in that paragraph as the reduction under section 612(a)(18)(B) bears to the total allocation the State would have received in that fiscal year under section 611(d) in the absence of the reduction: Provided further, That the Secretary shall either reduce the allocation of funds under section 611 for any fiscal year following the fiscal year for which the State fails to comply with the requirement of section 612(a)(18)(A) as authorized by section 612(a)(18)(B), or seek to recover funds under section 452 of the General Education Provisions Act (20 U.S.C. 1234a):
The maximum Pell Grant for which a student shall be eligible during award year 2021–2022 shall be $5,435.

That for student loan contracts awarded prior to October 1, 2017, the Secretary shall allow student loan borrowers who are consolidating Federal student loans to select from any student loan servicer to service their new consolidated student loan:
This title may be cited as the “Department of Education Appropriations Act, 2021”.

Title ILEGISLATIVE BRANCH
LEGISLATIVE BRANCH
This division may be cited as the “Legislative Branch Appropriations Act, 2021”.

Section 20013(b) of the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (Public Law 116–136) is amended—(1) by redesignating paragraphs (1) and (2) as subparagraphs (A) and (B), respectively;(2) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), as so redesignated, by inserting “(1)” before “In the case”; and(3) by adding at the end the following: “(2) If the Secretary waives any limit on grant amounts or rates for per diem payments under paragraph (1), notwithstanding section 2012(a)(2)(B) of such title, the maximum rate for per diem payments described in paragraph (1)(B) shall be three times the rate authorized for State homes for domiciliary care under section 1741 of such title.”:
This division may be cited as the “Military Construction, Veterans Affairs, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2021”.
International organizations

CONTRIBUTIONS TO INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATIONSFor necessary expenses, not otherwise provided for, to meet annual obligations of membership in international multilateral organizations, pursuant to treaties ratified pursuant to the advice and consent of the Senate, conventions, or specific Acts of Congress, $1,505,928,000, of which $96,240,000, to remain available until September 30, 2022, is designated by the Congress for Overseas Contingency Operations/Global War on Terrorism pursuant to section 251(b)(2)(A)(ii) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985: Provided, That the Secretary of State shall, at the time of the submission of the President's budget to Congress under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code, transmit to the Committees on Appropriations the most recent biennial budget prepared by the United Nations for the operations of the United Nations: Provided further, That the Secretary of State shall notify the Committees on Appropriations at least 15 days in advance (or in an emergency, as far in advance as is practicable) of any United Nations action to increase funding for any United Nations program without identifying an offsetting decrease elsewhere in the United Nations budget: Provided further, That any payment of arrearages under this heading shall be directed to activities that are mutually agreed upon by the United States and the respective international organization and shall be subject to the regular notification procedures of the Committees on Appropriations: Provided further, That none of the funds appropriated under this heading shall be available for a United States contribution to an international organization for the United States share of interest costs made known to the United States Government by such organization for loans incurred on or after October 1, 1984, through external borrowings.

SEC. 108. Due process protections in enforcement proceedings.(a) In general.—Section 60117 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—(1) by redesignating subsections (b) through (o) as subsections (c) through (p), respectively; and(2) by inserting after subsection (a) the following:“(b) Enforcement procedures.—“(1) Process.—In implementing enforcement procedures under this chapter and part 190 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations), the Secretary shall—“(A) allow the respondent to request the use of a consent agreement and consent order to resolve any matter of fact or law asserted;“(B) allow the respondent and the agency to convene 1 or more meetings—“(i) for settlement or simplification of the issues; or“(ii) to aid in the disposition of issues;“(C) require that the case file in an enforcement proceeding include all agency records pertinent to the matters of fact and law asserted;“(D) allow the respondent to reply to each post-hearing submission of the agency;“(E) allow the respondent to request that a hearing be held, and an order be issued, on an expedited basis;“(F) require that the agency have the burden of proof, presentation, and persuasion in any enforcement matter;“(G) require that any order contain findings of relevant fact and conclusions of law;“(H) require the Office of Pipeline Safety to file a post-hearing recommendation not later than 30 days after the deadline for any post-hearing submission of a respondent;“(I) require an order on a petition for reconsideration to be issued not later than 120 days after the date on which the petition is filed; and“(J) allow an operator to request that an issue of controversy or uncertainty be addressed through a declaratory order in accordance with section 554(e) of title 5.“(2) Open to the public.—A hearing under this section shall be—“(A) noticed to the public on the website of the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration; and“(B) in the case of a formal hearing (as defined in section 190.3 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations (or a successor regulation)), open to the public.“(3) Transparency.—“(A) Agreements, orders, and judgments open to the public.—With respect to each enforcement proceeding under this chapter, the Administrator of the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration shall make publicly available on the website of the Administration—“(i) the charging documents;“(ii) the written response of the respondent, if filed; and“(iii) any consent agreement, consent order, order, or judgment resulting from a hearing under this chapter.“(B) Gao report on pipeline safety program collection and transparency of enforcement proceedings.—“(i) In general.—Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of the PIPES Act of 2020, the Comptroller General of the United States shall—“(I) review information on pipeline enforcement actions that the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration makes publicly available on the internet; and“(II) submit to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committees on Transportation and Infrastructure and Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives a report on that review, including any recommendations under clause (iii).“(ii) Contents.—The report under clause (i)(II) shall include—“(I) a description of the process that the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration uses to collect and record enforcement information;“(II) an assessment of whether and, if so, how the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration ensures that enforcement information is made available to the public in an accessible manner; and“(III) an assessment of the information described in clause (i)(I).“(iii) Recommendations.—The report under clause (i)(II) may include recommendations regarding—“(I) any improvements that could be made to the accessibility of the information described in clause (i)(I);“(II) whether and, if so, how the information described in clause (i)(I) could be made more transparent; and“(III) any other recommendations that the Comptroller General of the United States considers appropriate. “(4) Savings clause.—Nothing in this subsection alters the procedures applicable to—“(A) an emergency order under subsection (p); “(B) a safety order under subsection (m); or “(C) a corrective action order under section 60112.”
(b) Conforming amendments.—(1) Section 60109(g)(4) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking “section 60117(c)” and inserting “section 60117(d)”.
(2) Section 60117(p) of title 49, United States Code (as redesignated by subsection (a)(1)), is amended, in paragraph (3)(E), by striking “60117(l)” and inserting “subsection (m)”.
(3) Section 60118(a)(3) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking “section 60117(a)–(d)” and inserting “subsections (a) through (e) of section 60117”.

SEC. 114. Inspection and maintenance plans.(a) In general.—Section 60108 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—(1) in subsection (a)—(A) in paragraph (2)—(i) in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting “, must meet the requirements of any regulations promulgated under section 60102(q),” after “the need for pipeline safety”;(ii) in subparagraph (C), by striking “and” at the end; and(iii) by striking subparagraph (D) and inserting the following:“(D) the extent to which the plan will contribute to—“(i) public safety;“(ii) eliminating hazardous leaks and minimizing releases of natural gas from pipeline facilities; and“(iii) the protection of the environment; and“(E) the extent to which the plan addresses the replacement or remediation of pipelines that are known to leak based on the material (including cast iron, unprotected steel, wrought iron, and historic plastics with known issues), design, or past operating and maintenance history of the pipeline.”; and(B) by striking paragraph (3) and inserting the following:“(3) Review of plans.—“(A) In general.—Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this subparagraph, and not less frequently than once every 5 years thereafter, the Secretary or relevant State authority with a certification in effect under section 60105 shall review each plan described in this subsection.“(B) Context of review.—The Secretary may conduct a review under this paragraph as an element of the inspection of the operator carried out by the Secretary under subsection (b).“(C) Inadequate programs.—If the Secretary determines that a plan reviewed under this paragraph does not comply with the requirements of this chapter (including any regulations promulgated under this chapter), has not been adequately implemented, is inadequate for the safe operation of a pipeline facility, or is otherwise inadequate, the Secretary may conduct enforcement proceedings under this chapter.”; and(2) in subsection (b)(1)(B), by inserting “construction material,” after “method of construction,”.

SEC. 116. Protection of employees providing pipeline safety information.Section 60129 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—(1) in subsection (a)(1), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking “employee with” and inserting “current or former employee with”;(2) in subsection (b)(3), by adding at the end the following:“(D) De novo review.—“(i) In general.—With respect to a complaint under paragraph (1), if the Secretary of Labor has not issued a final decision by the date that is 210 days after the date on which the complaint was filed, and if the delay is not due to the bad faith of the employee who filed the complaint, that employee may bring an original action at law or equity for de novo review in the appropriate district court of the United States, which shall have jurisdiction over such action without regard to the amount in controversy, and which action shall, at the request of either party to the action, be tried by the court with a jury.“(ii) Burdens of proof.—An original action described in clause (i) shall be governed by the same legal burdens of proof specified in paragraph (2)(B) for review by the Secretary of Labor.”; and(3) by adding at the end the following:“(e) Nonenforceability of certain provisions waiving rights and remedies or requiring arbitration of disputes.—“(1) Waiver of rights and remedies.—The rights and remedies provided under this section may not be waived by any agreement, policy, form, or condition of employment, including by a predispute arbitration agreement.“(2) Predispute arbitration agreements.—No provision of a predispute arbitration agreement shall be valid or enforceable if the provision requires arbitration of a dispute arising under subsection (a)(1).”

SEC. 118. Purpose and general authority.Section 60102(b)(5) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—(1) by striking “Chapter” and inserting “chapter”; and(2) by inserting “, including safety and environmental benefits,” after “benefits”.

SEC. 120. Unusually sensitive areas.(a) Certain coastal waters; coastal beaches.—Section 19(b) of the PIPES Act of 2016 (49 U.S.C. 60109 note; Public Law 114–183) is amended—(1) by striking “The Secretary” and inserting the following:“(1) Definitions.—In this subsection:“(A) Certain coastal waters.—The term ‘certain coastal waters’ means—“(i) the territorial sea of the United States;“(ii) the Great Lakes and their connecting waters; and“(iii) the marine and estuarine waters of the United States up to the head of tidal influence.“(B) Coastal beach.—The term ‘coastal beach’ means any land between the high- and low-water marks of certain coastal waters.“(2) Revision.—The Secretary”; and(2) in paragraph (2) (as so designated), by striking “marine coastal waters” and inserting “certain coastal waters”.
(b) Certain coastal waters.—Section 60109(b)(2) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking “marine coastal waters” and inserting “certain coastal waters”.

(d) Hazardous liquid pipeline facilities located in certain areas.—Section 60109(g) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—(1) in paragraph (1)(B), by inserting “, but not less often than once every 12 months” before the period at the end; and(2) by adding at the end the following:“(5) Considerations.—In carrying out this subsection, each operator shall implement procedures that assess potential impacts by maritime equipment or other vessels, including anchors, anchor chains, or any other attached equipment.”

SEC. 121. Safety-related condition reports.Section 60102(h) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the following:“(2) Submission of report.—As soon as practicable, but not later than 5 business days, after a representative of a person to whom this section applies first establishes that a condition described in paragraph (1) exists, the operator shall submit the report required under that paragraph to— “(A) the Secretary;“(B) the appropriate State authority or, where no appropriate State authority exists, to the Governor of a State where the subject of the Safety Related Condition report occurred; and“(C) the appropriate Tribe where the subject of the Safety Related Condition report occurred.“(3) Submission of report to other entities.—Upon request, a State authority or a Governor that receives a report submitted under this subsection may submit the report to any relevant emergency response or planning entity, including any—“(A) State emergency response commission established pursuant to section 301 of the Emergency Planning and Community Right-To-Know Act of 1986 (42 U.S.C. 11001);“(B) Tribal emergency response commission or emergency planning committee (as defined in part 355 of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations (or a successor regulation)); “(C) local emergency planning committee established pursuant to section 301 of the Emergency Planning and Community Right-To-Know Act of 1986 (42 U.S.C. 11001); or“(D) other public agency responsible for emergency response.”
